description:
The name says it all: delicious tacos! I couldn't have asked for a better Mexican experience than what I got at Tacolicious. The atmosphere is cool, hip, and modern but still gives the feel of a classic family establishment. When I walked in I immediately felt the joy and passion the employees had working there. It seemed as if everyone was enjoying life to the fullest and loving their meals and drinks even more.

A minimum requirement for a good Mexican joint is an extensive selection of mezcals and tequilas and Tacolicious did not disappoint. Classic drinks such as micaeladas were also available in addition to a variety of Mexican beers. 

The menu was full of everything you can imagine from simple tacos with gourmet sauces to tortas and fajitas that everyone can enjoy. I ordered the cod tacos and was pleased to taste the cool creme mixed with the warm, fresh fish. The house salsa was like I've never had before, a traditional tomato base but with an unexpected yet welcoming sweet finish. I wish I could have taken it to go!

If you're ever considering Mexican in the port area of San Fran, look no further, Tacolicious has got you covered!
author: Kashiff M.

description:
Tacolicious has quite a few taco options. They had a good bit of meat on them as well, but they were pretty pricey at $5.50 a taco. If you go with a group, you can get 10 tacos for $43 or 4 for $20. 

The service was subpar. We asked one waiter that was not ours for refill on water and they never came back. It took us quite a while for our waitress to return to get more water which was disappointing. 

The spot is great on Chesnut and they had good outdoor seating. If the service was better I would recommend checking this place out, otherwise I am sure there are plenty of other taco joints.
author: Roy M.

description:
Very disappointed with a blonde male seating hostess with a baseball cap and the bush of hair sticking from the back.   we asked to be seated outside but he said there's a 20 minute wait even though there are four open tables that are cleaning ready to go.

The waitress Heather, came in after we were forced to get seated  inside, she was very friendly and nice and the food was what you would expect, I have been to other Tacolicious locations all over the Bay area.

throughout the time we were eating, two of these tables remained open and we paid in left and they were still open.  so don't understand just blonde stupid male seating hostess why he did not want to tell us outside on the floor open table.  

Plz hire competent people in the future.
author: B D.

description:
With a nervous tic in my eye after buying a new computer at the Apple store, one word sprang to mind:

Tequila.

So into Tacolicious we went, a space that's better suited to a crowded Friday or Saturday night in the Marina; nearly empty on a Sunday evening, it has a neon and black '80s vibe that's neither sardonic nor retro. 

The food was okay, reservations for the ridiculous pricing especially for the sides that (either even-handedly or strangely) are all $7. 

$7 for a grilled ear of corn. Yes, it was artfully broken into 3 pieces and grilled with blackened bits and topped with a sprig of cilantro but it was still ..a single ear of corn. Keep in mind, this wasn't Mexican street corn, just an ear of grilled corn.

$7 for a tiny bowl of black beans. It was billed "Black midnight beans" to make it sound special but it was 7-8 oz of black beans and no, I couldn't taste any oregano or garlic. That's a half can of beans. For $7.

Tacos were pricy at (4) for $20. Small but with quality ingredients, each one was tasty and we ordered a mix: Pastrami, chicken, skirt steak and Baja style. It was $2 extra to upgrade to the steak and pastrami options.

A tray of attractively plated sauces accompanied our tacos but no one explained what they were. 

Horchata was excellent with bits of undissolved cane sugar and delicious cinnamon. The margarita picante hit the spot and had just the right amount of heat.

Service was sweet and apologetic especially about the overpriced sides but given its inflated pricing, I'd have to be pushed back in the door to Tacolicious.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Got the 10 taco special for a party of 3 at the Marina location and it's a little more cramped. Cool thing is that you can set a reservation on yelp and they will notify you when they're ready - tale a look at the nearby shops. 

The food was good - pretty much got to try most of what was put on the meat options. 

TIP: turn your 10 tacos into 20 by splitting the tortillas. You get full FAST. 

Go to smitten ice cream down the block for dessert if you are down for the challenge!
author: Erika D.

description:
Great place, especially on taco Tuesday. Their specials this day include a pitcher of margs($28) and "make your own taco" platter for $15! It comes with enough ingredients to make about 6 or so tacos! 

The beef isn't my favorite but it's the only meat option you get with this deal so I just embrace it for taco Tuesday! Margs are good and strong and have great flavor! 

Service could be better. We waited 10 mins before anyone even came to our table, another 10 minutes to order and also had to ask 3 times for the guacamole we ordered and was told, they ran out and had to make some...although that's hard for me to believe because the tables on each side of us sat down after us and got their drinks, chips, salsa AND guacamole before us.
author: Bethany M.

description:
I've always been a bit standoffish with Tacolicious because I felt the prices were a bit high for what you were getting (1 street taco for 4.95) but, after a really nice lunch there yesterday I stand corrected. 

I snagged a nice window table and the server was super attentive and friendly. She recommended the marina girl salad with shrimp (little gem, avocado, cucumber, radish, pumpkin seeds, cotija cheese, jalapeño vinaigrette) and it was delicious! My friend and I also decided to order four of the carnitas tacos and they were legit. I'm constantly surprised at the high quality carnitas you can find in SF and these are damn good too. 

Lunch came to about $60 bucks with tip and a a couple tecates so expect about 25 bucks a head. Worth a visit on a nice marina sunny day.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Thx tacos are great, and authentic for the most part. A little more cilantro and onions boost the flavor. The beef carnitas are so good and he fish. Be a touch careful with the mustard colored salsa, it looks like mango but it is super spicy, but also really  tasty. The four tacos for $20 is a great deal.
author: Tara K.

description:
We've all been there: It's 11:45 p.m. and you're driving down Lombard street when the driver says "I'm starving! I really need some carne asada fries, like now!" So you tap your help app, type in carne asada fries and pull off on the next street because you are only 2 seconds away from the first recommended place and they close in 15 minutes. 
We knew Tacolicious was about to close by the time we walked in last night, so we walked up to the bar to ask the bartender if they would still serve us food, but before we could even do that another employee approached us and welcomed us with seats and menus and said they would be happy to get us some food to go :) 
They brought us chips and salsa as we scoured the menu for those elusive carne asada fries, but alas they don't even have fries on the menu! WTH YELP?!?!? We of course found alternatives but I couldn't resist asking them to try and make me some carne asada fries anyway! 
We spend $40 on 7 tacos and I will tell you that, even though it wasn't their fault about the fries (I blame myself for not having time to read WHY this place came up in my search for fries) between the disappointment from that and the cost of the food, I left pretty certain this place would get 4 stars from me at best....and then it happened. The Pastrami Taco. 
My mouth is watering just thinking about it! As we sat eating our two pastrami tacos, conversation melded into moaning and grunting noises and we experienced the flavors of this amazing dish. I have never had anything like it. We wept at the fact we could not go back and get more because the business had already closed. It was the best taco we have ever tasted!
Their amazing customer service, coupled with the delicious flavors of that taco easily entitle them to 5 stars. The cost now makes perfect sense and I would gladly pay it again and again, not to mention the bathroom was clean and they gave us MORE chips and a variety of salsa with our to go order including a creamy salsa verde (which we fought over) and an interesting and yummy hickory or mesquite chipotle type salsa as well as a mango habanero flavor that brought tears to our eyes (I am totally guessing on the flavors btw) in addition to a big portion of their standard salsa.
I cannot wait to get back to the city and have another Pastrami Taco from Tacolicious!
author: Dale S.

description:
I think I found a cool spot to grab tacos. The happy hour selections are nothing to write home about. The tacos were tasty and filling. 

Clown tacos remind me of the ones you get at jack in the box, but still tasty. 
We also got the dip sampler with queso, refried beans, and guacamole, the queso was so good! Nice and thick and super tasty. The beans we just beans not much flavor , and the guacamole was good too, but the queso really stole the show. 
The margaritas were nice and strong. I will definitely return and try some other options and update my review. The service was good. The waitress was attentive without being overbearing.
author: Ty S.

description:
Really loud place, but the service, food, and drinks were delicious! My favorite tacos were the mushroom "carnitas" (its vegetarian) and the chicken chili verde. The tacos come with an assortment of 3 different sauces.

As for drinks, I highly recommend the margarita picante if you like some heat  the regular margarita is really good too.
author: Christina W.

description:
Came here for lunch to visit some friends from the area. Tacos and margaritas, what better way to socialize?

I'll start with the drinks. They have a decent cocktail list, most of them tequila based. I went ahead and got the Pasión margarita, which had habanero and passion fruit infused. Ohhh giiirl, it was so good. It wasn't as spicy as I expected it to be, but you got the full flavor of the habanero and it balanced perfectly with the sweetness of the passion fruit. Let's say I didn't stop at one...

Now, for the food! There's plenty on the menu, but of course I had to try the tacos. I got 4 tacos, which came out to just under $18 (a little steep for the size taco if you ask me), but we were in the Marina, so not shock. I got the potato and asparagus taco, chili verde taco, carnitas taco, and the grilled cod taco. Overall the tacos were really good, just the chili verde was a little salty for my taste. While I didnt try it, I heard nothing but rave reviews for the fried avocado tacos.

The overall vibe of the place is great. I would come back solely for the atmosphere and the drinks. But hey, the food is a nice touch, too ;)
author: Crystal A.

description: This place is underrated, totally worth going to!! We got chicken chile verde, mushroom carnitas and pacific cod and all were so good! The chips and guac were amazing. Loved the bottomless chips
author: Katie N.

description:
Came here for lunch as the first stop in San Francisco. We were immediately greeted by someone at the door and were seated within seconds.The weather was nice so we opted to eat outdoors.

Started off with some warm crunchy tortilla chips and delicious salsa. Their salsa was like no other I have ever tasted, the perfect amount of kick in each bite. We ordered 4 tacos each between the two of us because they looked small in the pictures but with the different types of things on them and the meat quantity, they were MORE than enough that we didnt end up finishing them. They come with three different sauces on the side which were not needed as the tacos itself were very flavorful but you can never go wrong with some extra spice from the habanero sauce! My favorite was the beef brisket and the chicken chili verde.

Our server Thalia was the sweetest, she went over the menu in depth which helped us in making decisions as to what we wanted to order and she checked back in on us periodically to make sure everything was alright. The place is a little on the pricier side but worth checking out!
author: Harv P.

description:
The tacos here are pretty mediocre and aren't considered "authentic" like the Mexican food you can find in the Mission District. The food here is also expensive and also has very long wait times on a Saturday night. Beware.

Came here before catching a movie at the Presidio Theater. Ordered 10 Tacos for $39, which I found a bit pricey. My favorite taco was the Pastrami and Steak. Everything else tasted really plain unless it was drenched in the free salsa they gave you. The Fried Avocado & Mushroom Tacos was also disappointing and I felt robbed for how much I paid for it. Definitely a pass next time. 

Overall I would come back here if I needed a drink at the bar and wanted to snack on some chips and guacamole. I would eat somewhere else if I needed a more sustainable meal.
author: MyTien P.

description: Yummmm!! I work in the area and recently dropped in for lunch with 2 of my coworkers after a shift. We ordered tacos (of course) and the Mucho Gusto cocktail-- one of the very best cocktails I've had! So smooth and easy to get drunk on lol. Salsas and chips are amazinggg, staff is friendly, and the atmosphere is fun. Didn't leave feeling gross, or that my stomach would be upset. Two thumbs up!
author: Marina T.

description:
It's all about Taco Tuesday!  Let me tell you exactly how to maximize your time at Tacolicious on any given Tuesday.

Sit outside
Come in for a starter margarita during happy hour
(Happy hour ends)
Order the special Tuesday tacos and margarita pitcher
Build your own DELICIOUS tacos
Wash down said tacos with a couple margaritas

Follow my instructions and I guarantee you'll have a fantastic time!
author: Jeff H.

description:
Yummy tacos- we ordered the combo plate and tried the fried fish, beef, chicken verde and original carnitas. Tacos were a bit salty but my fav had to be the fried fish! We also ordered guacamole which was also good. The plate of 10 tacos fed nearly 4 of us.

Yummy drinks - Agua Fresca was perfect. Mandarin orange this time around. The boys had a pitcher of margaritas and the pitcher was empty at the end of lunch 

Great service - service was prompt, and almost near exceptional. we only received 1 of our 3 frescas we ordered. Turns out they were making a new batch. Because of the wait, the server said he'd take them off our bill. The process took longer than expected so the waiter put them in to go cups for us!!!!!! :)

Dog friendly - we had three dogs. Plenty of outdoor seating

Tip:
- if your dog is reactive to other dogs , sit on Avilla as opposed to chestnut for their outdoor seating - way less foot traffic during your meal. This area is super dog friendly so you'll see a lot of dogs pass by during your time there
- metered parking is $4.75-$5.50 an hour so try to find hourly parking a few blocks away to avoid paying massive parking fees. We dined around noon on a Saturday 
- make your tacos go twice as far by splitting the meat into two taco shells (they wrap each taco with two shells). Makes for less mess, and feels more filling :)
author: Karen H.

description: This was my first time to the Tacolicious chain of SF. It was great for a light lunch! We were greeted with a warm welcome and had zero wait at noon on a Thursday. Quick and polite service with free chips and salsa brought to the table (even a second basket without asking). Tacos which were ordered were chicken crispy tacos, fried avocado, carna asade, and the guajillo braised beef. All were good with the braised beef being the favorite! I'm not a huge fan of grease and didn't find any of them too greasy. The beef did have a decent amount of marinade tho- in a good way! Highly recommend it, just be patient with parking as it took us a while.
author: Patrick A.

description: Great tacos, variety of different types. Favorite was the Cod, but they apparently have a famous Chorizo taco that they ran out of the day I came in. If you're a coffee person, they have a great cold brew available as well. Regardless, atmosphere is great with seating both inside & out. Service was great, definitely recommend stopping in if you're in the area!
author: Filip M.

description:
Nice bar to chill and catch up with friends...  f
Not your typical tacos .. very stylish and trendy ... super chill vibe and service was great .  

Pricey tacos... simple menu ... a la carte items

They do have vegetarian friendly items
author: Cathy C.

description:
Tacolicious is AWESOME, and Mickey the manager is the absolute BEST!

I live around the corner from Tacolicious, and they are the best thing that has happened to this block in a long time.  Although I was sad to see The Grove leave which I loved, I'm so happy that Tacolicious filled the space.

I love Mexican food and crave it all the time so I eat here often.  The food and drinks are so consistent and so DELICIOUS, and the atmosphere is more fun than any restaurant in the Marina.  Regarding drinks, I can't tell you how many restaurants (and I eat out a lot) make terrible margaritas in SF. I'd say the majority of other restaurants make bad margaritas. Tacolious makes AMAZING margaritas made with fresh daily lime juice and fresh agave. The classic is fabulous, and I also love the spicy passion fruit margarita as well.

The produce at Tacolicious is locally sourced which I really appreciate, and they use paper straws which is a small but environmentally impactful choice and detail that I also appreciate.  I've had everything on the menu so it's hard to pick a favorite, but I do especially love the ceviche and carnitas.  The chips are my favorite in the city. It's also amazing how many bad chips there are at other restaurants.  Tacolicious has perfected these.  I love them!

My favorite thing about the staff is the manager Mickey. If only more restaurants had managers like him. He has every quality that makes a fabulous manager. He loves his work and the customers, he is very seasoned (has worked for some of the very top SF restaurants), he works hard, and he really cares about teaching and supporting his employees.  If he ever leaves, I'm not sure I'll want to keep going to Tacolicious. That's how important and necessary I think he is.  If you ever were to have a problem, do not blast off an unfair review here without giving them a chance to address it. Talk to Mickey. He will always make it right.  BRAVO Mickey for being the BEST!

I have also had 2 parties in the private dining room upstairs, and they were both wonderful!  The room is so cool, and the food and staff were amazing as always! Try having a private party at Tacolicious. It's so FUN!
author: Paula M.

description:
Was actually pretty disappointed with my experience. I've heard great things but walked away thinking "meh". 

The vibe is awesome for drinks inside or out. 
The complimentary salsa and chips were deliciously fresh as well. But my tacos fell super flat, though looked beautiful. I got the fish, steak and chicken special. All the proteins themselves fell flat and didn't taste seasoned at all. The skirt steak was SO chewy and dry - too thick of chunks. The special's toppings were delicious- had a pad Thai type of palette but I couldn't even taste the chicken.


The food came out pretty quick but service was pretty spacey- we asked for a water bowl for the dog three times- water twice etc.. 

Overall I wouldn't go out of my way to come back u less they beefed up their food prep.
author: Tash B.

description:
This is a review based on service, free chips and salsa, and one dish: Ensalada Chingaderas.

First off, service is great and attentive. Walked in, put together a table for a rather larger party of ours, and made sure we were served our menus and chips and salsa shortly afterwards. Water was consistently refilled, and for busy restaurants like these, this is usually an oversight.

Chips were crispy and thick. I prefer this because I like to dip my chips in an overwhelmingly amount of salsa that if the chip is thin, it breaks. Ain't about that brittle life! Salsa was not watery and more of a mild sauce than salsa. Very tasty.

Ok now onto the Ensalada Chingaderas. Lemme break it down. This is essentially a grains bowl with barley as the main grain and the salad being chopped kale. I am a huge fan of this bowl. I enjoy trying various types of grains, and barley has this juiciness because of its larger volume. I've only had barley in soups, so I worried that the barley would be too dry in a salad. This was not the case! I think it had to do with the kale being CHOPPED kale, like baby kale. None of them dry stems and dry leafy leaves (ugh, why do people enjoy this?). Chopped kale is the bizness. There was a wonderful touch of sweetness with the sliced peaches and a surprising crunch with the toasted quinoa and charred corn. Mmmm mm! Devoured in 10 minutes. The only downside is that they added a bit too much dressing - next time ask for it on the side.

Overall, I like the vibe of this place. A full bar, TV playing, lots of seating and good for groups. Would definitely come back here to try other things on their menu (like taocs, duh) and for their drinks. Errs on the more expensive side for Mexican food, but it's a nice place to hangout and have fun.
author: Vickie Z.

description: Went here for dinner with my 3 friends. We got tacos, guacamole, and fried tuna empanada. Was not a fan of the tuna empanadas but the tacos were very good. The service was a bit slow and took us over 15 min to get our checks. I'll definitely come back again with a group of friends!
author: Amy C.

description:
Prime location! Good vibes and good food!

Friday night was a bit loud inside and it was hard to have a conversation so not ideal for a first date lol but me and my cousins had a blast we just talked loud with everyone else.

The 10 meal taco platter was worth it! We mixed and match steak, fish, veggies, pork and chicken tacos on corn tortillas. These tacos are all meat! And the give you to tortillas per taco and you will easily turn them into 20 hearty tacos with all the extras salsas and garnishes to go with them.  

Only downside is we had to wait like 20 min to refill our waters but the establishment is a definite must see!
author: Komatsu O.

description:
Damn... I'm just going to have to be brutally honest. The food here was underwhelming AF! Sucks because the atmosphere was really amazing. With a name like Tacolicious, I was expecting to receive the most amazing tacos here. Unfortunately, it was anything but. 

After roaming around the city and driving down Lombard street, a friend and I had worked up quite an appetite. We were in the Marina district and decided to try out Tacolicious for taco Tuesday. When we walked in, I was instantly enamored by the whole setup! The bar was set right in the middle of the room and was surrounded by tables. It's really open, making it feel super comfortable and breathable. The crowd was pretty lively and the music was a bit loud for my taste. It was almost 11 pm, so I kind of expected it. 

Our server Talia seated us and gave us a menu. They had a taco Tuesday special going on which consisted of 6 ground beef crispy tacos for $15. Although it sounded appealing, we opted for something with more variety. We decided to do the 4 tacos for $18. We chose the guadillo-braised beef brisket, Baja-style pacific cod, chicken in mole Colorado, and the hangar steak. We skipped drinks and just settled for waters, as we had already been drinking earlier that night. As we waited for our tacos, we munched on the complimentary chips and salsa. Now THOSE were actually really tasty! Nice crispy flour tortillas chips that tasted hand made along with a spicy red salsa that had an amazing flare of jalapeño. 

Our tacos arrived, and what a mess it was! Visually, they weren't even very appealing. They were sloppily put together with tons of juice and grease oozing out of the sides and onto the plates. The fish taco was the only one that was quite decent in my opinion. It was a little soggy, but flavor wise, it wasn't too bad. As for the others... no flavor what so ever. The chicken was super greasy and needed way more spice. The steak was extremely tough and overcooked and the beef was the absolute worst! It literally tasted like I was eating raw beef from the package! Cold and completely flavorless! They barely put any toppings on it, which might have helped just a tad at least. We used the four additional salsas that they provided,  but nothing at that point could save those tacos. I was left so unimpressed and it was definitely not for $18 in any sense! 

Despite the horrible food, the service from Talia was wonderful! She checked in on us multiple times and refilled our water glasses. It's just too bad, because I really enjoyed the environment. I didn't have any of their drinks, so I can't comment on that. But just based on the food alone, I would not come back here again.
author: Shayla B.

description: Ferry Building Farmer's Market favorite turned brick and mortar with locations sprinkled across SF and now the South Bay. Great spot for American Mexican food with inventive twists on the classic taco. You will find your standard carne asada, pollo, and carnitas tacos here, but you likely know a better mom and pop resto serving more flavorful traditional tacos. Instead, opt for Tacolicious' taco creations, such as the fried avocado taco and, if available, the chicharrón taco - both are delicious and unique to the restaurant. I also saw a pastrami taco on the menu and veggie specials. The queso dip is my favorite item here. If you have a guilty pleasure for Tostito's queso dip, Tacolicious' version will be right up your alley (and definitely more tasty!). The wait list system on Yelp works well if you're trying to snag a table on a busy night. They text you when the table is ready and show how many parties are ahead of you through the Yelp app.
author: Edwina D.

description: Service was great but the food was just okay. I opted for the clown tacos during happy hour and they came out fast but the tacos weren't warm at all. Thank goodness they were only $5.
author: Sara J.

description: Ordered the Marina girl salad with shrimp ($20+) and this is how it came. I ordered takeout and realized how pathetic this was once I got home- really wish I would have opened it right when I picked it up. This is ridiculous.
author: Jessica G.

description: Just ordered takeout and am disgusted by my entire order. The cod fish taco arrived grossly over-breaded and burnt. The carnitas were so salty I couldn't eat them. Both tacos had corn tortillas SOAKED in oil, so much so that they REFLECTED LIGHT off of them. The rice is dry and comically under salted (maybe try taking half the salt from your carnitas and add it to the rice next time....?). So pissed I just threw $25 down the drain for nasty food that I can't even send back to the kitchen, or refuse to pay for it because I had it delivered by a third party delivery service. Never again, Tacolicious. Get it together.
author: Sarah G.

description: Its a nice place to eat tacos. Maybe a bit noisy but the food and beers are very good tasting.
author: Carlos E.

description:
Great place on Chestnut St in the Marina. Felt so comfortable and we really liked the various drinks and foods available, but aside from that I felt so welcomed from the staff and even other patrons.

Marin our waitress was so sweet and I'm glad we took her suggestions because we left extremely happy, I can't tell you everything we ordered but I'm glad Marin moved us to a bigger table because of the amount of food and drinks we had. lol

Will go back soon and even bring other friends so they can check out a great place in the Marina!
author: David W.

description: Try the pastrami tacos sounds gross but it's so freaking good awesome service great location fantastic food
author: Louise M.

description:
I've been there two times now. Overall the place is good but it is on the pricey side. Tacos will cost you about $4-5 per taco depending on how many you get. If you have a group and get 10 for $40 bucks; it's cheapest per taco. Although they are pricey per taco, they're pretty filling; they don't scrimp on the beef or carnitas. The cod taco is pretty good but this time it wasn't crispy. The veggie one which is butternut squash was unexpectedly good. 

Tried their horchata cold brew for the first time during lunch. It was pretty good but I saw no cinnamon residue so was concerned if they use real cinnamon and just blend it real well or if it's a syrup flavoring instead. 

Their carnitas and beef tacos are the best. We went to Saturday brunch so they had the chilaquiles to share for the table which was pretty good! Whatever red sauce they put on was so good...garlicky and salsa-y and really good. The 5 of us were pretty full with the shared chilaquiles and 2 tacos a piece. There were even a little bit of leftovers. 

Wait is decent...around 30-40 at a given time. Put your name down and go shop or walk around. They typically text you way before the actual quoted time though.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Here is a well deserved hospitality battle star and "thank you" note to the world famous new host Cameron, who serves new customers like complete emptiness and has enough courage to not just to ignore new people, but to chase down the street with the pathetic accusations and black mouthing. 

No way we are coming back again!
author: Slava C.

description:
Horrible place!!! 
Arrogant waitress. It was a good day but they just spoiled it for the rest of it.
author: Andrii P.

description:
So I accidentally reviewed a different location of Tacolicious a long time ago and just realized it. This is the review that was meant for this location: 

God, this place is good. I went here during last summer when I was visiting San Fran. I got the Fish, Carnitas, and Short Rib Tacos. Each one was love at first bite. Some of the best tacos I've had. The short rib and carnitas were cooked to perfection and melted in your mouth. The fish tacos reminded me of the ones I had in Cancun and took me to a happy place. As for drinks, I ordered the Pasion and it was unlike anything I've ever had. A spicy kick to an otherwise fruity drink. Just my kind of thing. 

Definitely on my must-go list once I'm in San Fran again!



PS. I went to their other location on Valencia Street a month ago and posted a review for it. Still the best tacos I've ever had.
author: Sargam B.

description:
Twice I have come here and the service has been just eh. I don't know if they only have 2 servers on board for the day but seriously..?! I understand, I work in the business of hospitality. But to not even ask me how my food is, when I'm clearly picking at it.. is beyond me. Take a hint! I ordered the fried avocado taco. First of all, this wasn't even a quarter of an avo. For $6, I expected a little more. Their salads are weird too. 2 of them are so bland (straight up tomato sauce) and the other one is some weird smoky habenero which overpowers any flavor on your plate. 
I really wanna like you guys, but your flavors really lack. Quite expensive as well. Not to mention the server was super rude about my husky dog and tried to force her to sit under the table. I WAS OUTSIDE! Probably won't come here again.
author: Courtney M.

description: I came here with a few friends for lunch. There was about a 20 minute wait on a Sunday. Our waitress was not that friendly (she might have just been assigned to too many tables) but the food was bomb. I got all of the veggie tacos and they were all very good. The mushroom carnitas Taco was especially good. I also liked the fried avocado. Definitely on the pricier side for tacos but nothing outrageous. My friends got the salad. They were generous with the shrimp. The music is really loud inside so I recommend sitting outside if you want to have any sort of conversation.
author: Chai S.

description: Cute place, long wait, ok service and food. Right when you sit down you are served tortilla chips and house made salsa. The mint in the salsa was throwing me off. Had the chicken and shredded beef tacos. The tacos cone with in house taco sauces- mild to habenero spicy. All the sauces were delicious. The tacos needed some help. The chicken was good and the beef was manly. You might laugh, but just to have a hunk of meat in a taco shell really doesn't scream tacoliscious to me. A taco, like a sandwich needs to be built right. There needs to be some sort of fresh element in order to balance the meat, like cilantro, lettuce, tomato, etc. Unfortunately neither taco had this so it was just blazay. The watermelon chili shots were delicious though. And the chiros were o.k. a bit dry... sad to say I would only come back for more of those shots.
author: Allie P.

description: Tacolicious is a cool place to get some great drinks and delicious food.  They have taco types that you won't find anywhere else.  They happy hour prices are reasonable.  The wait staff is friendly and the food came out at lightning speed.  Highly recommend.
author: Jessica O.

description: Pretty horrible service here. Took forever to get our food, wasn't given chips and salsa, no forks at table, apps came after main course. Had to talk to wait staff and management several times. Only two of us but took two hours to get through meal. Only saving grace was they comped most of the meal. Food was pretty good but nothing to write home about
author: Jon G.

description: Sorry Tacolicious, but this was the worst takeout order I've ever had. It's terrible to discover that the salads you ordered and paid $35 for were completely wrong. We asked for no jicama we received no meat and of course the jicama remained. I'd have given you one star but I know you can do better so there's and extra one for that!
author: Leslie T.

description: Very confused on the style of this restaurant. The taco I got was a shell with a slice of cold American cheese in the inside. Not appetizing what so ever.
author: Alexis W.

description:
This place has amazing salsa . Their fried avocado taco was pretty on point also. The corn was interesting . Sweet and spicy. My husband loves it . But the rest of the tacos were just average and it was pretty expensive . $20 bucks for 4 tacos. Granted it's the Marina of SF so I understand why. We waited a super long time for our food
Also. But with that  I would still go back.
author: alex p.

description: My friend was visiting from Toronto and was craving some tacos so we decided to try Tacolicious. We ended up getting a few tacos, guacamole and rice. The food was super good and we loved the servers too. The mint in their salsa is what makes it so good! We will be back. E
author: Mira B.

description: Place has a very laid back feel to it. If you're visiting the area get a table out side and get the entire vibe of the space. I got the cod, carnitas and chicken. All pretty good. Cod was worst out of the three. The chicken and Carnitas were super oily but still bomb. Check out my photo of the churros. Definitely recommend the spot.
author: Kevin R.

description:
Our team at work rented the entire restaurant out for a party. Needless to say- it was amazing. Loved the ambience of the place - very casual chic. 
The salsa and tacos were amazing, lots of variety in terms of tapas ( different appetizers) we could eat. The drinks were on point too. I'd definitely recommend this place for any casual or special lounge-y meals you'd want to have. Tad expensive but totally worth it.
author: Vidya R.

description:
Named tacolicious...but the winner here was the cheese quesadilla!

We had to fill our bellies with something before we headed off to a whiskey tasting.  Tacolicious happened to be in the area and thought we'd grab a couple of fish tacos and a cheese quesadilla. 

The fish tacos were A-OK.  The fish was fresh but the flavors were lacking.  Needed a tad bit of salt and maybe a kick?  

The cheese quesadilla was super thick and delish.  It was cooked perfectly on the outside with the cheese fully melted.  This was definitely the winner winner.

Chips and salsa were also given.  Good flavors in the salsa.  

Service was simple.  Order at the counter.  They'll bring over your food.  Done.  Street parking only.  3 stars.
author: Jen W.

description:
If I could give zero stars, I would. This place was mad disrespectful. And I really like their tacos. I won't be returning to this location. Terrible customer service. I should have went with my gut considering the vibe when my sister and I walked in. We stood there for a couple of minutes. The bar staff didn't acknowledge us and as soon as a "regular" shows up, the waitress was more inclined to serve him first, even though we got there before he did. 

The waitress just seemed cold and that made us uncomfortable. She asked if we were ready to order, my sister said we needed a bit more time. 5 minutes goes by and she's nowhere to be seen. There were other customers around, but they had already been served. 

We were over it, so we left. BYE!!

Please treat everyone well like you would to your "white" clientele. This has happened to my family and I on a number of occasions in the city. It's really sad and I don't like it.
author: Bernadette B.

description: Late dinner on a business trip - can't go wrong with tacos. Everything was delicious and reasonably priced. Secured a spot toward the top of my SF dining favorites list, in close competition with Nopalito.
author: Sarah J.

description:
A fun place to eat your tacos - always a bit of a scene in there but don't we all love the Marina for that? I personally like eating my tacos surrounded by girls that seem to shop at the nearby lululemon store. Nothing wrong with that...

Oh, and the tacos... are great! Yes, hefty price tag ($14 for 4 tacos if I remember correctly) but the tacos are packed with meat, or cod, and if you order guac plus 4 tacos, I guarantee you it's a filling meal. 

Love the vibe in there - rock music is blasting from the speakers, it's always very lively, and you're lucky to grab a seat without wait.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
We ate here on Taco Tuesday (unintentionally) and were met with a huge crowd of people. Tacolicious was packed the entire time we were there (7:30-9) with people constantly flowing in. From what I remember the deal was 6 beef tacos that you assemble yourself for $15. I decided against this since there were so many better options than just plain ground beef. 

I went for El Dorado plate which came with 3 crispy tacos with adobo chicken and other toppings. While these were good they were a little too greasy for me (the shells tasted as if they were deep fried in oil and then they forgot to soak up the extra grease). My friends and my sister got way better looking tacos since they ordered individual ones off of the menu (each one $4.95 and could get 4 for $17.95). They got things like carnitas, mushroom sofritas, carne asada, and chorizo which all looked like much better options all served on soft corn tortillas. 

I would definitely recommend ordering the individual tacos, which are a good size (2-3 tacos per person is a good amount) instead of getting the hard tacos.
author: Gabby U.

description: Best Tacos I've had in along time...I'm glad me and my friends decided to ride our bikes out to this way
author: Soup C.

description: Very busy here! Pretty weird, we had to wait for a table, and we went and waited at the bar. We could see our table was ready but apparently our host didn't see us and was about to give our table away. Menu is somewhat limited. I'd say the pricing is a little expensive at almost $5 per taco. Very small tacos. But good nonetheless. We had carnitas, cod tacos, squash, and steak tacos. One order of the tacos were all extremely salty. But the other order they were all very good. We split the meat to the 2 tortillas. Service was fine. The medium sauce tasted really good on the carnitas. And my biggest complaint... was the music. It was DEAFENING. We were one foot away from each other and had to YELL. That was ridiculous.
author: Michelle C.

description: One of my favorite spots for a Happy Hour margarita and tasty tacos. Awesome tequila selection and delicious treats. I come here every week or two just to get my carnitas fix and a classic margarita!
author: jessica f.

description: Do yourself a favor and order the churros! But before you do that, you must get the fish tacos or the marina girl salad. The food here is always so fresh and comes pretty quickly. You typically have to wait a bit for a table however.
author: Penelope W.

description:
Can't stop won't stop with my love of Tacolicious. I don't think I've ever had a taco I didn't love there, but my favorites include the chicken mole, mushroom carnitas, squash and kale and pastrami. The chips and salsa are also perfect, and I also recommend the tuna tostadas - perfect for a light bite- and the veggie appetizers - whether beets, heirloom tomatoes or something else, I've never been disappointed by how fresh and flavorful they are.

I'm also a big fan of their brunch! The breakfast tacos are so tasty, and the cold brew with horchata in it hits the spot!
author: Holly L.

description: The food was really good. We got the Beef Tacos, the avocado tacos and the corn and summer squash tacos, and they were all really good. The only downside was the service was pretty horrible. Took a long time to take our order, and we had to waive someone down about 30 minutes after finishing to get our check. Other than that, it was great
author: Graham L.

description:
Honestly for all the hype I'm not impressed. The food was pretty basic. The reason for my rating is the service. We barely saw our waiter. Our tacos were dropped off with no explanation of which was which. Felt like the waiters were 'too good' or had better things to to do. Not only that they got the order wrong and brought two steak tacos instead two chorizo tacos. 

I wouldn't spend the money to come here again.
author: Kathryn C.

description:
My friends and I dropped into Tacolicious for a late lunch on a Saturday.  This vibe in was poppin'!  It was certainly a fun party with fun music playing loudly, college football on TV, and a crowd of young, attractive Marina folk enjoying themselves.  

My friends and I started with a couple carafes of red sangria.  The sangria was delicious and did not dissapoint my desire to obtain a slight Saturday day-drinking buzz.  The little tiny pieces of fruit were an appreciated, festive little touch. 

We originally ordered a bowl of guacamole to share, but the server informed us that the avocados were not up to par, so we received a complimentary bowl of queso instead.  The queso dip was very tasty, but less enjoyable after it sits at room temperature.  Note to self: Next time eat the queso immediately!

The tacos here are quite delightful.  They are not cheap, but the tacos are complicated and delicious.  Also, the plate of three salsas that come alongside them add to their overall value.  When ordering a 4-pack of tacos, don't be afraid to mix it up.  

For a fun atmosphere, tasty drinks, and delicous Mexican food, Tacolicious is a homerun.
author: Andrea H.

description: First time here and I wasn't impressed. Service sucked and the food was mediocre. Came here around 1:00, waited for a while to be seated even though there were tables available.  Our server wasn't the friendliest or helpful and the follow through with staff lacked. My lunch companion asked for another glass due to the fact that the one she had was dirty, a replacement never came. She ordered an IPA, it came flat. She inquired if it came from the bottom of the barrel due to its flatness. The guy said he would check, again no follow up. The tacos were okay, I've had better from trucks. Would I go back? No.
author: Kim L.

description:
Why does Tacolicious get a solid four stars in the Marina and yet just an average of 3.5 stars in all its other locations?

The Marina crowd looks better. 

When you're looking at lithe creatures held together by tight spandex, that $17.95 plate of 4 teensy weensy tacos? 

TASTES 1000x better!

I highly advise getting the baja-style cod tacos with crunchy cabbage and cumin crema. Or maybe spice up your life a bit with that chicken mole tacos. While he and I munched on taco after taco and dunked our gratis chips in their addicting salsa (semi-chunky! my fave!), we vowed to walk the 2.5 miles back to our place, up the steep hill and climb the Lyon street steps so we can look as sleek as these people. 

To boost our confidence, he finished a can of Tecate and I enjoyed the El Rayo cocktail: mezcal vida, gran classico, ancho reyes, grapefruit and lemon juice. A lil spicy, a lot citrusy and the smokiness of mezcal comin' through. IMMA READY FOR THEM LYON STEPS!

The final verdict? 

Tacolicious: 4 stars! 
Lyon Steps post Tacolicious: $@^*!@* 2 stars!
author: Janice C.

description: The food may not be authentic but it is definitely still good. Know that when you come here you're going to get a lively atmosphere, strong drinks and probably a wait if you're trying for a Friday or a Saturday. Definitely start with guacamole and queso. If you're feeling something healthier, the marina girl salad with chicken is a great option. As far as tacos go, the carnitas and cod are my favorites! For brunch, the chilaquiles are great and a very large portion; the lone star tacos are a good choice as well! And if you're not drinking, the horchata cold brew is a must.
author: Lauren A.

description: What can I saw Tacolicious was taco tasty! The service was superb as she was able to memorize our complicated order of multiple tacos and apps. My only complaint was that the tacos took a fair bit of time to arrive but my guess was that they were hand crafting them with love and care. I would recommend to any visitor of the bay area.
author: David B.

description: Let me start off by saying we had glass inside one of our salsas!! Upon arrival, we went straight to the host and were told to sit at a dirty table with crumbs and spilled food. We waited to be greeted by a server for about 30 minutes while every single one of the working employees were in a huddle talking amongst themselves laughing assuming taking about the night before. Ben is the most unprofessional person I've ever encountered. We initially asked him to seat us, he said ok then disappeared for about 15 min. I went back in & asked for service outside & for him as our waiter. We let him know we weren't very happy about the wait, he apologized again & disappeared AGAIN. The manager Sam came out & apologized. He accommodated us & let us know Ben was on his way out, big surprise... CAMERON on the other hand took great care of us & even brought our dog some water & treats...DAY SAVED!
author: Luis M.

description: Tacolicious has good drinks and presentation but both the service and the food quality leaves something to be desired. Went while visiting a friend in the marina and had multiple types of tacos (chicken, fish, carne asada) - chicken was OK but definitely wouldn't make my top 10 chicken tacos in the area. Carne asada was an upcharge and was stringy and chewy - overall difficult to eat. Flavors were ok but a bit on salty side
author: Jiamei Z.

description:
I was happy to see and hear about so many vegan options in this restaurant. I had some great tacos, some amazing Plaintains, good refried beans, and some roasted corn with a chipotle sauce that was kicking.. 

They have a full bar and a happy hour menu.
author: Lin V.

description:
We arrived here pretty much straight from the airport after a 24 hour total transit journey from South Australia. 

Already this place kills anything we have back home, the service in the states are chalk and cheese to back home, it seems the people really like there job and want to work there. 

Food wise everything we had was fantastic from the tuna fish to the tacos we shared it all, best part about this place for us is that it is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel so we will most probably be back!!
author: Benji W.

description: Went here late night, no one in line or a host, so we seat ourselves. A waitress/hostess scolds us saying we should check in with the host cause "it's the polite thing to do" then she walks away. Our host finally shows up only to seat us in the place we originally sat. Three different styles of tacos...meh. Thanks Taylor for schooling me on how to behave and thanks for the mediocre tacos.
author: Veronica L.

description: First off I dont think anyone should wait 45min-1 hour for some tacos. Second off tacos should never cost that much.  The tacos were a bit salty and the chips were extraordinarily salty. Great selection of tacos but to be completely honest I would never come back and I suggest that people just go to the mission for legit tacos
author: Austin L.

description:
We had a nice overall experience. Great location, nice place with enough sitting space and not too loud.
The food was pretty good but way too expensive for the quantity (at least for what we ordered).
Service was ok.
author: Gaetan S.

description: Ate here for lunch.. very friendly staff & I had 2 waitresses. Free salsa is the best! Chips seemed too oily. Tacos were delicious but too expensive for each size. Great  service- waitresses kept asking how everything was!
author: Carol M.

description: Our meal at tacolicious was delicious especially the pastrami tacos and spicy margaritas. From the moment we entered the bustling restaurant till the moment we left we were well taken care of by the staff, who managed the Saturday night chaos with ease.
author: Pamela H.

description: Delicious! I appreciate that our meal came with free chips and salsa. You don't see that often at a nicer Mexican restaurant that is that busy. The chicken verde taco was amazing. The refried beans were some of the best I've had. The mucho gusto margarita was amazing as well!! I had a great experience here. I will definitely return next time I'm in the city.
author: Ani A.

description:
Meh. We waited a looong time for a table on a Monday evening, which would have been forgivable if the hostess was polite. She was quite rude as soon as we approached her to put our names down. Then, after waiting patiently for 30 min, we checked in with her (as we noticed many open tables and no one else waiting) and she got snappy, mumbled a remark that was something along the lines of "she knows how to do her job" while guiding us to a table. 
Once we were seated, we still waited. For water. For service. For acknowledgment. About 15 minutes. 
We ordered the marina girl salad which was delicious but a bit overly dressed and I couldn't find any avocado in it at all. 
We also ordered a variety of tacos to share. The short rib was the only memorable one. I think we tried all but the veggie option. Fish taco was unpleasant...soggy, didn't taste fresh, neither of us could take more than one bite.
Also had a spicy margarita that was way too sweet and not strong at all. 
Won't be returning.
author: Brenda R.

description: Was craving tacos while visiting San Francisco and found Tacolicious thanks to Yelp. I ordered the fried avocado, pastrami and traditional pork tacos based on the recommendation of the waitress. All 3 were delicious. The pastrami one was my favourite - bringing a Mexican twist to the flavours of a traditional, much loved sandwich. The place was packed on a weekday. Would finitely go back to try some of the other food.
author: Kimi S.

description: This is by far the best tacos I have ever tasted. I recommend the pastromi tacos and the fish tacos. My wife and I were here for one night and local recommend this to us. I did not disappoint. Spot on. Tacolicious!
author: James C.

description: I meant to write this review awhile ago but have not had time. We went in late on a Saturday evening and they were very kind to feed us so late. Our waitress was darling, she was asking our teen girls all about their clothes and was very engaged and helpful. She made their evening really fun and as always, the food was delicious!
author: Kristin M.

description: Excellent food and great service. My personal favorites were the horchata, sangria, and the carnitas tacos! The staff was genuinely friendly as well! Great atmosphere. Felt attended to and will definitely be returning!
author: Mack W.

description:
I've never really went wrong with any taco spot... anywhere in California... yet. Thanks for always looking out for me, Yelp. This one was particularly good because I actually ate some Taco Bell like two hours after my meal here and could literally taste the difference #noshame.

If you are looking for bad and boujee, you've found it. The tacos range from your standard chorizo, carnitas, and fried fish (FAVE), but you can also find tacos of the week like fried chicken. Which I didn't turn down. ... but also wouldn't get again. It's one of those combos that sounds amazing in your head, but doesn't really work irl.

Despite my flaw in logic, I really enjoyed this spot overall. The 3 salsas were a perfect addition to any of the tacos, and I liked being able to mix and match. This place is a little pricier, but it's a solid choice if you're craving gourmet tacos and want to be full.
author: Vicky N.

description:
It's been a few years since I've dined at Tacolicious. I used to love coming here back when I lived in SF. Delicious tacos (with interesting fillings); creative margaritas; and always a lively scene.

This time around, I was a tad disappointed with my lunch. It was the first time I had dined at their new Chestnut Street location. I found no fault with the new space (what used to be the popular Grove Cafe). It's much more inviting and with much more seating the previous location. Getting a table for two at lunchtime was not a problem at all. And everyone from our hostess to our server was super friendly.

I guess what disappointed me this time around was the food. For starters, the chips and salsa (a staple of any Mexican restaurant) were so bland and flavorless. The chips, in particular, did not taste fresh at all. I decided to indulge in an adult beverage while I waited for my friend, so I ordered the Margarita Picante (silver tequila, lime, agave, and red chili shrub). As anyone who knows me knows, I love me some tequila beverages, especially ones with a little heat/kick. Unfortunately, this drink was WAY too spicy and unbalanced. It gave me heartburn after just 3 spicy sips. I wound up not finishing it, and just sticking with water.

When my friend arrived, we shared three tacos (the guajillo-braised beef brisket; the chicken en mole colorado; and the shot-and-a-beer braised chicken). I'd say that the best one was the braised chicken taco. It paired well with the three sauces that came with it. The beef brisket taco was surprisingly oily and greasy. It would've been nice to mix it with some cheese, sour cream, or something sweet. Something was just off.

At the end of the day, it wasn't a bad meal by any means. It just wasn't really a memorable one. Also, 3 tacos, one undrinkable margarita, and a diet coke somehow cost me $43 + tip. $50 seems like a pretty steep price tag for a mediocre/fast-casual lunch (even by Bay Area standards). Maybe it was just an off-day for them. I'll def give Tacolicious another chance if I'm ever back in the neighborhood.
author: Kevin B.

description: Order 10 tacos two drinks and cheese dip paid 85. Terrible service not once did they check up on us. Tacos were tasteless. Cheese dip didn't even taste like cheese. Everything about this place just sucked. Service food and price was horrible. Waste of money should have gone to super duper.
author: Brenda V.

description:
My favorite Taqueria in the city! And my favorite location is in the Marina. Service isn't always the best. A hit or a miss. But the food never disappoints. They are always packed. You need to get there before 7pm before the rush. They take your number and will text you when table is ready. I come almost once a month even tho its not in my neighborhood. 

UNLIMITED chips and salas
Recommend: **Albacore Tuna Tostada with crispy leeks, chipotle mayo, avocado. It's so yummy. Add some lime and its full of flavor. 
**Traditional Carnitas - Good traditional carnitas.
**Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib - I believe to have the most flavors from all the tacos. So good. The best. 

Love the **Rice-o-licious - So much flavor. Spanish rice as a side to put on the tacos. A good add on. Trust me!
author: Sandy B.

description: Just love their guacamole, made to order, fresh and delicious. Strawberry água fresca delicious !
author: Marcela M.

description:
Our bartender is who made the visit a memorable one. Sean, you're a real one and you get 5 stars in my book.  Down to earth and attentive! Great Bartender. My friends and I came from LA for a quick weekend getaway and this was the first place we stopped at. 

As for the food was overpriced for the portion but then again it is Marina District. So you're paying for location. Which is lovely. Location is 4 stars.
author: Cynthia L.

description: My crew and I ate here for lunch. We had margaritas and tacos. Margaritas were delicious and tacos were superb. There's indoor and outdoor seating. I recommend the outdoor seating as you can people watch.
author: Susan C.

description:
Tacolicious was a must visit stop on our trip to SF. Originally, I was more invested in visiting a different location but the reviews of this place were too alluring to miss out. We went on July 4th right before the fireworks, so there was virtually no wait. We had a party of 6 and we were seated right away. 

Our server, Rosalind was wonderful. She was so nice and accommodating. She made great suggestions and was super attentive. We started the meal with a guac and chips. The guac was a huge hit with our group, we eventually ordered another one. It was a little onion potent, and a lot smoother than my normal favorite guacs, but I still loved it. 

For dinner we all ordered combinations of tacos. I don't love how he ordering process works because there is no happy medium between the 10 tacos and the 4 tacos. It would be cool of there was an option for 7 or 8. My boyfriend and I split 10 and we couldn't even finish them! They were small but packed with flavor and filling. The best tacos were definitely the brisket, I should have just ordered 5 brisket. The chicken tacos were borderline flavorless compared to the brisket, and the cod was okay but too stuffed with cabbage. In the future I will order the brisket only. 

One of the greatest things that happened on this visit was the accommodations they made when I ordered a drink I didn't like. I ordered the passion first, which has a spicy habanero tequila. I do like spicy stuff but this drink was sooo spicy it burnt my esophagus. I tried to muscle through it because there was nothing wrong with it, if anything it just didn't suit my palette. Our server noticed I was hardly drinking it and questioned whether I liked it. When I told her it was too spicy she happily replaced it with the mucho gusto for free and allowed our table to keep the passion. I have been to many restaurants in DC and New York where the places refused to refund a drink and if they do they never let the table keep the drink - they would rather pour it out. I found Tacolicious and our server to be super classy in this way, because the drink did not go to waste at our table. 

Overall, I thought this place was great and I would definitely return in the future. Definitely order the brisket tacos. They are mind-blowing.
author: Nicole C.

description:
Everyone loves tacos! Taco + Delicious = Tacolicious hehe so clever. This place can get pretty crowded during dinner. Thankfully because they are located in the Marina, you have shops you can go to while you wait. 

The tacos are pretty pricey. 
1 for $4.95 / 4 for $17.95 / 10 for $39.95

There are many taco options to choose from! I usually get the traditional carnitas and guajillo braised beef short rib. The tacos are stuffed which is great. They are accompanied by several sauces: chipotle salsa (red), avocado tomatillo (green), and habanero (yellow). They also have complimentary chips and salsa for you as you wait. Why not throw in some drinks while you're at it, wink wink. ;)

This place has decent tacos however for the price? Not too sure if it's worth it though. But it is located in the Marina, which is expected.
author: Breanna N.

description:
10 tacos for about 55 bucks with tax and ip (got two hanger steak which were extra 2 bucks each).

Chorizo was my favorite, followed by the beered chicken...both were flavorful. I liked the chorizo because it had potatoes. 

The tortilla was really thick, didn't like it much and definitely didn't really need two layers.

Didn't like the steak, too chewy, the cod was not my favorite, crunchy batter but it was bland. 

The grilled chicken was something my friend asked for, not a huge fan. 

Service was busy, took awhile before getting seated outside. Chips and dips were ok, chips were on the thicker side, dip was so so. 

The three sauces that came with the tacos, only one I liked the most, the yellow sauce. It was the spicier one of the three.
author: Minerva L.

description: Cold, tasteless carnitas & carne asada tacos, and cold dry grilled corn. Chips are over salted - so you drink more. Nice service and Baja fish taco is decent, but not worth it.
author: Nancy R.

description: Really good tacos, if you are willing to pay the high price. They are really filling though! I got the 4 tacos for $18, didn't need to eat dinner that day. Guajillo-braised beef was amazing, the best one. Super flavorful, meat was cooked just right. Chorizo potato and carnitas were also really good. Fish tacos were underwhelming, if you are craving that specifically (which I do a lot) I'm sure there are better (and probably cheaper) options out there.
author: Max P.

description: After passing by this place SO many times while in the Marina, I'm so glad I finally tried it.  There's always a line so I knew that this place had to be good.  We waited for about half an hour and got seated outside.  We ordered the 10 tacos set for $39.99 and tried each taco on the list.  I also ordered a Mia (guava drink) $5 which was really refreshing.  They also give complementary chips & salsa.  I thought the customer service was great.  They checked up on us frequently and the food came out fast.  I highly recommend coming here for dinner if you love Mexican food and are in the Marina.  Now I see why there's always a line.
author: Mikayla M.

description:
Dropped in today with the homie for a late lunch and as anticipated it was cracking, so we just sat at the bar. The bartender was cool, helped us right away and checked in on us periodically. Crazy packed all around the restaurant, especially the bar. Wonder if they thought about moving to a larger location...oh wait they just did. 

To start ordered chips with guacamole and salsa. The guacamole was good, nothing special in my book. For tacos ordered a 4 stack with the carnitas, chorizo, chicken en mole, and shot & a beer chicken. The chicken en mole was definitely the most flavorful. I'd probably order more of those next time. Overall decent food, very loud atmosphere, and if you're in a large group...good luck
author: John M.

description:
In town for the weekend, a small group of us decided to check out the marina for dinner. We decided we were in the mood for margaritas (because, duh) and headed to tacolicious. My intent was not to order food, but once I walked in and smelled the spicy aromatics of the restaurant, I changed my mind. A friend and I split the 4 tacos, which ended up being more than enough - after the chips and salsa, I definitely could've gotten away with just one for myself. 

After sampling a little bit of everything, I wish I could recommend a favorite. All of the tacos I tried were absolutely delicious, and the margs were great as well. I only wish the salsa served at the table had a little more kick.
author: Ali L.

description:
"yummmm" after every bite...

I've only had the tacos at Tacolicious and they're damn good. I usually stray away from "chain" restaurants, but I guess technically Tacolicious isn't a full-fledged franchise chain. I digress..

The drinks are strong, and tasty, with some really innovative choices. I think I've tried every type of taco on the menu now and haven't been disappointed with a single one. But the brisket, carnitas, and shot-and-a-beer chicken are sooo good. 

Their standard salsa that comes with the chips is probably my favorite salsa ever, but beware of some of the sauces that come with the tacos because my mouth was on fire (and the roof of my mouth peeled..) after eating the yellow one, it really sneaks up on ya.

Can't ever really go wrong with tacolicious..
author: Sarah G.

description:
+ new location: improved space, layout
+ good specials (taco of the week, etc...)
+ good drink offerings for those who don't drink tequila
+ menu can't be beat (get the ahi torta appetizer for your meal, you'll thank me!)

- heaters outside don't do the job on a "cold" SF night, but you'll realize it too late to move!
- this marina location is a bit saturated at the moment, the north beach location is a bit more fun
author: Kerry G.

description: We recently relocated to the neighborhood and had signed up for an event at Fort Mason, which led us to find a spot to grab an early dinner in the area. Wow! What an unexpected and pleasant surprise to stumble upon Tacolicious! We were greeted by the staff with warmth and smiles. The street-style tacos were AMAZING! The Happy Hour drinks were delicious! We will be returning... often!
author: Kirk P.

description:
My first meal in San Francisco when I moved here was at the Tacolicious food stand outside the Ferry Building. Many memories were brought back as I sat with my friend in the brick and mortar restaurant. We ordered four tacos for $17.95 and shared. The taco of the week (al pastor) was my favorite. We also got the carnitas, short rib, and cod. Out of those three, the short rib was probably my favorite. 

These perfectly paired with a beer... and I should really have gotten one of those delicious (Tacolicious) cocktails that the bartenders were making. Not in the mood, though. We finished our meal off with churros that came with chocolate dipping sauce. Yum. Service was fast and friendly. I'm surprised there was no wait on a Thursday night. I'm sure it gets busy during happy hour, though.
author: Stefanie C.

description: probably one of my favorite spots in the entire city. I love my Mexican food, but Tacolicious provides a version that makes you feel light even after finishing four tacos and some guac! I really do this this is a great place to bring friends, and I love their new and bigger location on Chestnut. It is always pretty busy, but if you want  more of a chill vibe inside, you can go during lunchtime during the week and its not that busy at all.
author: Micah L.

description:
All depends on what you are looking for here.  Mind blowing food, no it is food truck food served with style. Above average tacos, yes.  You want great chips, salsa, guacamole and a righteous queso?  This is your spot.  Great summer/sunny drink spot too.  Inside is good and stays pretty busy.  Inside will be loud at dinner or after.  Great bar.  You can't beat the Chestnut, Marina location patio when the sun is out and you have a cocktail, a few appetizers and maybe a taco or two.  

Also, great for kids outside and early (anytime before 6:45) - especially during the week.  If you have kids and are in the marina, this is an easy stop for a tequila drink while they devour guac and queso.

Overall, come here for a good time - not some foodie experience.
author: Chris E.

description: Was in town for a business event and stopped by here to grab some food during happy hour. Had Chelsea as my server and she was amazing. I ordered the cod tacos along with the fried avocado. Both were fantastic. This place is cool.
author: Brian M.

description: Ha this place should be called tacotrash instead. Me and my co worker came here for lunch thought it would it would be good.... nope $5 for 1 taco you got to be kitting me, I've had better tacos off a roach coach seriously! Honestly 1st and last time for me and my co worker.
author: Price C.

description: I come to San Francisco quite often for work. I wanted to try out a good taco place but somewhere that also felt like a really cool restaurant with a great vibe and good energy. Definitely glad I came of this place the reason why I gave it four stars and not five was because the first time I ordered my food came out somewhat lukewarm, but when I did receive it and rather quickly the second go around it was absolutely phenomenal I got the enchiladas one with green sauce one with red. The team was more than helpful and courteous when I share that the food wasn't as warm as I wanted it, they made sure they got my food out instantly. I love the energy of this place you can sit outside or in it it's a great place for friends happy hour and or a date!
author: Christy S.

description:
Stopped by here lunchtime. Super quick service and food is so tasty. Really enjoyed the tacos. The fish , Avacado and chorizo were so flavorful. 

The place was packed out which is always a good sign but that didn't stop us being seated quickly. 

You want tasty reasonably priced tacos this is for you.
author: Stu K.

description:
I had the worst customer service experience this past Sunday - I came in at 9:00pm with my boyfriend and we sat at the bar. We sat for 15 minutes and NO ONE talked to us. At first I thought that maybe they closed early...but no...they serve on Sundays until 11:00pm. The bartender literally ignored us and I believe the manager came at the back of the bar and also ignored us. The manager however, made sure to give a bottle of tequila to the buser to enjoy. We finally got up and left.
Classic example of a business growing rapidly (3 different locations), and losing their focus on quality. The restaurant lacks front of the house leadership and basic customer service training for its staff.
I will not be coming back here.
author: Stephanie W.

description: My group wanted to check out this taco spot in the Marina. We entered the restaurant and there was no hostess at the front so we thought it was a seat yourselves. We walked to the back and began to sit down when a server told us "You need to check in with the hostess. This is not your fucking living room." Never have I encountered such rude service, as my 5 years as a yelp elite. Will not return here.
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Trendy crowd & trendy eateries with outdoor seating... & hello, we've arrived in the Marina. 
Tacos aren't my favorite, unless they're crunchy. I love Mexican food, but I'll take a burrito or a quesadilla over a taco. Tacos with their flimsy tortillas, and filling falling every which way doesn't make my life easier. Plus, they usually don't fill me up unless I have about 5. When I factor in the cost per taco, I might as well get 1 burrito.
Same story here at Tacolicious. There's also the added benefit that they cost more than your average taco. However, they do have a nice selection of tasty taco fillings.

They start you off with some complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa was quite robust, with smokey and mesquite flavors.

Taco Prices (currently)
$4.95 for 1 (a little pricey. I want to say tacos average $3-ish?)
$17.95 for 4
$39.95 for 10

Tacos are served with a trio of salsas & 3 snazzy wooden spoons. 
- chipotle salsa - mesquite (dark red) 
- avocado tomatillo - smooth, almost milky salsa verde (green)
- habanero - spicy (yellow)

The size of the tacos are average and have a good amount of filling in each one. They line them up in a row to keep the tortillas from falling flat. The tortillas seem steamed and with the amount of moisture from the filling on top of the tortillas, it made the tortillas feel really wet, almost soggy. Some of them felt like they were ready to tear. Good thing each taco is lined with 2 tortillas.

The lighting is pretty dark, so I could barely tell which taco was which. It's also loud, so I couldn't really hear our waiter explain which taco was which. That doesn't really matter, because some of the tacos tasted like they were seasoned the same way, so there wasn't much differentiation in flavor either.

The Traditional Carnitas & Guajillo-Braised Beef Short Rib were quite tasty.
The Shot-and-a-Beer Braised Chicken was okay, a little dry. Couldn't resist ordering it for the silly name.
The Fried Rock Cod had sweet, tender white fish under some heavy batter.
There was a Filet Mignon in the mix, but I couldn't tell which through all the spices and heavy seasoning. I believe it was the one with the caramelized onions. Not bad, not great.
We also ordered one with grilled vegetables that was really good and sweet. I think there were roasted eggplants in it. 

$12.95 Albacore Tuna Tostadas Contramar-Style - chipotle mayo, avocado, crispy leeks:
Best taco of the bunch to me. The toppings lie on top of fried tortillas, so you eat it as if you are inserting a small disc into your mouth. The chipotle mayo acts as the glue that keeps the tuna and everything else in tact on top of the tortilla, while also giving it a good taco flavor. It wasn't the most attractive, vibrant-looking tuna, but the texture was smooth and meaty. The most color on the plate came from the creamy slivers of avocado. The best part of the taco was the crunchy fried leeks. 
Very delicious, but pricey for ~$6.50 each. It's not a must-have, since you can get some rendition of this at an Asian restaurant on top of a fried wonton, probably at a lower price point.

I also had some grilled corn once, which was okay, but also overpriced. 
Also had the margarita flight, which was pretty good. They were served in shooter glasses with salt on the rim. I wasn't a fan of the habanero tequila. 

After a couple of visits, I conclude that this is a decent taco place. But I didn't love anything, nor do I feel enticed to make a return visit, especially since the last time I was here it was crowded and there were people waiting outside on a windy day. I did enjoy sitting at the bar and watching the cooks prepare the food though.
author: Joy W.

description: Tried a Margarita, guacamole, fish/chicken verde/Carnitas tacos.  Solid Mexican food but pricey (can get same quality at food trucks for half the price).  Good quality ingredients.  Nicely battered and good piece of cod.  Juicy and flavorful chicken and Carnitas. And the margarita was spot on and you can't beat the location for people watching.
author: Brian K.

description: Have been in the marina for 10 years and frequented the old Chestnut St location a few dozen times. Tried the latest chestnut street location twice, 6 months apart as I was stunned how terrible the service had become after our first visit. Second visit was exactly the same, bar staff wildly incompetent, service in general is horrible, and food is just average at best.
author: Matt G.

description:
I used to go to their old location 2-3 times a month. Usually it had amazing food and decent service as long as you could put up with the occasional wait as I usually try to avoid the guaranteed times with wait. Now that they've moved, their food has gone down hill. The carnitas is dry, ceviche isn't as punchy, and their previously to die for salsa lost its edge. The service is just bad.  I don't know if it's inexperience or not enough people, but drinks aren't topped off, times between waitress coming by to check on things, are all bad. The only thing that did improve is that you get the food faster. 

If you've never been here, it's worth a try, but they've lost a frequent customer.
author: Dmitriy K.

description:
This place sucks! Tacos are totally uninspired, they are pretty cheap compared to some other taco places but they aren't tasty so... They give out free chips and salsa which is a nice touch but their poor service, lack luster drinks, and bland tacos completely make up for any points they won with complimentary chips and salsa. We were shuffled between servers claiming the server was going to lunch and then 10 minutes later she was back? 
Bottom line, the food we ordered came out before the drinks we ordered when we sat down. The drinks and food weren't good. $100 for two people we each had one drink and tacos. To top it off all the staff behind the bar were drinking and everyone generally had a bad attitude. I expressed my discontent and all the supposed manager could say was cheers! To be fair I would probably have a dismissive attitude if I was busier getting drunk and enjoying my Saturday than being present at work.
author: Kellen M.

description: Delicioussssss, I ordered some carne asada tacos and it hit the spot after a long day at work! Be careful of the hot sauce though (especially the habanero sauce )
author: Jessica J.

description:
I love getting my grub on at Tacolicious. The margaritas are scrumptious and I have at least 2 of them each time I visit. A few of my favorite snacks are the sopa de lima, chile con queso and I usually get the skirt steak tacos. I like to sit outside, meet a friend or two and people watch. It's usually busy inside which is a good sign. The staff have been friendly and helpful at each visit. 

I am a forever customer :)
author: Melly C.

description:
Came here for dinner and was seated pretty quickly surprisingly for the number of restaurants in the area that had 40+ min waits!  

We ordered the guacamole, the chicken and steak tacos, the shrimp cocktail?  appetizer and had salsa.

The guac was simple.  No onions, tomatoes or strong spices.  The tacos were good -I'd definitely just recommend sticking to that. 

The shrimp was weird.  It kind of tasted like someone just dipped the shrimp in cocktail sauce and chopped up avocados on top.  

The restaurant was very busy and a bit noisy but fun atmosphere.  I think the key is to stick to tacos as the name implies!
author: Kimberly L.

description: Overpriced for what it is. If you've ever been to a taco truck in LA or had good tacos, then this place will be a disappointment. The tacos were mediocre, guacamole was really good, chip salsa was better on the tacos than the sauces they bring out with them. For me, the food wasn't worth the price or the wait.
author: T V.

description: A cold December night, the bartender was extremely nice to give my friend and I a blanket after we asked if the door could be closed but sadly it was not possible. I give him 2 thumbs up for this kind gesture! Also the drinks are good and so is the music.
author: Rosy C.

description:
So sad that the California avocado shortage is real because #globalizationisdestroyingtheearth and also I could not have any guacamole.
