Instead, we got the queso dip, which was probably equally lit but I couldn't tell you for sure BECAUSE THERE WAS NO GUACAMOLE. But I digress because the queso dip was savory, rich, and heavy - just the way a cheese dip should be. They also start you off with a giant basket of chips and salsa so no worries about the potential that you'll just consume the queso dip just the way it is. I mean, you could if you wanted to, but like you have options, friend.

The tacos are the perfect size - slightly larger than bite-sized but you could eat two or three without feeling too bad. Highly recommend the chorizo with potatoes taco.

This place plays some dope turn of the millenium Top 40 jams and it's pretty popping on the weekends.
author: Kristen L.

description: Hi I don't know why more people don't give 6 stars this place was fantastic. It was busy but customer service was great, food was delicious, and drinks were phenomenal. Stop what you're doing and go here.
author: Rosebud F.

description:
When your friend has to make a pit stop in the Marina and you score awesome parking, you take advantage of it and stay longer than planned.  It was 2pm and I had only eaten a banana so you know what was on my mind.  Food.  I was leaning towards charcuterie but once I saw Tacolicious, I remember a friend talking about this place a few times so why not.

Free Chip and salsa - Awesome, yes its free but more importantly, the chips and salsa were fresh.  We'll take seconds please

Beef Brisket Taco - MEAT OVERLOAD.  They sure know how to pack a taco.  Tender, lots of flavor

Grilled Cod Taco -  Light, fresh.  Dabble a little of the 3 sauces on each bite for more flavor

Great service, good music, a little pricey for tacos
author: Linda N.

description: Love Palo Alto and Marina locations. North Beach location is a pass. Consistently delicious. Highly recommend!
author: Sarah G.

description: Tacos were great. Paying $40 for 4 tacos and guac was not. I ordered 2 kale/butternut squash tacos and my boyfriend ordered 1 carnitas and 1 nopales. My tacos were delish for being vegetarian. The chips and guac were good but not really worth the $10. The tacos came with 3 different sauces which were interesting and I love that each table gets water in a huge tequila bottle. Decor and aesthetic: on point, price: expensive and overpriced like everything else in SF.
author: Veronica S.

description:
Came on a Saturday afternoon around 3pm, waited about 15 minutes. Food is really good!

Feels like LA, loud music, bunch of folks eating, drinking, and overall great feel.

Order three different tacos and they were all delicious.

Place was pretty busy, so I can't say that the service was great.
author: Tootsie R.

description: I truly enjoyed the food here. Service was great, and attentive. We ordered 4 different tacos with the chorizo and beef being my favorite. Fish taco was good too. Carnitas were basic. I loved the salsas that came with. We also got empanadas. They were very hot and fresh. I liked the greens and cheese.  The kids menu was good and my son loved his tacos, rice and beans. It can with a sundae which he loved. Overall a good experience. Next time would like to try some of the cocktails.
author: Carla F.

description: I came here for lunch today with my mother. The atmosphere is fun and the carnitas taco was good! I appreciated the variation of salsa served with the taco. The drinks looked divine though I didn't dive in. Unfortunately their Marina Girl salad was terrible - no flavor in the dressing or overall salad and the chicken used was really gross. Their guacamole was also subpar / middle of the road (it didn't quite meet the expectations for the made-to-order description and price!).
author: Rachel P.

description: The old Chestnut space needed an upgrade. But since there was no space, they opened in the old Grove corner which essentially solves the problem. In soft opening there were a handful of tacos and cocktails bring passed around and the patrons were mostly old school regulars. An L shaped space mostly dominated by the bar and seating surrounded said bar. A future private dining room  and the kitchen occupy the upstairs. Sane great food and drink but now in a larger format!
author: Kim N.

description: BEST GUACAMOLE EVER! The staff is friendly, the happy hour deal is super- $12 for drinks and taco. Visited two locations and both were great. I had clown tacos which were tasty as well. Got exactly what I was looking for!
author: Diane A.

description: Change for the worse?  One of their signature items, their salsa is gone.  They've replaced it with a warm (really?) chunky mess that tastes like canned tomato sauce. And the worse part is, all of the employees know, all of the guests tell them that they don't like it, and the owners don't want to hear it.
author: Matthew S.

description: We had dinner right before we departed SF. This is an awesome place to spend time with your friends. The atmosphere is great very vibrant. Food was really good. Drinks were awesome. I will definitely come back
author: Arlind M.

description:
My wife, one-year-old, and I live in the Marina and have been to Tacolicious over 50 times - hence the difficulty of writing a negative review. But unfortunately, our most recent visit was super off-putting. 

We were stoping in for a quick dinner during Happy Hour. Waiting for our table (coincidentally plenty of tables were open but they refused to seat us until Happy Hour just happened to be wrapping up), we chose to get a quick drink at the bar. Right before it turned 6, when Happy Hour finishes, the table that had been actually been open for 30 minutes was now ready to seat us. 

We asked for another drink since we knew it would be awhile until they were able to serve us once we were seated considering it can be slow. We instantly were judged in front of the entire bar staff for trying to get another drink during happy hour. We aren't 20 year-olds trying to take advantage of a drink deal - we really don't care to save $2 on a margarita - instead had been waiting for awhile and simply wanted another drink. It was so strange and unwelcomed. Being questioned alongside our neighbors and friends was a rookie move. It was 5:50 on a Friday, give us a break. 

Really bummed to have to write this as we have always loved going here with our family and friends. The bar staff was so rude it was actually shocking. If we could give 'zero' rating we would after this experience.
author: Travis R.

description: Horrible food!!! Tacos are ok. But the place is more like bar. Salads looks like a fast food place. Don't know how this place have 5 stars and 3 starts they should have 1 star. Probably because of the bar that everyone gets drunks and don't care about the quality of the food. Tacos are better from the old mission.
author: Liliana P.

description:
New location, new staff, happy to report this place is pretty tasty and doing a lot better! 

:)
author: Briana G.

description: Really a great place to eat. It's a fun atmosphere and the food is good. I would not order the queso again, and sometimes the service is slow. Overall, I like their cocktails and tacos. It's a solid casual, mexican food restaurant. I bring people here a lot when they visit SF because it's good food, a great location in the marina, and reasonably priced.
author: Lauren A.

description:
Definitely worth the wait (and there will be one!)-

Love how they've tried to make something for everyone who wants Mexican, whether it be the "Marina girl" salad (amazingly marinated chicken, lettuce avocado, pretty sure dressing is on the side by default) or your standard tacos. 

The guac is fresh (and plentiful), the chips have the right balance of salt and the price is right ($16 for the salad with chicken on it, $4.95 for one taco or 4 for $17.95). 

They're moving to a bigger location shortly which will be great because it was extremely crowded and a bit of a wait. Hopefully the new place will be able to hold everyone!
author: Elliott W.

description: I can't say enough about how amazing Tacolicious is. The name is funny but the food is bad ass! I get the veggie tacos most often and every time they knock it out of the park. This location is especially great because of the atmosphere. I stubble here to eat tacos after filling up on Strawberry Fields, at the Tipsy pig across the street. Love it! Also, my company uses a service called Eat Club. Overall, the meal selection is not great, but they've recently added lunches from Tacolicious and still, they knock it out of the park. This is absolutely a go-to spot for taco cravings.
author: P F.

description:
For tacos in the Marina, these are pretty damn good. If you're expecting traditional tacos like you'd get from street carts of Baja, this is not the place for you and try to remember you're in the Marina, the land of old white money. 
That being sad, they have some pretty good tacos, good sides (the cauliflower is my favorite, but it's seasonal) and they have really good drinks.
It's gets pretty packed in there, so while service is good, do not expect your server to check on you every 5 mins, which is fine with me.
Definitely check out their happy hour if you can and I highly suggest going to the book store across the street after you eat.
author: Cat C.

description: Bloody Mary Review - You know those rides where they pretend to drop you off the side of a building, or a cliff, or some other such protrusion above a terrifyingly large crevasse? I personally have not experienced this, but I imagine the preparation, the ride up, the waiting, the falling, and finally the survival of such an experience would be very similar to the flavor ride of a Tacolicious bloody maria or michelada. You'll be screaming "Yes, yes, yes," and "Can we please do it again!?!" Why go? A wild flavor ride. | Price: $6-10
author: Shelley B.

description: If your looking for a great taco the name is deceiving. There's a better place just a block away! The guac isn't bad though.
author: Ravina Y.

description: Great taco place in SF. We hiked about 6 miles from the Sutro Baths into the Marina neighborhood. Great find, perfect place to have a drink and a few tacos before heading to the Giants game.
author: Jill R.

description:
Review is for the food. It's simply bad. I've tried Chesnut and Valencia and both offered the same: $1 quality taco from a cheap taco Tuesday for high level restaurant price.
To be fair the margarita was good and service in 1 out of two occasions was fast and kind. But really, the food, just nope
Go across the street and check Bonita instead if you're in Chesnut, and if you're in Valencia just go anywhere (literally anywhere else) in the mission.
author: Mayara A.

description:
Love this place. The people that work there are so nice. It is upbeat and fun. Loud, but that is also the fun part about it. Great place to go on a sunny day. 

Since they have moved locations in the Marina they have made all of their drinks so much more expensive and instead of giving you equal ratio of drink to ice, it is all ice!! After a fun lunch and 3 pitchers and moving on to our 4th I finally asked if they could make us a proper one, and they just brought it without the ice. 

Don't order their cocktails. It is a complete rip off. 

Their carnitas tacos are amazing though!
author: Caitlin M.

description:
Great little tacos! Each comes with 2 little soft taco shells so that you can seperate it out into even more tacos. 

I got the Nopales and Oaxaca Cheese tacos to try something different. The server said that it had a type of cactus in it! It just tasted like vegetable. 

The empanada was great. Larger than I expected and super tasty. 

Service was very polite and quick.
author: Candice C.

description: Absolutely sensational. Service was great. Our tacos came out within 10 mins of ordering. They were delicious and loaded. We barely had time to put a dent in the chips. We were asked by two different people how we were doing and had at least 4 different people waiting on us. We ordered a side of rice that we expected to come out after the tacos and when we asked they went ahead and took them off the bill. We weren't even mad that they were taking long, just curious. We only came here because the restaurant we wanted to try had us waiting for 15 mins and hadn't even taken our drink order yet. Blessing in disguise.
author: Diego C.

description:
Being the cautious optimist when approaching a new taco joint (especially one with more than one location), I was absolutely and positively over joyed with the options and results from Tacoliciuos!  Wife and I ordered a combo of 5 different 'pairs' of taco to make up a 10 pack ($39.95), including some dandies:  housemade chorizo and potatoes (for yer meat and taters folks), the traditional carnitas (to get your baseline awesomeness), chicken en mole Colorado (cause you need mole on chicken), the shot and a beer braised chicken (when mole is not enough) and the ridiculously good guajillo braised beef short rib.

Pair those up with a wonderful Earthy blob of guacamole, chips and salsa and some zinger sauces (no, the Habanero sauce is NOT mango), you've got a meal for the ages.

My one regret was that we couldn't enjoy them at the restaurant, as apparently Sunday evening is club DJ mix night (well, that's what I sounded like was going on).
author: Patrick K.

description: I would have been here sooner if it wasn't always busy. I'm impressed by the menu and execution of the products. Hats off to the kitchen. The tequila selection is ample so I'll have to come back when I'm not at work.
author: Carlos F.

description:
Always great food and margaritas. 

This time we thought we'd explore the tequilas and ordered the tasting flight. Don't bother. One of the tequilas, a blanco, was rough without interesting flavor. It's probably fine in a margaritas but not as a sipping drink. The second was OK, and the third was an uninteresting mezcal. If you're interested in trying tequilas, ask the bar tender for a recommendation - don't do the flight.
author: LH M.

description:
This place was great for tacos and drinks. We originally went into pacific catch. But after being sat at the bar across from the sink full of dishes and next to the bathroom we decided to head next door. We're glad we did.

The Beer breaded fish tacos and the regular cod tacos are great choices here. The restaurant was pretty crowded but we found a seat at the bar. The accoutrements that come with the tacos (sauce, toppings, cabbage, etc) were a bit underwhelming but the flavor of the meat was great and there was plenty of it. 

The drinks are pretty fantastic as well. Try a picante margarita and swap out the tequila for mezcal. Its delicious. 

This is in the Marina so you should Uber, Lyft or Luxe here...because theres no parking bruh.
author: Will L.

description: I would say the carnitas was the best one. We got brisket, carnitas, cod and steak tacos. Steak was lack of salt and cod was ok. The service was on point, but margarita was pricey.
author: Kim N.

description:
Ugh. I really wanted to like this place. But the service was just REAL slow. 

The good was good! Drink was bleh. Overall nothing amazing about this place really. 

We came with a group of nine. Note to everyone: DONT DO THIS. This place is superrr cramped and small. I was told they just moved form a smaller location? Weird cause this place was tiny as it is.

We must have waited 45 min on a Sunday night with no promise that we would all be together. At the bar we ordered drinks. I had some sort of custom made drink from the bartender made with a smoky tequile-type booze. It was awful and ran me over 13 bucks pre-tip (noamal by Marina standards).

No chips and salsa given until we asked. They were free. Weird that they dont just give them to you....

We all ordered tacos. My fried fish one was excellent! The chicken was nothing to write home about- pretty standard. I love brisket but unfortunately theirs has zero flavor!!!! So dont order that.
I did like their 3 different salsas especially the orange one. Unfortantely none of them were really mild....

Did I mention each tiny taco is like close to $5 each a la carte?

Overpriced. Overrated. Will crossed the street to the Tipsy Pig next time instead...
author: Erica D.

description:
I always get dragged here and I'm always disappointed. 

The food doesn't have a lot of flavors and it's expensive for what you get. Mediocre at best. If I'm gonna have Mexican food, this is probably going to be my absolute last choice of venue.
author: Mandi W.

description: Probably the most overpriced and overrated tacos in the city. Poor quality and guacamole had no flavor. Do yourself a favor and go to the mission. These tacos are subpar. Fish ceviche was cut in huge chunks. 2 thumbs down.
author: Brandon W.

description: 4 stars for the prices only. Food was amazing, staff was pleasurable to meet. All in all it was a great experience aside from the prices. The food was great but not worth those prices. Thank you Tacolicious staff for being so kind and friendly!
author: Sara G.

description:
Wow, talk about a bad experience, first things first, food was good, and.... that's about it, hence the two stars.

So started off with the waitress spilling water on one of us, didn't even apologies, girl don't have no manners, she don't even know Pangea...(see lil dicky's pillow talking).

Then tacos came out, great tacos, fabulous, great, delicious, asked for a few extra lime wedges... never showed up, until we finished the tacos.

Back to basics - asked for water didn't show up, had to go to the bar tender and ask for another.

At the end another waiter dropped the check, I told him about the experience, he said "don't worry she won't get a tip" I'm like brah there ain't no tip for this joke of a restaurant. 

Food was good tho.
author: Reza N.

description: The tacos are awesome, the drinks are amazing and the staff are all really friendly. I love that they give back to the community and support local students!
author: Grace F.

description: I definitely am a fan of Mexican food. I love looking for different establishments that have such great authentic Mexican food esp when it comes to tacos and even burritos with nice crisp and flavors. I can't say yet that Tacolicious met those expectations but the food was decent and the service was great so 4 stars it is. I definitely recommend you to try it out. Parking is definitely a hassle but convenient if you know your way around the area. I probably will try this place again to draw my final conclusion so stay tuned.
author: Chantille T.

description: Tacolicious is home to San Francisco's CRAPPIEST quest dip and only redeems itself by the fact that all their margaritas are made with fresh lime and agave. The mezcal collection also gains it a star as well as the fact that they have vegetables on the menu. Go only if you love agave spirits, don't go if you actually appreciate MEXICAN food. Trust me.
author: Tim W.

description:
Awesome spot. The wait staff really set this location above the others. They are really friendly,helpful, patient, and always check up on you. This is not the case at some other locations. 

Some of my go-tos are: 
10-taco plate - DO NOT order just one taco. Who the hell eats just one taco??  it may seem like a lot at first, but lets be honest. If you are with a group, you will finish them. Be sure to get the chicken mole, braised short rib, and the beer and shot chicken, but really they are all pretty good. There are a lot of contenders for good tacos in SF, but none of them have those sauces. 

Pitcher of Sangria - I'm not even a wine person and I ge it almost every time. 

Chips and guac are also on fleek. The guac is made fresh. 

There is usually a line for this place and space is kind of tight. Sit outside if you're there early. Otherwise it gets kinda of cold. I've sat at the counter a couple of times as well and that was pretty fun. 

aaaaaaand now I want tacos.
author: Thielson D.

description: Although some of its food tasted good, this restaurant was not worth the visit for several reasons. The restaurant seemed to be severely understaffed. When we walked in, there were only one or two servers walking around the place, and once we were seated, our server came to our table so infrequently that we actually had to get up and find somebody to take our order. Also, they got every order (at our table of three) wrong. One salad came without shrimp when my dad specifically ordered it with shrimp; one salad came with the wrong dressing; the third salad came with the wrong type of lettuce. They brought my dad normal Pepsi instead of Diet Pepsi. All the avocado in our salads was old and brown. Also, the salads were far too expensive for how small they were (they only filled up half the bowl). The chips and guac were delicious, but didn't make up for the rest of the visit.
author: Ellie C.

description: Exactly as what it tries to be...decent food, decent prices...nothing fancy.  Good stuff
author: Jack J.

description: We showed up unannounced with a party of ten at 9 pm and the staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating, like we were asking simply for a table for 2.  So warm and welcoming, genuinely really cool people.   The staff is so professional, you would never have known that a water main burst that same night a block away, seriously impeding water flow to the restaurant.  The hostess and servers were so incredibly chill and kind, just a delight to walk in and be seated.  The pitchers of margaritas were great, the salsa is well, incredible, and their Taco Tuesday old-school build-it-yourself taco plates were fun and delicious.  Everyone knows the food here is pretty damn cool, but the service......about as wonderful as it gets!   Great ambiance, music, food, and service.   San Francisco loves you, Tacolicious.
author: Audrey F.

description: WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER HAD. They were understaffed and rushed us out. Not our fault you are short staffed and completely unprofessional in a service industry.
author: Breanna S.

description:
Great tacos. Great environment. Carnitas and mole tacos were my favorites.

Wait was about 20 mins...heaters outside sporadically failed.
author: Enrique F.

description: Great food and drinks! The meals came out hot, the service was excellent, and our waitress was THE BEST!! If you want good Mexican and delicious margaritas I highly recommend you go here and make sure Chelsea is your waitress!!
author: Hilary R.

description: The salsa for the chips was great. Very mild but with a bit of a kick I could only describe as pickle-esque. Unfortunately the three chicken taco meal left a bit too be desired. The chicken didn't have enough flavor on it's own... To the point where I found myself dousing it in lime juice to give it a little zing
author: Michael S.

description: Stumbled upon this place when walking around the area. We ordered the guacamole to start with and it wasn't anything special - literally mashed up avocado/didn't really have any flavor or spice. The mitcheladas were really good tho! The service was a little slow but we didn't mind. We ordered a few tacos. The crispy chicken taco of the day or week was average. The best taco was definitely the braised brisket taco. 4 stars just for that taco it was so good. Overall it was good Mexican food but nothing to rave about.
author: Brigitte N.

description:
Pretty darn good. A friend recommended this place to us. They were packed on a Sunday night but I am guessing it was cus the NFL playoff game was on. 

We were offered a seat outside under heaters. If that is available TAKE it! Plenty warm and if you are still cold they offer blankets. 

Server was nice and food was pretty good. 

Highlight - kale salad and chorizo tacos. 

Lowlight - kale and sweet potato taco.  -1 star for such a flop.  Tasted like they tried to sauté the kale in oil but forgot to turn on the heat. Also I counted 2 tiny tiny pieces of sweet potato.  It was gross. 

We will go back some day just will not order that taco.
author: Dale D.

description: Recommend going for the margs- chips and guac. Not much impressed by the food or service (which seems a bit too cool) but the environment is high energy and upbeat. Outdoor street tables are a nice option.
author: J K.

description: A little pricey for mexican eats, but let's not get distracted by that.  But if you're all about great food for little $, go else where, like mission dist, as we were told. Embiance was great, got that street side feel. Presentation of our food was excellent and tasted equally great. We got the taco platter/plate thing, and we picked one of everything. All three sauces were on point, which impressed us a lot because we're really picky about them. Meats were tender. Just try them all!
author: Xia C.

description:
Amazing flavorful food! We shared the kale salad and ahi tuna tostadas. Don't know what all the spices were but can attest to them being phenomenal. The kale salad does have a strong cumin dressing so unless you love cumin....
The cod tacos are just as flavorful and had a generous amount of fish! 

Kids enjoyed a full meal with drink and dessert for $7.
author: Tina M.

description:
Came here during my visit in SF. Ordered the beer chicken taco and mole chicken taco. Not a fan of the mole chicken at all but definitely recommend the beer chicken taco. Got a 6$ house margarita which was very weak but what do you expect for 6$. Other than that the food was great. The service was also great. Very great staff. Clean place. And the chips and salsa were amazing. Just add some lime to the chips to add some flavor and you're set. 

changed my review to 5 stars because I came here AGAIN before my trip ended and the food was consistent and the tacos were amazing again. The Choco taco is 8$ which is a little expensive but the best Choco taco I've ever ate.
author: Sahil P.

description: I've loved every experience I've had going to this restaurant, but I'm planning to cater my graduation party with tacolicious and it was far from a great experience. I first was hung up on, then called back and waited 7 minutes before someone answered. The woman I spoke with was very unprofessional and not very polite. Although I love the food here, I don't think I will be choosing tacolicious for their catering.
author: Sinead G.

description: Food was great. Bar service was great.  When we received the bill, neither of our 2 drinks were charged. We politely mentioned it to the bar tender. Got the bill back a second time with FULL charges of both drinks. Really?! How about a even a tiny discount?... being honest doesn't pay... oh well. Still good food and good vibe. Will prob come again.  Lol
author: Emily H.

description: Got two brisket tacos to go, and to my surprise, in my brown bag was chips, salsa, and three small different salsas. Did they hook me up, or do they do this for everyone? Oh yeah, it was grub, generous portions of the beef brisket.
author: Pickle R.

description: Food is absolutely awful! Nothing is freshly made, just terrible. Our sever was very nice...
author: Shawn B.

description:
Ever since moving to their new location in the Marina, Tacolicious has failed to impress. Most notably the staff is somewhat rude/standoffish. On two occasions I've felt I am somehow a burden to the waitress serving us!

The food is consistent, there is no denying that. That said, consistently mediocre.
author: Cyrus R.

description:
Came here in a Saturday evening (3/4/17) and Chris was my server. Chris was extremely enthusiastic about his job and was hilarious. I ordered tacos  and a margarita. Food was great, but not very "authentic", if that's what you're looking for. It's more Americanized Mexican food. 
Will definitely be returning & asking for Chris.
author: Justin H.

description:
Came for lunch on a Thursday. Busy but not packed. Service was great; attentive and friendly! Salsa is good, nothing crazy! Guacamole was fresh and delicious; would order it again!

Order the Tacos Dorados and enjoyed them very much! The tacos are pretty small, but we were just stopping by for a small snack and this was perfect!
author: Jared L.

description:
I don't usually crave tacos, but when I do, this place is on top of the list. Although a little pricy, Tacolicious really satisfies my taste buds.

I've come here twice now, and both times have been very busy. I was able to get an indoor seat the first time around, but yesterday, I came at around 7pm, and the indoor wait was 45 minutes while outdoors was 20 minutes. Outdoor seating is quieter, and there are cozy outdoor heaters for warmth. If you want to have a conversation, choose outdoor seating, because at night, it gets loud and crowded indoors.

As for food, the warm complimentary chips and salsa are amazing! I couldn't get enough of it. Yesterday, my friend and I ordered 10 tacos for $33: pork (2), beef (4), cod (2), shrimp (2) and a glass of sangria. Everything was good but I'd have to say the pork was the best, followed by the beef. I was so full after my fourth taco.

Service was great and attentive despite a busy night, and food was delicious. I've only had good experiences here so far.
author: Corinna T.

description: Tried the butternut squash taco (awesome) and fried avocada taco (felt a bit dry). The roasted beet salad appetizer was good but it was v skimpy on the habenero goat cheese. :)
author: Nishank C.

description: Delicious tacos, but a bit pricey as other reviewers have mentioned ($9.95 for guacamole that was fine, but not anything special). Seated below a speaker so difficult to talk. (There was no other option available so we took it.) I'd say the flavors of the various tacos were unique and everything was fresh. Margarita Picante was quite good.
author: Germaine H.

description:
Trendy spot in the marina to grab some tacos and some adult beverages . They don't take reservations so you'll probably have to put your name down and grab a drink at the bar or a neighboring bar. The tacos are kinda pricey but you're more there to be seen than anything. 

They provided you with complimentary chips/ salsa for starters. Hands down to the Salsa, one of the best I've tried after eating at hundreds of Latin influenced restaurants. 

Our main course were tacos, of course. We had the in shot and a beer braised chicken, traditional carnitas, Baja style pacific cod, chicken mole Colorado and the guajillo braised short-ribs. They also served it with three sauces: the salsa from before, a guacamole, and a sweet yellow sauce I couldn't put my finger on. All three were good. The Baja style pacific cod definitively stole the show. The rest were drier than anticipated, but still tasty.

Great place to go out with a group to enjoy food with great ambiance.
author: Portia S.

description:
Not impressed at all! 
The tacos are ok but definitely not worth the price and the service was super rushed. The server started collecting plates while I was still eating as if she was trying to get us out of there as quickly as possible but there were plenty of tables available. 
There were only knives at the table (no forks) and no napkins so I had to grab them from the bar because the server didn't show up for a while after she took our order. 
Overall, I was very disappointed. For $5 per taco, I'd expect some silverware at the table and enough time to enjoy the not-so-memorable food before the server starts taking stuff away.
author: L S.

description: The music is SO damn loud you cannot hear the person next to you.  Stoopid!!!!!!!!  It's only 6pm and it's Happy Hour (not disco time!!).  Turn it f*in down idiots.
author: Christin A.

description: This food was pretty good and the place had a nice vibe to it, but service was somewhat slow. This might be because they were busy but either way, it was somewhat lacking. They forgot our chips + guacamole and only realized once the main dish came out. Besides that, the food was really great! They have a smaller selection of tacos but there are taster plates that come with three tacos if you can't decide! Overall pretty good, but slow on busy nights.
author: Anna V.

description:
I was out and about on a city tour with a few friends from out of town, and really enjoyed the late afternoon lunch here! We were a group of 4 and ordered 10 tacos with the following variations- the traditional carnitas, braised chicken, summer squash, pacific cod and braised beef short rib. More than enough food for everyone and it was affordable!

The braised chicken is a must try and the summer squash taco is good enough for vegetarians. And yes, the amazing chips and salsa -flavorful indeed! Not really the best margaritas in town but you can definitely enjoy some beers on tap here (Modelo and Dos Equis especially). 

We got lucky and found a parking spot just a block away from the restaurant but it's obviously better to use public transport in SF.
author: Disha S.

description: Great Tacos. First time I've eaten there and will be back. Had the squash, carnitas and Carne asada all were great.
author: Joe P.

description: One of the best places Mexican places ever! The plantains were out of this world! The spicy Mexican corn was also amazing and highly recommended. All the tacos were also delicious and the flavor was phenomenal! There's this really unique spicy cocktail called pasion which is very interesting and is worth a try!
author: Dhrithi N.

description: This place really gets me. Tacolicious - thank you for opening. There are so many excellent burrito places in San Francisco. However, I could never ever find a good taco spot. This is my go to place. I just noticed the other day they moved locations though. I have yet to check out your bigger spot on Chestnut. Can't wait to swing by for some margaritas!
author: Robin K.

description:
Really disappointed.  If tacos are the only thing you serve...they need to be on point....they were dry and flavorless.  The place benefits from a great location, nice bar and drinks. It's trendy...with loud, loud music and slowwwww service.  

Bottom line...really bad tacos, bad service and very expensive. 

Avoid at all cost!
author: Mariana F.

description: Been wanting to come here for a while now, finally decided to after spending the day in SF. Location is great lots of shops and other restaurants close bye, waiters where friendly and quick with our order. As for the tacos they were pretty bomb lol. I will say tho that they are overpriced but each taco is filled with a lot of meat, the sauces where great and the drinks where also pretty good I had a watermelon margarita. Had a good time and left full so it was a success.
author: Frank C.

description:
My wife and I visited for lunch on a Thursday.

She got 2 veggie tacos, and I got 3 baja fish tacos.

Pro: The food is good, service is good, and located in a trendy neighborhood.
Two opposable thumbs up for the small sampler tray of interesting and very tasty salsas.

Con: $5 per taco... and not a very big one at that... really?  I'm chalking that up to the trendy neighborhood.  
The chips were a tad on the chewy side, although, to be fair, it's been raining for weeks.  Wouldn't hurt to put them in the oven prior to serving them, however.
author: Alan L.

description: My wife and I had lunch there yesterday.  Sat in quieter section at high tables with high ceiling to avoid pretty high decibel situation.  The waitress arrived immediately, served chips and a great red sauce.  I ordered the chorizo tacos and she order pazole soup.   All great.  Terrific Mexican with an upscale twist.
author: Bill L.

description: Staff cleared out the restaurant because servers and hostess prefer it empty as opposed to half full. 20 minute wait so we decided to get a drink in the bar. We had 2 stools and I was standing and and they told me I was in the way and keep the walkway clear. Don't go unless there is a seat immediately available. They will make you wait outside
author: Charlie S.

description: Very expensive for tacos to me , not really the traditional tacos I'm used to it's more like the American gourmet style .
author: Jason M.

description: new location.. same great tacos and guac. My gf really like the braised chicken taco, i like everything.. margaritas are good even tho we didn't drink this time around we usually get them. cant wait for the one in san jose to open up!
author: Matt C.

description: This place was awesome - came here for a private work event and everything was so delicious. Their salsa and guacamole is so so good. Great cocktails too! I'll be coming back here next time I'm in the area.
author: Taryn C.

description:
If you're going to complain abt how pricey it is, jst expect it! It's the Marina & a more Americanized gourmet kind of Mexican place, not your authentic Mission joint.
*phew* rant done!

Anyway, I've always heard so much hype abt this place, so the bf & I decided to try it out on a Sunday afternoon w/ no wait fortunately. The complimentary chips & salsa were very good & addicting! The chips were thick&crunchy, and the salsa had a nice kick to it. 

Starters: Albondigas en Chipotle(pork&beef meatballs,roasted tomato chipotle sauce, cotija cheese) - delicious & flavorful. I would cut the meatballs in half&soak the half in the tomato chipotle sauce,which added that nice extra flavor. 

Main: 4 tacos (bf had the nopales&oaxaca cheese & pacific cod/I had the guajillo braised beef short rib & pacific cod) - the beautiful presentation&smell of the food looked promising, but sadly, it did not live up to its expectation. Both tacos tasted bland. The beef short rib was soaked in the guajillo chili sauce, yet there wasn't any flavor. I had to douse it in the green salsa jst to get some flavor. For the pacific cod, it was fried really well&tasted fresh, yet again, it lacked flavor to which I had to douse it in the green salsa again. Also, the tortilla was overpowering the cod that I had to take off one layer.

Overall, tacos were pretty disappointing. For the price, you would expect to be amazed by the food/flavor/taste such as Nopalito, but unfortunately, it did not. The place isn't bad, but I wouldn't really come back here again. Cool place & ambiance though!
author: Trina N.

description: Stopped by Tacolicious for the happy hour deals. The margarita and sangria were excellent and the holy trinity dip was just as tasty. I also order some carne asada and carnitas tacos that did not disappoint. A bit spends for tacos but the taste is worth it.
author: Ryan F.

description: I used to love this place so much. Their food is still good but their cocktails are a waste of money. They fill their pitchers and cocktails with so much ice. Their pitcher used to fill 4 margarita glasses and now barely fills 2 1/2. It is such a rip off now. I just go for the tacos and drink elsewhere.
author: Caitlin M.

description: Horrible food. The salad is old and totally not worth it. The tacos are ok but very small. This is just a bar and not a place to get real food. I don't recommend this place if you want good food. They also charge a 5% mandate fee out of nowhere.
author: Karla S.

description:
Tacolicious has moved a few blocks from its old location.  The new place has somewhat more room and light.  But for an older soul such as I, Tacolicious is a madhouse.  Upon being seated at the bar I realized that getting an order in to the incredibly distracted bartender was going to be problematic.  Actually, it was near impossible. The guy was trying but there were too many people trying to get his attention. 

I ordered ribs as a first course and then two tacos to come subsequently,  It just isn't possible for them to organize a coherent meal here.   Everything came at once.  And everything wasn't wonderful.  The food was hit or miss.

Dry ribs were slathered with a spicy sauce possibly to induce one to drink.  

The short rib taco was good, the carnitas taco was dry.  

At this point there was the problem of again catching the bartender to get a check.  After a few repeats and use of sign language I got through.

As I left I noticed a few people standing glassy eyed by the bar hoping to get someones attention.

In fairness, people, a younger, hipper set than I belong to, were having a good time.  If you want to drink and to get some food to accompany the drink in a boisterous environment then this may be your place.
author: David D.

description: No bueno.  All 3 salsas are terrible.  Too tart imo.  Tacos are average at best.  Carnitas underwhelming as they don't get that fried grease crust that makes carnitas great. Chorizo and potato taco is a bright spot.  Decent queso as well.  But otherwise forget it.
author: Bryan V.

description: I was happy with our food at Tacolicious until my Husband tried his braised beef taco. This particular taco was absolutely drenched in chili oil. He took one bite and got a mouth full of chili oil. He proceeded to cough for the rest of the dinner while struggling to get the taste out of his mouth. He is used to spicy food, but this taco was way too much.
author: Nicole B.

description: The server PM B sucks! He overcharged for a well drink! I had to pay $15 for one drink!
author: Kira S.

description:
I came from the taco land of San Diego and usually wouldn't get tacos but who couldn't try a place called Tacolicious?!?  I was pleased to find that some pretty bomb tacos and great margaritas! I had plenty of time but if you were in a hurry, this place isn't the fastest on a busy night...I went on a Monday and it was pretty busy.  

As a side note to food quality, I think it is of note to say that I left my brand new Maui Jim sunglasses on the table and went back the same day and they had kept them for me. I think restaurants that take care of their patrons deserve patrons who take care of them. I'd highly recommend a visit!
author: John D.

description:
HORRIBLE SERVICE!  

Here is a summary:
1.  Arrived on a Saturday night  and saw a line out the door.  I went inside to reserve a table and saw ONE-THIRD of the tables, inside and out and the spaces at the bar EMPTY.

2.  The person who was making the list told me it would be a wait of 1.5 to 2 hours.

3. She told me that I would get a text message when the table would be available.

4.  She took down the correct number.

5. I NEVER GOT THE TEXT MESSAGE.

6.  I went across the street to the TIPSY PIG.  I got a table in about 10 minutes and the service was excellent.

Newsflash:  Tacolicious is not doing anyone a favor by taking their money.

The trend will pass and the bad rep for poor service will stick.  

I've been here long enough to tell.
author: David P.

description:
I visited Tacolicious on a friday morning and there was no wait! Success! I've always heard that it can get pretty busy, so I was really happy that we were seated right away. Immediately after being seated, a waiter greeted us and asked us if we were interested in any drinks and gave us his opinion on what would be good right now. His enthusiasm got me pumped up for the meal. 

We eventually ordered the 4 taco combo (because seriously...who would go just to get one taco right?), Albacore Tuna Tostadas, and the moss drink. The complimentary chips and salsa was on point. Their salsa is probably going on my top 10 salsa list! 

The tostadas came out first and they were heaven in your mouth. All the flavors mixed well and the only problem was that I didn't order more. I've been craving it ever since!

Our tacos came out after. We ordered the Shot-and-a-beer Braised Chicken,
2 Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib and a vegetarian (Asparagus, mushroom, green garlic and potatoes) tacos. These came with 3 salsas; mild, medium and hot. They all mixed well together but I just wish that the chicken had more flavor. I was expecting more of a beer flavor to accent the chicken but it just tasted a little plain without much flavoring. The short rib was definitely our favorite!

Im excited to come back and try the rest of the tacos and Im especially excited to try more of the "snacks" portion of the menu.
author: Lauren C.

description: We walked in on Saturday night about 11 , about 5 people total at the bar. Bartender didn't acknowledge us at all for a minute, threw a menu down and turned around. Didn't greet us , hello nothing?!?!? Waters ? Then the entire staff turned around and took shots! While we were still waiting ! Bye!
author: Gina L.

description: The worst customer service here! I sat at the bar for 10 minutes before getting a menu and then another 30 minutes for my actual food because the server forgot to send our order in. NEVER EATING HERE AGAIN!
author: Marci N.

description:
I wish they still had the Agua Chile that was my absolute fav! :( The Guacamole was not that great. My Kale salad needed more of a lime vinaigrette, too much cumin overpowers any dish.
Service was good.
author: LJ E.

description: Gross. Ordered delivery and the food was so bland. My taco felt like it had never been hot and everything was just thrown in the bag which resulted in a big mess.
author: Stephanie G.

description: By far some of the best tacos I've had! We had the chicken, steak & carnitas tacos, that tortilla was amazing!! We didn't want to wait so we sat at the bar, the server was friendly. We didn't have any drinks because we weren't in the mood but the bartender was knocking out margaritas left & right, they were looking good!
author: Jessica F.

description: Birthday lunch at Tacolicious on Chestnut.  Seated outside on the sidewalk. Ordered margaritas and four tacos (plenty for two) - everything was delicious, promptly served and the waiter was attentive. I enjoyed the carnitas and beef brisket tacos and my companion had fish tacos and carnitas - excellent flavors, environment and service. We'll be back.
author: Pam R.

description: Love this spot! Tuna tostadas are impeccable! The homemade chips and salsa are bomb. Their food is seasoned well. Staff is polite. Always a good experience.
author: Rasha R.

description: We ordered four tacos: two chicken mole, one skirt steak, and one carnitas. They were all excellent, though we found the carnitas slightly better at Matador. We also ordered the hamachi starter, which was a bit overpowered by the citrus (against the yellowtail) but otherwise good.
author: David S.

description: Food is good but got the worst service from BEN B. We still tipped him well despite of. No matter how good food is, we won't come back to a place with servers who are like Ben. Disappointing!
author: Romina R.

description:
you guys! margarita here will fly you away to the stars)) for real. I enjoyed complementary chips with salsa, it was yum! we ordered grilled corn( be careful, it is spicy), fried sweet plant( for windy cold weather it was exactly what i wanted) and tuna tacos( the chipotle mayo was the best)!
the reason why i put 4 stars is servers( i have asked fresh orange juice and she brought from package) i returned very easy though
author: Irene C.

description:
I don't know what happened to this place once they made the move on chestnut street. Being a local, I would dine here often. Once they moved, I figured it would be busy. 

Fast forward to yesterday.  There are 5 outside tables open, so my friend and I decided to eat there. There was a couple in front of us who looked lost and I asked if they were in line. They said hey were waiting for about 10 minutes and hadn't spotted the hostess.   I circled the inside and asked the bartender (who was very polite) to help and he did. 

We were sat outside and were left out there for a solid 20 minutes without anyone attending to the tables. Both tables on each side were sharing the frustration. 

Finally, I asked the hostess (who was amazing as well) if she could help find our waitress. The hostess ended up taking our order. Our waitress was absolutely useless. And the food was horrible. The queso was cold, the carnitas were really oily, and there was lipstick on the glass of my margarita. 

if you want good tacos, try Toma on Steiner in Los Hermonas on Chestnut and Steiner.  They'll cost you a fraction of the price and have way more flavor.
author: Joustin C.

description:
If you're looking for authentic Mexican tacos, this is NOT the place. But, if you're looking for gourmet Americanized tacos, this is the place - but it will cost you a pretty penny. 

I've had Tacolicious bookmarked for the longest time, and finally had the chance to go because my bf picked it since we were in the Marina. But then again, the Marina is known to be one of the expensive places in the city..

Located about 4 blocks away from the bay (or Marina?), this place offers Americanized Mexican food. Their popular dishes are the tacos - 1 for $4.95 / 4 for $17.95 / 10 for $39.95. For the price of ONE taco, you can probably get 2-4 more elsewhere for the same price. They also offer snacks, chupitos (sold in 4, 8, and 12), sides, a special "taco of the week", and desserts. 

My bf ordered (4) "baja style" pacific cod (4 for $17.95). This dish comes with cabbage and cumin crema. The only "fish" taco in the menu, this taco was meh. The fish was good, but eating it with the tortilla, you can only taste the tortilla and hardly the fish. Surprisingly, I preferred this over the short rib taco.  

I ordered (4) guajillo braised beef short rib (4 for $17.95). Listed in the highlights, this taco was a disappointment almost as much as the baja style pacific cod. With 4 tacos on the plates, there was "mixed feelings" about it because half of it was moist but the other half tasted dry. Though it did have lots of oil or sauce, it still tasted bland and dry to me. This taco was nothing special to me. 

Fountain drinks are refillable (I got a coke & it was about ~$2-3). 

As for the atmosphere, it's very hipster! There's an open bar and it seems to be where the singles sit because the guys are always up on the girls. Look out for the Jesus candle lol. 

They also have a small outdoor seating area. 

Overall, I didn't enjoy their food. Must be because I prefer authentic.
author: Mandy G.

description:
Went here with a group for taco Tuesday. The taco Tuesday special was underwhelming. Ground beef with the standard taco mix seasoning. Portion was not particularly generous, and accompaniments were fairly bland - shredded lettuce and shredded cheese. Taco shells seemed to be the pre-made hard shells as well. 

A la carte tacos were better in flavor, I had the carnitas, which was delicious, but portion size was also not very generous, especially for the price. 

Drinks were good, I had the weekly special, some sort of peach concoction with tequila. First one came garnished with a nice slice of peach, but the second was unadorned. 

Overall, a marginally satisfactory experience, but there are better taco options out there.
author: Arugula F.

description: Sometimes you just need a really good margarita and a taco, and Tacolicious delivers. Some of my favorite things to order are: the tomato mint salsa (the one that comes to the table with the chips ... it's so good), the chile con queso (must be made with velveeta ... and it's so good), the baja-style pacific cod taco (get it grilled, not fried!), and the achiote-braised chicken taco. My two favorite drinks are the house margarita (there's something to be said for a classic) and the paloma. Last time we were here, the music was WAY too loud, but I guess that's what we get for hitting up a spot in the Marina on a Friday night.
author: Hillary M.

description:
Nom. Nom. Nom. 
-Chips and salsa to start, it's free and delicious. The Guac is huge and delicious so it's worth the spend if you are a fan (save some for your tacos).
-Two tacos to eat (three if you're feeling ambitious but after the chips and guacamole I can never do it). I like the carnitas and short rib. They also always have a special of the week. I'd stay away from the fish one and there's really no worthwhile discount the more you order (though the menu merchandises it this way). Tacos come with three delicious salsa sides. The yellow is my favorite, I just always wish they gave more. 
-Negra modelo to wash it all down, though they have a full and lively bar. 

Tips:
-Usually a wait but it's great for off hours too
-On a nice day, try and snag a patio seat
-Sit at the bar to meet fun people!
-Call it t-lish and people will think you're a local

Overall a solid, higher-end taco place. Definitely a place to be in the marina.
author: Aggie N.

description:
Expensive and underwhelming. Maybe I like good old down and dirty cheap tacos, but these even felt pretentious to eat! Lol! Okay, seriously, I came here for taco tues last week. The restaurant itself is super cute and was packed. I tried two tacos: the Filet Mignon & the Shot and Beer Braised Chicken. 

The Filet taco had no flavor. Plus it was just a hunk of meat on top of 2 corn tortillas which made it hard to eat. I had to cover the taco with salsa and guacamole in order to eat it.

The Chicken taco was just bad bad BAD! Super sweet and dry. I tried covering this taco up with salsa and guac and it didn't even help. There was no hiding thst sweetness!

The one thing I did enjoy was the queso dip. So yay for that! But for a place called Tacolicious, I'd expect the tacos to be better than the cheese dip!
author: Elena N.

description:
Honestly, this place isn't all that great to me.  
Not to say that the tacos weren't good, but I could honestly get some better ones at Taqueria Guadalajara for half the price....seriously. At $4 a taco, you can't help but expect it to be pretty bomb, right? Well I was disappointed to say the least. 

The short rib taco was decent, but mine were so wet that they soaked through the tortilla. It also had a sweet hint to it (bc it was guajillo braised I guess), which I personally do not enjoy in my taco. 

The shot & a beer chicken taco was my favorite. The chicken was tender and went great with the mild sauce. 

The fish taco was okay, but I've had better. The size of the filet was pretty generous though. 

My boyfriend had the filet mignon taco which cost $3 extra. It was supposed to come with caramelized onions but the onions looked like they were barely grilled- closer to raw. He didn't even want to finish it because the meat was too tough and dry. 

And with the service, I think that it's too loud and dark in there for the waiters to even notice the customers. My boyfriend had to flag down two waiters to get the check. However, the hostess that seated us was very friendly. 

For tacos, this restaurant is pretty overpriced. My party got 17 tacos with no appetizers/cocktails and the total was $75. Think about what you could do with $75. Probably 75 tacos from a taco truck!

Overall, 3 stars because I enjoyed the chicken taco and the dipping sauces that came with it. But I'll probably get my taco fix from somewhere else next time.
author: Marny N.

description: Good food but not amazing. We had lunch here because we had their ahi tuna appetizer at a fundraiser recently. They were small and bite size not large like the ones we had today. I liked the small ones more. The spicy margarita was the best thing. Refried beans were nothing special for $7.50. Really? The mole chicken taco was fine but not great. So, overall it was ok, but really not worth the $98 for 3 lunch bill. Would I go back? Sure, but not anytime soon. Staff was super great.
author: Donna P.

description:
I love tacolicious mainly for the ambience and vibe!  Outdoor seating was full on a Friday afternoon for lunch so we took a seat at the long bar, which I really like.  You can watch them make the tacos and see all the dishes that come out.  Although this makes ordering difficult because you may want everything! 

Delicious margaritas
Cool, relaxed vibe 
Homemade chips and salsa are fresh and tasty 
Guac is good not too bland like some places 
Decent street tacos, not the best but good - we got cod and carnitas 
Trio of sauces for dipping - one of my favorite things about this place (it's the little things)

Heard they offer happy hour
author: Danielle H.

description: We always stop here when in SF. The margaritas as of he best around, not sweet at all.... Which is just the way I like them. Food is always delicious and the service has been good every time. The carnitas are the best I have ever had. There is the reason that they now have multiple locations, their food is fresh, simple and always fabulous.
author: Bernie T.

description: I think the one in the Mission has better food, but this one's food is pretty good too. I really love the guacamole in which they don't put jalapinos. But I was given the wrong change recently in the restaurant's favor. When I questioned the waitress about why I didn't get my change, she said they ran out of change and she wasn't sure she could get any. Huh? If you're going to be rounding up or down or whatever, it ought to be in MY favor, not YOUR favor. I know the Marina might be full of ultra-rich techies or trust-funders, and 75 cents isn't going to put me in the poor house, but that really rubbed me the wrong way. Then when I brought it up to management (or whom I thought was management), he tried to tell me that the change I was given was in my favor. Dude. Are you stupid or do you think I'm stupid? I ain't Hawking but I know when I'm short changed. The food is still really good though. So, maybe I'll just use my credit card next time. I don't know if the waitress was just trying to pay her bills or if she can't count.
author: Frank S.

description: Marina girl salad with chicken, a carnitas taco and a Marina Blonde beer from SF brew co..what more could you ask for? Oh and complimentary chips and salsa. No issues with Tacolicious. I typically stop in when I'm in town.
author: Garrett D.

description:
We waited 90 minutes to be seated (thanks to Books Inc across the street for warm clean lighted place to browse...do the right thing and buy something!)
Waaaay too busy because of its grand opening (moved down the street): larger, more airy and open floor plan. Not to mention cool vibes, friendly staff, eclectic music (loud tho).
Oh, right: the food! Pretty much same menu as previous but lots of items went up in price. But if you stick to the tacos, can't go wrong.
Table set with fresh tortilla chips and perfect salsa.
Husband and I ordered 2 veggie, 1 fish and 1 hanger steak ( 4 for $17.95) plus 2  beverages. You get three different sauces to  spice up the tacos. Our tab was $34.20 before gratuity.
Perfect place for date night if you don't mind shouting. And you just might want your earplugs.
author: Liana T.

description:
This review is for wedding catering done by tacolicious.

Fantastic! Their food was amazing. Our guests loved it. 100% as good as the restaurant. The presentation was beautiful as well.

They had no problem setting up a beautiful buffet for our guests. Would definitely recommend.
author: Jeff F.

description: I came here for a Saturday brunch around 12 and the place was pretty busy. My friend and I managed to snag a tiny tiny table by the door. We were greeted with complimentary salsa and fresh tortilla chips which was nice. We decided to share four tacos, two fish (Baja style), one beef brisket and one chorizo and potato, and an order of guacamole to go with our chips.  The three sauces they provide for your tacos and the guacamole were pretty good. The fish and chorizo tacos were ok but I didn't like the beef brisket at all. It was rather dry and just tasted like bbq sauce.  Also the tacos were pretty small... For $4.50 a pop I think I could find better tacos elsewhere.
author: Linz C.

description: the food was wonderful. the service was good but she was busy and pulled in all directions, but handled it great. great for a scene on the weekends. lots of eye candy and people watching.
author: Steve M.

description:
Easy, solid option. 

Been here many times and it's always consistent. The margaritas are tasty, the tacos are good, the service is ok, and the prices are a bit high. This is an easy place to fall into with friends on an afternoon for drinks.
author: Stephanie M.

description: We have been going to Tacolicious for years but have noticed a decline in the food quality. Went there for lunch - had the carnitas tacos and a chicken mole verde. Found a big piece of metal wiring in my chicken verde taco - scary! Glad I didn't swallow it. Mentioned it to our waitress who wasn't very surprised to hear that - said that it's happen in past and is probably due to the wired utensil used in stirring the mole. Scary that it's happen in past and still happening. Might be time to use a different cooking utensil. Overall staff is great  and chips and salsa are amazing. Just be careful to check your meat if you order the mole.
author: Nette S.

description: I couldn't be happier with the service I got from Cameron today ! We have been coming to the location on chestnut and Fillmore for quite sometime and now on Avila and chestnut and had a great experience every time !! Try the churros and micheladas !!
author: Jasanfran S.

description: Once again, I am saddened to have encountered a restaurant that I will prob not visit again.  Obviously with the name Tacolicious, the tacos should be superb, but this was not the case.  I ordered the carnitas and short rib tacos, which were recommended by the server.  The tacos were SUPER oily and SUPER salty.  I mean they were so salty that I had to take little portions of the filling and put it on a chip to even eat it.  This was prob the first time, in a long time, that I left food behind (that says a lot).  Was not really impressed with the sangria either.  Overall, def try if you are inquisitive, but I would highly recommend saving your money for edible tacos.  Enjoy!!
author: Mijung H.

description:
Went to the new location today. Not as happy with tacolicious as I usually am. 

I had the taco of the week, Margarita Fresca, and the beef taco. 

The taco of the week was the Arbol de chile. Rather spicy, but tasty. 

As usually great chips and salsa. 

Service was slow, but they keep the chips and salsa full.
author: Ish A.

description: Absolutely shite,the waitress had a attitude as soon as we walked in and did seemed as if she didn't want to help us,the tacos we got were   Very pricey and were not worth the money.the pitcher we got was good but everything including service was very poor would never go back and pay for that again.very very VERY disappointing!my advice is keep your money and go somewhere else that has good food and service.
author: Karl S.

description:
Tacolicious-def, Tacolicious-def, Tacolicious-def-def-def-def-def-def. 

Sorry if you didn't get the Fergalicious reference but this place is the bomb! I've been to this location and the one in North Beach and both are great. The free chips come with salsa, which is so unique tasting because of the mint. My boyfriend and I usually get 4 tacos to split, which is a great deal.

The service is great and the ambiance is trendy and young.
author: Jane H.

description:
Super amazing full of flavor! Two will be good for the belly! 
Carnitas were amazing! Stacked with meat. Comes with 3 sauces. Not TOO hot but still great tasting. Tacos are $4.50 each but your sure get your money worth! I was so impressed. Also cool deals. I believe U get a beer, taco and shot for $10 I can be wrong on exact pricing. But I recall it being a steal!!! 

Must TRY!!!
author: Tracie G.

description: Maybe it's just because I'm from Austin and know really good tacos taste like but... I was very disappointed.  Bland. Not coming back.
author: Lee T.

description:
Ok tacos and ok drinks..

The wait can get pretty horrendous here (especially after 5pm). Inside is a bit small so good luck trying to find a seat at the bar. 

Nothing special..most likely won't be coming here anymore.
author: Jenn K.

description:
-10000 stars if I could. MOST HORRIBLE ATTITUDE EVER. Food is good. Butternut squash taco is a must get. But I can't believe how manager responded us after he switched channels on TV. 
Everybody was watching football. He switched it to World Series. We looked around and saw/made sure nobody is watching baseball. Asked him nicely if we could switch back to football (packers vs broncos) great game. 
He literally said : what. Are you watching my customers now instead of watching tv? 

Very rude. We had such a pleasant evening and lovely meal UNTIL THIS BS.
Such a shame. Food is great here and through out the meal we kept talking about coming back and trying different things on the menu next time.  
But with this HORRENDOUS attitude. We felt very violated and would never wanna go back again. 
I never wrote any bad reviews/ think badly of a restaurant because of the service. 
This is the FIRST time. ever. in my life. He was VERY rude. We all felt belittled, and that's not how you treat your customers.
author: Clair C.

description: I live down the street from this place, go frequently but don't plan to go again. Went there tonight, ordered two tacos but they came out with three. The guy who delivered the food told me I could just keep the extra veggie taco. About 15-20 minutes later, almost done with my two tacos I ordered, our waiter comes up to us for the first time since we received our food and asks for my taco (not how is the food, etc). Blankly looked at him and quietly said "sure". He then reached over my food, grabbed a side plate, then took the taco off of my plate with his bare hands, touching my other half eaten taco while doing so. My friend and I just looked at him in shock as he walked away. Horrible service. Told all my friends in the area. We won't be back.
author: Sarah R.

description: My favorite place for tacos, guacamole, and queso in SF. No question. I live for the carnitas tacos and their seemingly endless basket of chips and salsa. Marina Girl salad apparently is also awesome but I'll never order anything other than the tacos.
author: Rachel C.

description: This was an unexpected, yet pleasant surprise! The food was amazing! And the Margaritas were even better. If you like real Mexican food with great service this is the place for you. It was so amazing I even bought the cookbook..... The salsa is roasted tomatoes with a touch of mint, it was beyond amazing!
author: Cindy W.

description: The tacos are really tasty! The new location has a nice atmosphere but it can get a bit crowded. Try the guajillo-braised beef brisket tacos with the yellow habanero sauce.
author: Steven C.

description:
The food is DELICIOUS. Let me get to the positive first then the negative. 
We had the guacamole. It was great but nothing special. We ordered 10 tacos and they were amazing. My order of choice:
1. Canitas 
2. Hanger Steak
3. Cod
4. Chicken
Now to the SUPER negative. The wait was super long and the hostess was not even nice about it. She acted like she was a super model and said "i have no idea" and rolled her eyes while I asked approximately how long the wait was. Waiter service was non-existent. We can barely locate the waiter even this place is the size of a studio apt. He forgot the salad we ordered and we didn't even bother to remind him because we don't see him after the tacos came until he rushed us out by bringing the check. The place is super crowded and noisy. And they have ONE bathroom. So there a long wait to use the bathroom too. 
Even the tacos was really good, I don't think I will come back again. I am sure I can find another great tacos place in SF.
author: Ada W.

description:
You know that point where you are past hungry and nothing really sounds good but you know you should probably eat something so you don't stay horrendously hangry at everyone and everything you come into contact with? 

I was definitely at this point when the decision was made to eat at Tacolicious. We stopped in purely because of the Yelp reviews on a Saturday evening after 10pm.

We were completely surprised by the ambiance, some how we missed the memo that this place is all late night lounge vibing after dark. 

Luckily they were still serving food and at that point to my stomach that's all that mattered. 

The mister and I shared the camarones al diablo appetizer, along with a queso dip that so closely resembled Tostito's cheesy dip that made us very skeptical about whether or not it was actually made in house (that being said, it was very delicious and probably made with Velveeta). 

I also ordered a house margarita on the rocks (pretty good, maybe a touch too sweet for my tastebuds) and we got our own tacos (his: short ribs, mine: carnitas). I highly recommend the short rib tacos which were super moist and very flavorful, but the carnitas were kinda dry and not that exciting. 

Service was friendly and the food was prompt, but I'm definitely not racing back to Tacolicious anytime soon.
author: Siobhan F.

description: Obviously not a super authentic place. However I used to like going here to grab some tacos and a margarita because it's in my neighborhood. After eating there 4 times in a row where the filet mignon tacos were sooooo salty , I just can't. When I sent them back they came back with no salt . Was this done on purpose? I don't know . A little too much or little salt is one thing but aggressive amounts or none is hard pass unfortunately
author: Scarlett C.

description: Delicious! I am not sure how people can get through 10 tacos. They are FULL of meat. We ordered 5 and I think I am still full.  The chorizo potato one is awesome. The salsa is great, think there is mint in it? Anyways really tasty. I have had the cookbook for quite a while and finally made it to restaurant, well worth trip. Will go again.
author: Matt T.

description: They have the worst guacamole in town.  I've never had such bland, watery tasting guacamole before.  They don't use Haas avocados - they use the cheap watery kind. I expect much more for $9 (or $10?) guacamole.  Horrible.
author: Jane L.

description:
Cute modern space, though a bit small.  We sat at one of the tall tables along the window, which was uncomfortably close to the next tables (the lady next to me sitting along the bench seat went in and out a few times, and each time hit our nacho bowl with her shoulders).  Service was friendly but a bit slow.  

The food was great.  You can tell their complimentary nachos were homemade, a bit thicker than your store bought variety.  I enjoyed the sangria with spicy apple salsa, a slightly unique flavor, not in a bad way.  We shared the spicy shrimp appetizer which tasted very fresh (both the shrimp as well as the tomato sauce it was prepared in).  We also shared 5 tacos, one of which was their special with braised short ribs and chorizo.  The chorizo was amazing, though the ribs were a bit dry.  The baja style fish tacos were good, pretty doughy but the fish inside tasted fresh and wasn't dry at all.
author: Alice T.

description: Working in the Marina can be brutal some days especially on your lunch hour but luckily I made a friend in the cute host here named Theresia who got me served quickly and as well as hooked on these savory delicious chicken mole tacos! I'm not a big fan of onions although the lemon cured ones here at T-lish have turned me into a fan.
author: Izzy L.

description: Been wanting to try this place for a long time and finally made it there. It was worth the wait! Tacos were so good. Had the best service too!
author: Cathy W.

description: Great Mexican food. We had margarita de la casa, so fresh tasting! The bartender Jacob offered us tastings of Paloma & pasion margaritas. The later had a spicy fresh fruit flavor. The Paloma was tart & perfect for grapefruit lovers. The guacamole was the best I've ever eaten(better than my recipe!) The salsa/chips were ordinary, nothing special. The chorizo/potato tacos & carnitas tacos on fresh tortillas were the deciding dishes. We love this restaurant! It was was crowded and noisy but with a friendly neighborhood feel .This will be the first of many meals we enjoy at tacolicious.
author: Jenny V.

description: What unique tacos they have here! The fish tacos are for sure one of my favorites.  I love the sauces that an order of tacos comes with. They also have very unique tasting salsa that goes amazing on the tacos and with chips. This is probably one of the best places that I have gone to for tacos. All tacos are double wrapped and filled with ingredients. The customer service is also great as well! The waitress who assisted us was sweet and checked up on us occasionally to make sure that things were running smoothly. I will for sure be back!
author: Kimberly H.

description:
GOD YUM.

I got the plate of 4 tacos and the rice (I was carb hungry)
I got the cod, red meat, carnitas, and chicken.
The carnitas and chicken were my favorite! But honestly everything was so good taco-wise that I am sure any decision is a good one!

We went around 4 with a group of 4 and the hostess seemed extremely stressed out for no reason. The dinner crowd had not come in yet and she was frantic and not very accommodating.  We got a seat outside after we personally found it and she let us sit there. The service was great though.

We got the pitcher of the house margarita.. and eh, it wasn't that good, definitely not worth the price so I would go with another drink if you wanted to.

But the food is delicious and the vibe is great. It is a smaller restaurant and they do not take reservations here. 
Eat those tacos, they are well worth it and at a great price of 4 for $14.
author: Bori B.

description: Carnitas tacos & brisket tacos are a must! Great margs, great guac, solid service even though it was very busy. Really fun ambiance too on a Friday night!
author: Kelsey F.

description: BEST. TACOS. (And guac). EVER. Obsessed with this place, my boyfriend and I eat here all the time and we also love ordering it from door dash. Sooooo good!!!
author: kayla r.

description: Had tacos after some santa con festivities. Guacomole was great. Service was friendly. A little cold in the restaurant, but It's SF. I had a sweater
author: Tony S.

description: Good food.  Poor service and a little too salty for me. The nice thing is there's no line (I guess we are used to other locations) but they got our order wrong and kind of rolled their eyes when we pointed it out.  So thats why I took a star our for poor service
author: Paul F.

description:
I recommend getting their 4 for 14 Tacos for Two, oh wait...plus one! ($3.95 extra)

We came here for lunch on a weekday, which we got our tables within minutes. We wanted flavors of all worlds so we got the 4 for 14 Tacos: 1) Butternut Squash,poblano peppers,chicories,spicy peptias 2) Shot-and-a-beer braised chicken 3)Guajillo Braised beef short rib 4) House-Made chorizo and potatoes and 5) Traditional Carnitas. We also ordered the Plantains for appetizer which has beans and cream on the bottom, it was sweet,unique and bitter but it was okay.

The tacos tasted pretty good, my favorites were the braised meat tacos, I couldn't tell which was which but the braised sauce on these tasted similar. The house made chorizo and potatoes stayed true to its name and meshed well, chorizo mash? The servers tell you which taco is what on your plate, but I pretend to listen and all I wanted was to dig! 

Keep in mind there are two tortillas wraps on each of these tacos and is meant to spread the wealth. I ate some of these the way they are and got me stuffed real quick!  I wouldn't say the tacos are mini but the meat portions are enough to share with your date.  

I missed out on trying their chupitos, if anyone tried them hit me up and let me know how they are. This place may not feel like a typical Mexican restaurant but its a trendy bar atmosphere, even Obama tried their stuff.
author: Jon B.

description:
I had the lone star Taco's for Brunch and they honestly blew me away. I didn't expect such a high level of quality! Jusicy scrambled eggs,  crispy bacon and all the breakfast garnishes!

Do it for a VERY affordable brunch!
author: James H.

description: I ordered a kale salad with chicken to go. It took an hour to get my salad. They messed up my order twice, one of which they gave raw chicken. I'm never going here again.
author: Jenni H.

description:
Don't let the name fool you, this is good food. It's not a gimmick. 
My recommendations:
Pasion chupitos to share.
Get at least 2 carnitas tacos. One just isn't enough. 
The fried plantains are always a good idea. 

They don't take reservations, there may be a wait, and everyone in your party must be present to be seated. 

Enjoy !
author: Zen K.

description: This is definitely not your regular little dark taco place. The joint is trendy, pumping and has a full bar. We were lucky we came early (5 pm for dinner on a Saturday night!) and got a table! Server was friendly and helpful, and our tacos were gourmet. The best deal is to get 10 tacos for $39; the ingredients are fancy and flavorful. I also really like the rice milk drink that they creatively spiked with rum for me. Love the guacamole as well. Will come back for more.
author: Lily T.

description: The taco special offered poor quality meat, oddly spiced, and over-fried greasy taco shells.  The guacamole had a watered-down feel with little taste.  It's puzzling why this place is so popular when the food is so bad.  The wait staff, on the other hand, is attentive and polite.
author: darcy f.

description:
I'd have to say... people who haven't been to LA or San Diego don't really know how a real taco should taste and his establishment clearly doesn't know either. This was another Yelp Fail. OVERRATED and OVERPRICED. I'll probably only come here to drink, but definitely not for the food. What were you thinking putting Taco in the name if the taco weren't so delicious?!

Food: **
1) fried local rock cod - soft and fresh, but absolutely no flavor.
2) shot-and-a-beer braised chicken - The chicken wasn't that bad, but based on my experiences with chicken tacos, it's definitely not worth the price.
3) guajillo braised beef short rib - It had a weird texture that was inconsistent, it was a little dry on different parts of the taco.
4) Carnitas - Just like my review of the chicken; not bad, but not worth the price. Nothing special or unique.
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hcGIDuoE0Hn3-XKuICP0mg?select=o6tunUVlyI_1KWRChbIfZA#3fsPKHkznAe_QjN2E5gZqw

Drinks: 4 Stars ****
1) Tickle Me Telmo - chimayo reposado, agave nectar, lime, orange. This was the favorite of the drinks in our group. Strong and delicious with minimal tequila flavor.

2) Nopal - cabrito blanco, prickly pear, citrus. The taste of the tequila is more apparent in this concoction, but I didn't seem to mind. The girls liked the other one mentioned above because the tequila taste was minimal
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hcGIDuoE0Hn3-XKuICP0mg?select=o6tunUVlyI_1KWRChbIfZA#259lAe-B2_Tm5_BwmdJtfw

Service: 2 stars**
What do I have to do to get a glass of water here?! The staff was friendly when they showed up but they rarely even made an appearance to see how we're doing.
author: James B.

description:
As a lover of all this Mexican food and a Southern California native, I'm naturally a little picky with my taco selection. However, the Skirt Steak tacos are to die for. They're simple yet so tasty due to a sharp pickled onion and a well-flavored meat. The margaritas are a delightful combo of strong yet yummy. Highly recommend the fillmore paloma!

I'm coming back as a regular :)
author: Hannah B.

description:
