Good place to enjoy some 'Taco Tuesday'. I liked the margarita as well for $6 under your special deal of the day, which contained 6 crispy shells and ground beef for the tacos

The place is very comfy and nice looking. My friends and I had a great time here.
author: William H.

description: This is a small place but big food and delicious!  There is always a waiting list so don't expect to get seated right away,  but the wait is worth it.  Parking was difficult however there's a parking garage a couple of blocks that I found by luck. There is all kinds of fun shops everywhere. I would recommend for the food.
author: Donna F.

description:
Went as a double date to catch up with friends. Monday, 8pm. Was pretty busy, especially at the bar, which looked like a ton of fun. They got a table together for us pretty quickly though - maybe 10 minutes. Transferred our bar tab over too.

House margarita: excellent! There was plenty of tequila in there...

Started with guac, which was realllllly good. Then we got 10 tacos for the 4 of us, which was plenty of food after the guac and drinks. They came really nicely presented too! I went with what seemed to be the most popular: short rib, carnitas, cod. The carnitas is "the best one" according to the waitress. I liked the short ribs a little better, but they were both juicy, fresh, and delicious. The cod was really tasty - a bit greasy as it is fried. My girlfriend loved the veggie tacos as well. They bring out a number of sauces as toppings. The yellow habenero sauce is SPICY, but really good. I mistakenly put too much on at first and went reaching for my marg class. Careful.

Great service, and really tasty tacos. Good atmosphere too! We stopped over to the Tipsy Pig afterwards to sit outside and enjoy a yummy post-dinner cocktail with friends.
author: Eric R.

description: The food was good, although the service was so-so and some things ordered didn't come. I'm reviewing this because of the attire on our waitress. Not that I'm on either side of the politics in today's environment, I just want to be kept out of it when I sit down at a restaurant and am greeted by a waitress wearing a shirt opposing a certain political figure. It made it uncomfortable for me as I can tell the table next to us didn't appreciate the shirt. Keep politics out of your restaurant and just serve tacos. It's just called being professional
author: Brandon L.

description: Awesome tacos! Very creative and unique! Love the new location at the marina. Bartenders are super friendly! Drinks are also amazing. Can't wait to go back.
author: Rodolfo C.

description:
Tacolicious is an alright place for Americanized Mexican food in the marina, most easily explained through their business model:

1. Crowded place full of twenty-something girls having "girls night" with watered-down margaritas

2. 4 dollar artisan tacos

3. Salsa rationed so small that it probably came from a humanitarian aid crate

3. No water 

If you're interested in taqueria Mexican food, go to Los Hermanos across the street.

If you're interested in Americanized Mexican food, go to Tacko.

If you want a place to catch up with your girlfriends after a barre class, come here. 

Pretty expensive. The food is fine, but you can do better.
author: William M.

description: Not impressed at all. The spicy sause was not at all. Over priced. I would not recommend it. Overall not good to me at all, I love Mexican food. I will say one thing, the drinks was a 10
author: Alphonso W.

description: Came to Tacolicious with a friend for drinks and some snackage while visiting SF to get the local experience! We had much for fun than we had intended here! Though it was pretty busy we enjoyed the outdoor seating watching passerby's while we enjoyed our margaritas! The bartender definitely had some fun whipping us up some new drinks that I wish I remembered the name of! I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good time while enjoying good conversation in the city. We also had a super cute server who had amazing customer service! thanks Giorgina!
author: Troy P.

description:
(Feel free to sing along to the beat of Fergie's "Fergalicious")

check it.

Tacolicious definition makes them boys go taco
They eat my treasure when they get their pleasure from my nachos
You can see me (You can't squeeze me)
I ain't easy (But I'm cheesy)
I got lemons so i squeeze them
Guacs they come and go like seasons

Tacolicious (So Delicious)
But, it ain't conspicuous
And if you were suspicious
All the flavor is contagious
I clean my dishes (mmmmmmmm)
Horchatas on the rock, rock!
And they be lining down the block, just to eat, what i got

Tacolicious (sauce is hot, hot!)
Tacolicious (they got Horchata on the rocks!)
Tacolicious (they wanna crunch on what i got!)
Tacolicious

t-t-t-t-t-tasty, tastyyyyyyy!
author: Ringo M.

description:
Years later I'm naturally still a big Tacolicious fan. Actually, I'm an even bigger Tacolicious fan. Last April, though I failed to update my review, I took my New Yorker friend here for lunch. Two days later my boss was in town and wanted to meet for lunch, so we went- AGAIN- and pretended that we didn't go a couple of days before. Secretly we just wanted to try out the tacos we hadn't on our prior visit. Over the past year we would haunt each other and talk about how good our lunch was, send photos of the tacos and reminisce about our marina mishaps. 

I went for lunch with another friend this past Monday and OF COURSE I sent him a photo of the menu, guac and tacos (the response from him was "I HATE YOU!!!!"). The guac is seriously amaze and the chips/salsa are also perfect. I had the cod and the pork taco while my friend had chicken. Yum- I only wish there was cross-country Tacolicious delivery service. :)
author: Kristin F.

description:
Don't go to Tacolicious if you are looking for 'super authentic' Mexican food.  Do go if you are looking for a DELICIOUS, reasonably priced meal, full of flavor and with high-quality ingredients.

Tacolicious is not a $1 taco el cheapo crap shack.  They have a very interesting and well-balanced menu featuring a number of different tacos (standards like 'carnitas' as well as their own creations such as a filet mignon & veggie tacos and specials of the week...) as well as many other non-taco items- salads, sides, great guacamole, salsas, sauces, etc...My personal favorite item on the menu regularly is the tuna tostada.  This dish features two generous albacore cuts (raw) on a flat/circular taco shell accompanied with a slice of fresh avocado, spicy mayo, and fried shallots...awesome - a MUST order.  My other favorite item is from their drink menu- be brave and try the passion margarita- it comes flavored with habanero and packs a punch!

Anyways, there is a reason Tacolicious is ALWAYS packed.  The food is great.  For those so inclined, I've ordered a few times using their on-line take-out system, and it works smoothly and my food has been ready every time with little or no wait.  Enjoy Tacolicious for what it is- a source of great food- but don't bash it for not being a 'traditional' Mexican restaurant.  It's on Chestnut Street for crying out loud- are you really looking for traditional Mexican food on Chestnut Street?  I'll be back often...
author: Andy S.

description:
Don't bother.

Go find a taco truck for some real "taco-liscous" tacos for less than half the price.

DOOOO EEEEET!

Ok, fine I guess I should elaborate more...

I got the traditional carnitas tacos that was just DRY. Fail.

I also got the cod fish taco that only had a drop of their creamy sauce.  Fail.

I also tried the short rib taco my co-worker didnt want anymore...dry and the flavor was weird...no wonder she stopped eating it.  

The sauces weren't spicy enough...even the yellow one.  Yup, fail...but at least it made the carnitas less dry tasting.

Ok ok there MUST be something good out of this.  

The company :]  I came with my team after work.  THat was fun.  

I tasted the habanero margarita which I thought was interesting because the spiciness was gradually immersed after one sip.  I liked that it just didn't punch you in the balls as soon as you sipped it.

Oh yeah the chips and salsa was good...not spicy but good...that or I was starving.  But I rather fill up on those than the tacos, heh.

The atmosphere was nice.  I digged the mexican stereotypes decor with the jesus candles and the luchador figurines.  I'm not being sarcastic.  The interior of the restaurant was nice :]

Now to go get me some taco truck tacos....
author: Tu-Anh N.

description:
Fun energy, good location. The guac and spicy Margs are my faves. Salsa is excellent too- I basically drink it.
The main downside is how long the wait can be on Friday and Saturday nights. I guess that's what you get though.
The tacos are alright. Kind of pricy.
author: Magda M.

description: Very expensive tacos!  $5 per taco.  But it's good.  The fish taco could have been better.  The pulled pork and chicken tacos are nice.  You can tell the quality of the meat is fresh.  The dips are nice.  Ambience is great.  Too bad this place is so expensive i can only come here once in a while.
author: Byron L.

description:
*FYI TO GUACAMOLE LOVERS,, GUACAMOLE=$10*
I visited Tacolicious on a Tuesday *cue ILoveMakonnen vocals* and just as horrible as his vocals, so were these tacos. 

Maybe I being a little harsh on the both but I didn't really enjoy the overall experience. There taco Tuesday specials drew a large crowd, as it should be. But it seemed quite disorganized, by seating people that arrived later than me and my girlfriend. 

Once we were seated though we ordered the $12 "make your own tacos" deal. It came with ground beef (cannot choose other meats), lettuce, chopped tomatoes, cheese, some sort of sauce that resembled Tabasco's smoked flavor, and 6 corn tortilla. They give complementary tortilla chips and salsa (spicy). It was an overall decent meal, but not truly worth the $12 in my eyes. It was too Americanized for my taste buds.

But I believe the reason I give it a low number of stars is due to the seasoning of the ground beef. It was to bland in flavor and didn't remind me of classic/authentic Mexican style tacos. Another reason was the price of guacamole which is just shy of $10 and the amount served should only warrant a price that isn't over $5.

So in all I believe if you look for authentic Mexican style tacos, across the street might be a safer bet. But if you desire Mexican food that is not authentic, definitely try this place.
author: Daveed C.

description: This place was alive! They have truly excellent tacos especially the carnitas ones. Our waitress, despite a broken rib and a boisterous crowd, was super attentive. I will be returning.
author: Chris W.

description: I really enjoy their tacos. Let's be honest, this is not real mexican food, and I love the real stuff, but tacolicious is an americanized twist of their own, which is fun if you are looking for something different! It has a cool atmosphere (yes it's loud, so don't go for a romantic dinner), nice for a drink and some tacos, haven't tried anything else besides all their tacos, their queso and guacamole. Their tacos are definitely overpriced, but they come with a lot of meat in them. First time we went there we ordered 8 tacos for the two of us and my husband was so full that we only ate 7 of them (keep in mind that he is someone who usually orders 6 tacos in a regular mexican hole in the wall). So yeah, it may look expensive but the tacos come loaded! Also they keep refilling your chips and salsa which is complimentary, and considering how delicious their salsa is you end up eating too much chips and salsa. their salsa is not spicy at all, again this is not the real mexican restaurant, but it has a mint twist in it which makes it amazing and refreshing. All their salsas that come with the taco are pretty boring, I honestly just use the regular salsa over my tacos! Our favorite tacos are the fish, nopales with cheese, and homemade chorizo with potatoes.
author: J. S.

description:
REAL TALK.

Chances are there will never be an El Farolito, Taqueria Cancun, or Taqueria Vallarta in The Marina. I'm not going to hate on The Marina; you can read the Yelp reviews for that (http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-marina-san-francisco). But there is one thing I will NEVER understand...

WHY do some Marina chicks feel the need to grab a skinny latte in head-to-toe Lululemon, 5" Loubountin stilettos, Bump-It hair, and FULL-ON pageant make-up...at 9 in the freakin' morning?!?!? Don't get me wrong, they are hot but unless you're on your way to the Gold's Club, Crazy Horse, or to the AVNs, please stop making the rest of us jelly. 

And to the pompous fellas, "I went to Yale..." is NOT an effective pick-up line. Most girls can care less about the prestigious university you went to or the scholar accolades you've received especially when my 5'2 self can see your bald spot. Please go eat a slice of humble pie. 

ANYWHOO...back to the review at hand. 

You're not going to find authentic nor cheap fare at Tacolicious. What you will find is gourmet Americanized Mexican fare that will come at a pretty penny. Expect to spend as much on a meal at Tacolicious as you would 5 meals at your local taqueria in The Mission. I have no problem splurging on good food, only if it's "good" though.

F O O D
*Albacore Tuna Tostadas "Contramar-Style" w/ Crispy Leeks, Chipotle Aioli, & Avocado (2 for $10.95) - 4.5 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hcGIDuoE0Hn3-XKuICP0mg?select=9hOblhjY-THOc2It3HmsqQ
The highlight and saving grace of our meal was worthy to be on 7x7's Big Eat List of "100 Things to Try Before You Die" for the third year in a row.

Atop a crisp tortilla chip was a smearing of the chipotle aioli, topped with silky smooth layer of fresh raw tuna sprinkled with fried leeks and three thin slivers of ripen avocado. Each bite sparked fireworks in my mouth, the sweet delicateness of the tuna, the decadently creamy and fiery aioli along with the crunchy leeks and buttery avocado was SUBLIME.

*Albondigas Guisadas: Mexican Style Meatballs w/ Tomato-Chipotle Salsa, Cotija Cheese & Cilantro ($8.95) - 4 STARS 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hcGIDuoE0Hn3-XKuICP0mg?select=fane4XjjiJMR7s8ffeyL0g
The trio of good sizable balls was tender, soft, and moist (from the onions). The accompanying "salsa" was a fresh, tangy and vibrant marinara sauce. The sprinkle of cotija cheese gave it a pop of salty creaminess.

*TACOS (10 for $31)
There was NOTHING Taco'licious' about these tacos. The corn tortillas were torn even before picking up some of the tacos. Was Morton's Salt the secret ingredient of the night? The tacos were SO salty that I was left with cotton ball mouth till 4 AM even after chugging 4 glasses of water and a liter of coconut water right after coming home. UGH.
 
**Filet Mignon & Caremlized Onions (+$3) - 3 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hcGIDuoE0Hn3-XKuICP0mg?select=IfPv5Rup8BHKcHJviiY8CQ
The best of the three I ate (it better be for $6 apiece), the tender medium filet mignon was the only meat we could taste unhindered by all the unnecessary spices. The onions were all it needed to give a nice contrasting sweetness.

**Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib - 0 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hcGIDuoE0Hn3-XKuICP0mg?select=aSw6DcHeaKHtcmSXBtVOZg
EEEECKKKK is this really highlighted on Yelp?!?!? The short ribs had spices and salt CAKED onto each shred making it disgustingly salty, over seasoned and over spiced. The oils from the beef leaked through the tortilla turning into a greasy orange disk and breaking it into pieces upon picking it up.

**Shot & Beer Braised Chicken - 1 STAR
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hcGIDuoE0Hn3-XKuICP0mg?select=oOyS6EA8cRZcztW5nkJvqw
Way too sweet and the shreds of chicken breast meat were dry. 

S E R V I C E
Started off friendly and attentive but towards the end of our meal, it felt very rushed and service was annoyingly intrusive. There were still tacos on our platter and I had 1.5 tacos on my plate, yet within 5 minutes, we were bombarded 5 times (by 2 different wait staff) with variations of "Are you still working on that?".... "Are you done yet?".  WHY ask a question that you ALREADY know the answer to when you see I have a fork in my hand??? 

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R
Casual, dim and lively, Tacolicious is good for small groups especially during game nights though I can imagine it turning into a sloshing, obnoxiously loud frat party on the weekends with the extensive tequila menu. 

There's ~30 seating in the dining area, counter seating and outdoor patio seating. 

P A R K I N G
Metered street parking. Nearest lot is 1.5 blocks away on Lombard/Fillmore streets. 

Before coming to Tacolicious, I raved to my friends about how good Tacolicious was when I came here 3 years ago. But I left out one eenieeeee weenieeeee minor detail... 

I WAS DRUNK.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: This was our first time here. Loved the interesting menu choices. The staff were friendly. The bartender got a little busy and forgot to bring my hubby a second beer. Then when he realize it, he said it was on the house. Super friendly! Loved the tacos and sauces! Will come back next time we are in SF!
author: Kabee X.

description: First time here. Very delicious tacos!!! We had short rib taco and taco of day habanero pork. So damn good. Very friendly server but unfortunately he was bogged down with too many tables both inside and out so service was slow. However next time I'm SF, I will return!! Poblano margarita awesome too!
author: Kathy F.

description:
I'm on the fence about Tacolicious.  This isn't a normal spot that I'd frequent, but I was down to check it out since it was chosen as a meeting place for a group lunch.  As usual on a weekend, the Marina was bustling with people out and about.  Tacolicious was no exception.  We arrived before 1pm and snagged the last open table for our party of 5.  It was a bit of a tight squeeze as the restaurant has is a small space.  The tables are quite close to one another and bar seating is limited.  They have outside seating on the sidewalk, which looked a bit crowded as well.  Note that there's only one unisex restroom (and it was clean).  

Two large baskets of chips and salsa were placed on our tables right after we sat down.   You can really fill up on the chips alone!  Our group decided to order an assortment of 15 tacos and a pitcher of margarita.  I tried three tacos deemed to emulate Mexican street tacos with an American twist.  
- Fried rock cod taco: The piece of fish was quite large and fried crispy golden brown.  Can't say it was that flavorful without adding salsa.  
- Shot and a beer braised chicken taco: Topped with lots of shredded chicken in plenty of sauce.  Don't remember anything else about it besides being saucy and spicy.
- Guajillo braised short rib taco:  Taco was a bit wet from the chili oil.  The beef was plentiful but nothing special. 
- Paloma Fillmore Margarita: If you like grapefruit juice and lots of tequila, you'll enjoy this! 
Total tab including tip was $110.  Overall, the tacos are OK. It is what it is.  I don't think it would be fair to compare to authentic Mexican food.  You have to go to Tacolicious and almost expect that you're getting wannabe tacos and willing to pay more for the service and ambiance.  The tacos were filling and each of us were pretty stuffed by the end of our meal.  They do make a mean margarita. 

On our way out, there was a large crowd waiting to be seated.  I overheard the hostess telling someone that the wait would be an hour and 15 min.  I, personally don't think it's worth the wait.  However, I can see how Tacolicious is a popular place for groups.  Wouldn't return on my own accord, but glad I gave it a try.
author: Liv A.

description:
Fell in love with this place on a Tuesday night! 

- Food: I loooove the free chips & salsa. That's a huge plus for me (like why do some places make you pay extra for chips?.... I don't get it). I also had their tacos (pork and chicken) which were both very good, if a bit dry. 

- Prices: a tiny bit overpriced if you ask me. Everything inside the tacos is good don't give me wrong, BUT they could easily be more generous and throw a bit of guac and/or cheese on there. 

- Atmosphere: vibrant and ideal for a night out with your friends. I will definitely be back!
author: Sev G.

description:
Carnitas - off the charts fantastic!! Favorite in the city. 
Chips - as good as they get! 
Salsa - amazing! 
Guac - um... needs work. 
The salsa trio - ridiculously good! 
The service - always friendly and prompt.
author: Robert Z.

description: Very friendly crew. Drinks are good and they have their own spin on Mexican food not very authentic but very flavorful. It was a very nice experience. I took one star because is crowded and noisy and the stools uncomfortable.
author: Ck M.

description:
I LOVE this spot....fun...good food...great atmosphere. Know ahead of time this is not a place for intimate conversations. The place is always crowded (we sat at the bar rather than wait for a table) and it is quite apparent that everyone was having a great time.

Our waiter was fabulous!!!!!!!!!!He suggested certain food items and was good when asked questions. He was enjoying himself and so did we.

Food very good; great variety and the BEST ADDED VALUE: fresh homemade chips and salsa brought throughout the meal which were FREE and DELICIOUS! All the food tasty but the guacamole was the best i I have ever had.

I usually don't like to return to the same restaurant since there are sooooooooooo many to try---but I would go back enthusiastically.....highly recommend
author: marcia g.

description: The Tacolicious in San Francisco on Chesnut street is not only in a prime location, but is easily one of the best restaurants on this street. I love the heaters outside & music playing. The salsa is to die for and the service is not spectacular, but definitely friendly. Everything is at a reasonable cost especially in comparison with the other Mexican restaurant on the street.
author: Lauren H.

description: Nice server. Great veggie tacos. Chips and salsa were very good. They serve big bottles of Mexican beers, which I like a lot.
author: John H.

description: Out of all three locations the marina location is my favorite. I love the atmosphere! Everyone who works there really loves their job and you can tell because the service is great. My server was Bri and she really made my experience at Tacolicious awesome. She was able to recommend a good tequila as well as awesome tacos! Will totally recommend this place to family or friends.
author: Giorgina N.

description: I'm not entirely sure how this place consistently impresses the masses...for me it's the very definition of mediocre. The catering is a decent deal for corporate gatherings, but you could do much better in San Francisco for Mexican food in general and tacos specifically. Just my two cents...
author: Ryan B.

description: Dropped by to kill some time while in the city. I enjoyed their marina girl salad- the dressing was the best part. My friend had the fish taco which came with 3 different types of dip/salsa. Their house salsa served with chips isn't too spicy and has almost a sweet taste to it. It was some of the best salsa I have had in a while! We also ordered a pitcher of their house margarita. It was good but 3/4 of the pitcher was ice so it didn't seem like we got our money's worth. Other than that, I would recommend Tacolicious.
author: Tracy M.

description: Located on Chestnut Street in San Francisco, this place is quite a little gem. Their filet mignon is absolutely fabulous whether on a taco or in a salad. My personal favorite is the Marina girl salad bowl with filet mignon and grilled chicken. The service is very attentive and flexible, so you can order things pretty much as you like them #noCheffitude. ;) Oh, and finally the salsa is perfect, just a tad mild for my taste. Lipstick Lady deposits 3.5 kisses. XXX.x :b
author: Bean C.

description:
Being from LA, and knowing great taco places, I would not pick taco as a meal when I'm out of town. 
I am glad I opened an exception for Tacolicious.
I over-ordered as usual, and got carnitas, cod, chorizo, and tuna tostadas, plus a side of drunken beans.
Everything had lots of flavor. The tuna tostadas were awesome.
The chorizo with potatoes were spicy and so good too.
It's a great option for the area. I hope they open one in LA soon!
author: Luciana B.

description: Pretty good but not anything special inSF. Given that everything taco in SF is great this is not really a bad thing. Price is very reasonable for a place with great service and a nice tray of salsas.
author: Julia S.

description: The new tacolicious location may be going through some challenges but currently the level of service is not as high as the other locations. This is my third time at this location and I've been shocked at the poor service every time. I will not be coming back until I here from other people that they have hired better staff and working out the kinks.
author: Oscar S.

description: Went to the new, bigger location. Very disappointed. We really enjoyed the original spot. The new spot didn't feel special. The prices were higher and the food felt commercial. The tacos were small and most lacked flavor. The chorizo was the best of them all. Salsa's are still great as was the guac. I don't think I'll be back to this location.
author: Jim A.

description:
My husband and I have been regularly going to this T-Lish in the Marina for about 4 years now. The reason I am just now writing a review is because we have been thoroughly disappointed every time we have dined here since they moved the location further down Chestnut Street. The food and drinks are still GREAT, but has the management and/or staffing changed? I only recognize a couple of the waiters and bartenders from the other location.

Service has been pretty terrible the 4 times we have been here since the move. It has taken about 10-15 minutes every time before a waiter has come to our table to ask if we would like a drink and then it takes another at least 10 minutes to get the drinks. Once the drinks didn't come until after we received our meals. We thought that maybe they were a little overwhelmed with the high volume of customers but we just visited again on a Tuesday around 5pm, and there were maybe 10 other people dining there. Same super slow service. Empty drinks sitting in front of us for 15 minutes before anyone asked if we wanted another and when my husband ordered a 2nd it took another 15 minutes before he received it. All the while the staff is just hanging out with each other around the bar talking and goofing around with each other. 

Like I said already, quality of food and drinks is still amazing, but service needs to be brought back to the level it used to be at otherwise I'm afraid we may not be coming back anymore.
author: Stacey N.

description:
This place is awesome!

Food: we ordered 20 tacos (for 5 of us). We each had 2 and were quite full as each taco was pretty filling. We got the vegetable tacos  (nice variety of vegetables and balance of spices), fried fish (large pieces of fish and a very good sauce on top), pork, and chicken. 

Drinks: we ordered 2 pitchers of margaritas and 1 pitcher of sangria.  The margaritas hit the spot so well and went incredibly well with the tacos.

Environment: this is a good place for groups of 2-7 people. Larger groups would be a bit difficult to fit. The ambiance was fun and friendly, creating a nice atmosphere for a relaxing lunch out.
author: Mel S.

description: FIRST OFF THEY HAVE THE BEST TACOS HANDS DOWN. I went there before checking out the bars in the marina and it was an awesome spot. The servers were really busting their butts because the restaurant was packed and it was a Friday night. The manager Jp introduced himself to us and made sure we were having a good time! Love this place!
author: Brianna G.

description:
So, I tried the Marina Tacolicious the day after I ate at La Taqueria in the Mission... So, that kinda killed it for me.. With that being said, the margaritas were okay and the ambiance is fun and they have a pretty huge menu with a bunch of different types of tacos, meals, apps, etc. I tried the fish taco which was ok, and the nopales taco which was good. We also had the mushroom empanadas which I highly recommend! 

Overall, this is a fun spot to check out especially after work for happy hour. But do not expect a small local divey taqueria...
author: Harmony H.

description:
Seriously disappointed to be writing this negative review but my friends and I have been coming to this Tacolicious location since it's inception (at Fillmore) and have been getting the special and amazing Jack-in-the-Box inspired "crack in the box" tacos from the happy hour menu. After leaving work early to be sure to make HH (ends at 5:30pm), we ordered the tacos to be told they no longer make them. WHAT?! We were just there the week before and had ordered them as we always do.

After asking for an explanation the server continued to just tell us they don't, won't and CANNOT make them. We were in shock and insisted on an explanation -- he proceeded to not have one and just tell us to order something else. He suggested some "crispy" taco combination instead. Spare yourself -- the meat inside the tacos was cold and had no flavor. Barf.

To top it all off, the service is just terrible. The waiter was rude, he never brought us water (after reminding him twice) and the hostess doesn't even acknowledge/greet people who walk in. After a couple minutes of standing awkwardly in the doorway someone hurried us to a table in the back by the kitchen with plenty available seating up near the window. 

Needless to say, my friends and I (who live in the Marina and often frequented this spot) won't be coming back.
author: Ali S.

description:
Really small spot, but it's pretty dang good.

I haven't had better chips and salsa. Super addicting. Fresh, perfect amount of salt.

I ordered the ceviche, and it could have been better. The lime was so heavy in it, that it made my mouth pucker and couldn't taste the fish. I'm sure it was just that day.

The table also ordered the chicken enchiladas, and beef enchiladas came out. She still liked it, but was a little odd. 

Oh, also...there was a non-alcoholic fruit drink ordered. Some pineapple orange thing. It looked scrumptious, and I heard it was all that.

Service is nothing remarkable or lacking. Just is there. But, hey, it's a taco joint. A fresh food and clean taco joint. Well priced too.
author: Amy O.

description:
The ever-expanding chain empire of Tacolicious made me a bit uninterested in trying them but a couple things conspired to get me in the door.  First was a story told at Porchlight by a T-licious chef about his Mexico City adventure to taste, then replicate, Contramar Restaurant's tuna tostada.  Tacolicious' version hit #29 on 7X7's 2012 Big Eat List of the "100 things you must try before you die" so I guess the Mexico City jaunt was worth it.  Second was the fact that the restaurant looked like a shadow of its usual self on a Monday at lunchtime and that's a good thing.  No hordes spilling out the doors, not sorority sisters jamming up the tables, just a single table in the outdoor sunshine with no wait.  I'm game.  

Complimentary chips and mild salsa were the first things to arrive at our table.  They were delicious.  The bowlful was deceiving, appearing smaller than the usual Mexican restaurant's chip bowl, but it actually contained a perfect amount (aka a little too much) for two people.  Our waitress offered us more but we were well-satisfied.  Overdoing things at Monday lunch sets an ominous tone for the week ahead.   

We led off with the aforementioned "albacore tuna tostadas contramar style" with crispy leeks, chipotle mayo, and avocado ($10.95).  It was easy to understand how such a simple thing inspired a flight to Mexico City.  Two crisped corn tortillas were topped by the fine, fresh (raw fish) ingredients and served in a way that was easily split by two.  I've had a cheaper, similar version of ceviche served this way at a taqueria.  I'd be hard pressed to say you must try this dish before dying but it was quite good and worth the extra cost.

We followed tostadas with 4 tacos ($14) settling with consideration upon 2 with fried local rock cod, 1 traditional carnitas, and 1 chicken en mole colorado.  Each taco came with the traditional 2 corn tortillas (1 which I usually use for spillage).  Though amply filled, no spillage transpired, even when topped with a trio of unique salsas (red, green, and fire yellow).  

The rock cod taco was good but I have no shame in reporting that I like Rubio's version better.  The chicken en mole colorado though?  That was delicious, mainly because it's something for which I had no comparison.  A little savory, a little sweet, and a good-sized amount of filling.  

I didn't taste the carnitas but noticed that the plate was emptied.  

T-Licious is pricey for Mexican food and though I won't say I was wowed, I was definitely interested and liked what I ate.  More than what I ate though, I liked the menu with all the unusual little starter snack items.  If  I again found this place easy to get into I'd  consider a return visit to further sample from that section of the menu.  

I'm pretty sure review #894 won't be the one that inspires you to give this Tacolicious a try and that's okay.  It increases my odds of my finding a seat on visit #2.
author: Tracey A.

description:
Terrible!! Terrible!!
Wife LOVES fried fish, even when it's not that good she still likes it, and she said tacolish's  was the worst taco she's ever had!! That's something!
My carnitas was ok but i could taste the sugar in the marinate they use, ugh

Don't get me started on the salsas! Horrible horrible horrible horrible!!!
author: Roberto Z.

description: Overly rated taco place. I am expecting that it would wow me as it was highly recommended and by judging the line to get into. Coming from east coast, I am expecting good Mexican food scene in SF but I was disappointed with this place. They had good corn tortillas, but the flavor of the fillings did not meet the mark. The double tortillas made the flavor even bland.
author: Tommy C.

description:
I'm a huge fan of tacos of any variety--from authentic to inauthentic and Americanized to T-Bell, so I didn't think much about coming to Tacolicious . . . until I arrived. Two things, first: 1. The crowd here is so, so Marina, it almost feels like a caricature of the Marina because there's THAT much Marina going on here. Anyway, this isn't T-Lish's fault. 2. They use prayer candles all over this joint for aesthetic purposes. This, on the other hand, can be helped. Even my Mexican but incredibly hard-to-offend boyfriend found them kind of off-putting. 

That aside, the food itself was just not great. Not bad, but . . . just generally missing the mark. The prices are steep (which is no surprise, but then again they never touted themselves as a taqueria so no blame either), and the tacos are stuffed to the brim with meat. So much meat--TOO much meat, dare I say?--that it threw off the ratio and lent itself to a rather drippy and one-note eating experience where, even if they were properly seasoned and cooked meats, I got bored after half a bite.

The tuna tostadas were a great starter though, tasty and texturally on-point with the smooth raw tuna, creamy avocado and sauce, and crunchy tostada bottoms. However they were also two small tostadas for $15 so I likely would have been more pleased with 30 Jack in the Box tacos.
author: Betty W.

description: The tacos are very bland and expensive for their size. There are basically no toppings on the chicken tacos. The only good thing about them is they come with a good amount of meat. Not worth going to more than once.
author: Kevin W.

description:
On a weekend in SF, my friend and I'd gone to Tacolicious for lunch, looking for some nice, messy, greasy street food. I got the beef short rib, carnitas and chicken tacos at 3 for $11. It was amazing weather - the sun on our face, the wind on our backs, and a take-out box of juicy, meaty tacos in our hands. What could be better?

The tacos are quite big, they put a LOT of meat on it, and I especially liked their salsa sauces - they were pretty spicy! There was a bit of a line-up when I'd gone, but I'd say it's worth it. Greasy, yes, but hey, that's exactly what I was looking for!

Quick service. Appreciated that they accept credit cards, and a fancy system of emailing/texting you the receipt!
author: Anujit C.

description:
Vibey cute spot in the Marina. We sat outside which was perfect on a sunny day. 

Ordered micheladas which came with tecate beer and were perfect! No clamato in these, which I don't like. They were so refreshing. 

Had the chips, salsa and guacamole for the table. Loved the chips! They will re-fill them for your table and are home made. Super salty...just how I like em! The guacamole was ok and the salsa was too mild for me so I asked for something spicier. They brought out a very vibrant yellow salsa. Had never seen salsa that color before but it tasted good. 

We got an order of 3 albacore tuna tostadas. Not sure what contramar style is but I enjoyed it! 

The fish taco was fresh, flavorful and good.

With the unlimited chips I left pretty full after just a tostada and taco. 

Recommend for day drinking/eating on their outside patio. 

Enjoy!
author: Lina K.

description:
Overall: Solid food and service.  Great location.  

Details: 
Chips and Salsa (free):  Fresh house made tortilla chips and homemade salsa (very mild).  Good and unlimited.  4/5  (They have spicier salsa if you ask for it)

Guacamole:  Made fresh to order, perfect mix of avocado and cilantro.  Served with freshly fried up tortilla chips.  5/5

Albacore Tuna Tostadas:  Crispy, spicy, oniony with cool avocado.  5/5

I tried 4 different tacos (Cod, carnitas, chorizo, short rib).  My favorite was the short rib (5/5), and my least favorite was the cod (3/5).  The carnitas and chorizo were solid 4/5.  They are all served on (2) corn tortillas.  

Service was good.  Attentive without being annoying. 5/5
author: Paul W.

description: Meh. Went to the one in the Mission a few years ago and it was pretty good. Not so much this one, this time. WAAAAYYY overpriced for what you get, and frankly I make better fish tacos. Guacamole was bland (I needed to add salt, and I never add salt), Margaritas were mostly ice and the chocolate for the churros was lumpy and bitter.  Services was slow and mostly inattentive.  Had to ask for a to go box three times.  Better tacos at the few remaining authentic taquerias in the Mission.
author: Bingo T. K.

description:
Came here in a Saturday at 2:30pm and it was packed!  Sat at the bar!

Guacamole - 4 stars - very fresh!  I would like it a little more spicy but it was stil very good!
Enchiladas de pollo - 4.5 stars - these were amazing. Fresh Mexican cheese melted in top was amazing, chicken was tender and well seasoned with the delicious marinade.
Shot-and-a-beer braised chicken - 3.5 stars - we let this sit awhile before eating it which may have effected the taste.  Meat was tender but flavor was too mild for my taste.
Guajillo braised beef short rib - 4.5 stars - again very tender meat.  Flavor was amazing and literally danced in your mouth!

My friend got the basic margarita - 4.5 stars - thought it was amazing, made with fresh lime juice
Moss - 3.0 stars - drink was ok but sorta sour for my taste.

Service was very good!  Our server, Sebastian, was extremely friendly and attentive enough given how busy it was!  

We sat at the end if the bar and had a birds eyes view of the kitchen.  We saw tons of fresh cilantro, chicken being tenderized and fat being cut off.  This place takes pride in what they serve!  

I would give this place 4.5 stars.    Bill was $43.  Seems a little expensive but margarita was $11 and guacamole was $9 so in the end the rest was pretty reasonable to a little pricey.

BTW, there is a $10 taco, tecate and shot special good ever day!!!!!!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
The gauchos had an amazing experience at Tacolicious. The best part of the experience was their service. Waiter and accompanying staff were extremely attentive and friendly. They hooked it up with chips and salsa as soon as we sat down. Salsa was amazing. Ordered some guac and queso which was also delicious and came out quickly after we ordered it. 

Let's rewind for a minute though. The experience might have been completely perfect if the hostess didn't try to sit our 5 person party at what was clearly a 4 person table. We elected to sit outside to forgo a wait which was accommodating to some extent but outdoor seating in San Francisco is never my favorite (always too cold). Anyway, we were starving so we f'd the lemons and sacked up gaucho style. BUT when the hostess sat all 5 of us at what was clearly a 4 person table, a horrible chill rain through my  vascular fore arms. I was in shock, my friend señor Quiñones was so awkwardly positioned and jammed in at the corner of the table I looked up with an inquisitive glare and made eye contact with this so called hostess and LUCKILY for Tacolicious she realized how bad she had just performed the only function of her job and offered us an accompanying third table which made room for 6. 

Now that issue was resolved we ordered a pitcher of the house margarita which was great and got some great picante shots that are bundled in some great deal options. 4 for $12, 8 for $24 - might not be exact but was a pretty reasonable deal overall and their are some interesting options for shots. We ordered tacos that are offered in the same package deal situation for family style eating. 

Let's cut to the chase. Tacos were delicious. Short rib was the best one, Carnitas was great too. Drinks were on point. Service was a freaking 10 besides the initial seating incident. Place is the answer for tapas / tex-mex cuisine in The Marina area of San Fran. Mamacita's food is comparable and has a little classier ambiance but not as cool and my service experience wasn't as good. Overall 5 stars. They went hard in the paint for the Guachos so we show our love.
author: Gaucho N.

description:
Not gonna lie, I came in here by mistake trying to get fish tacos at pacific catch, but they had fish tacos anyways so hey! I'm not a fancy taco fan usually but once in a while it's good to challenge your assumptions.

Anyways I had 4 tacos:
1) Fried fish - Good, well battered, fresh tasting, nice sauce.
2) Grilled fish - even better, not overdone at all.
3) Carnitas - eh, kinda dry in parts, wouldn't get it again.
4) Pollo - eh, kinda dry too and a little bland.

So the lesson is get the fish.
author: Misha T.

description: I came here with my friend because shes a fan of this place. I ordered the baja style taco which is a fish taco. My friend and I decided to share the guacamole as well. The guacamole was pretty standard, a little on the expensive side because it was $8.95 but they did give a good amount. From what I remember it was smoother than Chipotle's which I didn't like as much. As for the taco, I've definitely had better. The service was pretty good, very attentive. Overall, it's decent but I dont think I would go back on my own. I give it a 3.5 rounded up to a 4.
author: Grace C.

description:
So i debated between one and 2 stars and settled with one.i walked in after 10 to place a togo order at the bar. The bartender took my order and had me repeat it and she still got one wrong, not a big deal, the carnitas was ok, not the baja fish i wanted but ok. I paid for my taccs and left a 25%tip, i left for a few minutes and came back to where i was at the bar and she came by again and asked if i wanted something and i remided her that i ordered to go and she didnt seem to thrilled, i tipped her 25% on $20 for a to go order which i felt was fairly decent, that percentage on a in house order would be good. she then informed me i had to wait by the door not at the bar. i almost asked for my tip back, but i didnt. I went by the door and waited for 10 more minutes and a guy came over and asked if i needed something and i said i was told to wait over here, and he said it might be ready, and it was, so i was waiting by the door while my food was ready, awesome. Great customer service lady. Oh and while i waited, no one sat at the bar seat i was at before. more seats even opened up. 
Heres a thought, dont have poeple order togo at the bar if you dont let them sit there after they ordered it and tipped pretty well. I will not be coming back. sad part is i work on the same block. bad service.
author: Brian M.

description: Decent cali-mex with good margaritas and house made guac.  I suggest the tuna tostada - it comes with 2 so you can share.  I shared that and then got a chicken mole taco - yum.  I like the roasted tomato salsa as well as the 3 dips / hot sauces they serve with the tacos.  The service was fine, nothing special.  Stays pretty busy during lunch so there could be a wait.  Enjoy!
author: Ali C.

description: Very busy and lively. There is a small sitting area and a bar. decent range of tacos and cocktails. I tried the Margarita Picante which was nice but not amazing. Fillet mignon taco was the best one. They have a taco of the week as well. The service is ok at this place.
author: Khash S.

description:
Love this place, but didn't have a good experience one time. :/ usually it's just "ok"-4 star worthy. But it's ALWAYS PACKED. we came in and they say is at the bar, right next to where they send out drink orders and yell over to the bartenders--yeah, awesome right? :/ 

So, if that annoyance in my right ear wasn't enough we got 2 servers. One was "checking" on the other one who was on her last training. As a server of 4 years, I have no problem with this whatsoever. I do, however, have a problem with 20 people asking me how I'm doing every 3 seconds and then being obviously disappointed that all I was ordering was drinks and salsa. 

I get it, how annoying, a table that doesn't eat! But mind you, my bill was $75!!!! So, it's not like we bought a $4 drink and sat there for 6 hours. 

A little nicer staff would be nice. I also think bar should be self seating instead of waiting in a long, never ending line just to sit in the worst spot! At least self seating, you get what you sat  for!
author: Demsina B.

description: Best Tacos ever!! great prices, great taste and you can mix and match. You get 3 different kinds of sauces to pair with your tacos that are all amazing! Gets pretty busy but worth the wait!
author: Crystal P.

description: Terrible place to eat if you are hungry and in a rush. Customer service is bad. And I couldn't enjoy my food. There was so much noise I can barely even here my family talk. DO NOT COME TO THIS PLACE
author: Crystal A.

description: Tacos and tequila, great post race meal! Got lucky again and scored two seats at the bar just as two people were leaving. This place was crowded on a Sunday afternoon. Right away Jeremy greeted us and took some drink orders. I had a strawberry margarita and my cousin had some kind of tequila. After the race I was starving so we ordered like crazy. We ordered the guacamole, tuna tostadas, calamari tacos, short rib tacos, and chicken tacos. I enjoyed everything but my favorite were the tuna tostadas. The service was great too! Jeremy and the other bartender were even friendly to us Dodger fans. They also served us two complimentary tequilas along with others sitting at the bar. Free booze, why not!? Places like this make me enjoy my trip to SF even more. I left this place extremely full and buzzed! I'd definitely come back!
author: Lei S.

description: Tasty food for reasonable prices.  Salsas/sauces are fantastic and have individual serving spoons.  Fun atmosphere, great for drinks/dinner after work.  Outdoor seating is also available.  Tacos double up on the tortillas and the filling is generous, so what we do is create 2 tacos from 1 and share!  3 tacos for ~$9.  Burger is also surprisingly very good--the patty is half beef half chorizo so is very tasty and also tender, and I generally really like pepper jack cheese on burgers.  Burger special with the Tecate and tequila is $15, or the burger alone is $9.
author: Vanessa O.

description: This was a fun taco joint in the marina.  I wouldn't consider this authentic mexican or even California Mexican, but there were several fun options.  We were getting some quick lunch on our way to a meeting, and were very happy with our service and food options.
author: Ethan S.

description:
I ordered the tuna tostada after reading all of the raving reviews. I may be a fish snob but this tuna came out fishy and just not good. 

The margaritas were bitter even after I asked the server for the sweetest option. The prices are definitely not worth it.
author: H K.

description:
I like the new location, much less cramped than the former spot.

But I'm confused/unhappy about something. Margarita pitcher: $41 for a (wine bottle size) carafe, filled completely to the top with ice. Yes, I do like my margaritas cold. But the tasty liquid within might only fill one cup, so what is that, 2 shots and some mixer? Tastes like a ripoff. 

Having tended bar in the past, I totally understand that liquor sales pay the rent. And I'm happy to pay. But glasses (or carafes) should be 1/2 ice, not really any more.
author: Slob M.

description:
Okay this place is very pricey, especially coming from LA where you can get great tacos for $1 each. Their tacos were pretty good, but I don't know if it's really worth the price? My friend and I split four tacos, and my friend tried the baja style pacific cod and traditonal carnitas tacos and I tried the braised short rib and pollo tinga tacos.

- braised short rib: I really liked the flavors of the beef and it wasn't dry at all! It was a little greasy but that just made it taste so much better..There's also a LOT of beef rib for a single taco. I'm not complaining.
- pollo tinga (special): I realize I'm not a big fan of chicken tacos, it's probably my least favorite meat on tacos. This taco was pretty decent though, it had pulled chicken breast, avocado, and cheese. I probably would have preferred the fish taco over this.

Service: We came here to watch one of the finals games for NBA. At first, we thought the waitress would be annoyed that we only ordered tacos but stayed for like 3-4 hours on the bar. She did keep asking if we were fine or if we needed anything else but she was actually really nice about it. The other servers were all very friendly too and one of the bartenders...eye candy hah my friend has a huge crush on him!
author: Nadine U.

description: The salsa is absolutely delicious. It has a hint of mint in there which is tasteful and not overpowering. We ordered the Marina Girl salad and two tacos (cod & brisket) to share which was the perfect amount. Service was friendly and quite to take our order. Would go back next time we visit SF!
author: Abigail H.

description:
TACOLICIOUS.

I've been in love with this place since the first time I've tried it. They offer a great a variety and a more Californian approach to their food.

They aren't your $2 tacos so don't expect to be transported to Mexico.

I've been to the North Beach location but the Marina is my favorite.

Check it out!
author: Shana B.

description: I absolutely loved this! Not only was the food great but the environment was so inviting and fun. While the music was playing the food was so juicy and the best part for myself was that you get to choose how many tags you want. Many times I can feel as if I don't have enough food or it's too much, so you can choose what you want. Everything else from the guacamole to the drinks was amazing. The only critique I have is that the price is a little bit expensive but overall it was amazing.
author: Nicholas H.

description:
The bartenders. Lazy, sloppy. Heard the bartender say, "tastes like lemonade, but whatever," after tasting the $10 margarita he was making. So don't expect to get what you pay for. 

The service. My food was delivered first and my friend's 5+ minutes later. Her egg was over cooked. 

The tacos are good and reasonably priced for what you get.
author: Danielle K.

description: Love the new location!! Dislike the new salsa... tasted like it came from a can.
author: Rachael P.

description:
Fantastic! I came here for lunch on a weekend and was Very Impressed with the attentiveness of the staff. The organization and cleanliness of the place in general was refreshing. My meal was tasty and fresh, which made up for the slightly-higher-than-average prices. I found the salsa de la casa to be exceptional and my margarita very fresh and not to sweet. 
Thank you for a great experience, Tacolicious, I will definitely be returning and bringing friends.
author: Jojo M.

description: Great tacos and Friendly service. The photos are great and pretty accurate so did not add any. I've been eating tacos in Texas lately but thrilled to find a quality taqueria in SF! You can't go wrong here as all menu options were great. Fast friendly service will keep us coming back.
author: Jobobb S.

description:
Tacos were good. 
Salsa selection was on point. With the right amount of spiciness. 

Wait staff was great but didn't know what dessert places were in the area-- being that the best crepe place is on the same street just a block down. -__- 

The food is a bit pricey and not really quality good food. 

The chicken soup tasted like salt hot water with veggies and not enough chicken.  The camarones a la diabla were like 8 shrimp with a ton of tomatoes and onion with hot tomatoey sauce. Not worth it. 

Definitely stick with the  tacos if you must eat here. The place looks good because it's nicely decorated and that's probably what brings people in but honestly I think there are way more better choices for food in San Fran than this place. 

Oh and the tables are way to close for comfort.
author: Noemí C.

description: Very disappointed with the service didn't even try the food ... we arrived and had to wait for a table to clear up we waited 15 min before a busser cleaned the table we had been waiting. After we were seated  we waited another 20 minutes.  In those 20 minutes we saw  our waiter walk By 5 times and never acknowledge us.  Our meter was running low so instead of feeding the meter we left that place. 40 minutes wasted just sitting being told to be patient .. we didn't even get water
author: Jennifer G.

description:
Came here with a friend on a Friday night.  We arrived around 6:30 and had to wait around half hour for a table.  We ended up getting up a pitcher of sangria while waiting ($26 and pretty good!).  The staff was nice about letting us hang out outside with our pitcher and the hostess tried to keep an eye on open bar seats as well for us.  We did encounter some rude staff though, commenting on how there were people in their way.  I get that it's hard to be a waiter in a busy restaurant with people standing around but we didn't create the tightly packed layout so don't make rude comments to your customers!

We were finally seated and it is a very compact restaurant.  Also, incredibly, incredibly loud.  I would have given Tacolicious 4 stars except for the noise, mostly due to the loud music rather than the busy guests.  For a dinner around 7, I don't want to have to shout to my friend!  My ears were still buzzing after leaving the restaurant!

But anyways, on to the food.  The chips and salsa to start - really good salsa!  We decided to share the enchiladas and four different types of tacos.  (Sidenote- why do they have one taco for $3.95 and four tacos for $14?  Where's the three taco deal?  Isn't that normal?  Four tacos is a lot!).  All in all, a lot of food!  The enchiladas were really good - a real smokey taste to the meat.  It was three enchiladas and only $8.  For the tacos, we had the vegetable one (squash and some other things), both chickens (a beer and a shot and a mole) and the chorizo.  The mole chicken was BY FAR the best.  The beer and a shot chicken was probably the least interesting, but if I want back I would probably just get all chicken mole tacos.

So, the food is pretty good.  But be prepared for a wait and a VERY LOUD restaurant.  In retrospect, we probably would have ordered food to go!
author: Rachael M.

description: Good tacos if you happen to be right there... Bar type taco place, descent food, drinks, in the Marina so watch for young drunk college kids scarfing down tacos.
author: Kirk M.

description: It is really crowded. The waitress recommend two tacos for each person so we only ordered 4 for two of us. She recommended four: carnitas, chicken, beef and cod, which are exactly what we ordered. Chicken is awesome. The complimentary chips are really good.
author: Hayley H.

description: Great restaurant if you do not want to hear the one you are with, at least if you are inside. I felt the food was not particularly good, was of small portions, and was expensive for the quality. If you like extreme noise and want to just watch the other customers and don't care what you eat, it may be the place for you. It is busy and the estimated wait at 20 minutes extended to over an hour. The waiters seemed overworked and stressed by conditions. I will never return.
author: joe g.

description: I live for this place super friendly foh staff. You have to try there queso dip and their carnitas tacos are so great.. I work in the area and this is my go to for tacos... I'll miss u guys when you move up the block but that won't deter me from my tacos
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Went here on a whim looking for food in the Marina. Definitely was surprised by how busy it was for a Thursday night. Tacolicious sounds like a cheap Mexican joint but it was the opposite.

We sat down and started with some drinks. Their house margarita was strong. They brought over (seemingly) made-in-house chips and salsa. The chips were a little oily for me but the salsa was good.

Next we had the albondigas (meatballs) and those were tasty. The sauce was spicy which gave us a good kick and needed a little bit of water to mellow out the spice. The meatballs themselves were made with some good spices, large, and evenly cooked. A nice (and unique) appetizer to start with.

Our main course were tacos, of course. We had the in house chicken, carnitas, and pacific cod. They also served it with three sauces: the salsa from before, a guacamole, and a sweet yellow sauce I couldn't put my finger on. All three were good. The carnitas definitely won the night with the fish a close second.

We would've closed with dessert but we were full. The bill came out to be what you'd expect from a place in the Marina for two people each ordering a drink. We're definitely going to go back to try more of their menu and especially the desserts that looked tempting.

The only cons are the dim lighting, noise (bar-like), and the cooks weren't fully up to food safety standards (i.e. drinking water next to the grills).
author: Chris L.

description:
Great happy hour spot to head to with the gals! 

I love these tacos much better than Nick's and marginally better than Don Pisto's. They are tender, juicy and surging with flavor. However, my personal favorite is the nachos - it's not on the menu but you can ask for it. And boy should you ask for it. It's PERFECT alongside a pitcher of the margarita picante. The margaritas here are absolutely delicious in a deceitfully strong way - just how I like it!

The ambiance is pretty Marina-casual - take that however you will. It's not very spacious and they don't take reservations so I'd recommend coming here earlier in the night to claim a prime spot. 

Definitely consider Tacolicious on your next trip to the Marina for a fun post-work endeavor!
author: Priya S.

description:
I love this place. LOVE the tacos. Fresh margaritas, amazing tacos, you name it. I personally love the carnitas (there's something sweet about them), the cod, and I finally tried the tuna tostada everyone's been raving about....YES! Although, I wasn't as amazed by the ceviche. Nothing bad, but I'd choose the tuna if you're stuck between the two. 
The crowd is classic marina. You go there at night and be surrounded by attractive and well-dressed people. I could swear the very physical stature of the people in this neighborhood are different than the rest of SF. If you're looking for awesome, dressed up mexican food with a fratty culture there's no better option.
author: Rachel E.

description:
Food is okay. 
Friday night really busy. 

Terrible club music super loud. If you want to talk this is wrong place to go.
Also very hot inside. Doors open but its not helpful. 
Sitting outside is just stupid with San Francisco foggy weather and bad traffic outside.

There are better places to eat tacos. 

This one is good for people who like standardized food. American way tacos. 
Just real real ones on the Mission
author: Marianna P.

description: I wish 0 stars was an option. I would love to say that I ate here and loved it but I didn't even get the opportunity to eat. We sat down waited 10 minutes for anyone to even acknowledge us and then all we ordered was water.. Fast forward 20 minutes with us leaving after not even getting our water. Everyone around us was also complaining about service. Queso served without chips, then getting cold before the chips were brought out. Looks like an awesome place but you may have to wait hours to get sub-par food and service.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Shoutout to sweet bartender for swiftly giving us change for the parking meter!

Ten tacos for $33 ($37 including tax) is not bad, not bad at all. Shot-and-a-beer braised chicken and guajillo braised beef short ribs... Melted in my mouth.

Loved the salsa, loved the carnitas and loved the guac. It's a fairly small joint -- and popular -- but we rolled in around 3:30 on a Monday afternoon and there was ample seating.
author: Elle T.

description: Love this casual Mexican spot. Favs are the Sangria Roja with apple salsa, Carnitas, and of course chips and quac - all gluten free!
author: Kendrick G.

description:
These are not your average tacos, my friends.  These are absolutely tacolicious.

You can get 4 tacos for about $13, which I highly suggest because you need to try the Fried Local Rock Cod, Traditional Carnitas, Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib and Shot-and-a-beer Braised Chicken Tacos.  The fish taco is fried perfectly - crispy, not greasy, and tender moise fish.  Actually, the meat in all the tacos are so tender.

The Albacore Tuna Tostadas are crunchilicious.  I love the spice from the chipotle mayo.  Chips and salsa are complimentary but skip the guacamole (very good but kind of a rip off at $7.50).

They even had a kids menu - for $8 you can get the agua fresca del dia, your choice of taco or cheese quesadilla with rice & beans, and ice cream with chocolate sauce.

Our server was super friendly.  There was such an energetic vibe.  Food was delicious.  Definitely a place we'd go back to.
author: Rose A.

description:
I literally just got back from Asia and as soon as I arrived to Orange County, I left for San Francisco for a music event. My friend and I are really into eating so we picked out several food places near the Marina and set out to discover good food.

Food: 2 stars

Tacos
  Rock Cod- Fresh but no flavor whatsoever. Perhaps a bit of course salt sprinkled        prior to cooking would enhance the flavors of the fish.

  Shot A Beer Chicken-Decent flavoring but dry

  Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib-Very dry

  Traditional Carnitas-I know I had this, but cannot remember the taste whatsoever.


Drinks: 4 stars

 Nopal pink- Cabrito Blanco, Prickly Pear, and Citrus. Cabrito Blanco, the recession tequila! Medium strength with a hot pepper finish...Perhaps drinking this on its own may have been a better idea than to mix it with such liquids. The pear and the citrus was drowned out by the hot taste of the tequila's finish and it did no justice to this drink. One thing that I did enjoy was the french rose pink color which really drew my attention!

 Tickle Me Telmo- A delightful orange yellowish liquid which includes: Chimayo Reposado, Agave Nectar, Lime, Orange. I definitely preferred this over the Nopal.

Service: 1 star
"I don't want to bother you, but....may I get a menu? Can we get some drinks? We would like to order now. I almost felt bad hounding them down. 

My mom tells me I'm "SPECIAL" but I definitely didn't feel "special" here.
author: Gloria M.

description: Just spent a gorgeous Saturday afternoon sitting outside with friends at Tacolicious. They have a lot of items on the menu here, but I only ever have the tacos because they are so good and they always mix it up with different flavors. My favorites are the fish, steak and veggie. The guac is really tasty too. The staff here are awesome as well and the service is always excellent. I really enjoy going to the Marina and North Beach locations and when it's a beautiful sunny day there's nothing better than Tacolicious tacos, beer and friends!
author: Elzabeth G.

description: Came here with some buddies last night.  Wow, I was shocked by how good the food was!  The tacos were to die for and not crazy expensive!  Plus the service was sharp and quick.  Definitely coming back!!!!!
author: Mike M.

description: Tacos were great! Salsa was the best with the chips.  Great atmosphere and music. Michelada can be better, that's the only thing I wasn't too happy with but other than that everything was good and delicious!
author: Andrew O.

description:
I wanted to give this place 3 stars but Food here is really good. Second time here. First time i came at night for drinks and my bf wanted food, so this place worked out. 

Honestly, this place is overpriced. The food is really delicious. But the portions sre just so small. 8.95 for a small bowl of guacamole. And the ceviche was delicious but also overpriced for its portion. 

Tacos. My bf and i love the filet mignon tacos but it sucks that they charge 3$ extra for each one.. Totalling $8 per taco.

Overall, this place is worth trying but I don't think I'll be going back anymore.. 

Tacos: 4 for 14, but filet is 3$ extra per. So total was 26$
Beer on tap: $5 each
Ceviche: $11.95
author: Jane C.

description: This is not the first visit to Tacolicious and have returned numerous times as the food is closer to a 3.5 rating.  However, on my visit yesterday during lunch (which was NOT busy) the female server with long dark hair was horrendous.  She was rude, curt and should not be working with the general public.  We sat at the high tables and could see and hear her interact with other patrons.  No difference.  Same scowl, can't be bothered body language and completely uninterested personality.  Too many restaurants on this street to not have better service.  Go elsewhere.
author: Angie G.

description: The restaurant has a dark and lively atmosphere. By dark, I mean there isn't much lighting run through the restaurant. The tables are dimly lit, and most of the lighted area comes from the partial open concept kitchen. The servers were rather slow. It took them awhile to get to our table because of how crowded it was that night. The food definitely makes up for that. The food is fired out pretty quick. For appetizers, I would recommend the albondigas guisadas. The dish has this savory taste to it, and the sauce has this marinara consistency to it. The tacos are amazing. The tacos we ordered were the guajillo braised beef short rib, the filet mignon, bistec adobado, and chorizo & potatoes. The tacos are pricey, but after eating them you kind of negate your thoughts on how expensive they really are.
author: Jonathan Y.

description: Had 6 tacos in total. 2 short ribs, 1 fish, 1 chicken mole, and 2 chorizo with potato. Each taco was $4.95 and in my opinion that is very overprice. The short rib tacos where greasy and cold. The chicken mole taco was good but if not used to the mole being sweet you will most likely not like it. Even tho it was cold, the chorizo with potato tacos were good. The fish taco, was not so great... The batter was soggy and it was also cold, it was like it was seating out for a while... For drinks, I got a horchata and a passion cocktail, for the horchata it was a water down version of Mexican horchata but it was also alright. For the passion cocktail in the other hand, I regret getting it! It had noooooooooo alcohol in it, and it was super overpriced for $11.95. Overall, I would not come back. We do not have a problem spending the money but this time it was not worth it , and the service was trash.
author: IVanna V.

description:
This place is fun to come with friends for lunch and sit outside on a nice day. The food is pretty good and they have good margaritas.

I always get the chorizo and the cod tacos when I'm here. 

The tables are close together, so it may seem like you and the person next to you are brushing elbows, but you'll all be friendly after a few margaritas!
author: Monica H.

description:
I came in about a month ago and enjoyed a great date night filled with margaritas & tacos, only issue was that the waitress accidentally overcharged my cc $50+..

I reached out via message to Tacolicious here on Yelp, expecting to hear back maybe in a week or 2, if at all. To my surprise, the owner contacted my within an hour and led me to the location manager for further help.

Despite complications reversing the charge with the cc processor, the manager continued to work on solving the issue on my behalf. Although it almost took a month, it was eventually fixed and I have to say I am impressed with, and appreciate the due diligence. Great customer service, thank you!
author: Luke W.

description: This location had a decent size dining room with bar, and several tables outside. We sat outside- seemed pretty loud and a little chaotic inside. We each had the 4 tacos for $18 and a pitcher of margaritas. Guacamole to start was OK, chips and salsa were fine. We mixed and matched tacos- the grilled fish and carnitas ones were terrific, and the chicken, veggie and brisket ones were very good also. The tacos were great overall, but the rest was just OK, and the service was a bit spotty. I know this is the big city, but both the food and the drinks seemed a bit pricey to me.
author: Mark M.

description: I was just here for lunch with my roommate and as per usual, it was delicious.  I've only ever been to the Palo Alto location before, but this is just as great.  We were easily seated, service was great, and the food was superb.  There was a little mix up in the kitchen, but the manager and our server were so sweet the entire time, and it was not even a huge issue!  We got the marina girl salad with shrimp (LOL get it? cause we were in the Marina? LOL) and the hamachi something. And margaritas. Definitely coming back.
author: Shawn T.

description: The best server Cameron he is the best I love the churros with chocolate and of course the beer is my favorite part!!! But make sure you server is Cameron!!
author: Fanny C.

description: Came out on Taco Tuesday, at a somewhat late manner. Ordered the taco deal which was make yourself, it was interesting with the barbecue tasting sauce. The margarita with the deal was tasty. And then as the finisher I had fresh chirps and chocolate which was perfection to say the least.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
the presentation and ambiance was great here but the food def EH!
I would come back just for the virgin margaritas though ;)
author: Nessy N.

description: Just got to San Fran... We decided to go in because of the crowd waiting... Must be good right? It wasn't good at all... It was amazing! The best "street" type tacos we have ever had. I had the chorizo and potato taco. It was full of flavor. I also tried the Pasion cocktail... It was spicy and fruity. Delicious! Mark and JP took extra good care of us this evening, checking on us often, made suggestions and were super nice.  Will def come back again.
author: Sherrie T.

description:
We had a great time. 
Margaritas- great I recommend the pitcher
Cod- best fish taco I've ever had
Carnitas- slightly disappointing, not your traditional carnitas flavor that I wanted but still good. 
Filet  mignon- delicious tender pieces with caramelized onions
Braised beef- very full flavor juicy
Braised chicken- very full flavor juicy

Great chips and salsa
Attentive waitress
author: Dana F.

description: Solid C+.  What is it about Millennials and their thing for loud restaurants with boring food and uncomfortable seats and an ever present big screen?   Basically it's a modern day McDonalds. So sad.
author: Philip B.

description: I have always liked the good however the drinks are ridiculous. We ordered a pitcher of margaritas for $42. We barely got four glasses and we tasted all mix and no tequila. Very disappointed and not sure if I will return. New location means they are cutting corners.
author: Jill H.

description:
This is the first time I've been here and I found it a little overwhelming but not in an overly bad way. There were a lot of people in there for a Sunday evening and I didn't expect such a crowd but I suppose that is a good thing. The spacing is a bit cramped, we sat at a high table with a booth seat on one side and a chair on the other but the table next to use was a little too close. 

After reading a few reviews, we decided to order the 10 for $36 plate. We decided to choose 5 different types of tacos and went with the following:

Nopales and Oaxaca cheese: This was really good to me with the cheese crispy and layered as a pancake on the tortilla. The nopales weren't bitter or tough but soft and delicious. 

Baja-Style Pacific Cod: This was a fat roll of fish that was fried and added to cabbage and cumin crema. 

Traditional Carnitas: This one was my favorite since well, PORK!! It had the right amount of flavor and juice that I wanted to have more. 

Chicken in Mole: This one was my least favorite but I think it was the because of the sauce. There seemed to be too much of it and was just a tad too sweet. 

House-made Chorizo and Potatoes - I really only have one word for this taco...Yuuuuuuuuum!

As a side we also got the semi-traditional refried beans that have the cotija cheese which was $6 and also the rice-o-licious with mojo verde that was $5. 

I felt like having something a little different to drink so I tried their Moss drink, which is passion fruit, pineapple, and sparkling lemonade. This one is sweet but with a sour fizzy kick to it. It wasn't cheap though so at $4 I would drink it slowly. 

Overall, I would like to come back again to this place to try some of their other stuff.
author: Sara L.

description: I could never figure out why this place is so popular.  Okay food but too salty and very, very expensive.. good service and nice outside, sidewalk seating.  Super corporate feeling.  Not recommended.
author: Bill S.

description:
Came here the other week and I thought it was very yummy..we got 3 tacos each..the fish tacos, the vegetable one, and the chicken in beer? I think.  All were very good...the fish was huge, the vegetables with a lot of flavor, and the chicken very tender.  

The service was very friendly...the only complaint I have is that we were seated near the front and there was hardly any lighting.  It sets the mood, but man, it was so difficult to read the menu.

Definite be back but sit near the back..
author: James L.

description: Door girl/hostess was rude and rather abrupt. Not the best first impression. The place may be popular and busy  but the service should still be friendly and with a smile. Will not go here again, this is where good business start to loose their trade, when service becomes unimportant. Queso still great but always look for the full experience. Will now look for a new Mexican with good food and service.
author: Ami S.

description: If you love tacos, this is definitely the place to go. They have a great deal of 10 tacos and you can choose from their variety of options, around 6 or 8 different tacos to choose from. The place is kind of small and it can be loud of but its a great place for some food, drinks and have a good time.
author: Xavier M.

description: We hosted a end of season hoops gathering with 6 families and 10 kids in the private room.  Brielle from HQ and JP onsite were great to work with to set up the buffet and service.
author: Nate C.

description:
Tonight I visited Tacolicious with a few coworkers. The place was packed! I'm not sure if they take reservations, but I'd say the wait is worth it. They won't seat you unless your WHOLE party is here, which kinda sucks because we ended up soitting outside. Even though they have a heater, it's still pretty cold so dress warm just in case.

We ordered 12 tacos (4 carnitas, 4 chicken mole, and 4 chorizo and potatoes). The best was by far the carnitas. I highly recommend them. The meat is tender and there's so much flavor! Yummmyyyy. I was too full to try the chorizo one but my coworker loves it. I'm sure all the tacos are delicious! We also ordered the brentwood corn; sweet but kinda sour from the sauce/marinade. The traditional churro dessert was delicious; nice and crunchy, but I think the chocolate sauce was unnecessary. We also ordered the laiola chocolate dessert thing too. It's basically chocolate ganache on baquettes. The chocolae tasted like chocolate soft serve or chocolate pudding; it really wasn't anything special.

Oh, get the enchiladas! They're kinda spicey but very good. You can do without the empanadas.

The drinks, mia, moss, and silas, were all real bubbly. They tasted like flavor carbonated soda. They were pretty good at first, but I got full and the bubbles didn't help.

Come eat and order the tacos and enchiladas!!!
author: Angie Y.

description:
We had Tacolicious catering in our office and it was easily the best catered food we've had.

They brought us corn tortillas, chicken, beef, onions, cilantro, guacamole, salsa, and chips. Literally ate 1/4 of a bucket of guacamole and pissed off my co-workers. The chips are made fresh and are lightly salted.

Everything was good even though I was an hour late. The chicken was my favorite. I'm hoping next time the bring the short ribs and cod.
author: Eric C.

description: Ok, great good not taking that away from them at all. Here's my problem! My daughter and I say down on a Monday at 3:30. Not busy. Sat outside. Got chips salsa fast. Server took about 10 min. Kinda no big deal. Ordered, food came quick. Good right? Yes! Good food chatted away. Now done. Buser took the plates away.... waited over 20 min for the check. Needless to say no tip.
author: Hairball H.

description:
I go to school in Boston, but I'm from Marin, and anytime I come home for a visit this is my FIRST stop. Uggghh these tacos make my heart go a pitter patter! They're seriously so tasty; very simple and authentic. You can pick from a boatload of meats, and they also have vegetarian/vegan options. If you don't like spicy, try the carnitas. They're sweet with hardly any spice (they're my fave). Also, you might have the undeniable urge to order like 4 tacos on a breezy Sunday afternoon because, hey, yolo right?
