It's brunch and I'm gonna live large dammit! And also, THEY ALL LOOK SO GOOD. But I'm telling you, these are FILLING. I'm full after one, and my record is like 1 and a half. Go easy, k my friend? OH MY GOSH THE GUACAMOLE. FORGET ABOUT IT. I have DREAMS about it. I seriously can't stop telling everyone about it.  Like.. It might be becoming a problem. My friends are a little worried. But I mean, when you're talking CALIFORNIA avocados, NATURALLY they're gonna make for a KICKASS GUAC. REGARDLESS, it was also my boyfriends favorite restaurant when he visited SF for the first time, and I took him EVERYWHERE. I'm happy to report that he now understands me on a deeper and more meaningful level, and it made our relationship that much stronger, so THANKS TACOLICIOUS. YES, there most likely will be a wait. Is it worth it? Does a bear s&@! in the woods? JUST DO IT. Never have I ever waited 45 minutes for a marg and a heaping pile of tacos and been like, "UGH, yknow what I wish I DIDNT do? THIS." Im always like, "THIS IS THE BEST DAY OF MY LIFE." 
In summation, anything you get here will be delish, worth the wait, don't go too bananas, try a margarita, and let your inner taco goddess free.
author: Olivia N.

description:
My bf and I brought a friend to Tacolicious from out of town hoping to show him a good experience.

The hostess was extremely friendly and welcoming. We were sat (at a table really for 2) right away. It then took over 10 minutes of us sitting there and asking the busser to find our server so that we could order. When the blonde, wavy haired, waitress finally did show up, she never apologized for being MIA, she simply asked us if we were ready. Knowing we wouldn't see much of her, we ordered everything at once. Our drinks again took another 7-10 minutes and the food about 25 (10 tacos). We didn't see our server for (no exaggeration) about 30 minutes. She never checked to see if we were doing okay, she never explained the fact that one of their sauces are insanely hot - so when we were desperate for water, my bf had to get up to find someone to refill it for us - again taking at least 4 minutes to even refill the container. 

Then at the end when we were beyond annoyed, we received the bill. For the amount of food we had, it was ridiculous. We had 2 beers, one glass of wine and ten tacos for $71. She of course didn't mention that when we ordered flour shells that they were an extra $1.25 each.

She never once thanked us, asked if we needed anything else or how everything was. Two out of the three of us have worked in the service industry for over 8 years. I will NEVER tip under 20% unless it was God-awful. We gave her a 10% tip that night and it was hard even giving her that.

I will never go to that location again. SF has too many delicious restaurants with great service to waste your time at a place that barely acknowledges you.
author: Christine J.

description:
I really don't want y'all to think I just like leaving bad reviews LOL I am just being honest, and Yelp needs to be known for HONESTY again. Not phoniness. Having that said....

1) For some reason this location DOESN'T have a phone. What. The, F---. It's already a big hassle to place to-go orders at the damn bar at least have a phone like the other locations to place to-go orders. Not everyone wants to go online dammit. Tacolicious is technically a restaurant, not just a bar so I don't understand why you have to place to-go orders at the effing bar when there are SERVERS WITH A POS TERMINAL OUT FRONT WHO SHOULD BE ABLE TO TAKE THE ORDERS FOR YOU. LIKE THEY DO OVER AT DELAROSA. Again, WHAT. THE. F---.

2) I also repeat placing said orders in person are a hassle as you practically have to yell over the music and standard bar chatter/noise across the bar (which is like 3 or more feet wide) to the douchebag bartenders. I offered to write the order down on a piece of paper but the bear looking guy with a bad flannel shirt rudely told me to just tell him what the order was. So I kept trying to talk over the music. 

3) I remembered that I wanted to separate a couple of the tacos from the others, so when I finally got the taller douchebag's attention as he was handing me the bag, I ask can they separate a couple. He stills tries to hand me the bag saying they are all placed together. I say a little heatedly "I know that but can they just separate 2 of the tacos???" He gets a major attitude as handing it back to the cooks, which is funny because he acts like he's the one who had to separate them. 

The first bartender I originally spoke with hears about what's going on and rudely tells me to next time say in advance I want separated, because they pack them "family style". This is where I start to get mad. FIRST OF ALL, they are TACOS. NOT SOUFFLE. YOU CANNOT MOTHER-EFFING TELL ME THAT IT'S SO MUCH TROUBLE TO OPEN THE CONTAINER, PICK UP TWO MOTHER EFFING TACOS OUT THE G---DAMN CONTAINER, AND WRAP THEM SEPARATELY. AND IT WASN'T EVEN BUSY IN THERE AT ALL WHEN I WENT THIS PAST WEEKEND!!! IT WAS NEAR THE END OF THE NIGHT, THE BAR WAS EMPTY AND THERE WERE A FEW TABLES WITH CUSTOMERS BUT THE BARTENDERS AND COOKS MOSTLY DIDN'T HAVE MUCH TO DO. And yes I literally asked him to his face "is it THAT hard to separate tacos??" That's when he finally caught his attitude and tone of his voice when he realized he met his match. He tried to re-explain the family style thing which still didn't make sense. It's not SUSHI, it's not SCRAMBLED EGGS, they are TACOS. They are already separated by the shells. I'm not understanding why it's an entire new job just to fulfill a customer's request. This is the second location I've dealt with rude staff. I don't understand why they hire douchebags who think they are above everything just because it's San Francisco, but they will keep getting checked real quick if the snobby attitude keeps up. If you don't like your jobs, leave., 

4) There was another review on here that talked honestly about the actual quality of the tacos, and they are right. They are nothing special. However, it's good food for after-the-bars on an early night.
author: Marquis A.

description: About what I expected from a "taco" spot in the Marina--it's really just a crowded bar that serves small-ish plates of overpriced whitewashed Mexican food. But after working an event for a solid 7 hours and not eating anything for even longer, I was OK with that. Got seated in a dark corner, had to use the light on my phone to read the menu, then ordered cheese dip, a spicy shrimp app, and two tacos (carnitas & braised short rib). The cheese dip tasted like it was from a can at the grocery store--again, I was really hungry so this didn't bother me one bit; the shrimps were awesome and had a building heat factor to them; and the braised short rib taco was MUCH better than the carnitas, which happened to be a bit dry.
author: Jon S.

description: I came here on a Saturday around five. It was unbearably hot for San Francisco and the sea breeze of the Marina and tacos and margs sounded just about right. We only waited a few minutes and were seated outside. We devoured the chips and salsa and ordered margaritas. I got the trio of frozen margaritas and got to try all three. They don't really highlight this option but I think it's a great deal for $9. They were all delicious but the pasion was the best. My friends ordered their margs on the rocks but regretted not getting a trio to taste more. I then got a carnitas and chorizo taco. The carnitas was excellent, chorizo was kind of dry, wouldn't order that again. All in all, a really good experience.
author: Madeline S.

description:
Well, I hate to go against the flow of what I'm seeing in the reviews, but I gotta call it like I see it.  I agree with James B's review from July.  I had pretty much the same experience.  Here's what we ordered:

BRAISED SHORT RIB TACO: Dry, weird meat texture and flavor was off point

CARNITAS TACO: OK, but even Chipotle's carnitas is better than this

FISH TACO:  Again, OK, but a real lack of flavor

FILET MIGNON TACO: My wife had a problem swallowing it because of the chewy toughness of the meat

TUNA TOSTADA: Very good!  Best thing we ordered by a longshot.

After reading the reviews, my expectations were high, the food looked good, but just about everything fell short.  I should say the salsa and chips were decent.  I actually appreciated the uniqueness of the salsa. 

We won't be going back.  Nothing to draw us back.
C'mon Yelpers, these are the best tacos you've ever had?
Really??!
author: Darien R.

description: Noisy but fun. Very special dishes. Love it here.
author: Lisa T.

description:
12/5/12 Dinner

Having been a fan of Tacolicious on Valencia, we decided to try out the one in Marina. They have pretty much the same menu, but this location is obviously not as busy. We walked in on Wednesday night at 7 and got seated right away.

Service is prompt and friendly. I noticed this location has all-boy servers, as supposed to the all-girl crew on Valencia. Interesting. The manager who greeted us on Valencia was here on the night we ate. Anyway, the food didn't disappoint:

Rock cod taco: loved the tangy sauce, batter a bit thick
Short rib taco: my bf loved this one the most, very tasty and tender
Shot-of-a-beer chicken taco: my favorite of all time

The only downside is the Brussels sprout a la Plancha, way too salty!  Chips and salsa were tasty, love that minty kick in their salsa. The music here doesn't burst my eardrum like on Valencia. A plus!

Dinner for two $35
author: Matt Y.

description: You say TACO, I yell LICIOUS! Worth the wait, this place is packed with 20 something who know a delicious taco (or 4...) when they taste it. A killer selection of mixed drinks and standard drinks along with booze supplements the evening vibe. With a few outdoor tables and tables inside, you are bound to not only enjoy the food but also the environment. Save room for churros!
author: Regina D.

description:
The most expensive imitation of Mexican tacos 
Not real Mexican recipes, not even real salsa 
If you're looking for real mexican flavor and sazon, this is not the place, service is very slow, drinks expensive. I have to say that the personal- very helpful and friendly.
author: Ofelia M.

description: Braised beef tacos and margaritas. Yum. Perfect for brunch in a sunny day or to kick off the weekend Fri night.. :)
author: Lindsay C.

description:
Love their margaritas! The wait is always the most disappointing part of coming here. 

Food is amazing. Their chips and salsa are simply YUM!

I am a vegetarian and I was able to find vegetarian tacos and appetizers.
author: Hiral P.

description: Beautiful friendly people in this fun trendy hotspot seeing fun drinks and tacos.  Tacos comes family style but tasty to fit everyone's palate.  Also, good kids menu with good options and crayons.  Highly recommend the vegetable taco with squash and corn as well as the beer chicken taco.  Staff is awesome and you can sit inside or outside.
author: Steve S.

description: Food was fresh and service was nice. Tacos were all fine but nothing extraordinary. They give lots of chips and the guacamole was good. Free refills on iced tea. I'd say if you come here you can expect good food, but don't expect anything wonderful or out of the ordinary. The chicken taco was probably the most boring. The fish taco was probably the best.
author: Piper W.

description: Absolutely amazing food and fast, friendly service to boot. Will definitely come here again next time I'm in SF!
author: Leah S.

description:
I came here for lunch and it was packed but we didn't have to wait too long for two seats in the bar area. Our service was a little slow due to the lunch crowd so it took our server about 20 minutes to take our order and it was hard to track her down when we needed additional salsa and/or assistance. 

We ended up ordering the fried plantains and 8 tacos. The plantains were delicious but they weren't crazy good. The tacos were also good, but nothing special. Overall, the food was fresh, made to order and tasty but it wasn't special. 

I'm giving this place 3 stars because it was expensive! With tax and tip we paid $55 for 1 appetizer and 8 mini tacos. They charge the same amount for vegetarian tacos as they do for steak tacos. I don't think that is necessarily fair because we all know 4 veg tacos don't cost the same as 4 steak tacos. 

Sadly, I don't think I'd come here again because it was too pricey for food that isn't 'special'.
author: Reena P.

description:
Stopped by Tacolicioius with some friends last weekend before the Beerfest at Fort Mason. We needed a good solid base before a day full of drinking. Tacolicious was a great choice to serve this purpose. Not only was the food incredibly good, the staff was friendly, and the cocktails are a fun combinations of flavors.

We ordered the following: 
To start- Plantains, made to order Guacamole, and the kale salad.

The plantains were fried and served with ranch gordo heirloom beans and cumin crema. These were pretty incredible. The cumin crema offered a little bit of a savory flavor to the sweet plantains. I didn't realize they came with beans when we ordered them, but they were also a nice compliment to the overall dish. 

The made to order guac is some of the best I have had in a while. It was fresh and flavorful. It had a nice hit of lime when you took a bite.

The Kale salad was tossed with cabbage, quinoa, persimmon, apples, carrots, roasted almonds, and a cider-cumin vinaigrette. I am normally not a fan of raw kale, but this salad was light and tasty. 

For our main course we split 8 tacos. We tried the butternut squash, the beer and a shot chicken, the carnitas, the fried cod, the chicken in mole, the chiroizo con papas, and the filet mignon. The standouts for me were the chicken in mole, and the fried cod. The others that I actually tried (the butternut squash and the beer and a shot chicken) were good, but the chicken in mole and fried cod are where its at. 

For our after entree drinks we decided to try some of the chupitos. We were confused by this concept at first. Basically what they are is one drink that is split into 4 shot glasses for 12 bucks. We tried two different ones, the margarita picante and the pasion. 

The pasion is a drink made with habanero tequila, passion fruit and lime. the margarita picante is made with tequila, lime, and red chili-pepper. We were anticipating the pasion to be the spicier of the two drinks, but that was not the case. The margarita picante had quite the kick! I don't think I would be able to handle a full one of those. Both drinks were really good, I cannot wait to come back and try some of their other cocktails and entrees!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
5 STARS for the staff! Truly one of the best service experiences I've had in a restaurant, ever. Everyone, hostess, wait staff, bartender, awesome!
So, why only 3-star rating? The food. It's so....just okay. Of the 4 tacos I tried, only the rock cod was stellar.
author: Deb A.

description:
Definitely the GO TO place for tacos in the Marina on a BEAUTIFUL day. They have amazing outdoor seating with a nice view!

Their menu is super diverse, and I went all out and got 4 tacos for $14. In my mind I thought, "YES I'M GOING TO BEAST IT OUT AND EAT ALL THESE" but after snacking on their DELICIOUS complimentary chips and salsa, by the time the tacos came I was so full...

So verdict: tacos were no doubt pretty damn bomb. Compared to Pacific Catch next door? I like Pacific Catch better for their fish tacos....but Shhhh. Still a WONDERFUL place to get good tacos.

Only pet peeve? If you're ordering tacos with another person, they put both of your orders of tacos on one huge plate. Obviously when it comes down to it, it's hard to distinguish which taco is what and who ordered what? Dude, put our orders on two separate places so I can figure out what I'm eating and which one is mine!

Overall, good service that was fast with good food.
author: Vicki L.

description: Having read good reviews of this place we were anxious to try it out while visiting San Francisco. Me and my girlfriend are both big on Mexican food and we tried almost every taco they had. Overall we found the food good but weren't exactly blown away. The chicken and the fish taco were both kind of bland and didn't impress at all. The other ones tasted overall good. The service was kind of slow  yet friendly. I'd still recommend it though. Heads up; on a chilly night it is quite cold inside so bring a sweater.
author: Johan J.

description:
The nectarine mint agua fresco was super refreshing and my best buy from here (despite it being 3 bucks) 

The three tacos for 9 bucks.. whew.. coming from places that have flavorful tacos for super cheap (East San Jose and Watsonville) the prices are super steep.  

The beer chicken was decent,,, our carnitas were a tad dry. 

Overall filling and a novelty but eh.. I would try something else before coming here again.
author: Vicky T.

description:
Really like T-Lishhhh, as my friends and I call it! Come here all the time, along with their other locations. Yes it is a little pricey but the food is great quality (or so it tastes as it is). Fun to come with about 4 people so that you can get a big plate of different flavored tacos, along with a veggie side, Guac and/or queso! They also have a fun birthday surprise - a shot of tequila with a candle on the side, very fun for those that eat too many tacos to make room for dessert! 

Service is spotty and a long wait pretty much ALWAYS. Also, please bring the Brussel Spouts back!
author: Alexis T.

description:
For me, this is the best place for tacos when I am SF. My favorites are shot-and-a-beer braised chicken taco, traditional carnitas, and baja-style pacific cod cabbage, cumin crema. Can get busy, and a bit loud, but not really a problem. Service could use some work, but never really had a bad service more just mediocre. 

I crave these tacos!
author: Joseph C.

description: We have had some great meals here in the past. Much of their food is stellar. When we went in on Sunday though they were a little off. Most egregious were our chips, which were beyond greasy and overcooked. This made enjoying the queso fundido very hard. The shrimp cakes were good and the shrimp a la Diablo were also tasty. But the mind blowing loudness, exacerbated by the staff's habit of throwing things around and shouting, combined with the greasy chips, made for a disappointing experience. Too bad, though from the line out the door these issues do not seem to be hurting their business at all.
author: Doron A.

description: One word: margaritas. Get a pitcher. Definitely get the chicken mole taco, beef short rib and guacamole. COD was not as good as the others. Make sure to make a reservation. The yellow salsa is spicyyyy!
author: Tori T.

description: Delicious, and really fresh. Taco Tuesday taco plate is good but I would go for the specialty tacos as well. The carnitas was delicious, chicken in mole was a bit too sweet for me.
author: Therese M.

description: Being a white woman in the marina of course ive been here 100 times. I just wish the food at this location would get better!! Flavorless fatty beef, always dry chicken ..small overpriced and greasy tacos...attitude filled hostess..butttttt the margaritas are AMAZING. Bartenders are always on point and hospitable. Never had a bad drink. Save the money on food and just get the cocktails! Having an actual friendly hostess in front wouldn't hurt either.
author: Alexis A.

description: My boyfriend suggested Tacolicious the other night and my reaction was 'meh'. The tacos are decent (I highly recommend the short rib tacos - by far the best). Nothing to write home about, though if someone put it in front of me I'd be happy. But, it's just too much of a hassle. The wait time is pretty silly. And, for take-out, you have to go up to the bar and weave your way through the packed crowd to pick up your order. Not fun.
author: Andrew G.

description:
Loving Tacolicious was no surprise since I had already fallen for Mosto and T-Lish. Something about Tacolicious makes me crush more and more every time....it may be the service, it's definitely better here, but it has to be a combination of things that makes this spot stand out from its sister-hipster-venues. I'll do my best to break it down.

Tacolish has me at the salsa. Sounds simple, but I am a tough crowd. There is a tangy sweetness that makes it corn-chip-dippin' perfection. They don't stop there either, when your tacos arrive, there is a whole-nother array of salsas to be dipped, chipped, and slathered. 

The tacos. They are not skimping on a thing here. Expect your tilla's to arrive (beautifully) piled high with savory meats, fish, or veggies. Seriously, one taco is enough to fill me up. 

Speaking of which; taco+tecate+tequila= $10   
Yes, please. 

Keep doin' what you're doin'
author: Jocelyn B.

description: SKIP it!! Tourist trap that is way overpriced. Went in for margaritas and and queso. Came out with a $70 bill and left the velvetta they call queso on the table.
author: Kendall B.

description: Meh, I forgot why I haven't been here in years.  Seriously $10.50 for a bad Margarita?  Mamacitas is likes 100 times better.  It does have a cool bar an scene and the food is decent.  But let's be real, the food is not why we are there....  There are so many great places in SF, I am not sure this makes the cut.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Been here a few times & the food & service makes up for Pretty much the worst & driest hostess you can find in SF !  Awful.

The bar is pretty nice & drinks are great. They are attentive to any allergies & accommodate changes. But feeling "welcome" is not part of the experience!!
author: Mark K.

description:
Went here on a Sunday during lunch time. I thought it would be way more packed considering it's location and vibe. Got seated after 10 minutes in a prime spot right at the open windows.

Had 4 tacos to share. Filet mignon, braised short ribs, chicken, and the chorizo. Chorizo was by faaaaaaaaaaar my favorite. Everything else was meh. Comes with 3 different salsas, the highlighter yellow one was bomb! Super spicy and tasty even though it looked a little toxic.


Also had the cheese dip and side order of beans. Not a fan of either. But I wouldn't necessarily listen to myself considering I'm a huge fan of movie theater nacho cheese. :) 

Overall, had a pleasant experience and would definitely come back for those chorizo tacos!
author: Angela L.

description: Fun place.  Tacos were pretty tasty, I came with a group and we got a selection as recommended by the server.  It was a bit loud for conversation.  Good drinks as well.
author: Rupert Y.

description: This place was AMAZING the reviews are not over rated! We were there on a Tuesday night and had s 10 minute wait but was initially told it would be 20. Much faster which was great. I had chicken tacos my girlfriend had the special which was beef tacos and both were awesome but the mango salsa was the stuff that really pushed over the top. I wanted a bucket of it. The chupacabra drink was the best I've ever had and we must have had 3 each. Absolutely every time I am now in San Francisco I will make it a point of going to this place
author: Michelle C.

description: This place sucks over price for tacos I told my server we wanted a small position she said the 10 tacos would be enough for 2 people when the tacos came it was enough for 4 people I feel like she didn't even tell me how big the portion for tacos and 2-4 would of been perfect. She sold me on tacos that weren't even great her suggestions as a server sucks!! Id rather go to tacko down the street
author: Mike Y.

description:
We took our chances on a lazy Sunday afternoon, and only had a 15 minute wait for a nice airy table on the window bench. 
Warning: It's super hard not to snarfle down those amazing chips and delicious salsa (and get talked into ordering some yummy guacamole) But if you "HAVE TO" then go with a very large appetite, because you'll need room for TACOS!!!!!
So yeah, of course I OD'd on that salsa which had a Jam-like consistency and a perfect spice level ( just could not stop eating it seriously) and yes, of course guacamole is a fave, so we indulged in that too. (Hey I do workout 6 days a week!)
Sunday's = Funday's in my book (when I'm not working)
Anyhoooooo, Tacos:
(so they do have a deal if you order 4 your get them for $14) but I was already pre-lubed with chips and salsa...So I just went for three. And it was very hard picking, they all sounded mouthwatering delicious. What to do, what to do...
My selection:
Fried Local Rock Cod w/cabbage, and tangy crema (really good) not greasy at all and the fish sooo fresh and flaky! Winner
Filet Mignon w/carmelized onions (3 bucaroo's extra) totally worth it. Like "buttah", tender and oh so flavorful....mmmmm. Winner
But MY absolute Fave of the three:
Chicken en Mole Colorado! Ding DIng Ding! WoW packed with meat, and the mole sweet and spicy....and was I full after all that food! YES. Okay maybe MEN could eat more....
I so can't wait to come back and hey I didn't know they were in the Mission too, Sweet! I could take Bart! 
Service Excellent and they had a full bar for those of you alcoholics. I was happy sipping my iced tea. 
There were so many other things on the menu I'd love to try on subsequent trips, but hey I know me. A creature of habit, I'll probably go for those chips and salsa and tacos.....OH YEAH....
author: Susan D.

description:
Another super long over due review is needed for this one, I should take stay cation days more often! Let me start with the only reason for the missing star is that it is always disgustingly busy. Now some may say this shouldn't detract from their rating, but I think part of the wait comes from waiter disorganization as often times after waiting 45 min for a table you will still have wait time when you sit down so be prepared with what you'd like to eat when the server gets to you and settle in.

That being said the food and drinks here are a winning combo. Their infused tequilla shooters and spicy magaritas are yummy just on their own. While they have other menu items than their tacos their tacos really do take the cake. You get to pick sets of tacos so if you go in a group it is a good idea to pick different kinds and share as you can't split up your groups. This same thing happens for their shooters (the man and I have actually traded shooters with a random couple next to us that also wanted to try different types so try that if you're stuck!)

Out of all of their taco types the only kind I have ever been dissapoionted with is the rock cod. It may be because it was breaded and it felt like a fishstick on a taco to me. Hands down though my fav is their carnitas. I could eat four of those to myself if I really tried and be in a happy food coma they are that good. 

Their queso and their guac are quite large too so if you are ordering those as starters be aware that youll get full fairly quickly and a large number of tacos may be hard to take down.

Another note is the bathroom is a bit dirty at all times. It is to be expected though as there is only one and it  is situated right near the kitchen which isnt very encouraging of cleaning mid lunch or dinner service. Add to that the typical alcohol intake of the marina inhabitants it can get a bit rank. So if you  are squeamish about that pop into one of the bars nearby on the way out.
author: Meg N.

description:
I first heard about this place from my chiropractor. She found out that I am a total foodie and asked if I ever tried this place. Of course... I am always down to try new places. So one day... I found myself in the Marina and there was a single parking space available right across from my Alma Mater Marina Middle School. Well... since it's usually hard to find parking there... during lunchtime... I figured it was fate and decided to try Tacolicious.

I am so glad I did! Their short ribs taco is sooooooooo good! I also tried their filet mignon and others but the Short Ribs are a definitely stand out here. 

Service can be slow but as long as I get my short rib tacos... we're all good.
author: Mei C.

description:
I would avoid this place if you dislike disrespectful service. I had a bad experience, and there are truly great places on that street that are better.

We were asked to sit in the bar for lunch. Once there, we were asked to make room for another couple but there was only one chair so I tell the waiter that I dont think we'll fit there but happy to try. He goes back to the couple and says that we dont want to move (blaming another customer! Very lame). As I overheard it, I highlight that I said we can move -- we give it a try and my wife moves over having to clash legs with another customer, and the other couple and I are trying to figure out how the three of us can fit in a place designed for two, which ended up being impossible. The rude waiter who sits people left us figuring this out, all of us feeling very uncomfortable and weird. 

We decide to leave, too many great places around there  and this was clearly unacceptable.
author: Scott L.

description:
I have been to this location multiple times and every time I have a difference experience.
The taco's are a little overpriced for no reason what's so ever , but hey I guess it comes with the experience. 

This place is most defiantly better for a large crowd because of the prices and the awesome options of margarita pitcher's they have available.
Weekend's are always busy , but try this place out late night on a week night and its just the right amount of crowded.
author: Stefani P.

description:
Love everything about this place minus the long wait. I don't think I've ever come here and a table was open and available for me. Clearly, the owner and management know that they are doing or this place would always be so packed! Why not get on open table so that reservations would be easier? 

The food is always tasty and fresh. Since I am a pescy, I have only tried their fish tv aid (grilled and breaded) and their veggie option. I love the fish tacos. The fish is usually cod and always yummy. Make sure to ask for extra of their 3 different taco salsas. The yellow is my favorite! 

Great service always, regardless of how busy this place gets. If you're in the area, I recommend this place. 

My favorite part about this place... Their complimentary chips and salsa and their pasion margarita. If you love spicy, you will love this! Every single sip will leave your mouth tingling in the best way possible.
author: Anastasia N.

description:
Pick-up order:

- 2 Carnitas street tacos
- 2 filet mignon street tacos
- 2 bottles of Coke

$37.00 total

The meat was good (hence the bonus star), but these were street tacos. Street tacos!!!

Save your money people...
author: Brooks A.

description:
This place had amazing tacos and queso and a great Bloody Mary.  There's a little trio different salsas to try and they are all pretty good, although none are spicy.  The short ribt tacos were my favorite; we ordered a bunch and shared between the table so we could try everything.

Friendly service and fun crowd for a Sunday brunch.
author: Erin E.

description: Awesome private room party experience.  We used this for our daughters 16 bday and could not have been any happier!  Service was great, atmosphere was perfect for group of 18 and food was delicious.  Thank you Tacolicious for a great experience!  Highly highly recommend them for your next private party.
author: Genie D.

description:
Being from LA there are tons of taco options all over the place.  In SF it seems like a newer explosion of everything mexican with some awesome results. Tacolicious, goofy name and all seems to make it work.

Cool vibe of this place with a small yet potent menu.  Some great apps.  The guacamole, bean dip and cheese dip were all tops.  The cheese dip in particular is something so old fashioned and bad for you, but done so well, it just begs to be eaten and eaten and eaten.  It made me remember that in my high school days I used to devour this stuff at my friends house on Sundays when we watched football. And this version was even better.  Any food that does the long time memory jog must be a good thing!

Great comp chips were crispy cooked and super fresh.  Salsas ( three of them) were also great and a bit different.

Albacore tostada was a starter and quite yummy.  Marinated tuna had chipoltle mayo that had just the right kick with some crispy leeks. Nice touch.

Tacos were all quite good with the exception of the carnitas which is to bad.  To me Carnitas are the go to in an authentic mex place and in L.A. there are some that are awesome.  These were sweet with no char or pungency to make them memorable.  So for me, I'd skip them next time.  The short ribs and chicken mole tacos were really really good.

Many other menu items sounded fantastic so will hope to return to sample more.  Thats always a good sign.  

They say all the food is sustainable and humane and farmer friendly.  (Like the farmers are petting their livestock so we know they are happy.).   I like friendly farmers so I'm in.

Had some nice booze drinks and a virgin one called Moss that hit the spot.

Service was great and the young woman who I think was the manager did two nice check ins to make sure we were all happy.  The place was hopping which it seems is the norm. 

So looks like LA may have some good competition for trendy yet reasonably priced hip mexican.  SF puts another foodie gotta go place on the map.  The city that just can't stop itself...

Andele yeehaa...
author: Bruce M.

description:
Neighborhood fave. Ye be warned: thou dost waiteth for many moons to get a table (yeah, I switched tongues mid-sentence, what?). Fortunately, Chestnut Street offers plenty to do/see during the wait.

The guac rocks. The tequila and beers are great. 22 ounces of Sol? On a work night? No problem. 

The eponymous tacos are obviously the main attraction. 3 or 4 tacos usually do me right depending on hunger level, and are fantastic. I lean toward the squash, carnitas, chorizo, and  carne asada, but the filet mignon and cod are popular as well.

It's almost impossible to have a bad time at T-Lish.
author: Peter C.

description:
The queso is the reason I will come back for more and more. 

I LOVE GOOD QUESO, and this place has it! The food is good, not super authentic, but the tacos are good, and you can order platters for your entire party if you choose to do so. Grilled chicken ones are delicious. 

The service is great too, so expect some fun and lively waiters/waitresses. 

The only thing I would say is a neg on this, is depending on when you go - you might have to face a wait just because it's so crackin and lively. 

Going there tonight! :)
author: Raji R.

description:
I wanted to dislike this place, I really did. Mexican in the Marina? I almost died laughing. This was place was legit though. The tacos were DELICIOUS. It pains me to write it, trust me. I've been twice now to prove it wasn't a fluke. Nope. Second time was actually better than the first. 

Think modern decor and low prices. It's a win-win. It is always crowded with young and good looking people if you're into that. 

The two tacos which I really like so far are the cod tacos and the carnitas. Slight edge to the carnitas. The short rib tacos are supposed to be really good (according to my friend - I didn't actually try them). 

Honestly, the service wasn't that great the first time as my server dissappeared as he flirted with a table full of blondes but the second time around was much better.

The chips and guac are also very good. 

Presentation is also very nice. See: http://farm3.static.flickr.com/2689/4313658715_0c2715cf55.jpg


As far as the price you can get tacos for about $3.50, 4 for $12 and 10 for $29. 

I will definitely be going back. Not as cheap as the taco truck but just as good if not better and in a much nicer ambiance.
author: Carlos A.

description:
First of all, good luck with parking!  Second, you'll be waiting for a table for awhile because this place is pop-U-lar!  Third, you'll also be waiting in line to use their restroom because they only have one.. (just a warning ladies!)

The staff are really friendly and accommodating.   Since my friends and I waited for over 30mins, we were ready to order right away. We told that to our hostess, who relayed the information to our waitress and we got our food right away.

And I didn't order any tacos.. Crazy right? Well, I had a taco binge at Mijita at the Ferry Building the day before and wasn't up for anymore. I did order the ceviche and it was delicious.  For $9.95, you would think you'd get more, but in reality it was just enough.  I heard about their yummy guacamole.. it was good, but I prefer the one at Mijita.  And I should mention that their salsa is delicious.

We sat outside, so we couldn't order alcohol.  So now I have a reason to go back.
author: Vira P.

description: Yummy fish tacos, a full bar and delicious sauces to accompany your food make this place a gem! Looking forward to trying more of their offerings in the future.
author: Nicole V.

description:
First the good: the food is tasty. There are small plates and appetizers. It is gringo Mexican but then again it is in the Marina. Notwithstanding, good flavors and fresh-tasting ingredients. The tacos are great too, the more you buy the better the deal. 

The bad: the service is atrocious. The wait is long-but that's due to popularity-however, there is no excuse for the hostesses' lack of attention. They are slow to fill tables and appeared checked-out on 2 of the three occasions I came here. The wait-staff is understaffed. They do a decent enough job, but they need help. No one came to check on our meal progress or refilled the water which had run out. Further, our busser got the next table's drink order wrong and didn't bother asking if I wanted another beer. The tables are stacked tightly. So close that patrons have to move the whole table out to climb into their seat. Last but not least, some genius employee placed a doggy water cup behind my seat without telling me. Good thing I looked or I would have stepped right into the bowl.

Overall, food is 4 stars, but the service makes dining in completely unpleasant. I highly recommend getting take out instead.
author: Oleg A.

description:
Somehow, and I won't say how,* I ended up in the Marina last night not having had dinner. After an hour wait, we were finally seated at 10pm. 

I ordered 4 tacos and ate all the chips. I also ordered a Paloma and it was quite good. 

So I had chicken and short rib tacos. I got grease all over my pants partially because I couldn't see anything in there due to the lighting, and partially because of the Paloma. 

I STRUGGLED to finish my third taco. Seriously. I'm making my mancat come with me for a cheap date. AND they were GOOD. I don't know what salasa's I put on them because, well, its dark in there, but the one I liked the best tasted green. 

Get the green tacos. Get greasy beef short rib tacos. Get a good time. 





*Alcohol was how. Obviously.
author: Emily D.

description:
Greg and I went to Tacolicious last night to satiate the random taco craving.  We had to wait 40 minutes for our table, but we walked over to California Wine Merchant for a glass, so it really wasn't that bad.  Once we sat down, and overindulged in two baskets of chips, we put in our order:

-3 carnitas tacos
-2 chicken tacos
-3 short rib tacos

We also ordered a pitcher of the El Camino, and it proved to be more like a regular margarita.  Not necessarily bad, but we were expecting something a little different.  Anyway, the carnitas taco was probably the best out of the three, but in all I thought all of them were pretty good.  A little pricey, obviously, but still good.  The one issue here is that the bar area overflows into the eating areas, so you end up having to yell over the plaid shirt-wearing, overdressed and high heeled wearing crowd that turns up around 8pm.  I've been to Tacolicious during the daytime, and it's actually a great place when it's less crowded and sunny.  Tacolicious is a place that is nice every now and then, so it'll probably be some time before we head back.
author: Lisa I.

description:
I feel like Tacolicious is the closest I've come to being in a "club."  This place transforms as soon as it hits 8 o'clock; it's crowded like a rush hour bus, the music is deafening, there are drunk, beautiful people everywhere, and suddenly the name means something totally different! (Why are people bringing their toddlers here??!) 

But for real, these glamorized tacos are tacolicious.  The chorizo and potato isn't greasy at all and the short-rib is super tender and flavorful.  If you want to get churros... SHARE.  These suckers are big.  I drank nothing but the Pasion all night and it was dee-licious.  Just the right amount of sweetness, crazy spicy, salt rim all around.  

I'm glad I lost weight or I wouldn't have fit between these tiny tables.  Now to practice walking in heels...
author: Yelena K.

description: If it's one thing you must try, its the delicious cocktail "mucho gusto"(el jimador, pineapple, coconut water, lime, agave). I lunched with a friend here to catch up on school/ hometown gossip and had a nice time. Our waiter was constantly checking in on us and kept our glasses filled. I can't remember what I ordered but I do remember the chips and salsa were on point.
author: Court S.

description:
Date & Time:  Monday January 11, 2010 @ 6pm Opening Night
Company:  Michael
Crowd:  Packed w/ Groups of Cute Suits, Single Girls in Blumarine Tops, William Rast Jeans & Riding Boots & Girls in Baseball Caps, Lululemon Vests & 3 Carat Diamond Solitaires Accompanied by Husbands in Business Casual
Music:  Mix of Alternative & Girl from Ipanema 
Vibe:  Energetic
Decor:  Fun & Contemporary Small Space. Dimly-Lit.  Sleek Bar.  Slate Blue & Brown Walls.
Service:  Friendly Girls in Head to Toe Black
Imbibe:  Tecate & Margarita
Devour:  Tacos- Fried Rock Cod, Chorizo, Shot-and-a-Beer Braised Chicken, Braised Beef Short Rib.  T-Lish Prix Fixe- Shot of El Jimandor Blanco+Can of Tecate+Taco of Choice
Skip:  Salmon en Mojo Verde
Total:  $39.42
author: Genevieve Y.

description: Taco-meh-ish..Heard a lot of great things. Unfortunately left disappointed. Nothing to write home about. Just give me some tacos from Chavez supermarket and I'm good. For one, yelp should really change the price amount to $$$. Dinner for 2 came to $60 excluding tip. That's $$$ range. How'd they taste? They were alright..nothing you can't get at a local taqueria though. Sure the atmosphere is nice, but the tacos are Americanized to hell.
author: Sean R.

description:
While touring SF with some of my bests we came across: Tacolicious
The place is a bit tiny but suites its purpose.tacos check , tequila check. & some lemons check.

We went in on a Tuesday night & it was filled up with a line out the door. We waited for about 30m. We started up at the bar with some Sangria. I must admit, I'm not a huge fan of Sangria because places usually fill it up with tons of sugar and some cheap red wine. but Surprisingly the Sangria was very de-'licious'. with fresh fruit & bold flavors.

Food: we ordered tacos (which you can mix & match, i recommend the butter squash) & albóndigas chipotle soup.  When I first got served the albóndigas, the meatballs looked a little lonely.  I'm use to the albóndigas swimming in lots of broth & veggies. but as soon as i took a bite into it, i was turned into a fan. I added extra lemon and some salsa which created perfection. The albóndigas is not too spicy, but Tacolicious offers a salsa platter that has a mix of red, yellow & green salsa. all tasty...grab a chip & take a dip. 

vibe: young & fresh...but it is perfect for a family ambiance on Sunday mornings. If you are ever in the Marina district stop by, grab a taco or just try one of their 50 tequila "chupitos" you will never leave disappointed.
author: Priscilla N.

description: My favorite place to go when visiting the Bay! Best tacos, margaritas! Tip is to go during happy hour can be pricy otherwise. It's a fun atmosphere and can get packed. But sooo good!
author: Jamie L.

description:
My wife & I were very excited to eat here as we'd heard nothing but good things. We ordered guacamole and queso and a pitcher of margaritas. We ordered 5 tacos to split and munched on the dips and chips while we waited. The table next to us was sat a few minutes after us and the table next to them about 15 minutes after. Both neighboring tables got their food, ate, and we're finishing up before I was finally able to get the eye of the expo. I could see the expo asking our waitress about us and figured our waitress would come over and let us know the status of our food. Instead, she went and grabbed a couple orders, rang them in, then came by to ask, "How is everything?"  I explained that we were still missing our food and she went to find out what the hold up was. When she came back, she said it would just be a few minutes but offered no explanation as to the delay. About 10 minutes later, another expo came out with a plate of food that wasn't our order. I explained this to him and he took it away. I looked around for our server but she was nowhere to be found. A few minutes later, we decided to just pay for what we'd received and leave. I stopped our server at the POS station and explained that we were leaving and wanted our check. She was confused because she was sure our order had just gone out. When I told her it was the wrong order, she double checked to discover she'd entered the wrong food. I told her I just wanted to pay and leave. She didn't offer any kind of apology. She did not offer to comp any portion of our meal (not that ever I expect that, but the gesture would've been nice). $61.00 for a pitcher of watered down margaritas and a bowl of guac and cheese. We waited for 45 minutes for our food, was delivered the wrong food, and then given no explanation or apology. It wasn't even busy in the restaurant. 

Just as we were leaving, the table next to us noticed a bug in their food. They called the manager over to send it back. As we were leaving, the expo stopped to ask us if we wanted the completed order to go, but it was the food that we'd just sent back, the wrong order. 

$61.00 for a 45 minutes wait and no food. 

I'd like to give this place another shot but the bug sealed it. Never again.
author: Dan T.

description: We got here around 2ish on a Saturday and it was pretty packed. I thought that we were going to have to wait but we were seated right away. They have a lot of interesting items on their menu but we decided to get the 10 tacos for $33. We split it among three people and no one was able to get the last taco down. It was probably because their salsa was so dang good that we ate way too many chips. The tacos are more expensive than I'm used to and the only special part were the sauces they came with. We are definitely not in LA anymore. My favorite was the fish taco and the short rib wasn't bad either. Their drinks look great but I didn't try any of them.
author: Irene C.

description:
Glad we stopped here!! Definitely would be going back to.  The guacamole is arguably, the best Ive ever had. It wasn't fancy or anything, it was just avocados and you can really enjoy the goodness of it too, and I lovveeeed them!!! I can't wait to come back and have them again. Also the salsa they provide along with the complimentary chips was fantastic as well. Ev and I kept trying to guess what that other ingredient was in the salsa that gave it extra kick and it was MINT!!! Soooo delicious. We ordered short rib, rock cod and carnitas tacos and also one of their specialty tacos and all of them were amazing!!!! We truly wanted to stay and just eat and drink. 

Will be a definite must go to place next time were up there. Also another plus, it wasn't at all greasy, everything is just as good as it gets.
author: Vanessa P.

description:
Food:  I had the Mexican soup and shared the four tacos; the beer braised chicken was by far my favorite taco.  I liked the fish a lot as well.  The soup was to die for!  

Atmosphere:  SO CROWDED.  They pack you in like sardines.  

Service:  Not a friendly staff, but things came out quickly.  

Overall, I'd definitely go back because the food over-powers the other stuff.  If the other two things were different I'd give them four stars.  Maybe during my next visit I'll get a friendlier waitress?  :)
author: Melissa P.

description:
The butternut squash tacos were incredible. Fresh, flavorful and perfect for vegetarians! Just an FYI the fish tacos are fried.

My husband had a few meat tacos. We were both surprised at how big the meat portion was.
author: Roz B.

description: First timer, me and a friend of mine went there late Thursday night, literally after we got off the plane, so that was a plus that it closed at midnight. The food was awesome we had 6 carnita tacos and shrimp cakes to share. Our tacos were stuffed!!!, like... alot of pork!! Lol! It was sooooo good. It also came with 3 different sauces, from mild to hot. The shrimp cakes were good, nothing special, kinda spicy. A Good place to hang with friends, the only thing I didn't like was the lighting. It was really dim, a little too dim for me. But all in all I had a good experience there and the food was good!
author: MaliaAdrian M.

description:
One of my all time favorite restaurants in the Marina!

Best items:

-fried cod tacos
-carnitas tacos
-bottomless chips and salsa
-flor de Jamaica cocktails/pitchers! 

Tips* 

-never just order one taco, its not worth the money. Always order at least 4 tacos and split with a friend!
-They'll always refill your chip basket for free, don't be afraid to ask!
-for larger groups, bday parties, or less marina type crowd, go to their Mission location instead, same menu and bigger space!
author: Alex K.

description:
Great name and great tacos. Saw my friend check-in at Tacolicious and almost jumped up to find her... then I realized she was at the Mission location.  Yes, there is more than one Tacolicious to go around.

The 10 tacos for $30 is a pretty good value.  The three of us shared that and didn't finish it, and we also had the chile con cheso.  

Get:
Rock cod taco
Beer chicken taco
Short rib taco

The others were good too, but those are the standouts.  Going back soon!
author: Erika C.

description:
Stopped in for dinner on a Tuesday evening while vacationing in SF. We had to wait about 20 minutes and were seated at the bar. I ordered a house margarita and my cousin got the passion one. Mine was just ok but she said hers was good. 

I had read great things about the tacos so I was excited to try them, but unfortunately I was left wanting more. I ordered the cod taco, carnitas and the chicken and all were out within five minutes of ordering- very quick. Although service was speedy, the tacos were not my favorite. I found them all to be rather dry and bland, like they needed more sauce to balance them out. The sauces they provided to add were ok, but a little too spicy for my taste. 

Overall, not a bad spot to grab dinner, but for the price and quality I think it could have been better.
author: Maryclaire H.

description:
Who doesn't love tacos? 
They're not hard to make, small but delicious, numerous ways to dress them up, and packs a ton of flavor in each bite. Most of all, tacos are cheap! 

Tacolicious definitely hits home on all of the above, well.. except for being "cheap".

My girlfriend and I weren't too hungry for a real meal so it was a perfect plan to finally check out Tacolicious. When we entered, we were immediately greeted, seated, and given complimentary chips and salsa -- awesome! Because there was so much different Mexican fusion eats to pick from, our waiter recommended the Albacore Tuna Tostada and the taco 4-pack. 

Albacore Tuna Tostada - [http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ATcV86xCrL4W_Ug-PBV1qw/l.jpg]
Don't get me wrong, the tuna tostadas were very good but for $11.00 and considering you only get 2 small tuna tostadas, it's definitely leaves you with a "wtf? that's it" look.. 

Guajillo Braised Short Rib (x2), 
Traditional Carnita (x2), 
Ancho Chile Braised Short Rib Taco (x1) - 
[http://s3-media1.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/QB-i6_4HDalk9uNdIpSktg/l.jpg]
So on our 4-pack of tacos, we got 2 of the carnitas and 2 of the braised short ribs, so that my girlfriend and I could each have one. The ancho chile taco was T-lish's "Taco of the Week" special, so we got 1 to try it out (which was about $4.00). 
The guajillo short rib taco was packed with meat (nice!) but on the other hand, was very very oily (blah).. I kept my taco in midair in attempts to drip most of the excess oil out. But on the other hand, the carnita taco hit the spot. Nicely roasted pork, and a lot of it, on two warm taco shells. Lastly, the ancho chile taco was good, but a tad too salty and oily (it is adobo after all), but just not as oily as the guajillo one. 

Tacolicious does make delicious tacos, it's in their name after all, and the staff was very nice, but our little 7 taco fiesta, along with 1 Sierra Nevada draft, summed up slighty over $35.00.. It was good, but incredibly overpriced. Do you know how many tacos you can get from a Taco Truck with thirty-five bucks? Exactly.
author: Albert L.

description: Great service, limited seating, around 20 bar stools. Thoroughly enjoyed. Great mojito.
author: Jay D.

description:
It was pretty busy on this Monday holiday. The host told us it would be about a 25 minute wait it ended up being about 40 minutes, but the host was really nice and kept letting us know how many people were ahead of us. 

I ordered enchiladas de pollo. For $7.95 you get 3 enchiladas. Not bad. The enchiladas were a 4/5 for me only because the tasted kind of Americanized but hey we are in America! I asked our waitress for lemons for my water which I never got. 

Everyone else in my party enjoyed their meal. My cousin got a drink that was really good! I can't remember the name of it but it was a hot pink margarita. Yumm. 

I'm not sure if it's everyday or just on Mondays but for $10 you get 1 taco, 1 beer, and 1 shot! That's a great deal and on Tuesdays they have $15 for a burger, 1 beer, and a shot. I might have to come back on a Tuesday. This place is always packed. I recommend going early.
author: Kate T.

description: I generally like the street taco, or those taco truck, but the tacos here are of premium quality, pretty big tacos, I've tried every taco already, I like their triple sauce thing they have, especially the butter lookin' one that is extremely spicy. All the tacos are good, my least favorite is the veggie one, but it is.... very good also.
author: Raphael A.

description: If you're hungry and on a budget, don't come here. I ate 4 tacos for lunch and it cost me $21 after tax. Tacos are tasty but average. Meat fillings are on the bland side- couldn't taste the beer in the chicken, or the guajillo in the beef, or the salt on the cod, or the spice in the spice-seared salmon. What saved my taste buds were the salsas.
author: Melissa N.

description: Make sure you check your bank account after eating here and paying with your credit card. Servers here will try to add more tips on your tab after you left!!!
author: T N.

description: I'm sorry but I really don't understand the hype :( Especially for the price! The boyfriend and I decided to check it out since everyone always talks about it and we were super hungry. We ordered the 4 taco combo and to be honest they were very sub par. We both were confused about the hype because we thought the tacos themselves were missing something - very much kinda bland, over priced and boring. The sauces that came with them were not very tasty at all and the whole time we kinda wished we had spent our money somewhere else. Plus the waitress we had was kinda rude when we couldn't decide what we wanted and not very friendly. But their chips tho were absolutely wonderful - really the only thing I thoroughly enjoyed. Sorry tacolicious, not again for me!
author: Callan B.

description: Hmmmm. Some friends we were visiting suggested that we make a stop here while doing some shopping. Super busy, had to wait,and wait, so obviously very popular and a little disorganized. The food was okay but certainly nothing special. We had the shot & Beer chicken and carnitas tacos and the meats were all a bit flavorless. Maybe I'm picky because I'm from LA where you can get amazing tacos all over. The margaritas were also just ok. Skip the margarita and go right to a shot, they have a good selection of tequila( and maybe it won't seem so LOUD).  It was crazy loud and I do hate yelling at my dining partners so it's one star off for the ambiance. The highlight was the Guac and the queso dip which was actually quite yummy.
author: Ann K.

description: The tacos were good! However, the kale salad was lacking (may have been a taste preference thing) and the service could use improvement. Overall, I felt it was a bit overpriced for the experience.
author: Casey P.

description: Very fun atmosphere, very crowded on a Sunday afternoon. The food was excellent, loved the salsa that came with the chips and each of the tacos I had was great (hangar steak, carne asade, and a chicken with cheese one). Great for an afternoon lunch after leisurely walking around this adorable part of SF!
author: Brooke S.

description:
No need to repeat all other reviewers, we enjoyed our tacos x 4 and liked that we could mix and match the meats.  

A very lively place to people watch and their chips & salsa are very good.  Our server was really nice and although there were people lining up for our table, they asked if we wanted a refill on chips....nice.
author: Randall F.

description:
Tasty food with nice outdoor seating under heated lamps (for evenings). 

Margarita pitcher servings are very generous.
author: Andrew S.

description: Amanda is the best waitress that's ever waited! She recommended the salmon tacos and we were not disappointed. I don't even like fish! She deserves 6 stars.
author: Brian M.

description:
Can't believe this is my first review as I eat here at least once a week, but this place is GREAT! 

The food is all very photogenic, well presented, and tastes just as good. Everything on the menu is great, from all the tacos to the guacamole, it's wonderful. 

I seriously don't have anything to really complaint about the place except the service and the cramped tables. As I said, I'm there all the time but they still manage to act like they've never seen me and my GF in their lives. They rarely check on you to see how the food is doing either (but it's always great so oh well. Would definitely give 5 STARS if they stepped up their service!
author: Dan D.

description:
"It's too loud", screamed Cate with her hands cupping her ears. "Here, eat these chips", I said while dumping our stuff on the only stool of the crowded bar. The loud music coupled with the beautiful young women with straight hair and chunky jewelry immediately took me to 1999 when half my pay check went to rent and the other half went towards clothes and going out. Tacolicious in the Marina whisked me back to my 20's when all the bars and restaurants in the city were jammed pack and you could hail a limo to drive you to the next neighborhood.  We were staying.

As soon as my Margarita de la casa arrived our table along the window wall was ready. We squeezed passed a couple on their first date, I later realized, and continued to check out the scene of  good looking, well dressed Marina people. Cate started to shimmy so I knew the music was no longer a problem.  Although they do have a kids menu, I always have Cate share with me so that she can experience new flavors.  We had a hard time choosing our 4 four tacos because they all looked delicious. The menu has something for everyone. From kale salad to Mexican style meatballs , your little one could even just dig into a side of drunken beans and rice-o-licious with mojo verde. We ended up choosing the roasted butternut squash with pasilla peppers, fried pacific rock cod cabbage, tangy crema, traditional carnitas, and the chicken en mole colorado. Needless to say we were stuffed and satisfied with the organic ingredients from local purveyors. I'm hoping to go back again with my husband, this time sitting at the bar in a new outfit with my hair blown out straight.
author: Danielle W.

description: Not impressed with the price for the value. Tacos were actually creative and good, but coming out to almost $20 is not my idea of a lunch value. If money isn't a worry, get your taco on here, but for the rest of us, there is far better deals.
author: Robert W.

description:
Are you kidding me?

I recently got a job close by and haven't really ventured out much in the neighborhood.  Well I'm glad I did today.

I was amazed by how much they gave me in my togo bag.  Large bag of chips, 3 different dips that were all scrumptious, and a whole bowl of pico de gallo!  Did I REALLY just lick that salsa bowl clean?  You bet I did.

Then the tacos... wowwwww!

I've always joked about orgasmic food... but just like the real thing, you don't know until it's actually happened.

It was seriously unfair how good this food was and I am having trouble coping with life after that one, I just cannot go on living after that.  Part of me regrets ever walking in there as I will probably never have a taco more delicious ever again... well until my next visit.  IT'S A VICIOUS CIRCLE!!!  Well played Tacolicious, well played.

I can definitely see myself getting fat at this place, and I am thankful my job is a little bit of a walk away, I will need it.  Need to come check out "Burger Tuesdays"... a burger, tecate, and tequila for 15 bucks?  WOW!
author: Kelly N.

description: This is the first and my favorite Tacolicious. I love the cocktails here, the Flor de Jamaica is my fav. I love Jamaica and the blanco is perfect with it. The beer list is pretty cool, it offers a good selection of Mexican beer. Love that they have Tecate in a can. I've had the tacos at this location and I must say they are pretty true to something my honorary mom in South Central LA would make. My favorite taco is the Chicken En Mole Colorado; the sauce is spicy and savory. Though the place feels hella hipster, the food and service makes up for the jaded  Marina area feel.
author: Faith C.

description: We had a great time here at 3pm on a Saturday. We were seated right away. The table was against a wall and getting into either seat was a squeeze for both me (curvy lady) and the Mr (6'8" gentleman) but we made it work. We split 4 tacos for $14--the fried cod and short rib for me, and the chicken mole and carnitas for him. Everything was delicious. The salsa that came with the chips was okay (very chunky, watery, cilantro-heavy) but the trio of sauces that came with our tacos was even better. $7 for a tall beer was borderline outrageous, but hey, it's SF. A nice place for a snack.
author: Andrea A.

description:
What a unique place! Gourmet tacos in an energetic setting on the busy and trendy Chestnut Street near the Marina District. The food is different and very tasty, but the noise - it's very loud in there - and the service - they seemed overwhelmed and struggled to keep up - were drawbacks.

My favorite taco by far was the Short Rib. Meaty, juicy and tender with a perfect burn of spice. Wow! The Filet Mignon tacos were also quite delicious, but they are $2 extra per taco, so beware of sticker shock when you get the bill. (Kudos to the server for telling us this fact up front.) The other tacos are good, but I would order a plate of the short rib tacos the next time...wonderful.

The food is messy, the parking is difficult, the patrons are packed in there like sardines in a can and, strangely, the bathroom is in the kitchen area. However, that's what you get in San Francisco sometimes.

I'd sum up Tacolicious as a 5-star taco joint - how absurd it sounds to write that - with enough deductions to drop it down to 4 stars...maybe 3-1/2 stars. However, I would go there again when I am in town. There's nothing like it in Portland.
author: Matthew W.

description:
This place was recommended by one of my friends and it was very crowded. Luckily, the host was able to squeeze my party of 3 at the very end of the counter. We were given freshly made chips and salsas. The chips and salsas were hot. I probably devoured 3 bowls of chips by myself because I was so hungry. The trio of salsas were amazing. My favorite was the yellow habanero salsa but man, that salsa was beyond hot. If you cannot stand the hotness, I suggest the mild green tomatillo sauce. Now onto what they are famous for, their tacos!

We ordered 11 tacos which included the carnitas, fried local rock cod, chorizo - potato, beef short rib and braised chicken. My favorites were the carnitas and braised chicken tacos. All the tacos were topped nicely with cilantro, onions, red cabbage, radishes, among other things. The service is quick and very friendly. I liked the atmosphere a lot but be prepared to fork out a bit more for tacos than you normally do from a local taqueria or truck. I would definitely come back and remember, use your fingers and not forks.
author: Danster L.

description:
Awesome food/drinks and service. 

Fave Food: Made-to-order guacamole, short rib tacos, carnitas tacos. 
Drinks: Tecate, margs.

We will be back!
author: Kristen V.

description:
The best way to go hear is with a big group, not super hungry and ready to drink.  Get a bunch of the 10-taco platters and margaritas, and go to town.  

The food is good, especially the sauces.  I would actually say that my favorite thing from Tacolicious is their standard salsa that comes with the free chips--there's something very different about it that is really tasty.

The ambiance is definitely trendy, and the place gets crowded.  If you're going on a tuesday night or any weekend meal, be prepared to wait a bit.
author: Zack H.

description: This place was aiighhht. We went for taco Tuesday's, and their tacos are nothing like their regular tacos which aren't discounted. Whatever. Their standard lineup of tacos are pretty good but this other crap they sent us for $10 felt like something from a drive through, except neatly plated. Anyone can do ground beef with taco seasoning and shredded Mexican cheese out of a bag, seriously, I thought there were some standards to this joint. We had a pretty fun night, but then again, it was the company and not the venue. Their drinks were cheap I think, I don't know it got blurry towards the end. Let's just say for taco Tuesday, I'd rather not.
author: Elton F.

description:
If I could give 2.5 stars, I would. Ate here for lunch today. Impressed by the crowd given it was around 2pm on a Monday. Sat at the bar and enjoyed watching the chefs work their magic. Our waiter was fine, friendly enough, and I think checked in on us at some point. I got the filet mignon and short rib tacos, both of which were tasty but very salty. Too salty. It would've been nice to taste more of the meat.

There were only a couple of onions -- which were also supposed to be caramelized, but were just plain grilled -- on the filet mignon taco. Would have appreciated more of the mild sauce (green, I think an avocado base) to go with the meal, which was probably my favorite part, but I didn't ask for more so that's my bad. Two tacos filled me up so the price was right. Chips were decent, too, but pretty oily. However, nothing seemed too special so I don't see a reason to return.
author: Justine M.

description:
Tacolicious= tacos and gangsta rap. A good combination. 

This place does a pretty good job. The margaritas were tasty, guac is good and the tacos are tasty. Nothing is worth mentioning as incredible, but nothing is bad.

The food comes out really quickly and the little kids menu taco trucks are awesome!
author: Kate L.

description:
I haven't had to write a review about such a poor experience in a very long time.

For the short version, just go somewhere else as they are so many great bars and restaurant on Chestnut St.

The place was packed for dinner and music extremely loud, so we went someplace else for dinner.

We decided to come back for a drink afterwards, as we were told they have great margaritas.

Drinks were ok, but the service was so poor that even tipping 1$ was painful.

We sat at the bar and waited more than 20 mins to have our order taken.

In the meantime one of the staff came to take away my friends stool, to give it to a nearby table. There were some available on the other corner of the restaurant and it seems she didn't bother to go all the way to pick one.

The bar tender could not understand our order due to the loud music, brought us a wrong drink and got very rude when we asked what drink he served us.

To finish it, the bill came wrong as they tried to charge more drinks than we ordered (they corrected it and offered one of the drinks) Same thing happened to the guy next to us!

For sure, We certainly won't bother going back there.

PS: during the whole time the couple right next to us was waiting for their food order and when we left, they were still waiting ...
author: Sebastien L.

description: The name says it all.  Tacos and delicious had a baby and it's this place.  There is a margarita for everyone whether your taste is spicy or sweet.  The tacos are bite size with a mouthful of flavor!  You really cant go wrong and the combo deal lets you get a little taste of everything.  The cod and the mole tacos are 2 of my go-tos.  The chips are solid and I recommend enjoying them with their mm-mm made-to-order guacamole.  Your inner-Mexican will thank you.
author: Jacqueline S.

description:
Oh the Marina, you are what you are and I thank you for your restaurants.

Tacolicious is great for a small group, if not a bit loud.  Luckily, we were able to sit outside, and although it was a typical SF summer night, the heat lamps kept everyone plenty warm.

The guacamole and chips were very good, nothing too special, but good.  Everyone enjoyed their drinks as well.  

I got the fish taco and a beef one.  The fish taco was a bit bland, and I think I put too much hot sauce on the beef one.  Despite this, I really enjoyed Tacolicious and will be back to try other types.
author: Shelby B.

description: I was very pleased by the tacos I ordered. While the crowd was a bit hipster-ish, the very food was quite welcoming.
author: Keith M.

description:
Finally, I ran onto a spot that had delicious tacos in SF. The tacos here made with authentic style but its a new age of culinary genius'.  It has a modern twist to them and everything that I had tasted so far was off the hook.  Bold flavors and not for the weight conscious I am afraid.  

I was frankly tired of running into promising places for tacos especially the mission.  It didn't deliver, not close to anything I have tried in the hood of NYC.  

The chorizo taco is outstanding.
Great trendy, rustic foodie place.  Must come here more often.
author: A K.

description:
I would categorize my food experience here in terms of the great show Seinfeld - The Risotto Episode.

In comparison, the food was more like having sex with George Costanza; where I was left feeling unsatisfied and bloated.  As opposed to feeling full and satisfied like Karin after the Risotto. 

I had four tacos: the short rib was the best, the carnitas was second best.  I was full after these two, but then the curve ball; the chicken tasted like they threw a pound of brown sugar in the chicken.  It was so sweet that if I was diabetic, i would have either died from high blood sugar or been jolted out of a diabetic coma.  Either way the chicken is too sugary in taste.  Which leaves me to the fish taco.  The fish was ok bit the breading was soggy like a wet sock.  It had no taste.

So in my experience, skip the fish and chicken all together. The table also ordered queso, which is essentially a Velveeta recipe on the back of the box.

The best thing about this place is the margaritas and outside seating. 

In conclusion, to bring it back full circle to Seinfeld, I was full, but George, not like the Risotto...
author: Jeremy E.

description:
Tacolicious brings tasty nueva Latina cuisine to The Marina.

The menu features "snacks," sides and, of course, the raison d'etre: tacos.
Don't be fooled into ordering too much food. The tacos ($3.95 each, four for $13 and 10 for $31) dwarf the regular taqueria offerings. One "snack," two tacos and maybe a side will more than suffice.  Add to that the unending supply of the freshly made chips from La Palma tortillas as well as house-made salsa and two diners will surely be sated.

A great way to begin your meal, the albacore tostadas ($10.95) are served with avocado and caramelized leeks atop a crisp tortilla with chipotle-spiced aioli.  Despite the cutesy name, the Marina Girl salad ($9.95) with romaine, avocado, cucumber, radishes, pumpkin seeds, cotija cheese, and a light, but spicy, vinaigrette is a winner. Deep and rich, a favorite is the Camarones (shrimp) a la diabla ($10.95).  Perfectly seasoned--not too fiery, not too bland--it rocks.  Moist and fresh, the fried local rock cod was good, but lacked in the flavor department.

All that being said, the tacos are undoubtedly the star.  You can choose from short ribs, cochinita pibil (slow-roasted pork), carnitas, chicken mole, and more. Whichever you select, you will not be disappointed.  Moist and tasty with a nice level of heat, they are all winners.

If you go to Tacolicious at peak hours, be prepared to wait.  Yes, everyone else has discovered this gem as well.  Once you sink your teeth into a delicious taco, Tacolicious is, however, worth the wait.
author: CJ G.

description:
My gfs and I went here on a Friday night and it was super packed. We waited for 30 mins to get a table and the hostess was very friendly and accomodating. We ordered a pitcher of red sangria, tacos, tuna tostada, guacamole and empanadas. All were great except for the empanadas which tasted doughy and not much flavor. It would have been better if they have meat inside.  For my next drink I ordered the SERENA which was very tasty.
Love the music, vibe, decor and the crowd. Will definitely come back to try other tacos and the CHUPITOS! Parking is just a pain in Marina
author: Claudine V.

description:
The crowd gathered outside makes one wonder whether Tacolicious is giving away free food or if it is that good.

This is one of those places where you will smell like your food if you sit inside. It would have been fine if the food was above par.

Don't understand the hype. The stone-faced bartender barely acknowledged we were there. I guess we kept him from talking to his co-workers, which he did at length.

The food was mediocre and the wine was clearly left out over night (and they had no problem serving it to us). I tolerated it, but, the person I was with took one sip and left the rest in the glass.

Generally, I would have said something, but, we were in a rush. The bartender didn't even ask if there was something wrong with the wine. Poor service. Can't say I will return or recommend this place to my friends.

Recommend Delarosa if you are in this area.
author: Jason M.

description:
I went here with a friend with the goal of getting a quick bite before a night out.  Here's what I thought of what we ordered:

Empanadas: they're trying for a veg-frienly version with purple potatoes & peas and sweet corn puree.  It was tasty but a bit dry inside, which is probably why it is served with the puree and pico de gallo.  It wasn't my favorite interpretation of the dish.

Albacore tuna tostadas: this was actually the best thing I ate.  The fish was fresh (or at least they put enough lime juice on it so I couldn't tell otherwise).  The whole plate worked and was very good.  Sure, the crunchy tostadita round ensured that you were sandwiching broken pieces together as you finished it, but what the heck.

Carnitas tacos: The pork was too dry...there's really no way around it.  Put all the salsa you want on it but it can't mask the fact that you have excessively dry carnitas.  Ugh, with the massive latin american culinary talent in SF it amazes me that restaurants can still goof something as fundamental as carnitas.

Filet tacos: Good, but nothing stupendous.  My friend claimed it was the best thing he ate there.  I thought it was good but nothing to write home about.  It was "your standard taco".

One bonus is that the hot salsa that they serve with the chips is particularly good...surprisingly so.

The service was generally good and friendly.  The food arrived in a reasonable amount of time and the prices were about what I had expected.

But in the end, it's a "Mexican" place with an emphasis on booze in the Marina.  The food doesn't live up to the potential.  There are better Mexican options all over SF.  But if you want a bite to go with your booze, you could probably do worse in the neighborhood than Tacolicious.
author: Ben G.

description:
TL;DR - THE SERVICE WAS ATROCIOUS. Two of our three drinks had bugs in them. No joke. At the end of the night, the manager, unapologetically and condescendingly, told us to pay for the drinks and that it was "fair" since they replaced it for us with "clean" drinks.  Are you kidding me?

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

Three of us came here for a late dinner on a Sunday night. Like many others have said, the food itself was good. No complaints there. However, we did order three drinks. And when they came, I noticed a speck swimming in my alcoholic elixir. The restaurant was pretty dim, so I shone my iPhone flashlight on it to investigate.  I kid you not. It was a drowning fly. Without hesitation, my two other friends checked their drinks and one of them had TWO of those suckers in his. What. The. Eff. Two of our three drinks were bug-infested.

We told the waitress, who promptly replaced our drinks, and we then proceeded with dinner. At the end of the meal, we got the check and nothing was done about the bug situation. No apologies or anything. In a place like San Francisco, you would think bug-infested drinks (note: plural) would be comped...or at least appease us with dessert. Nothing. Ok, and that's not even it.

By this time, our original waitress was already off her shift, so we asked for the manager. The manager told us that she didn't know about the bug situation. We told her everything and she exclaimed that it had been "fair" since the waitress brought out "clean" drinks after we pointed out the bugs. She pretty much insisted on us paying the full bill. 

I disagreed with her vehemently by saying that the drinks shouldn't have bugs in them in the first place and that the waitress should have checked before bringing them over. I asked her "What if we hadn't noticed the bugs and drank it?" or "If she would served drinks like that to customers?" or "if any other respectable establishment would just brush off this problem?" She admitted she never checked in with the waitress OR the bartender. This was Sunday night at 10PM, mind you. It was NOT busy and she had been chit-chatting with said waitress and bartender this WHOLE time.
