Even then, she wasn't apologetic about it. She kept insisting that they already did what they can do about the situation and was SUPER PATRONIZING in her responses. With her tone of voice, I wouldn't be surprised if she assumed that the three of us, Asian guys, were just being Asian trying to get out of paying $20 from the bar tab. If it came down to poor customer service in the restaurant industry, this manager would easily win an award for being the perfect case study.

Eventually, in her condescending tone, she offered to "comp" us the drinks "if that's what we really wanted." Um...no, bitch. I can afford my drinks. And since you put it that way, I'll even pay for it to make a statement about the crappy service we received and that it's not about the money. So take this $20 and shove it.

To make matters worst, this was a birthday dinner for the friend who had the two bugs in his drink. I couldn't have been more appalled for even suggesting Tacolicious.

I've frequented Tacolicious a few times before, and this will for sure be my last time. After this, I wouldn't recommend ANYONE to come here, with the exception of the health department. Final note, good luck if you're ordering sangria or any dark drinks because you won't even notice the bugs that could be in your drink. And even if there are bugs, Tacolicious will make DAMN sure that it's YOUR problem and that YOU pay for them.
author: Jeremy F.

description: Fun place to go for dinner! Definitely a busy place so expect a wait. Margaritas are yummy. Chili con queso is a nice starter, as well as the housemade salsa. Short rib tacos were delicious and a must get.
author: Teresa C.

description:
I don't know why I've felt the need to avoid this place since it went in.  I guess I figured I shouldn't go for Mexican if I'm not in the Mission.  Well a friend and I found ourselves hungry and headed for the water so Tacolicious provided the perfect pit stop, and wow am I glad I finally went.  

The soup was some of the most flavorful tortilla soup I've had, and the carnitas taco was kind of mind-blowing.  I kept telling people it was so amazing because of the grease, which in retrospect probably was not the ideal way to market it.  But it's like a tasty, healthy, not disgusting grease? (ok, obviously not healthy, and not over abundant, but trust me, it's a good grease).  That was one of the best carnitas tacos I've ever had.  I hope it wasn't just because I was starving, but I'm totally coming back.  My lunchmate seemed just as satisfied with her two tacos, and we both devoursed the chips and salsa.  I'm impressed, Tacolicious.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: The food was really good and but our experience was ruined by the very very VERY rude bartender, it was hard not to take it personally!!! not only he was rude to us when I asked him a question regarding the food and drink (I mean it was our first time there) he pointed to the menu meaning read the menu! but then after he took our order he completely ignored us for the rest of the time we were there, never asked if needed anything not even water!, never took our plates after we were done and pretty much didn't talk to us until I asked him for the bill, really never experienced anything like that at a restaurant! I feel like they need nicer people that are happier about being/working there!
author: Sabad M.

description: This review is about their $42 pitcher margaritas.... RIP-OFF.  There is absolutely No Tequila in their margs, more importantly the pitcher is filled to the brim with ICE.  Did not taste a single drop and ended up spending $85 on 2 pitchers of ice.  Guess they have to pay for their rent increase at their new location.  NOT Cool, NOT Right.
author: KEN S.

description:
Is this a bar with a restaurant attached or a restaurant with a bar attached? Either way it's delicious. 

I'm too old to stay here much past 8pm, on future visits I need to get in, down about 10 tacos and get the hell out before the crowds from the Marina filter in. This place is filled with the sorts of people who bring their kids to bars, the sorts of people who insist they can have it all and annoy the shit out of you in the process. That doesn't detract from the food and drinks though, which are completely awesome. Try all the tacos, they're great and similarly there's not a bad drink on the menu.

On a Saturday everything was fine up until about 8pm when the music and patrons just became a background roar that my table had to shout over to be able to hear each other, adding to the cacophony. We left shortly thereafter, slightly tipsy, comfortably full, and partially deaf. Ideally, stop here for dinner, get some tacos, stare in amazement at the parents who have their kids here without adequate ear protection, get a few drinks and then head off to one of the quieter bars down the street.
author: Andrew M.

description: I love the new Tacolicious location in the SF Marina district. Great bar, great outdoor eating, wonderful bartenders and drinks! BUT the music is so loud you can't hear anyone near you. Please HEAR me...turn down the music!
author: Ellen M.

description: Just ordered 2 Tacos and the margaritas look tasty too bad I can't have one next I will
author: Jessica M.

description:
Full house on a weekday around 1pm. Place is clean, seats comfortable. Service good... but 3 little tacos at $3.95 each were good but did not wow. My fish taco was kind of oily and tasteless. My husband liked his short rib taco... My son thought his chorizo potatoes taco was ok... 
So why 4 stars... the incredible albacore tuna tostadas $10.95 were delicious... but only two... too little yummies... We had to order it again. So 3 for us, 1 little taco each...and 1+ little yummy tostada each.... and one of us had a non alcoholic drink... with tax and tip $50.
Overall, food was clean, not heavy... 
I think I could have eaten 3 orders of the tostadas by myself.

This is not your traditional mexican taco burrito place. You would not like this if that is what you are expecting.
author: jane f.

description: Food was yummy, but environment was rough. Waited forever for a table, the seat smelled rancid, and it had a club-like vibe (loud and bro-filled) only around 8 or 9 pm.
author: Claudia P.

description:
If you ever catch yourself wondering if there is such thing as a Taco Heaven, let me tell you, there is. But it prefers to go by the name of Tacolicious.

Sure, the place may be super crowded (which really only serves as a testimony to how amazing their tacos are) and you might catch yourself conspicuously eyeing the food of the tables around you as you wait (it didn't take that long at all, but DAMN those tacos looked good), but it is 100% worth it.

I had a shot-and-a-beer braised chicken taco and their taco of the day, which I believe was some sort of pork taco--it wasn't the carnitas pork though.

Anyway, GET THEE TO A TACOHEAVEN-ERY!
author: Jenn L.

description:
Today is NATIONAL MARGARITA DAY!          February 22, 2015

My cousin picked me up this morning. & we headed for Brunch. When we arrived it was pretty packed but didn't have to wait too long, but then again, we got there at opening to avoid the crazy lines.
Once we were seated, we were greeted with complimentary salsa & fresh tortilla chips. We immediately ordered an order of Guacamole. And naturally, a Margarita for each of us. We saw on the menu Fried Sweet Plaintains, so we ordered it for an App. It was DELICIOUS!  Not crazy, over the top good, but GOOD! We decided to share four tacos (2) Shot & Beer chicken tacos (my favorite!) and (2) Rock Cod Fish Tacos. Loved the flaky batter but just a tad too crispy. And it was time for another Margarita for each of us, again. The three sauces they provide for your tacos and the guacamole was pretty good.
We shared an order of churos for dessert. Super Yummy!
Our male server was friendly & helpful, no complaints. The ambience is casual, lively, food was hot & came out quick. Good vibe.
Would I come back? Absolutely .....Remember I do have a taco fettish after all.  LOL.
author: Janet T.

description:
Tacolicious was not delicious. I am seeing these high ratings and I'm so confused. I've gone twice now and both times have left disappointed. 

Positive: Free chips and salsa. I love free stuff. Chips are thick (I like them thinner) but the salsa is good. I enjoyed the mint they add to it.

Positive: The margarita fresca was delish.

Positive: Service was good and food came quickly. 

Negatiive: Tacos. This last time, I tried the squash, fish, carnitas and prime rib tacos. All of them seemed to lack flavor. I had to douse them in the salsas to find them edible. My SO agreed. We are never ones to leave food behind (even if we're stuffed), but neither of us could finish our plate due to lack of flavorz. 

Negative: Tables are way too small. Everything gets way too crowded.
author: Michelle B.

description:
This the place, that offers intensely delicious California Mexican food.

Our party of five arrived at this place packed with a crowd a bit past 8 on a lazy Sunday. We were pretty lucky to be seated fairly quickly, on the outside of the restaurant, literally. There's no patio, no fence, just casual street-style.

We ordered their fresh guacamole ($7.65) and the chili con queso ($7.50) to go with their crispy tortilla chips. The guac is wholesomely creamy and delicate, a palate pleaser, but the queso dip is even better; it arrived at the table attractively steamy, it's very rich but the spice cuts out the fattiness, and makes takes the dish to a whole new level.

Of course, the star of the show are their large selection of tacos (10 for $33, 4 for $14):
I know everyone would struggle to pick out their favorites, but here are a few that I'd order again:
Chicken En Mole, that shredded chicken remains heavenly moist in that slightly smoky sweet chocolaty goodness.
Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib, there's nothing special about it, except that huge hunky piece of tender meat loading up the entire tortilla, gets better with a touch of their medium salsa.
Butternut Squash, I ordered this out of curiosity and I am delighted to report that this taco stands up to all the other selections; the various grilled veggies are so underrated.

Overall, this place is a bit pricey, but anyone expect a bit of a premium for great place for a chill Mexican-party. Order a few tacos, a few sides, and 2 pitchers of their house margarita ($30) and you are in for a good time. 

Cheers.
author: Edward L.

description:
Came here last night with my roommate after we both got off work around 6:30.

We were seated immediately, but the hostess who sat us had a sort of attitude/air about her that made us feel like we shouldn't be there or that we didn't belong (hello...we're both college students but we still like to eat good food...) so that did not start well for us.

Luckily, after that our waiter came with the most delicious chips and salsa *he must of known we were dead after our long day* and gave us time to look over the menu

We ordered drinks, but requested a kalimotxo, and the waiter, Francisco or something like that, was so accommodating and reaffirmed our choice, saying that his family was Basque and the drink is a Basque-style drink. 

When it arrived, we ordered our food, I got the taco of the week, the grilled shrimp marinated in garlic, and also a cod taco
My roommate got the taco of the week along with the carnitas taco.

We both LOVED our tacos, we preferred the carnitas/cod over the taco of the week but it was all delicious. The tortillas were amazing and we could not get over how good they were.

Our only complaint was that we ran out of one of the sauces that come in the sauce trio, because it comes with such a small portion for two people who love salsa. 

All together, the waiter was AMAZING and loved the service. The food runner was also fabulous, getting us Tapatio and more chips when needed.

Where I minus a star was the small portion of salsa trio and the hostess who thought she was 'all that'
author: Annie C.

description:
The food is great! I don't even mind the wait, but the female servers here really get on my nerves :(

I don't know what it is...they're not especially rude, nor are they super nice..but I just never feel at ease eating here and never stay long after the last bits of taco's have been gobbled up. There is one female manager ( I think? ) which is super nice and helpful. I always ask her which margaritas/pitcher to order and she never fails me!!

Take out here is awesome, because you get exactly the same amount of food, no less no more.  
Just double ( i mean it ) check your order as I have gone all the way home to find out I got a completely different order and then drive back and the customer who's order I have is steaming red mad...at me.
author: Selina W.

description: Stopped in to eat at the bar quickly before a movie. Got the fried plantains and the squid a la plancha. The plantains were very good...super sweet....super yum. The squid was okay. Could you grill the squid first? That would make a huge difference and put this dish over the top. Had one of the few dark beers they had. The only negative was the bartender/server. I felt like I was bothering him the entire time. Or he thought he was super cool and needed to show me that somehow. Nope dude. Super cool is a helpful friendly guy. I did get a big kick out of the dad who had baby strapped to his chest and came in to order takeout for himself and whoever was going to be in the car with him. He was able to order two stiff drinks in the time it took for the order to come up. Pretty sure the partner was driving, since he was in charge of the baby. What is it with all the men in the Marina walking around with babies on their chests? Amusing.
author: Laurie H.

description:
This place is a bit small but by far its one of the best mexican restaurants i've ever eaten at! Very trendy and young vibe in here. Lots of tequila to choose from. The tacos are delicious (hence the name tacolicious!)

Chorizo tacos, filet mignon, even nopal tacos for you vegetarians! They bring you a salsa sampler dish (red, yellow, and green) with your meal and all 3 are amazing.

Drink a michelada.

worth the wait!
author: Obed C.

description: The spot is pretty small but I enjoyed it a lot. The tacos are really good and their three sauces that come with it is excellent. I got the ten tacos for 33 dollars for me and my girlfriend which was perfect and we had leftovers from it. The fish taco is the best choice. I would probably just pick ten fish tacos next time because they taste so good. Carnitas is good too but I don't recommend the beef short rib. Too dry and not enough sauce. I would recommend this place to have a date at because it's so close to Crissy Fields and Palace of Fine Arts and the Golden Gate Bridge. So you can eat and go somewhere romantic
author: Philip S.

description:
I LURVE ME SOME TACO-LICIOUS!!! 

I am not the biggest taco fan to begin with and will have a burrito any day but this place is right on the money. We had the guac and the chilli con queso for an app and both were just delish. Fresh, cheesy, chilli-like...perfection. 

For dinner we got the 4 tacos for $13 (awesome price in my opinion for the quality of food you get). We got the fish, veggies, chicken bathed in beer, and the short rib. Veggies was so so. But the other three were so flavorful and yummolicious!!! 

Only debbie downer? No reservations taken and the place is always super packed with an hour wait or so. 

Its a must try...
author: Michelle I.

description: Fried sweet plantains were amazing! Try them as a starter and them order four different tacos to enjoy four different flavors. Also, enjoy watching the kitchen working as a well oiled machine!
author: Adriary O.

description: I remember a time when the Marina Girl Salad with grilled chicken ($3.95) chicken had a generous serving of grilled chicken strips.  Now, I am not sure what happened with the passage of time and the move to the new location.  Instead of grilled chicken strips, the salad was topped with burnt chicken scraps.  What has happened to the place???
author: May N.

description: Gotta say right off the Marina Girl salad just makes this place.  Food is good, quality ingredients, the drinks are delicious and pleasing.  In fact, if you're jonesing for Tacolicious so badly, you might skip this location and go to get your short rib tacos at the Ferry Building were  the attitude and usually the crowd is much better.  But you're going here for the atmosphere and the salad!  Because really, S.F. has better and cheaper taco places.  But this one is good for the Marina.
author: Dina F.

description:
Ima be real (like I always am)...

Either it was my waitress, or maybe cause it was Friday afternoon, or something..

But i think theyre either racist or saw that my party and I were just kids and overall I did not receive even the slightest attempt for good service.

The food was ok. Most of the tacos couldnt compare to any Taquiera in Mission (plus youre paying $4/taco) but one or two were decent, so 1 star for that.

But back to the service. Honestly you can have the most delicious of food but if the person serving you shows me attitude (especially when I'm being polite and respectful) I cant stand it. Our server, Dani, needs to fix her attitude..whether you hate minority ethnicites, kids, or above all else..you ruined my lunch. I even tested to see if I wasnt mistaken, I looked at you right in the eye and said as most sincerely as possible "Thank you very much" and you didnt even make eye contact with me. Do I disgust you? 

What a terrible experience, Im never coming back. I paid $23 for a mediocre meal for 2 with a side of bad service.

**OH, and reading all the rest of the reviews, people are claiming this place as the BEST TACOS IN THE CITY!? 

OH MY GAWD..HELL NO! I kid you NOT, that is FALSE! 

These reviewers probably only had Taco Bell, Jack in the Box or some other low grade taco. Its unfortunate that they are even throwing out "best in the city.." as carelessly as people say "i love you..". 

Go to the Mission District and get CHEAPER, TASTIER, FRESHER, & LARGER QUANTITY TACOS. Seriously, like that makes me mad.
author: Phillip S.

description: Tacos are good, but WAY overpriced.  However, the waiter took forever to bring the beer I ordered; the tacos literally came while the drink that I ordered first floated around.
author: Christina S.

description:
Ok I'm getting close to some real good Mexican food.
The place small but they did a great job on moving the people and it was easy thanks to the bat tender to get a drink while we waited. Every body working there had a good attitude.
Always start with the chips they always tip me off on star count. The chips were great and the salsa was just the right amount of heat.
We had fish tacos which I'm super picky on and they were just right. The fish was fresh and crunchy.
By now I'm totaly stuffed from above but I gave the carne asada taco a go. Corn totillas were perfect and the meat delisous.
We were in and out in just under an hour with wait.
author: Donald M.

description: Was not a fan of this Marina taco joint. Every taco I had was pretty bland. The margaritas I ordered were overloaded with sour mix, making them almost undrinkable. Service was fine, nothing outstanding but more than sufficient. Given the Marina prices you'll pay I would recommend passing on this place.
author: Michael C.

description:
Taco-LICIOUS indeed! The flavor combos in these tacos blew me away. Butternut squash, and the Colorado somethin'...I was practically begging for more. But those little tacos are filling, so I held back on ordering anything else. 

The service: Yes. 
Food wait time: Yes. 
Food quality, presentation, flavor, temperature: Yes yes yes yes and one more YES just for good measure.
Sauces on the side: Probably the second reason why I'm so crazy about this place.

If you're looking for a place to go on a casual date or somewhere interesting to watch the game rather than just any ol' sports bar, go here. Yes.






Yes.
author: Maria M.

description: Taco perfection. My go to taco place. Love the flavors! Wish they'd open one in Marin.
author: Ali B.

description:
tacolicious is one of those places you hope will live up to the hype. after seeing this place all over instagram, food blogs and yelp...i decided it to give it a try for myself. SO glad i did!

the ambiance is lovely, staff is friendly, the price point is just right for those who aren't sure they can commit to having a full meal or just want a light bite to go with their margarita.

must orders:
tuna tostada
local fried cod taco
filet mignon taco
queso dip

this place is solid and i'll be back for more!
author: Mandy A.

description:
I came here for a late lunch, so it wasn't too crowded. As soon as we got seated, they brought the chips and salsa, which were  pretty delicious.

I thought it was a little pricy for tacos when I first saw the menu, but the tacos were pretty large. My boyfriend and I shared the 10 tacos for $29; that's probably the best deal, but that's how they get you to get more! It was more than enough for the two of us since we each only ate 2 or 3 and took the rest to go. 

I tried:
- fried local rock cod cabbage, tangy crema = tastes good but not the best
- shot-and-a-beer braised petaluma chicken = tasty 
- traditional carnitas = BEST
- chicken en mole colorado = not sure what mole really tastes like, but it was good?

And no, I didn't eat them all in one sitting. 

Definitely check it out!
author: Kathy L.

description:
It tends to get a little packed but that's the only downside. Sadly, I've been unable to try the whole menu. I love the tacos way to much not to just keep buying them. The short ribs tacos are the winners! 

They have a taco, shot of tequila and tekate for ten bucks, good start to a Friday night.

Always ask for extra salsa, you're gonna want it.
author: Mark Y.

description:
Definitely the short ribs and carnitas.

Came here with a date and he somehow cut down our wait time - not sure how, but regardless, got 4 tacos for the 2 of us. He let me have the short ribs and carnitas tacos and they were delicious. 

Will be back to try other tacos and the drinks!
author: Nina Y.

description:
I stopped here for a break from shopping and it was happy hour! I loved their happy hour sangria, which was delicious and only $5 - same price for margaritas! I tried their quesadilla and I really liked it. One of my friends had the nachos and the happy hour portion was large enough that she did not finish it. They gave us chips and salsa when we sat down (even if we were at the bar) and the salsa was different from what I ever had before and so much better!!
The service was great; they frequently asked how we were and if we needed anything else. I would definitely come here again!
author: Dodi G.

description:
This place really lives up to its name because these tacos ARE delicious! After trying some of the other Mexican places nearby, I was wondering if there was any good Mexican food in the Marina at all!
Luckily, there's Tacolicious! The tacos were the "street taco" style and although they're a bit expensive (but let's be real, what in the Marina isn't...) they were exactly what you want in a taco. The carnitas was perfect,  not too greasy, but not dry either. The rest of the taco fixings wetter simple, but effective with some cilantro and onion. The tortillas were nice and not to thin, wispy or dry.  They had excellent chips,  although the salsa must've had mint or something in it which was kinda weird and I could have done without it to be honest. 
I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a good taco!
author: Ian C.

description: You know how some people that live in the marina insist they aren't "marina people"? Not me! I've totally turned into a marina mommy, when I was pregnant this is where we'd go for dinner (if you get here before 7 and eat guacamole and tacos you're out in 40 minutes) 3 times a week....I'd watch Tinder dates, brogrammers indulging in $10 taco shot and beer, gaggles of girls on the prowl....now that my special snowflake is here the outside tables can accommodate my mommy mafia complete with enormous bugaboo buffalo stroller for leisurely lunches before strolling down chestnut to Susie Cakes.
author: Poppy C.

description: It was my first time here, it wasn't that great and overpriced. I can tell it's not authentic Mexican. Why would you charge  1 taco for $4.95?! That's absurd. Oh and they don't have public restroom. I wouldn't come back again.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
If you're looking to find your monthly intake of sodium, look no further.  One bite of these "delicious" tacos and you're set for the month! 

Maybe I'm a little jaded since I lived in San Diego for the past 3.5 years but I thought the tacos here were horrible. Come on people's, with a name like tacolicious you'd expect the tacos to be amazing.  

The sole saving grace of this place is the fact that it seems like a great environment to have some drinks. 

Note: chips and salsa = good.  salty taco were the chicken and beef ones.
author: Astro D A.

description:
Came here with my sister on a Thursday night and it was packkkkedd. Was told it would be 20-25 minutes but got seated under 15 minutes which was good! The space where I sat felt very squished but for my size, I guess it was fine. Ordered a Mia (drink) which was more sour than sweet but I liked it. The little pieces on top were interesting, because I first thought they were apples but they weren't sweet like one. Still can't figure out what they are though. 

Complimentary freshmade chips and salsa. Ate nearly the whole basket before our tacos came, but they were delicious!

Ordered 10 tacos for $33. Had two chorizos, two short-ribs, two taco-of-the-week: buffalo chicken, one carnitas, one chicken en mole, one cod, and one shot & beer braised chicken. I had a chorizo, short rib, buffalo chicken, and carnitas but it wasn't as flavorful as I hoped. I liked the buffalo chicken best if I had to choose. The tacos came with three sauces ranging from spiciest (yellow/orange) to not (green). I liked the green one best. 

Check and service to help us take tacos home for our mom was quick. An experience but won't be back unless my sister wants it again.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I definitely wasn't overly impressed with this place.  I found the food was Blah... i mean, I was starving (I mean like famished and even left overs in garbage bins was looking good kinda hungry), so I finished it all.  But would I have been as enthusiastic otherwise?  Probably not.  

I also found the atmosphere rather loud, and a group of nearby patrons found it necessary to drop f-bombs like a pastor drops "amens" in a southern church.  Apparently this is standard practice?  Not sure, the staff didn't seem to ask them to knock it off - so assuming that it is SOP.
author: Jerome B.

description: Sat at the bar. Great service and delicious food! Had the delicioso guac! Loved it!
author: Catherine M.

description:
Wait time for lunch on a Saturday: 30 minutes.

Number of 'pedestrians' I cursed out in my head for walking too slow or for stopping in the middle of the sidewalk on Chestnut for no apparent reason: 3

Cigarettes smoked: 2

Complex carbohydrate goodiness and blackberry margaritas: TOTALLY WORTH IT!

OK, I will admit - I was apprehensive initially.  I don't like the Marina [insert backlash from the Marina kids and cheers from everyone else here].  But I actually had a good experience at Tacolicious.  

The empanadas, butternut squash taco (too many peppers, and hence, I couldn't even taste the squash) and chocolate taco dessert (skip it!) were just OK.  However, the fried plaintains (amazing!) and the margarita fresca w/ blackberries (can I have 5 please) will make me return.  Also, free chips and salsa!

Service was fast and friendly.
author: Gev M.

description: Food is generally great across the board only let down by the LOUD atmosphere and hit n miss customer service. The place is always packed so you'll be queuing for 30 mins most nights. Shame really as their are other Mexicans close by that have decent food but offer a much better atmosphere and service.
author: Stephen B.

description:
Went here for Sunday brunch after Fort Mason Farmers' Market. This was our first time but have always heard good things about the place. 

It was packed but we were seated in 5 minutes. So glad the brunch menu included all their regular items (usually places have smaller brunch menu). Since it's brunch I had to get the sparkling sangria and my partner ordered the margarita fresca. My sangria was good but boy that margarita fresca with cranberries was soo soo yum!! I did order it as my second brunch cocktail LOL

The ladies next to us had the tuna tostadas and convinced us to order it because she thought it's the best thing ever. So we did and really liked it! Very good. I had the 4 tacos deal for $14.. 1 chorizo con papas (good), 1 fried rock cod (ok and my least favorite), special of the day chicken (not sure what it was but it was good), and the chicken mole (my favorite .. soo good!). I like that they put the tacos on 2 corn tortillas. They are smaller size but by no means will you go hungry (esp if you order 4). My partner ordered from the brunch menu bistec huevos rancheros I think.. he liked it but said it was average. But we both really liked this place, and was surprised at how good it tasted and very good approximate of what Mexican food should taste like. The service was excellent also. I have heard disparaging remarks about the neighborhood of Marina.. but we always love it! We meet the nicest people and enjoy good food. We'll be back!
author: Vol T.

description:
Tacolicious.  Man, with a name like that, they have to be good right?  I mean, if you're going to make up a new word to describe how good your tacos are, they can't be average or mediocre.  Taco-verage?  Taco-ocre?  Umm...no.  Nevermind the fact that they wouldn't even taste good, it doesn't even sound fun nor does it roll off the tongue as well.  

Ended up coming out here with a few friends to check out just how tacolicious these tacos were.  The reigning king of the moment for me is Nick's tacos from Underdog, but I've read some favorable reviews for Tacolicious as well.  To get a bit of variety for us to try and compare, we each put in identical orders of four tacos ($12 for four): fried local rock cod, housemade chorizo and potato, shot-and-a-beer braised Petaluma chicken, and guajillo braised beef short rib.  And let me tell you, 16 tacos take up a lot more space than you would think.  But, when the waitress dropped two huge plates onto our table, It was on!

Fried Rock Cod - my favorite of the bunch.  Rock cod is one of my favorite types of fish, and they did this one right.  Fairly generous sized portion and garnish, nice crispy batter, and good flavor.  Not quite to the level of Nick's, but I would recommend it.

Braised Petaluma Chicken - although I was okay trying it, it was the one that I was least excited about when our order went in (personally, I would haven chosen carnitas).  For me, it was pretty middle of the road since nothing about it stood out.  I didn't find the chicken that flavorful, but I wouldn't quite call it bland either (I've had worse chicken tacos).

Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib - though it wasn't my favorite, it wasn't too far behind the cod.  Of the group, I thought that it probably packed the most punch in terms of flavor, but the cod was better overall.  The meat was fairly moist as a whole, and I liked that you got the taste of that char too.  Most of the meat was pretty tender too.

Chorizo and potato - my least favorite of the bunch, and would not get it again.  Generally, I like chorizo since it usually has some strong, meaty spice and flavor, but I wouldn't have known it was in there if I hadn't read the menu.  For me, it tasted more like seasoned potatoes, and it had the matching soft consistency.  Disappointing.

In addition, the free chips and salsa they offer for each table is pretty good.  Beyond the food though, I thought the service was great as our waitress was helpful and friendly, but seating can be problematic.  Given the layout (bar takes up a lot of space), seating is limited and even when you're at the table, it can feel a little tight.  Grabbing a seat at the bar is not a bad alternative, but it can get pretty packed over there as well.  Given the popularity, there's usually a crowd at any given time, so I'd recommend going with a smaller group if possible and a little earlier or later to try to avoid the peak dinner hours.  Definitely worth trying though.
author: Mike L.

description: AMAzing tacos and margaritas they even have burgers...haven't ventured into the burger realm there yet. But the service is good the tacos are always great.
author: Jamie H.

description:
I know this whole taco thing was invented down south and everything.. but the fusion-esque tacos here at Tacolicious blew my cowboy boots off. I still had to ride my horse home, but without boots. Boots and horses are pretty necessary, but not this time. Whatever they are serving up as the taco of the week - GET IT. I almost wish they'd add these tacos of the week permanently b/c they are all rock stars in my book. You seriously can't go wrong with any of the tacos on the menu. 

Tacolicious = Yummylicious. Cheesy but true.
author: Henry W.

description:
My favorite taco place in the Bay Area.  Was super happy to hear they opened a third location in North Beach. (With the original in the Marina and their second location in the Mission.). Great selection of tacos and the best tequila drinks outside of Mexico.  They are known for their extensive list of tequila if you are down for a shot or two. 

Great chips and salsa.. Get the guacamole, you won't be disappointed.  My favorite thing to order is the clown tacos.  Think updated spin on the Jack in the Box version from your high school days.  I tend to order their special taco of the week, which is always changing but guaranteed to be fabulous.

Staff is super friendly and are always happy to make suggestions.  Only downfall is be prepared to wait for a seat.. The word has gotten out, so it is no longer sf's best kept secret.  Totally worth the wait, and much quicker then zipping down to Mexico.
author: Victoria O.

description:
I'd probably give three stars, the daughter loves this place tho. We sat inside, but the heat lamps  outside were blasting on us and I sat there sweating. The guy next to me asked to close the window or turn them off but wait staff said NOPE

I swear we ordered four tacos and not 90 seconds later, the plate arrived. Isn't that weird?  Are they sitting  back there pre-made?  We were there today about 1 pm.  Most  tables occupied  but several empty  so not packed 

The carnitas were the best. Fish tacos were greasy. The veggie taco was okay.

Service is aloof, we were out of there in less than 20 minutes

Tacos were good. The salsa and chips very nice. No tres leche cake tho, bummed
author: Foodlover B.

description: Have to say, I was looking forward to checking this place out for a couple months but always missed out because of the line out the door.  Well tonight I got a seat at the bar after a 20 minute wait.  The waitress came up twice during the hour we were here, I had to flag down a bus boy for a refill on a drink.  The cheese dip was not bad but I have made better with a brick of Velveeta and 2 cans of Rotel, honestly.  When the tacos finally came out after 20 minutes they were all on 1 plate for 2 people.  Overall I was not impressed with the tacos and to add they were extremely overpriced, I mean come on, 4.95 for a little taco?!  Not coming back to this place again, not exactly sure how it gets 4 star reviews.
author: Forrest R.

description:
We visited Tacolicious twice in 2 days...that statement alone signifies what great things this diminutive venue has going for itself.

Fresh, fresh, fresh is how I'd describe the food at Tacoliscious (and divinely organic), and the produce is bought local at the Ferry Building, and it shows.

The grilled Calamari with fava beans was scrumptious, and I never use that word, we actually ordered a second order it was so delicious!!
I've rarely had such tender calamari in my life, and I've had squid dishes from all over the world.

There is a plethora of taco ingredients in which to decide from, but the carnitas and the chicken mole are by far the tastiest and are very moist and tender. Four tacos for $12 is such a steal in the SF Marina district, hell, anywhere for that matter.

Lastly, the service was quick, friendly, and very enthusiastic, too.

This eatery on Chestnut is a must!!! 

P.S. I almost forgot, the desserts are heavenly, as well...we had the flan both visits:
Silky an perfectly sweet describes this heavenly Mexican custard.
author: Kevin W.

description:
This was a tough one for me. All the food I had was great, but the atmosphere and service was not so hot.

I went in just for a bite. I wanted something really comforting (i.e. had cheese on it). I managed to find a seat at the bar, but it was really crowded that Saturday night with many parties waiting for a table and trying to get a drink while they waited.

The bartender seemed annoyed that I wasn't drinking. Get over it. Not everyone drinks and I was heading up to Napa the next day. I didn't need any more alcohol. He begrudgingly took my enchiladas order and gave me some chips and salsa while I waited. The salsa isn't awesome, it has mint in it. Also, the chips I think were a little overcooked. Sadly I ate most of the chips and salsa, not because they were good, but because proximity to food is my biggest weakness. The enchiladas appetizer was really really good. Also, I got to try one of the shrimp cakes which was really good too. 

Overall I thought the atmosphere was really noisy to enjoy a meal with friends. Also, said bartender told the guy next to me who ordered a martini that he could only make him one because it wasn't too busy yet and therefore he had the time. He apparently needed to focus on making margaritas and pouring tequila shots the rest of the night. I found that odd and off putting.

I guess if I were to come back it would be during the day, preferably a weekday.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Just came back from an impromptu super fun evening with friends at Tacolicious. Yes - this place is about the fun!

If you are looking for authentic Mexican food, this is not the place for you. But here what is great about Tacolicious: casual atmosphere where you can eat tacos and listen to fun lively music, awesome cocktails, easy menu( perfect for sharing!), reasonable price, and good tacos.The food is not going to blow your mind, but you will have some very awesome drinks, have some laughs, eat some tacos and call it a great night. Guaranteed. Definitely good times! :-)
author: Simone W.

description:
Tacolicious is the perfect combination of good food and good service.  I have been to Tacolicious a number of times and have tried almost all of the different taco flavors, and I have to say the Carnitas are some of the best in the city.  The food might not be 100% authentic Mexican food but it is 100% gourmet tacos.  One of my summer favorites is when they have the corn with a citrus salt that adds a tangy bite.  

The other side of Tacolicious is their great service.  I recently contacted them to place an order to cater my wife's birthday party for 17 people.  I emailed on Friday night around 6 and within an hour I spoke to their catering manager, Kory, and soon had my order worked out.  When I came in to pick up my order it was hot and ready on time and everyone was helpful in getting it out the door and back to my hungry friends.  They gave me a mountain of chips, large cups of salsa, onions and cilantro.  They pretty much gave me everything we needed to make it a great night.  

If you are in the Marina district and you can get a seat at Tacolicious, come in and you won't leave unhappy or hungry.
author: Matt M.

description:
I always find the Marina to be astonishing.  In my 10 minute walk from my car to Tacolicious I had, no joke, two girls stare me up and down. It was probably because I was not wearing a single item of Lululemon attire, and therefore I stood out.  I rarely venture into this sub-world of San Francisco, and it's always an adventure when I do.

The minute I walked into Tacolicious, the blond hostess gave me a big, welcoming smile and told me she would be right with me. She took my Marina-edge off immediately and for probably the first time in my Marina-ventures, I felt truly welcomed into a restaurant.  I was 30 minutes early to a dinner date with two friends, but the hostess told me to grab a drink and let her know when my friends got here because she would make sure we were at the top of the list. I sat at the bar near the kitchen and did a little work while I waited.

My girlfriends arrived, and within 5 minutes of letting the hostess know we were ready, she came over to update us on the status of our table.  She had us seated soon after, all the while maintaining a very genuine and  friendly demeanor.

We shared the 10 taco plate and the shrimp a la diabla.  Tacos were fresh and yummy, but the shrimp a la diabla was the big hit. The salsas were flavorful and spicy without wreaking havoc on my taste-buds.  Our waitress was friendly and offered the perfect balance of good service with leaving us to our girl-chatter.  I drank beer, my pregnant friend had a delicious lemon, lime and mint drink, and my other friend had the tickle me telmo. Overall, I would say the food was very good.  This is not "knock your socks off" Mexican, but the food is great and the prices are right.

I rarely write reviews, as you can tell from my Yelp history, but I wanted to recognize the hostess. She was genuinely welcoming and sincere.  It made me realize how the attitude of the servers and staff members can really set a tone for diners, and I hope management appreciates this hostess for truly enhancing the experience of their guests.
author: Shayna F.

description:
Tacolicious is absolutely delicious! 

The ceviche was soooo good. My fiancee and I were careful to mind our table manners as we painfully attempted to scoop up every last drop of the sauce with a tortilla chip. 

The tacos were also amazing. I was really impressed that the vegetarian taco was in first place on the menu, usually vegetarian/vegan options are listed shamefully down at the bottom. 

Tacos are served with three sauces ranging from mild to spicy. In addition to the salsa that was already served with the 'waiting for our food-chips". 
Having four different salsa choices was slightly overwhelming but exciting once I wrapped my mind around the different  possibilities of combinations!  (Green salsa mixed with red table salsa was the best)

Cocktails ran a little high in price but was well crafted and balanced in taste. 

We enjoyed the Michelada $7.50
Ingredients: Tecate, lime juice, tapatio, other stuff. 

We guessed at what "other stuff" could possibly be since we want to recreate the happy-hour magic at home. 

We will be back!
author: Jessica N.

description:
I came back this week for lunch and I ordered the Kale Salad. On the menu the Kale salad look like the healthy boring option but I was wrong. The salad was amazing!
It had kale, quinoa, cabbage,apples and carrots. I couldn't tell what the dressing was made out of but it was really light and tasty. I also ordered a mucho gusto from theu drink menu which is pineapple juice, coconut water and tequila. The drink was very light and refreshing, it even came with a little pineapple slice. I can not wait to come back and try more!
author: Adriana M.

description: Great selection of tacos...loved the carnitas and chorizo/potato.  Great drinks too!
author: Fidel M.

description: Just stupendous. Tacos are the way to go. We sampled all of them, and there wasn't a single bad type. Let me restate that: they were legendary. All of them. Meat is flavorful and the tacos combinations are creative--inspiring even. Watch out though, they don't look big but they sit heavy. Four is generally enough for most people I think. Food comes quickly and the tables turnover well. Fun to watch them make it right before your eyes if you get a seat at the chef's counter. Can be a bit hectic on weekends but if you're willing to wait, you won't regret it.
author: David D.

description:
Stick with the namesake.

Beer braised chicken and butternut squash tacos were overflowing. Both with flavor and ingredients. Better than street trucks at a very reasonable $3.50 platter price.

Less enthusiastic for the sides. Rancho Gordo beans and grilled asparagus both lacked memorable flavor and quantity. Lesson came at an expensive ~$6 price.

Scene is packed and energetic. Server seemed to briefly forget us. Felt like he was running through the motions more than anything.

Four stars for the tacos. Two stars for the sides. Can't go wrong with the namesake.
author: Jason B.

description:
Dear "trendy'" SF Mexican Restaurant,

Thanks for unforgettable meal. Between the culturally insensitive "mood lighting" prayer candles, the cluttered, loud setting, and the artwork in the bathroom with the most misogynistic Spanish word possible  scrawled across the middle (on purpose, mind you!), you've given me a night to remember.  Don't worry about that last one, though, I doubt your clientele understands a lick of Spanish.  

Signed, 

Me

P.S. Your tacos are crap.
author: Carlos R.

description: Ugh!  Dirty and I got sick from the food...been in the bathroom since lunch.  Had to wait forever and the lunch manager today was unprofessional at best. Won't go back.  There are too many good places nearby...Pacific Catch next door; Delarosa; Blackwood Grill; Castagna...hell, even Barny's Burgers.
author: Janet R.

description:
Tacolicious. You go here for tacos obviously.

I had the tacos and tortilla soup cause I love to eat. Got the tortilla soup and it had some baller ass avocado in it that added a rich taste to the well seasoned soup. The people working here are nice. I left full and happy.
author: John B.

description:
We used there catering service for a party, and they had nothing to cook the quesadillas on! Oh, and one more thing, they forgot one of the three meats we ordered.
I do not recommend catering anything with them.
author: C B.

description:
+1 on the fratty vibe, however the food is awesome and the server we had was great! She was extremely on top of it, friendly without being pushy/fake, and genuinely seemed to like being there. I was actually blown away about how nice and attentive she was.

Food was great, and the free chips and salsa at the beginning really are a great touch! I usually am a 20-25% tipper, and I gave our server 50%. She really nailed it.
author: V. H.

description: My Kale salad was excellent, but the tacos were extremely greasy. Atmosphere is nice and the restaurant is clean, but the service was lacking. It was a good experience overall, but I doubt I would ever return.
author: Nick A.

description:
This was a great stop for a mid-day snack.  I ordered the Tuna Tostada and a Pina Colada aqua fresca.  Can't lie - I could have skipped the drink.  But the tostada was fantastic.  Simple, fresh, a little squeeze of lime, and it was perfect treat.  Also - while I was waiting, i was served chips & salsa.  No idea why Papalote's salsa is getting all the attention.  This place's was fantastic

I ate at the bar as I was flying solo.  Great service, friendly staff, and energetic without being over the top.  As often as I am up in the Marina (very very rarely), I will definitely stop back in and try something else.
author: Lilly N.

description:
The Good: Tacos and queso. The food really is good. 

The Bad:  I have eaten here dozens of times and one thing is consistent: TERRIBLE SERVICE.  The hostess has forgotten to add my name to the wait list several times. You will typically sit for at least 10 (but sometimes as many as 20) minutes before anyone stops by the table.  Once the food comes, you'll need to ask the bar backs and bussers for condiments or anything additional you need at the table, because you wont see your waitress agin ubless you flag her down.  Forget about ordering rounds of drinks in any timely fashion.  Its like this early or late, busy or not, no matter who is working....clearly a cultural thing.

But what can I say? The food is worth the headache. Well, it was, until the price per taco climbed to 5 bucks.  C'mon guys, it's still a taco.
author: Clint S.

description:
I was psyched to try these guys and ended up disappointed with the outcome.

It's clear from the start that this is taco land for cool kids... aka it's too loud to have a conversation and a tecate dressed up with some standard michelada fixings suddenly costs $8. After tasting a pretty good cross-section of the menu, pretty much everything was underseasoned and came with a trio of side salsas to spread on there yourself. I think this is a missed opportunity, as there are some wildly different tacos on this menu that could have otherwise been vessels for equally flavorful and unique salsas. We're paying $4 for a taco, dudes, aim higher than side sauces!

The service was pretty lousy from start to finish. The bartender was as douche-y as the clientele and our waiter was a nice enough guy but only came to our table twice: to take our order and to deliver the check. A runner delivered the food. 

There's some good to be found in this place, though: their chips & salsa is STELLAR. In fact, it is the sole reason I'm giving this two stars instead of one star. It also gives me hope that their guac is good, though at $9 (really guys?) I can't help but shake my head.
author: Bradley M.

description: The food is good.  The service is fast.  The drinks are great.  But I have to give Tacolicious three stars for people who work there and for the people who frequent this location.  The staff wasn't friendly.  And the joint was plagued with big-time-operator frat boys who don't know that they've been out of college for 10 years.
author: Hilary H.

description:
I love tacos. (So why don't you marry them?) 

I also love booze. (So why don't you marry it?) 

And I love to sit and watch people being people (So why don't you...?) 

This bustling joint is busy yet welcoming, a little cramped and crowded, yet somehow, comfortable. The staff was fantastic from the cheerful, efficient waitress to the attentive kitchen staff. 

The tacos were delicious. Someone in the kitchen took just enough creative liberties to make things interesting but not so much that they deviated from the taco genre entirely. The salsa was some of the best I've ever had. 

The cocktail list is extensive and will likely keep me busy for a while. The nopal was tart and sweet and a lovely shade of bright pink. 

The flan was smooth perfection. The only reason that this review lacks 4 stars is that I could not have coffee with dessert. They don't have any. At all. Bummer.

If you can swing it, sit outside so you can watch the people being people.  It's so much better than TV.
author: Victoria T.

description: super over-rated. the food is good but the service is pretty bad. I live in the area so this isn't a marina-bashing. it's a poor service bashing. It's chaos. yes it's trendy and that may be part of the shtick but it's not that hard to be polite and attentive, especially when there are open tables and the place isn't packed. i have been there a few times and thought maybe the new location would be different, but nope. Really wish the Grove was still there.
author: K C.

description:
I expected adequate from Tacolicious. Adequate with a bit of an attitude. The Marina doesn't strike me as a hotbed of Mexican culinary achievement by demographics alone.

I was still surprised despite a midday crowd on a beautiful Sunday - I assumed it was simply a case of location, location, location. These are actually excellent tacos. Based on the pleasing bar aesthetics and the aforementioned location I was expecting minuscule tacos and foolishly ordered four ($14) for lunch on top of the complimentary chips and on the sweet side salsa (likely intended to prompt more drink orders.)

Rock cod, short rib, chorizo and the house special were all succulent and proper cilantro, onion and meat tacos with a side of salsas across the spiciness spectrum including a slightly unexpected yellow variant - and like most hot sauce, the oddest looking one is often the strongest. (It wasn't lethal by any means but still definitely higher than standard tourist level hot.)

Coming to Tacolicious purely to cure a hangover would both be unfair to the food and foolhardy given the wide range of alcoholic drinks and bar environment unless one subscribes to the endless intoxication solution - but it is definitely worth the trip.
author: Sean C.

description: Can someone tell me why the meats are all flavorless? I get there's salsa but wtf is up with the unseasoned meat?
author: Lee S.

description:
I came to this place while visiting my friend in the Marina.  We went at 430 pm on the weekend and there was already a pretty big crowd.  We were able to get seats at the bar to eat.  The wait staff was great pretty attentive considering the amount of the people eating there.  

I had the carnitas and fish tacos.  The fish tacos can either be fried or grilled and, of course, I opted for fried.  The fish taco was ok, definitely not as good as Nick's Tacos.   The carnitas on the other hand was pretty tasty.  The tacos are one for $3.95, 4 for $14 or 10 for $33.  They were mini sized tacos, so I thought the value was average.  

The guacamole was $8.95 and was pretty natural tasting, i.e. really just avocados and not much else.  Again, it was good, but I wasn't sure if it was worth the money.  My friends had the margaritas ($12) and again they said were ok.  We did get free chips and salsa, and actually that was pretty good.  The chips were thicker and lightly salted and the salsa had a nice kick to it.  

It did get pretty crowded as it got closer to 5pm and subsequently a bit pushier.  I had someone put there bag on my stool while I was till sitting on it and basically resting her bag on my back. (The stool was as close to the bar as it could get, the seat was just bigger than my bottom).  The lady didn't even apologize when I looked at her.  In addition someone finished their can of beer and put their arm between our conversation to put their trash on the bar.  I understand they are busy and crowded, but couldn't you at least put your trash in between groups rather than in the middle of people talking?

Overall for food, I think there are better places to get value.  However, I think this place is pretty good for a night out drinking with your friends, hanging out with the yuppie crowd and meeting new people.
author: Mel L.

description:
Tacolicious, I love you. Why must you always be WAY too crowded? Busiest nights are Friday and Saturday. I came here, party of 3, and the wait was almost 2 hours on a Saturday night at 7pm. 

It was probably worth it though, as we were seated with some delicious chips and salsa, and we ordered guacamole and a pitcher of sangria right off the bat. Our waitress told us the pitchers are usually about 4 drinks large. We got 6 drinks outta this one (not sure if we just got lucky, or maybe they're larger than she thought).

The salsa and guac were both very fresh, and the chips were excellent too. My friends ordered a variety of tacos, and I ordered the beef taquitos. The tacos looked pretty delicious, however, I preferred my 4 taquitos smothered in guacamole and salsa. Every table gets a salsa dish with 3 salsa samplings when your meal comes. Mild, Medium, and Hot. All fantastic!

I'll try out the tacos next time I'm here-- which will most likely be for lunch on a weekend with [hopefully] a lot less wait time.

An odd fact about the place: there's Jesus candles everywhere. Why? I don't know. Jesus is ubiquitous, especially in Tacolicious.

A Tip: tried to plan a part of 15-20 guests here for a Saturday night. They told me they could possibly do that, but the table would not be guaranteed and to call the day of. If you're planning a large party here, have it be on a weeknight, or don't expect it to work out.
author: Ashley D.

description: Long wait for table (busy) but food was good. I got 4 tacos, butternut squash=kinda spicy and I prefer meat, rock cod=tasty, chicken mole=my favorite, short ribs=juicy and good.
author: Christina H.

description:
Wow! So many reviews. I love me some Mexican food. I can't imagine living without the stuff. And, Tacolicious does it right. 

I won't bore you with what so many others have written. They just have solid, fairly priced (by San Fran standards) tacos. We also had a squid dish with salsa Veracruzana. It was really tangy and delicious. 

Can't wait to go back. Take heed, this place gets packed! And, no reservations taken. Now, how can I smuggle out some of that delicious salsa that comes with the chips?!
author: Dusty B.

description:
Came in the other night, and sat at the bar after a long day at the office. I was greeted very promptly by Pat and he quickly quenched my thirst with a glass of Negro Modelo, my favorite. He also made great conversation and was able to make me feel really welcome. He's one of the guys that should be in more often, as he truly delivered great customer service. I ordered a few tacos (fish, veggie, and short rib) and they were excellent, just as always. It's good to see that not only was the food great, but the service I received was also very good.

Thanks
author: Alex G.

description:
Hooray for delicious tacos and humane meat options (edit, I missed the e on humane before, that must have looked funny :)

The tacos were large so even though they seem expensive at nearly $4 a pop, I'd say 1-2 is enough if you eat some chips with them (which are free).

Great service and atmosphere. They also had lost of tasty alcoholic and non alco drinks.

My only reason for the 4 star is that although I liked the 3 salsa selection that came with the tacos, I found each one to be a bit too gourmet. I would have liked at least one salsa to be a bit more traditional as even the basic table salsa was a verde with mint (?) in it.
author: Christopher Steven O.

description: Tacolicious is very good - but really you should stick to the tacos.  The salsas are great, the tacos are very creative and I have not had one that was bad.  Definitely better than the standard mexican fare.  It is however expensive.  Especially for tacos.  And the few times I have tried other things they were average.  Staff is super super nice.  Service can get slow because they get busy, but people are helpful to the extent you can flag a server.  I like the mission location with Mosto next door - to be honest, my favorite tacos are the Nopales tacos at Mosto.
author: David G.

description:
Taco Disappoint!

My boyfriend and I ordered one of every taco just to try them out, and we were starving so it sounded like a fun dinner.

The tacos were OK.. the pork one was probably the best. The filet and fish were probably the worst! 

 The best part about this place was the salsa... the salsa was amazing!!
author: Sara D.

description: Great Taco's of the week, as of now my favorite it the Cheese Steak Taco! I also love the xi acai margarita and now they have the xi acai frozen margarita's which are really great with a salted rim. Everything there is really good, and you know your at a great place when the chips and salsa are amazing. Thanks so much!
author: Robert N.

description: The most delicious tacos I've ever had! There's normally a line for tables but the bar is first come first serve. Once you sit down, you get free chips and salsa. I'm sad I haven't tried any of their drinks yet, but they have a full bar and a lot of people come here for afternoon cocktails. You can get 4 tacos for $14, and 2 tacos are quite filling after all those chips. I tried the vegetarian taco (butternut squash, poblano peppers, chicories, spicy pepitas) and the fried local rock cod taco. The tacos come with a cute tray of 3 different salsas, all pretty authentically potent in flavor. The vegetarian taco was so delicious, a fresh mix of cooked veggies, and the rock cod is fried to perfection, crunchy on the outside while moist and soft on the inside. Can't wait to come back to try the margaritas :)
author: Leslie C.

description: Good food and fun atmosphere! Margaritas were standard and service was good as it took a while to get seated but they still honored happy hour prices. Guacamole was creamy but lacked flavor (lime/tomato). Tacos were generally good, especially when paired with the mild/medium/hot sauces that were provided with the order.
author: Sarah M.

description: Amazing.  What else can be said?  Great food, amazing ambiance, good people.  All around great place.
author: kevin p.

description:
So we ventured up to the Marina tonight (otherwise known as L.A. North) and were laughed out of Zushi Puzzle for daring to show up without a reservation. I remembered that Tacolicious had been on my bookmarks list, so we gave it a shot. It was a pretty quick wait for a Friday night--about 15-20 minutes. We were seated toward the front of the restaurant in a teeny tiny table with a banquet on one side and chair on the other. I kind of felt like I was eating in an airplane seat the whole time. 

We ordered the squid veracruz, which was really good, as well as a bunch of tacos and some sides. The chips and salsa were good, although nothing spectacular or out of the ordinary. We each had a veggie taco, the grilled rock cod, and the chicken mole. The veggie ended up being my favorite, followed by the chicken mole. The fish was actually bland and tasteless and ended up being my least favorite. The drunken beans, on the other hand, were overly salty--way too salty for my taste. The rice was OK. 

I also got a honey citrus drink, which I didn't like very much, but drank the whole thing. I think I'm just not a huge fan of that much citrus, but for someone who likes that it would probably be great. My own honey was excited to get a Mexican bottle of coke (yay for no high fructose corn syrup!). 

I'm anxious to try the Mission Tacolicious as I'm sure it will be a much different vibe. The Marina was super loud--so loud that we couldn't really talk to each other across the table because we couldn't hear each other surrounded by young 20-something L.A. North folks. You know, like oh my god crazy can you believe it's like that loud oh my god did she really say thaaaaaaat?
author: Amy B.

description: Came here for drinks and tacos before a Saturday night out with my boyfriend. Cool vibes with a nice young crowd. Ordered a couple of drinks (margarita fresca and their drink of the week called peachy keen) both were great and I like how they put fresh fruit in them too. Ordered 4 tacos to split between us because we weren't to hungry and it was perfect! Great presentation and good location. Probably will have to wait a bit but worth it for sure!
author: Lauren M.

description:
Fun and lively spot especially for dinner and drinks. The guacamole is solid - fresh and tangy and the tacos are delicious. I am a vegetarian but I think the veggie option is really good and always order a couple. 

The margaritas are good and pretty strong! It gets pretty rocking on Friday and Saturday nights - the music gets loud and everyone is enjoying themselves.

It can be a long wait which is not ideal but other than that, the food and atmosphere is fun and fresh.
author: Julia W.

description: Bland-tasting tacos that were overpriced -- we were surprised at the quality of the food since the place was hopping on a Wednesday night. We ordered 6 tacos to share. They came double wrapped, and the toppings (from short rib to cod) were ok, but nothing stood out. The soft taco shells were really thick and bland, we could barely get ourselves to finish them. The bill ended up close to $50 for just the 6 tacos and a beer. Likely never to go back again.
author: Tara T.

description: I was surprised to see a dessert being served up by Tacolicious at this weekend's Fallfest event. Intrigued, I reached out for a small dish of apple and raisin empanada with a mini drizzle of whipped cream. This is a cool, Latin-hip twist on apple turnover. Very tasty. I hope it'll be included on the regular menu 'cos I'd stop by and order it over and over.
author: Joanna T.

description: If you are in the mood for a quick bite and you happen to be passing by I would stop at Tacolicious, otherwise I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. The nachos and guacamole where something I would pass on but the tacos were not bad. The taco shells weren't amazing but the fillings were pretty decent. The kale salad I had was very average. The place itself is trying to be trendy, for example they have quite a long cocktail list. We sat on the patio on a sunny day so that was a bonus.
author: Kels E.

description:
Possibly the BEST "modern Mexican" food I've had! (i put that in quotes, as I am not quite sure the "modern Mexican" is a valid attribute)!

But regardless, everything is great in this restaurant. 

To start, the chips and salsa are perfect. I try not to eat many chips in Mexican restaurants, but these are awesome! There is sea salt all over the chips, which brings out the flavor, but they are not too salty. The salsa is really flavorful as well, and very different from other places. 

Once you order your tacos, they bring these three salsas, in a cool and modern tray and plates. Avocado mild, medium spiced tomato, and spicy tomatillo / jalapeno. These sauces are also great with the chips. 

As for the tacos,  they  are made with soft shells, and fresh grilled / cooked ingredients. In my opinion, the braised beef is by far the best. Bold beef flavor, tender and delicious. Another great option is the Chicken in Mole sauce. Satisfies the sweet and salty cravings. 

And couldn't leave behind the ahi tuna appetizer.  Must try! 

On a sunny day, just take one of the few tables outside, grab your margarita or draft beer, and enjoy all their food items.

One warning, though. The waits are long... so be prepared to wait , especially if you want one of those few,  sought-after outdoor tables. 

Enjoy your meal!
author: Michel A.

description:
One of the most crowded restaurants I've ever been to, serving some of the most delicious tacos and margaritas around. Our group ordered a ton of habaneros margaritas (YUMM!) and tacos (YUMM YUMM - and 4 for $14!) for dinner. My favs: short rib, beer braised and veggie. Their guacamole was super good, as well as the chips. 

The service was pretty good - not the best - but the delicious meal keeps them at 5 stars in my book. 

Oh, and the patio is dog friendly ;)
author: Lacey H.

description: Kids serve of fish tacos is nothing short of insulting.  One small taco with a small piece of deep fried fish. Adult serve was cold and taco was too thick and chewy. Bonitas across the street is far better.
author: Sarah C.

description: Came here after an awesome soul cycling session with some friends. Tuna tostadas was my fave! The salsa and chips were delish. Small portions but good flavor. Not much of a wine selection. Place is cool, casual and easy breezy. Our server was super nice and attentive. I would come back again.
author: Lan E.

description:
Wholly Guacamole!  Chips and salsa were complimentary, but $40 total (including tax and tips) for 1 bowl of guacamole, 3 tacos, and 1 mojito is still way overpriced!

The tacos for $3 to $3.50 were tasty.  But, similar tacos from my usual taco trucks are $1.50 max, 1/2 the price, just as tasty, and in some cases tastier!  

The price for the guacamole was way over the top, nearly $8 for a moderate sized bowl!  Again, tasty, but probably no better than the Chevy's made-to-order guacamole.

Mojito was too sour.  The bar accidentally made an extra one, so our waitress offered it to us for free, so that was nice.  Actually, the service (though a tad slow) was good considering how busy it was for a Sunday night.  When we arrived, an inside table for 2 was a 45 minute wait, while an outside table was no wait.  Duh, we sat outside.
author: Christina L.

description:
I'm pretty convinced that it's near impossible to find a bad meal in SF, and Tacolicious takes that belief, wraps it in a crispy shell and fills it with sweet Taco deliciousness, i.e., tacoliciousness. Don't be fooled by its corny appelation (which would better befit a sassy Mexican burlesque dancer, no?), Tacolicious is truly tacolicious. My dining companion and I showed up for a late dinner on a school night and the place was stuffed like a gordita. After a brisk 20-minute jaunt around the Marina -- which included an obligatory stop at Walgreens -- we circled back and snagged a spot on the patio waiting just for us.

First things first, we ordered up a pitcher of the margarita picante. It was tart and refreshing, with just the slightest kick. Me likey. But I didn't venture into a place called Tacolicious just to down tequila (though I totally would). 

Front and centre on the menu was the promise of seven different taco types, including a veggie squash and corn, chorizo-potato, braised beef ribs, and filet mignon. It took more than a bit of restraint not to order ten tacos for $29. I opted for four ($12), and they filled me right up. The traditional carnitas had to be my favourite; they were loaded with flavour, and God damn it's making me salivate just thinking about it. I'd totally to return to try the tacos I have til now untasted. Tacolicious, indeed.

Obligatory Title Pun: TACO my wife, please.

Menu Readability: Single pager in a respectable typeface.

Need to mention: Try the fried plantains.

What this place teaches me about myself: If I lived in the USA I'd probably visit Walgreens every day. What is it about that place?
author: Vivek S.

description: Great small plates and probably the best michelada I have ever had (switch out Tecate for Victoria). The Queso Fries for brunch are WHAT'S UP!
author: Chris B.

description:
FYI review for drinks/apps only

Do yourself a favor and go to Tacolicious ASAP - there's a reason why it's bumping all the time.

We visited T-lish while I was in town visiting a friend, we pulled up seats at the bar and quickly browsed the drink menu. The servers are all super friendly and gave us some good recommendations. As we sat there we probably also devoured almost three baskets of their chips & salsa. The salsa is clearly homemade and has a nice kick to it.

A lot of people at the bar we're eating the street style tacos and clearly seemed to enjoy it. I like how they have some seasonal ingredients in their tacos and have cool varieties. 

Rumor has it they will be opening up a second location which is great news for all taco lovers. I will definitely be back next time I'm in SF, thanks guys :)
author: Deena D.

description:
Tacolicious is one of the best eateries in the Marina. They serve excellent guajilo braised beef short rib tacos, and their salsa is actually hot! ESPN is always on the screen and the decor is a bit interesting. Here you'll spot several religious candles above the tables on the left, and a big print of a Tapatio bottle hanging next to the bar on the right. 

I wouldn't suggest bringing a big group here, however, because space is very limited. Come here for the tacos and drinks. It's a bit pricy for tacos, but their tacos are extremely good. You won't find these tacos anywhere else. Try this place on a weekday. Actually, come here on a Saturday, when the Marina is swarming with bridge and tunnelers! I want you to have a bad experience. I want this place all to myself.
author: Misfit M.

description:
1. I love the food, it is always super tasty and the salsa is great. The Margarita Picante is also fantastic, I think they put crack in there along with the spicy vinegar. 

2. Go on weekdays because with the weekend comes douchetasticness. 

3. #2 wouldn't be an issue except that the bartenders on multiple occasions have catered to drunk-as-hell guys/girls/whatever instead of folks who have already been there for a while and/or are conducting themselves in a civil and grown up matter. This evening was no different so we walked down the street to Mamacitas to enjoy some drinks with grown ups.
author: Christopher K.

description:
First things first

The Service: The guy who light weight helped out was Enrique. He wasn't the nicest or inviting but he wasn't rude either. Hey it's 5:41 towards the end of the day. No excuse but just maybe he's tired. Who knows so they loose a star for that. Especially being as though everybody else was extremely nice and helpful. 

The food: My enchiladas were actually okay. I even had them cold but I still liked the overall taste. I think my cheese should have been melted more but I was satisfied. My meat wasn't over salted like others have suggested. 

The Salsa: you can tell it's homemade with a twist of lime. Actually more lime flavor then anything but it was really good.  

It seems like a cool place to maybe chill after work with some drinks and a quick bite. They are a bit on the pricier side but I've seen worse. Will I come back? Yes
author: Sophie P.

description:
the taqueria the marina deserves. 

shit floor staff are just phoning it in. and why wouldn't they? when the mediocre food is three times as expensive as it should be the tips are flowing like wine.  perhaps the sting of a $5 microscopic taco could be eased with a $10 house margarita? sorry, try again. it was like a tumbler of pine-sol® on ice with a rim dusted in failure.

five stars for the kitchen staff who are busting ass to crank out the disappointing menu, sorry tacolicious is so shitriffic!

JCTSFR: 10+
author: W G.

description:
I am a local living in the Marina and have tried this place a couple of times. Each time it was so disappointing. The food is ok but there are much better places to eat in the Marina and the City. The service each time was terrible! I ordered a salad I have had before that does not say on the menu that it is spicy. I couldn't eat it it was so HOT. Pointed it out to the server and he said he would let the cooks know - that's it. No apology, no nothing. They seem to care less. 
They must rely on tourist because locals could not possibly tolerate this place.
Note: Last time I tried the place a fellow diner pointed out the owner to me. Not sure if it was the owner but boy I noticed he was getting great service!
author: Nora M.

description:
Except for the "Marina-Frat" feel (guy yelling "whooo...whooo" like an owl for a good 5 minutes). I love Tacolicious. I brought my parents here, they loved the food - it was their favorite place they ate while visiting. I went traveling for 1 month in Mexico, and had to eat here as soon as I got back.

The meat is slow cooked/ marinated/ juicey/ delicious! The salsa is unique, they use tomato mint? (I think that's what the server told me) and it's mind blowing. I love Tacolicious! expect to wait, because it's a popular joint.
author: Jenna P.

description:
Stopped in for lunch - my first time here.
Got a table right away. Good service. Food was amazing!! Had the beef tacos and the shrimp cakes. No domestic beer so this bud light drinker had to go without unfortunately. Will definitely eat here again!
author: Jessa W.

description:
I am not giving Tacolicious one star because of their food (it's quite good), but, rather because I had the single most disgusting and bizarre food experience of my life there.

A bartender who is slightly overweight and has a beard (I later found out his name may be Jeremy) was behaving extremely strangely. I'm not sure what my girlfriend and I did to provoke him, but, he literally spat in his hand and then shook my hand (you can imagine my shock when I realized what was going on). He then proceeded to throw change at my girlfriend. 

I don't know if he was drunk or on drugs but this is unacceptable behavior for any food services employee.  

To be fair to Tacolicious, I saw the manager, Leilan, who was very polite and seemed to be almost as outraged as I was. 

I used to be a regular customer and I may be again one day: that is assuming I never see this bartender again! Gross!
author: Zachary F.

description:
This is one of my most favorite place...except tacolicious and I are in a fight since my painful hangover from this past Sunday :D. Beware of tequila shots....It could have been my fault but I have to blame someone right?

Great tacos, fun atmosphere, casual, tv's & yummmyness. 

My recommendation: If you're out on a Sunday, or on a midweek date night or just having a night out with the girls..go here! You're lucky to get a spot by the window!
author: Heather H.

description: Come for the drinks, stay for the food.  Great bartenders with tons of tequila options.  Apparently the tips for jesus guy comes here all the time!
author: James D.

description: Best tacos in SF. Great decor. Friendly and attentive staff. Really wish they offered wine glasses with stems (hint, hint)!
author: Hanna E.

description: Everything except hostess/wanna be DJ/ not sure what she does except seem to get in every workers way. Food awesome service from servers and bartenders great. Even the kitchen staffed smiled this lady that works there hung out behind the bar in way of the people actually working then proceeded to the kitchen hovered over the kitchen staff picking off food whenever she felt like it. Then after the Warriors game 5 she started playing music after 2 minutes of a song she would change it. Seriously great place, but do your staff and your business a favor and get rid of this lady not sure what position she actually hold seems too young to be a manager. I will come back I've been here many times and always enjoyed the food and service!
author: Sarah M.

description: Pretty average tacos, very expensive at 5 dollars each. Salsa with chips decent but kinda minty? Would not come back but service was decent.
author: Brandon S.

description: My wife and I went here for dinner over the weekend.  The place was packed but it didn't take long for us to get a seat.  We really liked the ambiance of the place being a nice trendy place.  We both ordered drinks and tried several different tacos on the menu and they all were excellent.  Of course, the filet mignon tacos were to die for.  The servers were all very courteous and helpful.  We definitely will return as we had a great experience and highly recommend this place.
author: Rob M.

description: Fish taco was outstanding, bit of a wait but worth it. Would eat there again for sure. Tacos are a good size, ordered 20 between 4 and it was too much for us.
author: Matt C.

description:
Please stop coming here.  Go to Taco Bell--there's one on Lombard.  

I love these tacos but I hate having to get through the throngs of people to have these delectable dishes.  Did I mention that the sauces are killer too?
author: Anon M.

description:
I had this on my list to try out and so glad I did. Came here after the Camarena Taco Truck launch party. The chef from Tacolicious was providing the food, which was scrumptious. me and the wife along with our best friends tasted the tacos and beans and rice.
