Immediately we knew that we needed to go here. Finished getting RIPPED at the party. Headed down to Tacolicious, the place was busy, and the food smelled good. we were seated at the bar ordered about 20 tacos: carnitas, rock-cod, braised short rib. They were even better here.  Hands down, best in da city
The chips and salsa was On Point. And, yes they keep em coming. As we were eating the chef recognizes us from the party and was stoked that we came down. 
The atmosphere and vibe was great, location is great. parking will be based on what time you come, hard to find or easy to find. 

Will definitely visit again and again.   Thanks Camarena and M-Unit for the night....
author: Nic C.

description: This is a 3.5 star review. It's a fancy taco, not a street taco, not what i'm really used to, but it tasted great. I came here on a warm afternoon and I felt like I was in college on spring break. It was loud, booze flowing, and I thought I got transported to hermosa beach in LA for spring break, or maybe cabo, whatever. Ambiance for me sucked! I tried to order 2 tacos (short rib braised taco, and the carnitas) and it was hard to get the bartenders attention to order my tacos TO GO! Other than the ambiance and service, the food was great, i'm not really into this type of taco, but if i was in the area, i might just stop by.
author: Mia S.

description:
Drunken Beans and the Carnitas Tacos \m/

Awesome service too
author: Thömas F.

description: 4 tacos for $14 on Chestnut St! No wonder this is the busiest place on the block. Also, super hipster place. And the tacos are delicious! Also tried the cheese dip, super cheesy as promised. Very friendly service. Not much to look at on the dessert menu though...
author: Nikita K.

description:
I wish I could like this place more, I really do. It's always packed and every time I have to wonder if people are ordering something that I haven't tried.

I've never ordered something that makes me go, wow tacolicious is amazing and totally worth the wait for a table-- and I've been here maybe 6 times. 

It isn't real Mexican food and doesn't fulfill my cravings for Mexican. It's more like gourmet Mexican that lacks that authentic flavor. The service is amazing though so I have to give them that.
author: Cesie A.

description: Food good but not worth the RUDE and INEPT service. Of our 4 orders, they got 3 of them wrong (and in several ways). When we said something (very politely) they were so rude about it. Then they took 20 minutes to fix them (did not have to be remade) so the 4th person's food was cold.
author: Nancy P.

description:
I came here today for a quick bite to eat. I got the chorizo and potato taco and the cod fish taco. Topped it off with the nopal cocktail and oh my a perfect meal indeed!

I highly recommend the nopal drink, it is a concoction of prickly pear and tequila- yum!

I knocked off a star because the service was slow and it was hard to get their attention. One of the cooks had to inform the bartender that I was ready to order because he was too busy chatting it up with some other patrons.
author: Surge C.

description:
Pros:
+ Outdoor seating, which is always good for dog owners
+ The tacos, overall, are pretty good

Cons:
- I'm just not impressed with the salsa here
author: Captain B.

description:
Yay for awesome bartenders named Dan!!! 

The food and drinks here are great, the service is great, the atmosphere is great. If you ask me it doesn't get much...greater!

I love coming in and plopping down at the bar. Forget the table if you can; you'll make some new friends, get a little hammered, and throughly enjoy your day or night, which ever you prefer.
author: Julia N.

description:
I came here with three friends to try our their "famous" taco menu.  It was a busy Thursday night. Oops, mistake.  Oh well, we waited for ..mmm 20minutes, and we got a table right up front near the entrance.  In my humble opinion, the tacos were worth the wait (but only for the one time try).  I would and have been back, but only when I know it'll be less busy.

Ambiance: Loud, colorful and robust.  Then again, that's WHY you come here.  You may have to speak extra loud to one another on Tuesdays... Get it?  Taco Tuesdays?  TIP: GO FOR A GOOD TIME.  2nd TIP:  GO EARLY.

Service:  The people here are friendly and will take your order in full anticipation of questions from you.  On Thursday night, they were particularly busy (in part because of Happy Hour), so I could tell that they were stressed.  They still took the time to answer our questions about which tacos to have without sense of irritation.

Food:  VERY GOOD.  I digress that the majority of my favoritism for this place wasn't because of the ambiance or the service, but mainly the food.  If you want to order from this place, but don't want to deal with loud, cramped surroundings, try ordering ahead and taking it to go (if they let you, I don't know, I haven't tried).  There's something to be said, however, about their dipping sauces, which I'm not sure are available "to-go."  I couldn't stop trying them.  Yummooo

Be sure to try the Tuna Tostadas.  hell yes!  Also, be sure to try the spicy pork ribs - they are out of this world.
author: Bryan H.

description: This is my go to for out of town friends who want a delicious meal and good, unpretentious vibes. 10 tacos (the short rib!) and a few margs & you're good to go. Just look at the pictures ... that is all.
author: Anne A.

description: Nice casual place to grab dinner with seating inside & out. I got a mix of tacos all of which I enjoyed with the short rib and chicken mole being my fave. Fish tacos were great as well. But most of al I enjoyed the kale salad with  cabbage, quinoa, roasted butternut squash, apples, persimmon, radish, pickled carrots, cider-cumin vinaigrette, toasted almonds. Great place for happy hour, girls night out, or chill date night.
author: Flavia C.

description:
I love tacos, so when I saw this place has so many reviews with 4 star average, I was excited to try it! 

We made it just as happy hour started, so that was good because they offered $5 margaritas and sangrias. 

I ordered the sweet plantains, and my friend ordered some guacamole. They were both really delicious! We then followed with an order of 4 tacos. They were brought out pretty quickly, and after two we couldn't eat any more! 

They were good, yes but at $14 for four tacos, that is not that great. Tacos should not be more than $2 when they're little tacos like that. I'm from southern California where tacos are on every street corner and they are cheap and delicious. 

These tacos were good, but not amazing and not worth what I ended up paying for them.
author: Tabatha V.

description: I'll start by saying that the food here was delicious! However, the low rating is because of the rest of the experience. We had a bit of a wait for a table, and the hostess asked if we would mind sitting outside... However, she failed to mention that their heaters outside were broken. They made up with that by bringing blankets but it would've been nice to have known about that before deciding to eat outside. Then, there was no silverware, but we had to ask multiple times for our server to bring forks, while our food was getting cold.
author: Jaclyn A.

description: Tacolicious is such a great place. The tuna tostada is so good, all the tacos especially the filet mig on are exceptional. One of my favorite lunch spots to go to on a weekend.
author: Liz K.

description:
Came in on a Thursday night, it wasn't too busy. I do agree with other yelpers regarding the music - it is pretty loud in there, made it a tad bit hard to have a conversation across the table. I have no complaints about the service though, the staff was pretty attentive.

I ordered a fish taco and chicken en mole coronado. The fish taco was just OK to me. The chicken taco was hands down the best chicken taco I've ever had. I was doubtful at first because I've never tried mole, but it tasted amazing!
author: Nikki C.

description:
My favorite casual restaurant in San Francisco.  They have great, no expensive food, and they have some of the most tasty, creative mixed drink options in the city.  I love the relaxed vibe.  The only things I don't like are the wait for tables and the loud ambient sound level.

Fabulous.
author: Barry G.

description:
I love living in the Marina and Tacolicious is a big part of why. (Ok, that's going a big far, but hey, reviews should sound dramatic and cool no?).

The restaurant itself is well designed with a simple yet cool look. Keeping it just "low" enough to not make sure you don't forget you're going to have Mexican food.

Music and ambiance are great and both the bar and tables are great for dining.

Last but not least, the food.
Starting with the "no questions asked" amazing chips and salsa which sets the right mood, to the vary menu which is split between the great appetizers / plates to the Taco's which are all awesome. (Taco of the week is rarely not better then the regulars which is quite impressive).

Go here, I hear they open more locations, good call.
author: Assaf B.

description:
It was a beautiful day for a Taco or 4.  The 49ers were in the Championship game and Tacolicious was hoppin'.  Surprisingly, tacolicous turned out to be a great place to watch the game despite the crowd.  They were busy but responsive and kept chips and salsa and refills coming all game long.  And their tacos were incredible with a great selection of those soft homemade, tortilla treats filled with spicy meats of various origins.  Filet Mignon taco, yes...3 sets of hot sauces? Two out of three were great!  The very tasty meal solved my recently developed affection for cilantro. 

All and all, it made for a really fun afternoon in SF.  Good food, affordable, and filling.
author: Jeff G.

description:
Hubby & I were driving by and found an open metered parking space - in the Marina??
Right in front of Tacolicious. We needed a quick meal for lunch so we went right in and squeezed ourselves into the tight table for 2, right next to 5 others.  Let's put it this way, to get into that seat, you have to slide the table of the other customers over if you are larger than 100 lbs.  A hipster place with a couple of moms dragging along their toddlers for lunch.

We didn't think much of the melon/jicama salad, about $9. It was too spicy for hubby, sprinkled with chili powder.  The 4 tacos for $13 was flavorful especially the carnitas.  I didn't like my chicken mole and the short rib was "ok". It came with 3 types of sauce to top your soft tacos, including a bland tomatillo sauce. Hubby got a side of the rice, $5,  was really good.  It had this spicy green sauce on top, again.. too spicy hot for him. 

Our waitress was very nice and had these cute glasses on which made her look like Anne Hathaway to me.  They do give you a lge carafe of water and if you're not a fan of moderately hot/spicy food, you will need it.  We drank that whole carafe.  The complimentary chips with salsa was very good and you can ask for chip refills.

I'd come back for the carnitas tacos and may consider trying some of the others but when you can get tacos for under $2 in the MIssion dist or even off the taco trucks, it might not be worth the struggle to hunt for metered parking spaces at $3/hr in the Marina.
author: Ry T.

description:
Hmm...a 2.5 at best.
We were ready for a super early dinner...this is, mind you, WAY before 5pm!
There was a bit of a wait...ok, we can handle that.
The food came swiftly...but it was not what we expected...
It was salty...too salty (probably cooked for the alcohol imbibing crowd)...
We are disappointed after our last visit...the music was WAY to loud for us...

Oh well...I suppose we are not their usual crowd... :(
author: Barb L.

description:
Great tacos and guacamole! We have ordered tacos from Tacolicious for my office once a week for the past 8 or 9 months, and I never get tired of them.

The carnitas tacos are my personal favorite, followed closely by the short rib and chicken tacos.

The online ordering can be a pain sometimes, but if you send them an email they will get you squared away quickly. Any problems we've ever had (which probably come mostly from ordering so many tacos every week) have always been addressed and resolved by the management.

Tacolicious is definitely my go-to place for tacos in San Francisco.
author: Patrick H.

description: I come here like once a week - I always seem to be craving filet mignon tacos and a cadillac margarita. The service is usually not that great unless Mary is your server! She is great. When you come here you have to be prepared to wait a while and sit extremely close to the people at the table next to you - I am pretty used to it so it doesn't bother me but I can see how some people would be totally put off by this. I only like the filet mignon tacos so that's usually all I get. I noticed that they don't serve the filet mignon tacos at the Mission location so I usually stick to the Marina.
author: Allie M.

description: I AM MAKING AN ATTEMPT TO BE NICE.  I am a huge fan of South American food, so I thought i would try this place.  Location is cool.  It wasn't overly busy, the service was on par with maybe a day 1 McDonald's trainee, maybe..plus rude.  As far as the food goes, I think they got so busy making it eclectic, trendy and chic, they over thought 1 basic thing...flavor of any kind...it got the carnitas, and brisket tacos.  They were flavorless...I gave a 1 star rating because the app made me.
author: Adam S.

description:
Long wait, mediocre salsa - good butternut squash filling for the tacos. Bar none Tacolicious is a trendy Marina taco joint with okay food and a crowded atmosphere. My peeve being the thirty minute+  wait and the unfried taco shells. Although the option was appreciated as many taquerias rarely have non meat taco options. Still when not in the kitchen, my search continues for the best veggie taco. 

Tacolicious would be good for drinks and late night snacks. Although my dining guest said only one out of three tacos he consumed were delicious. He commented that one tasted heavily of plum sauce which was off putting for him. My taco was good but limp and cold. I'm tired of seeing these unfried or even ungrilled tortillas on my plate. It just doesn't do my craving justice when in need of a taco fix...
author: Honey B.

description:
This place is a bit over rated.  If you are going for the scene and the girls in spandex then its 5 star all day, if you are going for the tacos its a 3. I had the short rib, carnitas, chicken and something else tacos.  The short rib tacos were dripping with fat and grease.  My plate was COVERED in a pool of the orangeish grease after.  The carnitas were good, but nothing you haven't had before.  The chicken and the other one we got I don't even remember so they couldn't have been that good or bad. 

All that being said I would and will still go back, but its not going to be a once a week type of place.
author: Vince C.

description: Came in looking for lunch around 1pm. Although business was booming I found a place at the bar and was quickly taken care of. I had a great meal for a really good price.
author: Vincent P.

description: Tacolicious in the Marina the best! I always order the tuna tostada, triple dip caso and wash it down with a Paloma or mucho gusto. It's so good I get midnight cravings for this place, but I live in Walnut Creek. Woof!
author: Joanna G.

description:
Arrived for dinner on a Saturday night and Tacolicious was packed, as were many other restaurants in the lively Marina neighborhood.  No reservations available so take your chances.  The hostess advised us that the wait for 2 was 1 hour - whether we get a table or obtain bar seating. (1/2 of the bar in front of the kitchen is reserved, the other 1/2 is open seating)

We opted to wait the hour even though we were both famished.  While we waited, I sipped on a Margarita Picante. LOVED IT!  The red chili pepper and vinegar flavors were obvious and delicious!  This margarita had a nice kick.  We noticed a few chairs were open at the bar and the hostess told us that 1 of the parties were being moved to a table.  She said we could have the bar seating, or continue waiting for a table.  We snagged the bar seats right away.  We had perfect view of the baseball game on TV and couldn't wait to eat.  The only downside of bar seating, at night, is that it gets a bit dark.  Only the other 1/2 of the bar, near the kitchen, was well lit and out of traffic from the customers standing around trying to order drinks.  

We ordered chili con queso (mike's cheese dip) and tacos (carnitas and braised beef short rib).  The cheese dip hit the spot.  I love cheese so I would've preferred a bigger bowl.  Between 2 people it's certainly enough but any more than 2 would be too little.  My favorite amongst the 2 tacos was the braised beef short rib.  Extremely juicy and flavorful.  My hubby, on the other hand, preferred the carnitas.  They were both delicious.

I ordered a 2nd margarita during dinner known as the Margarita Fresca.  The description of pomegranate and citrus enticed me.  However, it tasted like a regular margarita.  It had some hint of orange flavor but it wasn't as satisfying as the Margarita Picante.

Tacolicious got busier throughout the evening and it felt very cramped where we were seated.  We really only came here for the tacos so there wasn't much need to stay once we were done eating.  The marina crowd trickled in continuously, as expected on a Saturday evening.
author: Nikki C.

description: We had 6 tacos: 4 braised short rib, 1 shot-n-a-beer chicken, and one chicks mole that were delish. Refried beans were tasty, as were the plantains. Margaritas were way overpriced, $12. Not worth it.
author: Jon H.

description:
Wow, color me surprised, as Tacolicious kind-of blew my mind yesterday!

After spending a sun drenched day shirtless (I know, I know - pump the brakes, ladies!) along the waters of the Marina, the only thing that could possibly make my impending sunburn worth the itchy forthcoming rash was an ice cold margarita.

I'm no hater, but there are plenty of things I'd rather do than fraternize in the Marina on a busy weekend. I've found some of my previous restaurant outings to be sub-par, the folks that hob-nob around the community aren't exactly my peoples, and usually, you won't leave the neighborhood without dropping $60 or $70 on an outing that should probably cost you no more than $30. Obviously, this is an arguable figure... but it's just my experience.

I don't think I'm alone in almost writing this place off as a tourist trap with a name like Tacolicious. I mean, would you even think about eating at a joint called "Pizzaville" or "Sushi-Rama" that happens to be situated in an area of town where many, many non-locals decide to push around their baby strollers and break in the awesome new Crocs they swooped at a Walgreens drug store? Probably not... and a taco shop in the Marina with a goofy moniker and an assembly line of fake tans and Prada glasses doesn't make it much more appealing either. But, when in Rome, do as the Romans do, right?

In a classic example of looking beyond the book cover before judging its contents, Tacolicious fully delivered. Got seats at the bar without hesitation (even though there was a wait to find a table), they had an amazing bowl of guacamole that they literally made from scratch per request (no freezers or day-old batches), and the margaritas were insane! I'd never go as far as to say they're better than Tommy's, but they just might be a close 2nd or 3rd, for sure! 

Whether you're looking for something sweet or spicy, they can provide a libation to suit your needs. Of the two I had a chance to knock down, the Pasión margarita was my favorite. Had just three ingredients - habanero-infused tequila, passion fruit and lime - but hot damn, was that sucker tasty! 

What I also really liked was their sense of humor on the menu. Clearly, they know they've got a good thing on their hands, but they don't take themselves too seriously. For instance, the umbrella of N/A beverages is described as "drinks for drivers, kids, and recovering bartenders." To poke fun at some of the pretentiousness of this city's restaurant scene, to expound on their chili con queso dip, they explain, "sustainable? no. local? nope. delicious? yep!" How great is that?

So glad I was able to take my Marina blinders off for a moment to enjoy the greatness that is Tacolicious. By no means does it compete with the authentic grind you'll find at some of the Mission taquerias, but it's a fun spot for great upscale Mexican food and some amazing drinks... especially on one of the most amazingly beautiful days this city has seen in ages. 

¡Arriba!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I will definitely come back here next time I'm in the Marina! Great atmosphere and probably some of the best tacos I've ever had! Between a group of four we split a large kale salad and the 10 for $33 taco combo plate. We tried the chicken, carnitas, and short rib and it was much too difficult to pick a favorite. We were worried we wouldn't have enough food for all of us but we all left feeling stuffed. The staff was so friendly and they brought us a basket of chips and guacamole on the house!

You can't go wrong with the Margarita de la casa. Tacolicious is definitely the place to be on a Friday night so it took us a while to get in, but it was well worth the wait! I'm excited to try some of their other locations in San Francisco.
author: Emily O.

description:
I had previously had Tacolicious tacos at the Ferry Building and really enjoyed them. I finally had the opportunity to dine at the restaurant last night and must say, I'm a huge fan. 

The tacos come in a wide variety of meaty flavors and ways to order them: 1 for $3.50, 4 for $12, 10 for $29. I went with four: fried rock cod, shot and a beer braised chicken, carnitas and the braised short rib. All four were good but my two favorites were definitely the chicken and the short rib. We also started the meal with some queso fresco (I love me a vat of melted cheese) which was the perfect compliment to the hot chips and addicting homemade salsa.

Service was fantastic - our waitress was super sweet (she hooked us up with a free dessert) and cute (call me!) And while we were quoted a 25 minute wait, we were seated in less than 10 minutes at probably the best table in the house (the big booth in the back)

I've found my new 'go to' fancy pants Mexican spot in the city. I can't wait to return to try some of the Chupitos and work my way through the rest of the menu.
author: phil h.

description:
This place was packed. But thank goodness it was a chilly night so it wasn't as crowded as normal. We waited for about 15 minutes for a table even though it was a little before 9.

I was pleasantly surprised by Tacolicious. My friend recommended the Albacore tuna tostada (also because it is on the 7x7 must eats) and it was really good! The tuna was fresh, thinly sliced on top of a crisp tortilla with fried leeks, avocados and chipotle mayo - it was light and delicious. 

I would definitely go back to try their other tacos.

This place is extremely noisy. The music is loud and then everyone is shouting to talk over the music.
author: Terry C.

description: I really did not expect to find such delicious, authentic tasting Mexican food in The Marina. I have been there twice in four days and have managed to order every single type of taco on their menu. The rock cod is definitely my favorite, but the chicken mole, carnitas, and chorizo are delicious as well. Try the extra hot yellow salsa if you enjoy spicy food. They have a great atmosphere, friendly bartenders, and quick service. Not to mention, $10 deal for a taco, tecate, and tequila is pretty awesome as well!
author: Kevin C.

description: Very disappointing. If you put your name down for a table, you can expect to sit at the bar despite their text message saying your table is ready. Then they just say "wait here in the middle of the place until maybe an actual table opens up "um, like ya, the bar takes like reservations too." Thanks! One more place i don't have to try in SF!
author: Chris C.

description:
I debated whether or not I thought this was better, but then I realized it was the people I was with that made this a positive experience. 

I came here on a Monday night with two friends... one from out of town. The staff was friendly and polite (sorry, I think this should be an expectation in the service industry, not something to be overly excited about... if you are the latter, then you should reconsider where you eat...). 

Between the three of us, we decided to get the Tuna Tostada that everyone raves about and ten tacos to split  - three carnitas, three short rib, three fried cod, and one veggie (with the squash, nopales, peppers, chard, blah blah). 

The tuna tostata is truly a winner. It was just delicious. However, the only taco I would recommend is the fried cod. The short ribs were greasy and flavorless (and not even that tender!), and I couldn't really tell the difference with the carnitas (no, I promise I didn't mess up and have two of the same thing). The textures were a bit different, but really, not so great. 

The takeaway: just dishes with fish. 

It's really hard to justify the high price tag for tacos, even if it is the Marina. 

And it's really loud inside.
author: Ingrid C.

description:
I'm lovin' Tacolicious...so much, in fact, that I'm contemplating on becoming a regular. Where does one sign up for that?

Tacolicious is not your average everyday taqueria; it's much different than the ones that line Mission & Valencia Streets. The decor is trendy & modern. Your street tacos are served to you on white ceramic-ware more appropriate for upscale, fine dining restaurants. I don't think I've ever experienced Mexican food this way before. 

The bf & I ordered fried plantains, 4 for $12 tacos (fried cod, carnitas, short rib & chicken), a beverage called Moss (pineapple heavy with hints of lemonade & passionfruit) & for dessert, Laiola's pan con chocolate.

Everything was a version of something I've tried before, but with a twist, so it tasted refreshing & brand new to my palate. The fried plantains came with a cumin crema, the chicken taco definitely tasted "drunken" & the short ribs were so tasty & had a comfort food-like quality in it's tenderness. The bf enjoyed the batter on the cod & gave the carnitas a thumbs up. Their salsas were spicy & complimented the over-stuffed filling in each taco nicely. I think our taste buds were very, very happy today.

Our dessert was interesting...I couldn't decide if I liked it or loved it. Our squeaky clean, empty plate implied I probably loved the dark chocolate mousse sprinkled with sea salt, drizzled with olive oil & accompanied  by a side of crusty toasted baguette slices. Creative, simple and a little odd-it just works so well. 

Service was impeccable. I will definitely be returning for my taco fix.

Total: $36 (not including tip.)

P.S. To Miss Patty P.--me & my taste buds thank you for your detailed review of the restaurant that took Laiola's place! You made me want to try it & I am a happier, albeit heavier, person for it!
author: Fancypants X.

description:
I have heard people talk about how they knew their significant other was "the one."  "When you know, you just know."  And now I understand.

If the Albacore Tuna Tostada was a person, I would marry it.    When I gaze down at my plate I think, "I want to spend the rest of my life with you."  Actually I may have whispered it out loud.  But that is neither here nor there!  The point is I am in love with the crispy leeks and chipotle mayo... the creamy goodness of the albacore and avocado... and it wouldn't be perfection without the crunchiness of the tostada and the acidity of fresh squeezed lime.  I actually get a little sad when I only have a bite or two left.  I don't want it to end!

But let's be real.  I gotta save room for my filet mignon taco!
author: Katie J.

description: Food was amazing, drinks were amazing and service was amazing! I loved the ambiance. Very modern Mexican. Food was super authentic for a non "hole in the wall" restaurant. A must try!
author: Jessica W.

description:
This place definitely lived up to the hype and it was indeed "licious." The tortilla chips are by far some of the best I've ever had and the homemade salsa can't be beat. Between two of us we had guac, the platter of 4 tacos, two sides, and some ever-so-lovely margaritas. I don't know if I stuffed myself with chips at the beginning, or it was a sufficient amount of food, but sadly I was too full to try one of their homemade choco tacos (I'm already planning my next visit just for this).

It can be a bit of a wait, but it's really not too bad. Just go to the bar and have one of the amazing margaritas, time wil fly!
author: Staci L.

description: Great tacos and margaritas! Good vibe.
author: Christine B.

description:
Come here for the scene... but definitely not for the tacos!
(or margaritas) 

I am a huge fan of fish tacos.  So needless to say I jumped at the opportunity to order them here.  The key to a great fish taco is perfectly cooked fish with a light and very crispy batter.  How Tacolicious managed to overcook the fish while leaving the batter more than soggy, i don't know! But I can't think of a bigger mistake than that when it comes to fish tacos.  

The next taco that I ordered was the short rib taco.  And while the flavor was OK the meat was actually VERY dry!

I believe I also ordered the carnitas,  however I can't remember much about them other than bland and soggy.

As for the margaritas.... WAY too sweet with all that agave syrup (a slight step up from corn syrup).

All this being said the people watching is great and most of my friends go here regularly even with all my ranting...
author: Megan M.

description: Three delicious words: Filet Mignon Taco.  Plus, a well-stocked bar.  Pair these two things together and you have absolute perfection.
author: Christy M.

description:
Oh tacolicious, how I missed your Marina happy hour and taco Tuesdays. It feel great to be reunited with your tasty food and even better sangria. I try so hard not to eat a ton of red meat (that's what she said??) but I always leave room for your yummy short rib tacos. 

A regular spot my roommate and I frequent, Tacolicious is never dull. Always a great crowd and a wonderful place to grab a drink with a few friends to catch up. Wonderful starting point for a night out in the area, or grab a pitcher and stay for hours. The staff is friendly and eager to serve. Love, love, love!
author: Meredith M.

description: The Passion Margarita and Veggie tacos are the first things I want when I go home to SF.  NYC mexican food has nothing on this place.  Come in a small group, expect a wait, and ask for the salsa that comes with the tacos first.
author: Kate K.

description:
Depending on your mood, this hip and happenin' restaurant has stools at the bar for watching sports, seats inside for enjoying a tasty meal, and tables outside for enjoying the outdoors.  Try ordering 4 tacos for $12 or 10 tacos for $29.  Once you have one taco for $3.50, you'll find it hard to resist trying their assortment of tacos, ranging from short rib to fried local rock cod to carnitas.  They also have special tacos each week.  Another highlight is the trio of salsas that go well with all the tacos depending on your taste buds.

Service is fast, friendly, and helpful.  The ambiance is clean and simple with a sports bar feel.  Parking can be tough on the street, but it's worth checking it out.  Beware of long lines at peak hours during lunch and dinner.
author: Jenny L.

description: I can't believe it's taken me so long to try out Tacolicious. I came here for happy hour on Saturday night and it was sooo good. Ordered margaritas, brussel spouts and tacos (chicken and carnitas) and everything was on point. They give you chips and salsa, and you get a tray of delicious sauces to put on the tacos. 10/10 will be coming back.
author: Emma W.

description:
Ok, so after the second time here, I'm a believer. Great service, delicious tacos, good beer, overall great experience.

For the 2 of us we ordered the 4 plate of tacos. 2 Ling Cod, 1 carnitas, and 1 beef short rib. The beef short rib and a Ling Cod were mine, and the beef clearly won out (the bf liked his carnitas but would definitely go for the beef next time). 

The tacos are filling, there is a good portion of meat. After 2 of these and the yummy (high quality) chips and salsa we were both full. Shared a negro modelo and made for the perfect early dinner on a Friday night. I'd definitely go back after this experience.
author: Krista S.

description:
My 5th review of Tacolicious! 
I keep coming back, so I gotta crow about this place. 
This time, instead of my usual Valencia St, we went to the Marina on a Friday. Not usually a recipe for a good time, but though they were PACKED, with many waiting, we got seated in around 10 minutes.
The food - I ordered short rib, chorizo and carnitas tacos - were better than the already excellent Valencia location. Don't know what they do differently, and maybe it's just our palates on a different night or whatever, but every flavor just popped like crazy. 
The margaritas however, though still great, were NOT as good as Valencia St. The Mission version is smoother and does not taste like it has sweet and sour included.
Still...it Tacolicious This place rules.
author: Jubilee D.

description:
Simply love the food from here!
I must say, they are quite packed during lunch and dinner! The best is getting items to-go!
It is not cheap but I think it is totally worth every penny!!! I can simply eat that over and over again...
Too bad I don't live in SF.
author: Adrian R.

description:
02.13.10

I should preface this by saying that I really didn't like Laiola.  Tacolicious didn't do much to change the decor, but the vibe is totally different.  I'm glad.  I mean, I can still see the seats where the creepy guy at the bar stared at us the entire dinner without saying a word.  In fact, I probably sat where the creepy guy sat at the bar!

Anyways, Tacolicious' customer service is through the roof super.  There are only certain items (denoted by the * on the menu) that they serve until midnight.  We stumble in at 11:45 and all I wanted was the tuna tostada (#31 on the 7x7 list) [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hcGIDuoE0Hn3-XKuICP0mg?select=bGLRGdeAWwHHf_3U_2gy9Q].  The guy next to me in the bar stool, after hearing me whine, got up and said he'd make it for me.  SCORE!

We also had the fish tacos [http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hcGIDuoE0Hn3-XKuICP0mg?select=klfnjqsPAG6QCXGhCbx4bA], $12 for four.  A bit pricey for tacos, yes, but would you rather have a drink or four tacos?!

The chips and salsa were excellent to boot.
author: Jenny L.

description: I've only been to the one in MIssion but the one in the Marina was super quick and accommodating for our party of five. (Pro tip: If you're ordering a bunch of tacos, just write them all down and give to server.) I had the cod and veggie tacos which were delish, and my friends were quite pleased with the chicken, ribs, chorizo and filet mignot (add $3 for that.) It closes at midnight, I believe, since they were flashing the lights and even took away our unfinished drinks but service was good.
author: Xteethx B.

description:
I was very impressed with the quantity and quality of the cod tacos.  I ordered the standard set of four not realizing that the fillets were going to be hanging out of the tacos.  They served me a whole bowl of salsa with the complimentary tortilla chips, then gave me three other varieties of savory salsas to season my tacos.  

I was very impressed with the upscale decor with a modest pricetag too.  Open window in the front on Chestnut street made it a very breezy and pleasant place for lunch.
author: Christopher A.

description:
Happen to walk by this cool little location. Lots of seating inside with outside seating as well. The taco choices are plentiful and full of flavor.  Only issue we had were the beans had a weird aftertaste. 
Staff is pleasant and the restaurant has a good vibe. 
Can't wait to go back!
author: Quinn S.

description: Wow!  Best tacos I've ever had! Casual place, a plate of 4 tacos feeds two.  We loved the Carnitas tacos and the beef brisket.  The chicken mole taco was tasty, too.  They we generous with the succulent, tasty meat fillings, and served up 3 sauces to go with.  I didn't try them; I loved the delicious flavor as it was.
author: Jamie M.

description:
It's simple. No it's not a food truck, yes it's still hella good.

The price might be higher than your standard taco, but the quality of food is worth it. Get the tuna tostada (it melts in your mouth), the carnitas taco, the shot and a beer pork taco, and the carne asada. 

The alcohol is also great and compliments the food perfectly.

*Note: If you eat at the bar, stay clear of the guy making the fresh lime juice. You WILL get squirted on.
author: Jorge H.

description: Pretty darn good taco! Had some on the go, because it was full in the middle of the day. The taste was great. I would say a you can call it a fancy taco bar!
author: Filip A.

description: By far the worst dining experience I've had in a very long time!! After looking forward to it all week, I came with my boyfriend here Memorial Day weekend. The service was so terrible, I doubt that we will ever go back. Having to flag down our waiter to get our order taken after 15 minutes of waiting, we were greeted with rolled eyes. Not only that, our server had a cut in his hand, with blood spewing everywhere. After taking our order, as though he was doing us a favor, we still waited without water or drinks. After half an hour we finally flagged down the manager, who too seemed annoyed. At that point we decided to leave and walked down the street to Sabrosa, who also were busy, but still were able to provide good service. Delicious food, good ambiance, and great vibe! If you want good Mexican cuisine in SF try Sabrosa! Steer clear of tacolicious, you will be lucky to get a drink!
author: Mon J.

description:
Delicious tacos.
Cute and classic seating area and deco -- good spot for a date.
The drinks are good too--I recommend the jasmine rice milk drink.
author: Alexa X.

description:
This place is well named. So many great choices here I don't know where to begin, but the menu's description of the queso says it all:

 "Local? Nope. Sustainable? Nope. Delicious? You bet."
author: Dan B.

description:
Good in theory but not in execution, at least for large groups. We came on a Thursday night and were told we had a 45min-1hr wait, but it turned out being a 2hr wait. A couple things they do don't make sense for groups. First, they serve all tacos ordered on a big platter. A lot of the tacos look the same so it was tough to figure out whose was whose. Also, they price the tacos differently depending in intervals on how many you order which is a huge pain when you're trying to split up the check 4 ways.

But the food itself - the chips and salsa were on point. The veggie taco was delicious. The chicken and braised beef were ok but too straightforward- felt like I could easily recreate it in my crockpot. The fried fish taco was NOT for me. Too much batter and not enough fish, and it was difficult to eat in the flour tortilla. I wound up picking at it with a fork.
author: Sara G.

description:
Do you LOVE endless baskets of freshly fried chips accompanied by delicious salsas? How about sidewalk seating with a carafe of sangria for $22? Do you LOVE a menu with all sorts of yummy offerings? If so, then you're sure to think that Tacolicious is Delicious.

Mike, the GM, was a gem. He seated us outdoors per our request, and we were able to enjoy a leisurely Sunday afternoon lunch. My gal pal and I shared the sangria, which was about 6 good sized glasses, the 4 taco platter (2 cod, 2 short rib), and about 3 baskets of chips. 

The sangria got my buzz going and I liked the fruit in it. The chips were fresh and delicious--I couldn't stop eating them. I really liked the salsa that came with them, and the green salsa that came for the tacos. The cod taco wasn't my favorite. It had a funny smoky taste and I couldn't really taste the fish. The short rib was yummy. A little greasy, but still a nice hunk of meat. wrapped in two soft tortillas. 

Sunday Funday.
author: Misha F.

description:
Pros:
- I like their battered fish taco, as well as their chicken mole and their beef short rib
- I love that they pack you complimentary chips and salsa even if you only ordered 1 taco to-go.
- their tostada is pricey ($11) but well worth it to try at least once.

Cons:
- The only other chicken taco on the menu (I forgot what it was called) tasted a little dry though.
- a little disappointed that they did not serve Pozole (pork and hominy in chile broth) at this location and only at the other location though.
author: Wendy T.

description:
I come here all the time.  Fun great spot with very consistent food and great prices!  I love the free chips and salsa they serve!  The carnitas tacos are a go to and their guacamole is addicting!  They have a great cocktails and margaritas.  I am also a huge fan of the taco+tequila+tecate special for $10!!!  Can't beat that. 

Also, the wait is usually much shorter than they quote!
author: Hannah M.

description:
A friend and I came here for lunch today and each ordered the pasión cocktail to drink with one cod taco and one "taco of the week" - chicken in a red sauce with cotija cheese and avocado. My friend also requested a side of guacamole (which never came) and I the rice. 

The chicken was exceptional, although the cod was lacking pizzazz and needed the help of the delicious, accompanying salsas. The rice I could do without. 

All in all - each of us paid roughly $23.
author: Tina A.

description:
Great place for a bite! Very nice and friendly waitresses!
If I lived in San Fran this will probably a place to eat once in a month. 
It is busy and maybe you will have to wait some minutes, but hey chat a little bit and time flies
author: An K.

description:
Probably one of the better places to people watch in the Marina (if you're into landscaping for bros, dog walkers, and runners). 

The menu has hit the PERFECT market price point where you'll complain, but still give them your money. The tuna tostada is no slouch, ask for an extra glass of water. 

TAKE AWAYS: 
- Good luck finding parking. 
- Lovely spot for quick dates. 
- Portions are somewhat humble, so set expectations likewise. 

Pro-tip: 
You can binge on their chips and salsa to complement the balanced Mexican breakfast.
author: Abel L.

description:
*definite stereotypical marina girl/guy vibe but in an ok way
*food is solid, get the filet taco
*service was dingy but authentic, great tequila list
author: Dan S.

description:
i came into the place in such a good mood with over 10 of my friends. got drinks at the bar. . dancing politely waiting for our table...

and the terrible hostess (damnit I forgot her name) u cant miss her. brunette medium length hair with a stink on her face..

so rude. ruined our whole experience there. rudely told us to wait for our table when all we did was ask how much longer. and when she finally sits us.. she throws the menu on the table and walks away. where the menu is sprawled out on our table....wtf

told the manager who was so nice and gave us a round of some fruity shots.....but then goes over to the hostess and starts laughing and hugging her. 

um....


ya foods ok.. but who cares at this point.
author: Susie L.

description: Food was good at best, not great. However the service was awful. I sat at the bar and the bartender seemed annoyed that I asked him for a menu (when all he was doing prior was standing around) I'm sorry... Isn't that a standard? The busser who brought out chips was more friendly than the bartender. I ordered food and a cocktail. Food was standard, he seemed annoyed by my choice of drink, bloody Mary. I have to say it was easily one of the most disgusting bloody Mary's I've ever had. The mix was thick and creamy and the garnish seemed strange. It's not his fault since I could see the mix was pre-made, I would just greatly suggest against it. Overall, I don't think I'll be coming back.  The food was good, but when its 18$ for four (4) tacos, a kind and friendly wait staff would be nice to everyone... Not just the pretty blonde girl sitting next to me.
author: Zak S.

description:
Absolutely great tacos - had the Traditional Carnitas, Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib
and the Chicken En Mole Colorado and all were wonderful.  They are served with 3 wonderful sauces.  Even the chips and salsa were spectacular.  Our waitstaff were great - we were outside and they turned on the heaters and then off and then on again as different members of the group needed or did not need them.  Great tacos, great salsa and chips and great sauces - best tacos I have had in a long time.
author: Dave L.

description:
This place is pretty damn good and a lot of fun.  
The tacos are filling and delicious.  Lot's of flavor and great salsa and sauces (nothing very spicy).  
It get's packed so put your name in, get a drink at one of the bars close by, before you know it your up for Tacoliciousness.
author: Robert S.

description: This place has great tacos but terrible service. Every time we go there the servers are rude and they take forever to take our order. Fun place to eat on a Friday night or Taco Tuesday. Despite poor customer service, I keep going back because of the food
author: Lauren G.

description: I finally went to Tacolicious at the Ferry Building Farmers Market a few weeks ago.  Their tacos were really tasty.  I'm kind of wondering why I never went here when I worked in the FiDi.  I ordered their Guajillo-braised beef short rib and shot-and-a-beer braised chicken.  They may be street tacos, but they were loaded.  I was so full.  Very tasty tacos.  If I ever come back to the Ferry Building for a weekend, I'm gonna stop by here again.
author: Rodney H.

description:
Amazingly  juicy carnitas! Actually.. all of the meats they use are very well-flavored and juicy! Whatever they're doing to cook their meats, the other Mexican restaurants need to start copying! 

Now, if only their tacos weren't so damn expensive... $3 each for a taco just sounds absurd. And yet, I ordered 10 (TO SHARE! Not all for myself.. I promise!)
author: Kazu O.

description: I love Tacolicious and their food, it's actually a very good place. But I can't resist to give one star because of one ****** there. He is a bartender and he is bad with a ton of people. I use Postmates and all my courriers are complaining to pick up food there. And as a customer he is not nice at all. That's the worst Tacolicious location in SF because of him. I'm still wondering why he is working there if he doesn't like people.
author: Sebastien T.

description: Slightly pricey for tacos, but good quality and delicious. Had the shrimp taco special and the home-made chorizo taco. Margarita Fresca was very tasty, too.
author: Stella H.

description:
Tacos are delicious and very reasonably priced. ($3.95, 4-$14, 10-$33) 
Margarita picante is great and $33 for a pitcher
Service is great and easy to get a table later in the evening.
Good music and noise isn't too much..
author: Paul P.

description: Absolutely the worst service I have seen in a long time. My gf and I went in on memorial day weekend on a Sunday and waited 30 mins for the bartender to even pour our drinks. The waiter was ignoring us and he even had a cut on his hand that was bleeding. We love this place but advise people to be cautious of who is serving and when to go.
author: Joe S.

description:
We went for happy hour.  Our waitress was NOT happy.  Service sucked.  We wanted to gulp our drinks and leave.
I have eaten at the other location and it was much more fun.  Bummer.
author: Kristin Y.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for awhile.  Every time we drive by it's always packed with people having a great time.  We finally got to go on a sunny Saturday afternoon for lunch.  We wanted to sit outside and the hostess was very nice about having us wait for an open table.  I was glad to hear the chips & salsa were free... I hate when Mexican places charge for them.  We ordered the braised short rib tacos and the fried sweet plantains.  We both LOVED the tacos... The meat just melted in your month and had sooo much flavor. I also ordered a margarita which was perfect for sitting outside with the yummy chips & salsa.  

We will definitely be back!!!!!!
author: Carlos Q.

description: This place is so great! The atmosphere is very upbeat and perfect for a fun lunch with the girls. They have out of this world carnitas tacos and fresh to order guacamole. They offer free chips and salsa when you first come in which I recommend you devour because they are so tasty! The more tacos you buy the better the deal! I recommend coming in with a small group so you can get a taste of their many amazing food options: refried beans with cotija cheese and the marina girl salad are some of many options that are delicious! Service is friendly and speedy! Keep up the great work!
author: Cindy G.

description:
Came here for lunch one day, sat outside on a sunny day. Staff was quick, friendly and knowledgable. I had one of there vegetarian tacos with butternut squash and peppers and then I tried the fish taco option, which was the local rock cod. Both were delicious and great. Complimentary chips and salsa.

I've previously had one of there tequila drinks at there mission location, but I think they serve it here too. Its the Paśion with passion fruit and habanero tequila, so good!
author: Carlynn A.

description:
It was ok. I didn't grasp what all the hype was about. The grilled veggie tacos were very greasy. The amazing veggies were lost. The grilled cod was semi-tasteless. The chips were served cold. The guc was pretty deelish and so was the tickle 
Me telmo margarita. 

I wouldn't really go back. It wasn't bad but it didn't make a statement.
author: Parichehr M.

description:
We had high hopes after reading reviews.  
This is the lowdown:

3 Stars for the tacos, we ordered 10 tacos for $33 to try all the flavors offered.
The only one we would not order again is the fried fish taco, bland.

1 Star for the drinks, although full of flavor, no booze!  After 2 drinks at $12 ea.  
I would usually get a good little buzz, but NADA! And that was before food! 

If ever again, I would come back for Happy Hour (must sit at bar) & hopefully pay 1/2 the price for the TRUE value of this $70 meal.
author: Laroo L.

description:
Not as delicious as the name makes it sound, but not a bad spot for tacos in a trendy atmosphere in the marina. The place is a bit small, but the layout is the same as when it used to be Laiola.

Meat is well marinated and piled high, but may be a little too much meat compared to the skimpy taco. Everything else in the tacos are a bit bland. They offer 3 salsas - Mild, Chipotle Medium, and Habanero. Habanero is spicy!

- Braised Beef Taco: best out of all of them
- Spicy Braised Pork Taco: taco of the week was pretty good & tasty
- Carnitas Taco: okay
- Veggie Taco: asparagus ok
- Chicken Taco: ok
- Filet Mignon Taco: not worth extra $3, a bit dry and no flavor
- Ceviche: skimpy and not that good
author: Linda C.

description:
WARNING: you WILL order the beef short rib tacos and you WILL fall in love with them! (They are to die for)

I give 5 stars for the food - but it always kills me when I have to take off a star for the mediocre service. I live in the Marina and always defend the "stuck up" reputation it gets - but this isn't the first time that I have had waitress/hostess with a bad attitude in the Marina and it justifies why people often do not like to come to our neighborhood. And to top it off she brought the rest of our partys food and forgot about my order - I had to remind her that I had in fact ordered something. 

To end on a good note, I still highly recommend this place and will continue to go there for the AMAZING beef short rib tacos :)
author: Jaclynn F.

description: Tacolicious is fabulous -- great margaritas, guac, and tacos. It's a good place to go with a small group, because you can order the taco platter and split down the middle. The atmosphere is fun!
author: Lauren L.

description: good food. great service. amazing ticket times. drinks are good nice variety and well poured. sometimes there is a small wait time but they will allow you to leave and walk around and then they will text you when your table is ready. they are many bars and places to shop or explore while waiting. the only location i  like to go to
author: Alonzo T.

description:
The food was average.. and I typically love mexican. Good selection, but it sounded and looked better than it tasted. We loaded up the tacos with sauces to get some flavor. We tried the chicken, carnitas and fish. They were all seemingly flavorless without lots of salsa on top. 

The outdoor seating was nice. Probably the best part about the restaurant.
author: Mina E.

description: Love the food and service. Everyone who works here is the best! Carnitas Tacos are simply the best!
author: Alison M.

description:
My mouth is salivating as I'm writing this entry hahaha...

Came here a little before noon--the place is small, and by the time we got there the place was pretty packed...the host greeted us and had us seated right away...when he showed us our table, I kindly asked if we could just eat outside...I asked because I didn't feel comfortable sitting too close the people that were already eating--I mean it was like hella close--hardly any elbow room, and I'm prettty sure I wouldn't be able to have a decent convo with the bf without having 6 different people listening to it (not that there's anything personal worth talking about in front of them, but still haha)...anyway, so the guy was kind enough to give us a table outside...I didn't mind people-watching anyway...it was a bit breezy out, but the air felt good nonetheless...

Our waitress attended to us immediately...and handed us the menu...I wanted to try the taco of the week, but it was $3.95 for just one taco (take in mind these are street-style tacos, so they aren't huge...and paying almost 4 bux for one is just an effin' waste)...I asked her if I could get 4 of those for 9 bux, but I was pretty sure it wasn't an option since there wasn't any fine print that said I could...o well...

So I ordered four of the beef short rib and my bf four of the traditional carnitas. While waiting for our food, one of the servers came out with chips and salsa. I've had better chips and salsa, but I still enjoyed stuffing my face with em haha...the chips weren't oily, and had just the right amount of sea salt on them...salsa was good, but I would have liked it to have a bit of a kick to it...

So...the server comes over with a couple of plates of tacos, and says,"Alright so I got 10 tacos here." The guy sets it on our table, and my bf and I were like...uhh...we didn't order 10...the guy looks at the tacos and counts it, and says,"Sorry, I mean 8...4 of the carnitas, 4 of the short rib." Lol...the tacos also came with 3 sides of different sauces...I feel so ashamed for not knowing the names of the three sauces, but what I can tell you is that they were green, yellow, and red-brownish (the green tasted a bit like guacomole, not sure about the yellow, and the red-brownish one tasted like the salsa)

Food experience was great!! The flavor of the beef short rib was soooo good...omg...so flavorful, the meat was tender, not too juicy,greasy,or fatty. Bf's carnitas were also delicious...the meat could have used a little more pulling/shredding though...some of the meat were left in chunks that's why haha...
the tacos were soft and yummy...the tacos definately taste FRESH!

Despite the price of the tacos, I definately enjoyed eating here...I'll be sure to come back here the next time around....
author: Zerrilyn P.

description:
Just got back from having lunch at T-lish, it is my go-to spot!. There is usually a wait at dinner time, but trust me it is ALWAYS worth it. 

Here is what to get:

- queso
- semi-traditional refried beans
- ahi tuna tostada 
- carnitas tacos
- chicken mole tacos 

Done deal.
author: Julie O.

description:
Good food  good prices . Eat outside because it's pretty loud inside .
Had the passion fruit frozen margaritas ... amazing ..they have some Habernero pepper in . It that has a really spicy kick.
Great for a fun casual meal .
author: leslie f.

description:
Absolutely love this place.

The seating is more bar seats than actual tables, but the bar seating has a realy large table area.

Tacos are awesome!!!
Make sure to get the guac because its awesome and its good to add to the tacos as well. Simply delicious. Perfect.

The decor is cool too.

A little noisy, but is lively and great.

Too bad its in the Marina.
author: Ash R.

description:
Excellent Food!

We ordered: 2 orange agua frescas, 1 chili con queso, 1 order of fried sweet plantains, 4 veg tacos, 1 side of rice-o-licious, 1 side of rancho gordo (black) beans, 1 dessert - the pan con chocolate

We paid: $69 with tip

Came here with my wife and the 2 of us were clearly stuffed at the end

I must say the fried sweet plantains and the pan con chocolate are signature items, the kind that are so good you recommend the restaurant just for that

The tacos were quite excellent too

I love their chips/salsa because the chips are not typically oily and the salsa was tasty without being spicy

They also have a great habanero salsa/sauce which is quite amazing!

Great service too

This place felt a lot like its popular because of their alcohol too (their tequila menu is HUGE). I don't drink so can't recommend it but I must say the food is really good!

Why not 5 stars? Well, not sure, maybe I wanted some more veggie food variety? (I am not demanding burritos or enchiladas, but maybe more veggie taco options?)

Be warned: After a year of living in the area, we finally ate here because they gave us a table immediately. Usually they quote like 45-60 mins of wait which basically meant we ended up going elsewhere, but I must say, the place is worth at least a half hour wait :)
author: Aditya S.

description:
This place is sooo yummy! I am a huge fan of their fish tacos. Plus they let me get them grilled :) I love the assortment of fresh salsas they serve with the tacos as well as the endless chips I get to munch on.

Their cocktails are amazing. I love that they change up their margaritas kind of regularly. Each time I go there its changed up to something new. My favorites include the watermelon marg and the white peach+basil marg.

The plantains were overpriced for what it is. I did like the corn on the cob tho. either way its ok its all about the tacos!
author: Natassia S.

description: Really good Mexican brunch food! The chips are a little dry and bland and the salsa could be a bit spicier but overall really good! great service too. I got the chorizo and potato taco...AMAZE
author: Jillian C.

description:
Came in on one of those lovely warm Saturdays in late winter that make you wonder if you're still in SF. Oh how I love my city and its crazy micro-climates!

Walked in and was seated at the bar. Got a complementary mixed shot from one of the bartenders - I think it was orange juice with red chili flakes and tequila? The chili flakes gave it a nice kick. Shortly after I had finished the shot, the other bartender intently stares at me and decides to ask for my ID. Hmm a little late there, but yes I is an adult!!

Anyway, had to try to tuna tostada. It was good, but I don't know if I would come back again and shell out the $11 for those two dinky things. Don't get me wrong. If I was a bajillionaire, I'd have those things stocked in my fridge at ALL times.

Also tried the carnitas tacos. It was good and flavorful, but I'd rather hit up any of the taquerias on Mission and get me some $1 tacos instead.

But it's a fun and poppin' place to be on a warm Saturday afternoon with good company!
author: Moraia W.

description: We stumbled across this restaurant on a late Friday night because it was near our hotel. We loved the food here! Great tacos and the pozole was crazy good! Pozole is one of my favorite dishes & its hard to find a good pozole.  So I was very pleased to find a good one here!!
author: Kim R.

description:
Once I walked by and saw the sign "Taco, Tecate, Tequila-$10," I was sold. Ironic since I definitely had more than a Taco, a Tecate, and Tequila. Well played, Tacolicious, well played. 

I expected Tacolicious to be good. It was packed when my friend and I got there at 6 on a Saturday night and we waited for a good 45 minutes. We got seated at the bar, which I'm normally not a fan of, but it ended up being completely awesome as we could see everything that was going out. And the slam dunk competition was on. 

Sitting at the bar was also dangerous. Everything looked so good! So in stead of going with the special, we opted for 4 tacos and the Albacore Tostadas. After eyeing the party next to us, we also decided to get the house made guacamole (best. decision. ever.). The tacos we ended up getting were the cochinita pibil, the braised shortrib, the fried fish, and the chicken. Each was really good and really fresh. I would recommend the braised shortrib. It was juicy and tender and had the perfect balance of seasoning. and it had some fatty goodness to it. Mmm. 

I was a little disappointed with the tostadas. EVERYBODY and I mean EVERYBODY in tacolicious was ordering these and conceptually, they looked and sounded amazing. But I found mine to be EXTREMELY salty. Had to lather it in guacamole to balance it out. 

The salsas they provided were all really good. Really smoky with a roasted tomato quality to them. 

Instead of tequila/tecate, we ended up going with cocktails. I have no idea what we ordered, but JESUS CHRIST THEY WERE STRONG. They were like drinks you get a clubs; flavored just enough so that you can call them cocktails, and strong enough so just one will do the job. 

The energy in this place is great. It's really upbeat, and the vibe is cool and modern. I really didn't mind how packed or noisy it was. It's a little pricey, but all in all not bad.
author: Michelle Q.

description: Came here on Halloween because daughter was trick or treating on Avila street with her buddies.  The food is actually pretty good and their Margarita was just okay. Over priced mexican food!!  Good atmosphere but they dimmed the light too dark, can't even read the menu! Service was good.
author: Alyce l.

description:
Just finished watching "Chef's read yelp reviews" - which is hysterical - watch it here - http://sf.eater.com/archives/2014/05/07/watch_more_bay_area_chefs_read_their_bad_yelp_reviews_aloud.php

Anyways, the first one that Telmo read shat all over the Tuna Tostadas which I think are the best thing on the menu. I litteraly had 5 orders (which is 10 tostadas) in one sitting - I weight roughly 130lbs, but give me good food and I will find some open abyss in my stomach to shovel it away. 

I get everyone has different taste buds, but unless the restaurant is dirty and has bugs crawling on the food don't listen to the yelp reviews! Grow a pair and try the food for yourself.
author: S B.

description:
Oh man!  I want to go back to Tacolicious!

I went to Tacolicious for a weekday lunch.  The ambiance was lively, but the music was a bit too loud (unless you've had one too many margaritas...but, like I said, weekday lunch!).  

I had the Albacore Tuna Tostadas, which were super yummy!  They were two medium-sized tostadas, with a generous portion of tuna on top.  Super yummy and fresh, topped with avocado.  Delish!  Less impressive was the Marina Girl Salad.  It was romaine lettuce with a generous dose of avocado.  Everything else in the salad, including the dressing, was hard to find/taste!  So, while fresh and healthier than some salad smothered in dressing, this salad was pretty bleh.

What I want to try when I go back are: fried plantains, sopes de nopales, grilled squid, the various tacos, and, of course, the margaritas!
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
How the boyfriend and I spent $70 on tacos is a huge shock to me, but it was well worth it. We pretty much ordered at least one of each of all the tacos except the ones without meat. My favorite was the rock cod fish tacos. The filet mignon ones were alright, but I could've done without them. The tuna tostada was alright--I'd probably skip on that one as well. Their cocktails however were delicious! 

The service here is extremely efficient. We arrived and of course the place was packed, but we were seated in about half an hour at the bar space, so we got to watch the chefs prepare everyone's food. It seemed like there were no set waiters to each table, so multiple waiters came by to ask us if we needed anything, which was nice. We always felt like someone was close enough to grab when we wanted more crack tacos.
author: Lily Z.

description:
The tacos are amazing. They remind me of Miami street tacos which are the best. I suggest all of them, I think they are great. Go during lunch, because it gets really crowded for happy hour.

Service was good, and the sauces are awesome.
author: Brittany F.

description:
Butternut squash on a taco?  With a massive bowl of guac on the side?  With three kinds of salsa to top?  And chips and another bowl of verde salsa for starters?  Sign me up! 

I enjoyed our lunch at Tacolicious, keeping it small and mostly centered on variety to try everything out.  We both enjoyed our tacos, especially trying out the various sauces to accompany.  The veggies were tasty, though the guac was a little bland for my liking - I would have preferred a more limey flavor, but that's just me.  

If I were in the area again, I wouldn't hesitate to go back!
author: Marcie A.

description: This was a nice place to hang out for an afternoon lunch. Although the tacos look pretty small for the price, they are quite tasty. I wasn't a fan of the three sauces they offered and I usually love all types of salsa/hot sauce. The bartender was a really cool guy and I would go back just because he gave such great service. Free chips, good beer and the other drinks are nice and strong!
author: Nathan L.

description:
Good food and a nice tequila selection (and I like that they don't serve Patron).

We had the enchiladas, chicken mole and cheesesteak (taco of the week) with side of rice and refried beans.  Everything was really good, but the enchiladas were our favorite.   

We'll definitely be back.    It was crowded, so don't go if you're in a hurry.   Agree with some of the other reviewers that the music was a bit too loud (and we normally like loud!).
author: Dave C.

description:
The tacos were the best tacos I've ever had.  And I'm comparing them to tacos from Kogi.  These were far superior.

I had the chicken taco, the carnitas, and the beef.  They each tasted different and unique, and were surprisingly filling.  The sauces that come with them are delicious, as well.
author: Ian C.

description: YUM!!! If this Tacolicious was near my house I would weigh 300 pounds. Thank god its a pain to drive here from Potrero Hill. An impromptu trip to the Marina and we found ourselves washing down some tasty tacos with some delic margaritas. The fish was light and flavorful, the carnitas- also quite flavorful (although a tad greasy), the beef short rib (skip this one), and the chicken one (god what was the flavor we ordered) was amazing!!! Big props for carrying Tapatio!!
author: Ritu K.

description:
Saw an article on LA Times online about some of SF's "cheap eats under $20" and this place was one of them. Since we were coming to the city for a weekend getaway, I had this place on my list as a must-try.

We came here for lunch on a Friday and this place was pretty busy. But not busy enough where we had to wait for a table to open up since we were immediately seated. Not a really big place but I did like the decor. Definitely hipster central just looking around (both the diners & employees). 

They have killer salsa they bring out with the chips. My husband & I were both starving so we decided we'd get 4 tacos each. We were able to try all their tacos and they were the BOMB. Instead of the usual rice and beans, we got their Fried Sweet Plantains and it was very yummy. I didn't realize until I took a bite that they sprinkled some salt which gave it a nice twist to the taste=) It definitely filled us up way till dinner time.

Would come back when I'm in the city again for sure.
author: Ida M.

description:
Good!
I was afraid 2 tacos wouldn't be enough when I ordered but it turned out to be just right with the help of the chips they bring out to you. I had the veggie tacos because I looove butternut squash. I also had the shrimp tacos and those were a little better.  This place was chill and most importantly inexpensive.
author: Natalie F.

description: The only reason I'm giving it two stars is because the food was decent and we got to sit outside and enjoy a sunny day in SF. Our server took about 20 minutes to even come to our table to take our order... But that was the very least of the problems. She didn't have time to explain the menu, so we of course figured it out through Yelp. My two year old was with me, so I asked our server if they had a changing table in the restroom, server said no.... And to my surprise.... There was one.... Really? Why you gotta lie? Food came out, and we wanted to order frinks.... Took our server about 20 more minutes to come out, we were two bites from being done with out food but really wanted to try a cocktail. Busser clears our plates and we ask for some boxes, 30 minutes later still no box.... Server comes out to check on us and we ask for box and check. 20 minutes later still no box or check, walk inside to ask for check and no one was available for me to ask. 10 minutes later server finally comes and we can ask for check and boxes. Such disappointing service and you're paying $5 per taco!
author: Magali L.

description:
This place is always really packed so my best friend and I tend to go during the off times.

The flor de jamaica margarita is great.  I LOVE hibiscus in my cocktails.  The short rib tacos are also very delicious and you must get the guacamole!!  One of my favorite places to eat in the city and pretty reasonably priced.
author: Nadine F.

description: First time at tacolicious and the food was definitely not my favorite. If you're not a cumin fan, dont go! Queso fries and baja style/beef short rib had cumin and i didn't finish any of it. Service was decent, but i don't plan on going back.
author: Francina O.

description:
The chorizo con huevos was perfect.  They make their own chorizo, which is awesome. Their fish tacos are pretty great too.  

Service: 4 stars as well
author: Michael T.

description: Can you say "way over rated"! Tacos of this quality can be found off any street vendor in LA. There was nothing original about the tacos, the tacos were cold and the tortillas, cold and greasy, the tacos for everyone in our party were served on the same plate, we had to figure out which ones we individually ordered ,service was poor , asked for a glass three times never got one, I would recommend going elsewhere
author: George L.

description: Excellent carne asada tacos. Always plan in waiting about an hour for table, they stay super busy but food is worth it.
author: Shalayne W.

description:
Tuna Tostada - you must eat it!

First, I loved Laiola's and was sad to see it go, but holy carnitas the new place satisfies me in a whole new way.

It was 24hrs ago and I can still feel that pure buttery tuna pressed on my tongue as I firmly pushed a firm crunchy corn chip up against it liked a ready lover.  The flavors sensation that exploded on my taste buds as the secret creamy sauce and caramelized leeks came together was to die for.

And it says a lot about the rest of the menu - Tacos (carnitas that tasted almost caramel roasted, fish that is one of the best I have put in my mouth - perfect crunch, beef cheeks that are so rich I just wanted to  suck the juices out of the meat and chicken that puts all others to shame with complexity and simply good flavors), Marina girl salad (perfect size to share with it crispy lettuce mix chopped to perfection and blended with delicious dressing and a few roasted pumpkin seeds), Rock Cod Ceviche (fresh, tangy chunks of apple really made this dish have beautiful mouth feel when combined with citrus poach fish) and the best house salsa I have had in years - that I did not order a second order of the Tuna Tostadas as I was satiated.

Add great drinks, friendly staff, great décor makes this a go to place in the city.

Tuna Tostada - you must experience it!
author: Daniel P.

description:
OMG! If this place had a location in LA, I would eat here every week! I have never been a fan of taco bars until now. This place ROCKS! 

We found the place on yelp as my fiancee and I were in search for some Mexican food while visiting SF. So when we got there, we were told there would be about a 45 minute wait...at 9pm! We decided to wait it out at the bar and grab some margaritas. Those by the way, are super good! They have quite a selection of drinks. I got the passion fruit w/ habanero margarita -- I love the sweet and spicy taste to it. I probably could order more if i had a tolerance for tequila! After we ordered drinks, within about 10 minutes, they decided to seat us. The menu is not super big, but the choices are really good. My fiancee ordered the veggie tacos, which were really good for roasted veggies. I ordered the carnitas taco, 2 shot-and-a-beer braised chicken tacos and a guajillo braised beef short rib taco. First off, unless you are a starved kid, I definitely could not eat past 2 tacos...I didnt realize how much meat they actually put in these tacos. I ended up eat 2 tacos and then the fillings on the inside of the other 2 tacos that remained. I went in to serious food coma following shortly after. :-) The salsas are LEGIT! I love a mexican place with good chips and salsa, definitely hypes me up for my meal. 

Ambiance, BIG HIGH FIVE to there guys. The place is filled with young adults looking to get the party started. They had a DJ or music cd there while we were eating. They were playing some great 80s and 90s songs, which totally rocked my socks. Who cant resist the jams from back in the day?! I've fallen in love with this restaurant. It can definitely get pricey if you are super thirsty and hungry, but the food here is incredibly great.
author: Sonal P.

description: Wow the service , atmosphere and staff here are all amazing. It's super busy but they still make you feel totally taken care you. Kudos!!
author: John U.

description: The Tacos are tiny.  The tacos are delicious.  You can get the shrimp tacos, fish tacos, beef tacos, more beef tacos, chicken tacos and a bunch of other types of tacos.  I'd get the tacos.
author: Patrick K.

description:
Came here during the 49ers vs. Saints game. I expected this place to packed like everywhere else on that day in the Marina. Lucky for my party of four, we got a table instantly! It was a nice casual atmosphere, and they had two large TV screens. We had a great table to watch the game.

I always like a Mexican restaurant that serves free salsa and tortillas in the beginning! Extra points for it being good. So, we ordered the 10 for $31 taco selection, and I got to try the gaujillo braised beef short rib taco and butternut squash, peppers, swiss chard, nopales, spicy pepitas taco. Well before I go on, we started with the albacore tuna tostadas "contramar-style"--I HAD to because it was on the 2011 7x7 Big Eats list. The tuna tostadas was amazing! I really like the crispy leeks that really added to the overall dish. The chipotle mayo added a really nice kick to it, as well. 

On to the tacos. I liked how it came with three different types of salsas--mild, medium, and hot. I love anything hot and spicy, so of course I used the hot salsa. I gotta say... it's hotter than I expected. I LOVED that it was a mango hot sauce. I had never had hot sauce with mango in it, and it was a terrific combo in terms of taste. The beef short rib taco was pretty good, but dripped oil--making it difficult to eat. The vegetarian taco I got was amazing! I liked it better than the beef one. The butternut squash was so tasty.

The highlight of my lunch there was definitely the tuna tostada. Must get!
author: Vera W.

description:
Let's get some facts out of the way first.

You came to the Marina because you wanted to see and be seen, right? You sought a place where many people congregate and shout to be heard and clink overflowing glasses and mingle drunkenly in the narrow aisle while waiting to be seated, and svelte waitresses elbow you in the chest as they pass by to serve giant round plates of assorted tacos to their ravenous guests, correct? That was your plan.

So, there really are no other caveats to having a nice time at this little, jam-packed Fusion Mexican joint. 

It's hip, it's rowdy, it's tasty. It's a bit egregiously loud, I must say. But this was on a Friday night.
If you want a quiet, chill dining experience, do not expect it here (at least not Thursday through Sunday eves). If you don't want to be intimately entwined in your neighbors' conversations, do not venture here. If you like to eat leisurely and take your sweet time digesting, it 'aint gonna happen here.

But given the popularity of the place, and the tightness of the quarters - we were a table of 3, and I was cheek-to-cheek with a friend on the window bench, who was cheek-to cheek with the next patron, and so-on - the service was swift and thorough, and the drinks and food were delicious. Their guacamole is some of the best I've tasted in SF.
author: Eva L.

description:
I am not going to dog this place - the food was OK, the service was OK, etc - but really not that impressive either, and for the price we got at the end of a few drinks and tacos, I most likely wont be going back.
All the tacos were very dry, including the meat, and the flavor people brag about here - I wonder if they got it all and didn't leave any for us.
author: Sam A.

description:
OVERALL:3.4   FOOD:3.5   SERVICE:3.5   AMBIANCE:3.5   VALUE:3
Exactly what you'd expect for tacos in the Marina: well-groomed, WASPy, fancy, trendy, and pricey....but still enjoyable in a gentrified, guilty way.

4 (small) tacos for $12 (Ay carumba, this sure ain't the Mission!)
Fried Rock Cod: tasty enough, but forgettable.
Petaluma Chicken: great beer-braised flavor.
Carnitas: see Cod above.
Beef Shortribs: WINNER!  super tender & hearty.

GREAT homemade fresh chips & assorted salsas! Generally decent tacos, though super sauciness made for super leaky eating.  Didn't try any of the many tequila offerings...can only imagine how much sloppier things could get. Kinda defeats the whole glitzy marina act, but maybe I just missed the how-to-eat-like-a-lady day in charm school.

Maybe I'll come back when I go blonde and have the right designer dog to carry around.  Til then, sticking to the Mission.
author: Amy K.

description:
