Wow - I loved this place 2 visits - amazing food great drinks too!
I had the chicken and the fish tacos - I don't even like fish tacos but these are great!
Good serve too
author: Grant H.

description: The tacos were good, but not much better than other options out there (Don Pistos). The service is the reason for the poor rating. We had people behind us in line who asked the hostess if they could buy us drinks to jump ahead. She asked us and we accepted, however there was no follow through on the drinks. Also, the waiter was incredibly bland. No smiles, just taking orders. He also left us without water the entire lunch. Not once did he check-in with us. To cap it off, the minute we finished eating, the busboys grabbed all our plates and the waiter reappeared to give us the check. Ushered out like farm animals. I will not be returning.
author: Vince B.

description: Tacolicious, thank you for making my boyfriend's surprise 30th such a success! The food was amazing and we are definitely still eating it all weekend lol! From the excellent customer service (after customizing my order they even helped me walk the heavy bags to the suite I rented) to the amazing food, this is our go to for events forevermore. We were given more than enough of everything needed and super high quality. Thanks again!
author: Jaymee S.

description:
Great atmosphere and amazing happy hour ($5 sangria and margarita). 

I want to try their actual tacos next time but my friends got the carnitas and beef short rib which they loved.
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
This place is a bit overrated for their tuna tostadas and tacos. I had the braised short rib and cod tacos... the short rib was dry and the cod tacos weren't too bad. I think it's missing some sauce. I thought the tuna tostada was going to be bigger so I was shocked when it came and it was so tiny, and only two tostadas for $10.95. And then when I ate it, I was even more disappointed... needs more tuna!! The different sauces provided were okay, nothing special either. However, I did like how bright the habanero sauce was, so yellow! 

I think I would come here just for the drinks. Next time, I want to try a margarita.. I hear they're awesome
author: Lisa P.

description: So good! I was pleasantly surprised by how kid friendly it was. They have high chairs available and were willing to accommodate us with two babies and our strollers. The sangria was delicious and the guacamole was very fresh!
author: Elena M.

description: We gave this place a shot based on other reviews and it wasn't half bad! The food was great, sangria even better and the staff was very courteous. We did however have quite the wait and there seemed to be some difficulty accurately predicting that wait. First it was 20 minutes; we came back to the restaurant 25 minutes later to check if we had missed our "your table is ready text". Turns out we hadn't! We were instead told we would have another 15-20 minute wait. I personally find very few places worth waiting for ever, but since we're brand new to SF my fiancé was set on eating here. So, alas we waited. Once we got the text and hustled back lest we miss our five minute check in time to claim our table, we were a little disappointed to find the table still not ready!  This may have just been our experience but if you find yourself in a similar situation the food isn't worth an hour wait, better wait for a downtime to get in.
author: Jordan L.

description:
I was skeptical about the name of this place because it sounds so American, however, I was still looking forward to it, especially because the pictures from Yelp looked attractive!

Got the tuna tostadas & 4 combination tacos.

I would personally skip the tuna...but maybe because I eat sushi a lot and I thought the fish was mediocre, earning a 3 stars.

The tacos were delicious but I still think they're tailored more for the American taste. This isn't to say that they weren't fantastic, I personally just like it with a little more kick in them... the beer & chicken one was actually a nice surprise.

I wouldn't hesitate to come here again. Friendly service, yummy food, and good energy!
author: Veronica S.

description: Great food, even better service and the best selection of tequilas. I had the prawns diablo dish in the appetizers and it hit the spot. We got the cod and carnitas tacos and I accidentally ended up getting the fried fish instead of the grilled and they made no fuss about it, took it off the tab right away! Would definitely go back here!
author: Mandy K.

description:
I'm in SF for work and a friend of mine requested this place for dinner/happy hour. The vibe is really casual, and the happy hour prices are great! I had their house sangria and is was delicious and cheap! Only 5 bucks!

The food is clearly not authentic Mexican, but you pay for the vibe and the nice neighborhood. The service was great, and I would definitely go back. I had the shrimp diablo, house sangria, and their chocolate dessert! Its softened chocolate with olive oil and sea salt....YUM-MIE. They don't give you enough bread for the chocolate, and will charge you for more bread but is so good, and so bad, that it would worth it!
author: Courtney h.

description: Quite possibly the best tacos in SF and beyond.   Succulent carnitas, sweet mole, savory squash, scrumptious cod.  Enjoy with three kinds of salsa!
author: Aviv G.

description: Great service, awesome tacos. Filet mignonette taco is legit(but 7$). Try it once, and get queso fresco on the side.
author: Roy C.

description:
We stumbled upon Tacolicious after some unsuccessful attempts at a couple different restaurants. It was a gorgeous Saturday afternoon in the city with every restaurant having a long wait!! Tacolicious seated us in the patio right away to start the meal on a good note!!
Between my friend and I, we shared a pitcher of Sangria, Grilled Squid Veracruz, tacos carnitas and rock cod as well as fried plantains!! Most of the recommendations came from our server and none of these disappointed. The squid was exceptional with its flavor and not chewy at all! We also got a hot sauce with our chips which was amazingly addictive. The tacos carnitas are not to be missed whereas the tacos with the cod is just about ok. For anybody who enjoys plantains, its an absolute must with its crunchy and sweet flavor!! We also got two of the Pasion Chupitos which were on the house. I would highly highly recommend Chupitos over Sangria for tasting. The habanero tequila was spicy and smooth at the same time and definitely gave me a buzz! All of this for a reasonable price was icing to the cake!

I thoroughly enjoyed the restaurant for a laid back and fun time in the city with good food!! I'd come back again!
author: Priyanka M.

description:
A pretty good taco place that walks that fine line between upscale and being authentic, and actually does a pretty good job of it... as long as you stick to the tacos! 

I went here a couple weeks ago with some friends. We had to sit outside because it was crowded, but it was heated so it turned out well. The meal started with chips and salsa, which were delicious, we probably went through about 3 bowls before meal the started. The salsa was not spicy, but very flavorful.

One of my friends suggested we try the chili con queso. The menu said, "Sustainable? No Local? No Delicious? YES", which immediately triggered my pseudo hippy food tastes and made me skeptical. When it arrived, it turned out my skepticism was well founded because it was just a bowl of the nasty liquid cheese they pour on "nachos" at the sporting events with some peppers floating in it. I had some anyway because it cost eight dollars! I wanted to get my money's worth.

The tacos however were a saving grace. You can get 4 for $13, which although it doesn't beat the deals on mission street, these tacos were much less greasy and don't seem sketchy. I recently turned pescatarian so I had 3 fish tacos and a veggie one. The fish tacos, which featured fried rock cod, were really good and the veggie one was surprisingly flavorful to the point that I didn't really miss the meat. The provided a spicy, mild, and medium sauce to accompany them, but definitely did not give enough for four hungry college students.

Overall I would return if in the area, it's a pretty good deal for the Marina and definitely more flavorful than you're average place in the neighborhood. I would deduct a star for the awful/weird cheese, but this is something I would never have ordered myself because I know I don't like it so it keeps the 4.
author: Nicolas H.

description: My wife and are really enjoy the marina on the weekend! While most places are very good with customers this place was not. Twice we have walked into this taco bar sat down at the bar waited for 20 min without any service. And twice we have walked out. As a restaurant owner my self this is completely unacceptable.
author: Greg B.

description:
Go for the tacos, stay for the chips and the unusual mint-laced salsa. The table salsas to go with the tacos are also pretty great, just small portioned, fine for tacos but not if you're zeroing in more accompaniments for the chips.

Whenever I'm in the Marina at a time when Tacolicious isn't insanely busy, I'll stop in. But it's nearly always very busy.
author: Sam P.

description:
Price : Quality ratio is satisfying.

food is a 7/10.

atmosphere is an 8/10.

service is a 9/10.

Marina-caliber food, but not quite up my personal expectations of what Mexican food should taste like. The venu is small and not ideal for parties of 4 or more.
author: Peter T.

description: Food poison on a Friday night!!!! Guys - read their bad reviews first before you go here. (Leaving 3 stars so people read this). I was busy all day and didn't eat so was looking forward to a dinner with my friend. Hamachi ...something, two orders, tasted funky and had mushy texture. Waitress took it off the bill. But we also had tuna and shrim....go figure. And this is besides that drinks are very unbalanced - margarita with some passion fruit has passion fruit 300% and another one "with wine vinegar" really taste like pure vinegar. Very blend food - mixed with lots of sault and lime. Don't eat here.
author: Nutty V.

description: UGH I love tacos and the margaritas are so yummy--strong but, yummy. Going back!
author: Kristin C.

description:
We had a party of 3 and shared the brussel sprouts which are very tasty, and had the special of the day taco that had cactus in it, the short rib, and both of the chicken tacos. Very tasty just thought it was a little pricy ( yes i know your in the marina) for what you got .
The margaritas are very yummy 
Service is very friendly which always helps
Tables where a little close together it felt my butt was in the other tables salsa trying to get up to use the bathroom. Overall I would come here again just not a weekly thing
author: JJ s.

description: The hostess working on 6/24/13 is a bitch.  If you hate your job quit.  If you hate fat people thats cool.  Fat people still like ugly people.
author: Fatty A.

description:
Are you kidding me?

I headed here last night with a large group of friends. I'd heard for awhile that they make some great tacos and that it's fun, so I'd put it on the "must-try" list to include in my upcoming book, "Food Lovers' Guide to San Francisco". 

http://amzn.to/my7MHz

Whenever possible, if I'm going to try out a new place and if it's fun/casual, I'll try to share the experience w/ my friends.
No, I didn't tell you I was here for the book. That shouldn't make a difference -- we're customers.

I get it -- I have a large group of 10 with me and it's not easy seating 10 people. 

"It's going to be about an hour," says the hostess. 
I ask if we can go across the street to Horseshoe Tavern and wait; can she call me when our table is ready? To this, she says she has no phone service.

"No phone service." A young lady of that age -- has no phone? 
Or Tacolicious has no land line?

Whatever. 

All good; I'm agreeable and then tell her we'll just check in then, but kindly request for her NOT to give away our table as we will, quite literally, be right across the street waiting. She says she will let us know when the table is ready.

Fast forward almost an hour and a half with ten hungry people trying to calm down our stomachs with some heavy beers -- and there's no update, no nothing. Two friends run across the street to check and they're told: "It's going to be about an hour." 

Surely, she must have not recognized them and is mistaken?
Now *I* run across the street to check -- and am told it will be another hour, at least. Now, my blood begins to boil.

G: "That's what you said an hour ago, and you're now telling me another hour?"

Host: "Yeah well, no table for ten has opened up."

G: "I'm sorry - - you were waiting for a table of ten to get up to seat us -- when you have no set-up inside for a table of ten right now?"

Host: "Well, if a four-top opens up, I have to seat the four people waiting."

G: "So, basically -- you told us to wait an hour when there was NO possibility of us being seated in that hour because you don't HAVE a table for ten in the restaurant."

Host: "No, if an entire section got up and ten seats opened up, I could have seated you guys but everyone is finishing their meals at different times."

....... are you joking? I have better odds playing craps in Vegas than an entire corner of one restaurant with tables for two, four, two and two ALL getting up at the exact same time so they could be PUT together!!

Do you think that people just have time to kill on a Tuesday night, closing in on 9 PM, hungry but patiently waiting because YOU said to wait?

Like I said - I understand that it's a large party, but after this length of time, I want to see SOME effort having been made to accommodate a party that arrived at 7:30 PM. 
By 9 PM, it'd have been nice to see her having saved at least two itty bitty tables in one corner, in an attempt to cater to the guests who have been waiting for an hour and a half, or SOMETHING -- anything. 
Basically, we just sat across the street watching some 50-60 people getting seated in that span of time -- and she had done NOTHING -- not even to inform us that it's not going to happen tonight until 11 PM -- NOTHING to help us.

G: "So - - basically, after another hour, you can tell us it's going to be one MORE hour."

Host: "Maybe - but I don't see the wait being longer than three hours."

Don't stop reading -- it gets better.

Host: "Well, if you made a reservation, you'd have been seated."

G: "RESERVATION? I thought you don't take reservations."

Host: "We do - if you e-mail us the number of people in your party."

G: "Your website clearly states, "NO RESERVATIONS" --  doesn't that mean you don't take reservations?"

Host: "We don't -- unless you e-mail our GM and then we will reserve a table for you."

Seriously - -what is this?
Are you toying with me?
You think these 10 people who all lead busy lives had nothing better to do tonight than wait an hour and a half while you did NOTHING?

I could have lived with you informing us that our chances were slim to none, and to make a reservation for ten on a different night -- and all my friends would have been all too happy to go somewhere else to eat. But no - you decided to waste all of our time so that by the time we went to Barney's and ate there -- it was past 11 PM on a weeknight when we walked out because you had to be completely incapable of doing your job.

I appreciate good food more than most, but part of a restaurant experience IS the service. Good service can make up for a lot -- but Tacolicious, however good/bad your food may be, which I will never know now -- you need to train your hostesses not to waste your customers' time, be upfront, and make sure not to ruin ten people's evening! 

And if you're going to state "NO RESERVATIONS" on your website - don't tell me when I get there that I should have made reservations!

I ask again -- are you kidding me!?!!
author: Grace K.

description:
Decent gourmet Mexican food if you're looking to spend $50 for a taco lunch.  Picked up tacos for the office from the Tacolicious stand at the Ferry Building last Thursday.  We got a bunch of chicken and short rib tacos.  They were excellent, so I decided to give them a shot at their actual restaurant in the Marina.

To begin, the chips and salsa were on point.  Chips were warm and tasted fresh, not store bought.  They gave us four different kinds of salsa which were all pretty good (they have no spicy salsas though! They gave us a "habenero" salsa that was incredibly mild.)  For our appetizers we went with the tuna tostadas and albondigas soup.  The tostadas were pretty good.  They were these little round chips with a small piece of tuna and leeks over mayo, topped off with a slice of avocado.  While tasty, they were actually pretty difficult to eat.  One bit and the whole thing falls apart.  The albondigas soup was pretty mediocre.  It was particularly oily and we ate maybe a third at best.

We tried the agua frescas, which were pretty disappointed.   The flavor of the day was a lime aqua fresca that ended up tasting more like minute maid limeade.  There were no fruit pieces or pulp in it whatsoever.  Go to underdog if you want a real tasty aqua fresca!

In order to get a good feel for their variety of tacos, we went with 2 braised beef short rib, 1 shot and beer braised chicken, 1 fried local rock cod, and 1 white shrimp (special of the day.)  The short rib and chicken were both wonderful.  They were very juicy, tender and flavorful.  The seafood tacos (fish and shrimp) were both quite disappointing.  Neither had any flavor, and they both left fishy tastes in my mouth.  Neither the fish nor the shrimp tasted fresh.

If I were to come here again (be willing to spend 50 dollars on a Mexican lunch) I would stick with only the chips, salsa, short rib and chicken tacos.  Those are all very good; don't waste your time with anything else there.  Or you could just go to the mission and get 10 super burritos for the same price...
author: Timothy C.

description: These are definitely more boutique tacos rather than street style, but that's ok. We enjoyed the braised chicken, cod, carnitas and short rib tacos. I liked the trio of salsas that were also served. The guacamole was fresh and enjoyable. The flavors are not complex and are bordering tasteless without adding lime, the salsas and guacamole. Overall, I left satisfied and would come back again to explore the menu further.
author: MissM R.

description: Great place!  We loved the house margaritas & tacos!  Patrick was fantastic - can't wait to return!
author: Jeff W.

description:
I'm giving this place four stars instead of three because of the fun decor and excellent service. 

I came here since I heard the tacos here were delicious and it was a must-try if you're ever in the marina. The tuna tostadas are absolutely amazing, each plate comes with only two servings though, so if your party is bigger you should order more (you can also get half-servings). The chips and salsa they give you before your meal are also delicious. The salsa tastes PERFECT, just enough flavor and super fresh. 

As for the tacos, I wasn't so impressed. We ordered each of the tacos on the menu so we could try them all and they were good, but not amazing. Each taco comes with two shells and a ton of meat, so you can totally make one taco into two by splitting the shells and meat. 

The prices are kind of high for mediocre tacos, but everything else was good! I'd come here again, but order smarter (i.e. less food) and definitely get less tacos.
author: Alice W.

description:
I came here because my friend had never gone to the marina, it was interesting their was a wait, which is pretty normal for any place in the city. 

I ordered the taquitos which were disgusting, they were not good. You must go for the TACOS, they were yummy :)
author: Veronica V.

description:
TLISH is the delicious! The chips and salsa you are given upon arrival are so good and FREE! I've tried a couple items on the menu and all are great - I love the marina girl salad.  Their tacos are definitely good but tiny... they double up the tortilla so they are small but filling.

On the weekends or most dinner nights this place is packed and you have to wait a while but it is worth it.. you can always put your name in and walk around the shops of Chestnut.

Definitely go check it out!
author: JL W.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVEEEEE this place! There's always a line, but the wait has been super worth it every time. It's a bit crowded, but the service has always been superb and the tacos are absolutely to die for. Also, the drinks menu is sweet. Not really a super family friendly place, but perfect for late nights.

I come here relatively regularly and would recommend it for anyone who's down for some awesome tacos. They also have online ordering for pick up, so if you don't wanna wait, this is for you.
author: Gloria Z.

description: I was very impressed here.  The tacos were delicious.  We had the braised beef tacos and the chicken tacos.  Although service here could use some work, And it's a bit expensive, I think the food and quickness deserves 4 stars
author: David S.

description: Average tacos, some were a bit dry and lacked flavour (filet mignon)   Yummy drinks.
author: Lia E.

description: Let's get right to the point. The best reason to go to this nightclubbish taqueria is the huge basket of chips and two delicious salsas they deposit before you as soon as you sit. The other reason is the scrumptious chicken mole taco, which is only sometimes on the menu. The other tacos can be hit or miss. Short rib, fried cod and chorizo are all solid if not memorable, and the carnitas was outright boring, to the extent that fried pork can bore. Tacos are $4, with various discounts if you buy a bunch, but they're completely overstuffed with meat. The refried beans with cotija are really nice - pick these over the drunken beans. The whole loud party vibe is a turnoff, and you get that at both the Marina and Mission locations. Overall I'd take Tacko around the corner over this place, but the salsas at Tacolicious sure are a draw.
author: Cecilia L.

description:
This place is super overrated! I went in expecting an awesome drink and meal experience. I had a bloody Mary to cure my major hang over and almost vomited! This drink was DISCUSTING! I have absolutely no clue what the bartender put in it! Shit comes to mind. Tasted nothing like that classic spicy tomato cocktail you long for after a hard night of partying. 

The meal was equally disgusting! I ordered an item called chilequiles which consisted of some nasty orange peel tasting sauce. No spice whatsoever! The beans were watery as hell and the rice tasted like soggy cardboard! With two bites of my meal and three sips of my atrocious cocktail I left there feeling more sick than I did when I started.
author: Venus R.

description:
I've been here 3 times at least in the past few months.

If you come to Tacolicious, you want to be seen.  They have huge windows that allow for great people watching both in and out.  The tacos are small, but tasty.  It'll take 3 tacos to fill you up, and it'll cost you $9 bucks.  Try not to order drinks in this place, especially the margarita pitchers, as they are smaller than normal and pricey. 

The bathroom has a weird set-up here as well.  You are forced to go through the kitchen to get to the bathroom, which is kinda awkward and gross.
author: Logan C.

description:
They're always busy because it's such a small place. We sat at the bar and got no attention from the bartender... after 10 minutes i was agitated that she hadn't come over to take our order and she didnt even look in our direction so i couldn't flag her down. 

The food was just ok... the salsa was weird and tasted like it had tequila in it... i couldn't tell....

Basically if you don't drink and don't eat pork, don't expect to find anything here for you

the BF and I agree that Rubio's is better
author: Layla L.

description:
I dig this place.  If you're looking for Mexican food, but more than just burritos and the like, come here for the variety.  

This place is popular.  Expect a wait, so come early and not when you're starving.  We did that and ended up at the bar for 3 of us.  Not the most conducive to talking, but the service was pretty great.  Got some drinks and food served right there.

The place is also pretty loud, so I'd not think this would be great for dates.

The food was pretty awesome as well.  It changes from time to time.  The first visit had spicy meatballs.  While that's typically italian, the fusion was pretty amazing.  Unfortunately, they didn't have that (or the beet salad that I'd had before).  I wasn't too disappointed, and had a great meal anyway.  

Looking for something fun and super tasty, swing by!
author: Andy S.

description: The tacos are delicious, but the crowds and often the long wait are a little much sometimes. No question the carnitas are the best options, carne asada is good too, but the fish leaves a little to be desired. the drinks are fairly good too but I wouldn't write home about them.  Still, with Nicks Crispy being all the way over on Polk, for the Marina/Cow Hollow crowd, this is the best brick and mortar taco joint going.
author: Mike V.

description:
Quite simply the best salsa I can remember tasting. Fresh with a kick and so much cilantro. We had a selection of tacos and the service was great though this place gets mighty busy so be prepared to wait. 

I don't get that excited for entirely traditional fare, much prefer a modern twist with interesting ingredients and presentation. This is that. And next time I go I will be asking if they can box me up some of that salsa to take home with me.
author: Jack C.

description:
*Fergalicious remix*

Tacolicous def-
Tacolicious def-

Tacolicious definition makes my tongue go loco
They're my treasure I get pleasure just by looking at their photo
You can see me, all day eating
Short rib tacos, for my meeting
I got reasons why I eat 'em
Get mahi mahi when in season

Tacolicious (So delicious) 
And yes they slight nutritious
With flava so damn vicious 
This taco ain't fictitious 
Eat with nachos (crunch, crunchh)
That make em bellies rock, rock  
And we be lining down the block just to eat up all the guac...

So delicious (it's hot hot) 
So delicious (makes them bellies rock, rock)
So delicious (they wanna eat up all this guac)
Tacolicious (t-t-tasty tasty)
author: Alexa M.

description:
Every once in a while you find your go-to trendy spot that knocks your socks off and is perfect for almost any occasion. Tacolicious is definitely that place. They have unique everything! Unique ambiance, unique drinks, unique entrees.

This location can get packed pretty quickly, so make sure you give yourself enough time to put your name down and then take a stroll around the Marina.

Unique ambiance:
Trendy and upbeat, yet casual. It's a chameleon. It can be anything you want it to be. Perfect for a date, or drinks with your friends.

Unique drinks:
Try the Nopal or Paloma. You can get either a glass or a pitcher. Get the pitcher. They have drinks made of combinations (and sometimes things) that you've never heard of here. Like manzano peppers, guava, prickly pear, agave nectar, red chill pepper vinegar, elder flower, and sage. Somehow it all magically turns out awesome!

Unique entrees:
Their complimentary fresh salsa is great. The chili con queso is awesomely delicious! I haven't tried it, but I hear the Marina girl salad is quite popular. Vegetarians -- they almost always have lots of veg options here. I liked the butternut squash tacos. I also tried cactus tacos for the first time here. Surprisingly good.

So, basically, you'll leave happy and drunk. Have fun!
author: Sahana U.

description:
I wish it was legal to marry a restaurant, because if it was, I'd get hitched to Tacolicious 'til death do us part.

Their carnitas tacos are AMAZING (caps lock was necessary), the fresca margarita is scrumptious, and their homemade chips & salsa keep me coming back for more. The service is great & super friendly. But don't be surprised if you roll in on a Saturday at 8 PM for dinner & there's a 45 minute wait. You know what I say? Who cares about the wait? The food alone is definitely worth it!

They have some pretty cool decor, like a giant Tapatio painting. The bar's nice too. And the bartenders are generous with their shot servings.
author: K K.

description:
Best tacos ever! The rock cod is my favorite.
Ambiance amazing, food delicious and prices reasonable.
Great scene, I mean what more could you ask for?!
author: David E.

description:
First of all 5 stars for having a pseudo baby changing table in the bathroom - that is HUGE, esp in the marina!!!

I wish they had carne Asada taco's....I always mix up carnitas (pork - delicious, but pig) and carne asadas....damn me for taking French in High school instead of spanish!
author: Shel D.

description:
I like their tacos, but they made an error with my order twice withing past 3 months !
First time I was dining in, so I asked them to exchange my tacos for which I had ordered.  2nd time was more frustrating since my friend and I walked for a long time to get there, waited a long time for our orders,  then took the long walk home to realized they had given me the wrong tacos again !
Again their tacos are good, but from my experience they don't pay attention when they take your order.
author: Monica R B.

description: Love me some Tacolicious.  While this place is a serious hassle -- every time I come here I feel I am pressed up against a wall waiting for a table -- this fact is compensated for by the very tasty tacos.  The fried fish is amazing, and the carnitas is also high on the yumm factor.  This is a fun place to hang out with friends, have a drink or two, and feast on tacos -- once you have landed that elusive table.
author: Sean M.

description:
Did a run through at the Marina District after a hike in Pt. Reyes...My friend and I couldn't get into the clubs with our garb so we scoured the place for open bars...man, places close early up in here!  Luckily we caught glimpse of this little Taco shop so we can get our grub on.

It's definitely some sort of creative fusion type tacos that you won't find poppin' outta Guadalajara or Jalisco.  Apart from the lack of Mexican authenticity the "tacos" are frickin' finger lickin' good.  The ambiance and service is very good despite the heavy crowd.  

There's a line that started in the kitchen and wrapped around the bar which I found particularly odd, it turned out to be the restroom line...luckily I didn't have to go....
author: Adonis V.

description:
This restaurant is not bad.  There are definitely some tasty options here and the place is pretty hip, but with a title called Tacolicous, you would expect delicious tacos,...they really should have called this place Taco-vicous.

Let's start with the good:

-The guacamole was excellent; just the right balance between the sourness of the lime and savory with its blend of seasonings. The chips were nothing too special

-  Supposedly the bartender said they won best margaritas in the city according to some sort of SF magazine; rightfully so. I tried one that tasted like an agua fredsca blend of cantaloupe, watermelon, lime mixed with tequila; definitely refreshing and thirst-quenching.

- The staff are friendly and on top of tasks

And now for the nitty gritty:

I would have given this joint three or four stars if they called this place guacalicous or margaritalicious, but this place is suppose to specialize on one food: Tacos. I tried two types - the short rib and the carnitas.  FIrst of all it's $12 for four small tacos and boy are they small. The size actually was a blessing in disguise since they did not taste very good. The filling is way too salty particularly the short ribs. It's as if someone made some sort of meat stew and filled the tortillas with the bottom remnants of of the pot - extremely concentrated pieces way too salty to be in a taco. I tried to add hot sauce and lime to ease up the flavor of the meat but did not work. 

So, if you ever need a taco fix, I would not recommend this place; overly priced tacos + unpleasant Salty greasy flavors = Taco-vicous!
author: Joel V.

description:
Awesome!
A huge list of tequila options, atmosphere was great. It's loud but fun even though we had over an hour wait. Drinks are about 10$ a pop, food was awesome.
4 of us split the 10 tocos foe 31$ deal and mixed the flavors. The chips and salsa is banging and I loved beer Victoria on tap, dark but light and overall, look forward to returning.
One last thing, it only has one bathroom with kept things interesting, so dont gowith a full bladder....
author: Stephen T.

description:
Came here for lunch with my mother. Personally think this is the best taco place in San Francisco. Everyone must try this place ASAP.

Ordered three tacos:
Shot-and-a-beer braised chicken
Traditional carnitas (pork)
and the taco of the day (cannot remember!)

Each taco order came with three sauces: a green, yellow, and red sauce.

In addition, we had the made-to-order guacamole. As expected the guac was fresssssh and addicting, there must be crack in it or something. 

The traditional carnitas was my mother's favorite. Tacolicious definitely expect us back!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Mmm...mmm...mmm...tacolicious is tacoLICIOUS! I am in love with their braised short rib and carnitas tacos. ...but there are many others that I also enjoy. You capacificn also try their special: a shot of tequila, a taco, and a mexican beer...for $10, if I'm not mistaken. I recommended giving this place a try...especially if you like really good tacos.

Ohh...and their free chips and salsa are damn good! It's easy to fill up on this, so beware...because it's essential to save room for their delicious tacos.
author: Kristin H.

description:
T-licious! Avid lover of the Carnitas taco, margarita, sangria, plaintains, the Tacos al Pastor and the Salmon tacos are amazing, but rare to be the special. I do miss their previous Spanish restaurant Laiola, would be awesome to see it reopen somewhere else. Being Latin, I have to say the tacos here are just like the ones in Mexico, traditional and not  overloaded with ingredients. Good prices, good food, nice staff. 

There was one time where my two guy friends and I sat at the bar and ordered tacos. This lady maybe in her 30, 50, who knows. My friend was pretty drink, he was massaging an old lady next to us and eating her hips. But therr was another lady on our left who was reading a book with the most sinister look. Inquiring minds begin to wonder. The conversation went something like this: 

My amigo:  "Ma'am, what are you reading?" 
Old lady: "Who asks that?!"
 My amigo; "I love to read and wanted to see what people are reading these days." [Her face suddenly becomes red like a tomato and she looks back]
 Old lady: "FINE!". [ She holds the book up with anger and it reads "How Sex Works"] 


We tried to not laugh, we really did, but wow.  She ordered a whole pitcher of margarita. And so did we.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I am no mexican but I think this MUST be the best mexican restaurant in California. I lived in SoCal for 10 yrs and still think this is THE best!
The food is cheep,  $3.95 for a large size taco. Much better than the neighbor Mamacita. Wait is a bit annoying, but go to horseshoe and talk to marina people. You can catch them while they are still rather sober and gents.
author: Mika G.

description:
I decided to go to Tacolicious one day for lunch after hearing about them in "7x7 Magazine's Big Eat 2010."  It is a tiny restaurant in the Marina district that can be easily missed at first sight.  The interior is reminiscent of a casual sports bar.  A whole variety of liquor stood behind the counter, and the television was broadcasting sports.  I was fortunate enough to come at 3PM when it was quite empty because it became busy by the time I was leaving.

For those not ordering drinks, they do provide you with your own pitcher of water.  However, I do prefer the waiter to refill my water for me instead, especially since he had the time to approach me every minute, asking if I have anything else I need to order as I'm eating.  I felt like they were rushing me to pay and leave, which made me uncomfortable and unable to savor my food to their fullest.

No matter what you order, Tacolicious does provide you with a generous portion of tortilla chips on the side along with salsa.  I could tell from just a taste of the zestful salsa that it was made fresh in the kitchen.  After reading about their famous tuna tostada, it comes as no surprise that the tostada was what I ordered, and it did not disappoint at all.  The combination of tuna, avocado, and lime served in crispy tortilla shells was a rich, savory, sensational delight.  If you could order anything from the restaurant, do choose this.

Tacolicious is the perfect place for people to grab some drinks, chips, and tostada while chatting and watching the games, provided the service quality improves.
author: Fook W.

description:
Street food is all the rage--bulgogi @ L Street Vending cart in DC, Goat Cheese cake from the dessert truck in NYC, to papusa's in the Brooklyn flea. It's exciting to see San Francisco with a growing and vibrant street food culture.

When I went to Laiola last week, I learned about the taco menu making its grand entrance today at the Ferry Building. So that's where I decided to grab lunch today. Tacolicious is simply that--tacos that are delicious. They offer three different types of tacos: steak, chicken and pork. My favorite is by far the chipotle-braised pork shoulder taco. (Confession, I love pork). When ordering, don't forget to help yourself to a generous squirt of one of three sauces. Sweet tomato is my fave.

Dripping with sauce and flavor, be careful when you eat it! 

You also HAVE to try the grilled corn with an ancho-chili rub with lime. The lime offsets the super sweet corn. I know you're concerned; corn for lunch? What if I get corn stuck between my teeth? It's not going to go well with my 2 o'clock meeting.  Maybe they'll offer toothpicks next Thursday. If not, I'm packing some floss just in case.

I'm so glad to welcome another fine addition to the Ferry Building. I can't wait to get myself a tacolicious Tshirt to show my support!
author: Vince H.

description: This place never disappoints. Margaritas are always excellent with a nice tequila selection. We always get the Tacos of the Week. Always fresh and always delicious! Service is great too! Highly recommend!
author: William H.

description: I have never been to this place before & I was there less than 10 minutes thanks to your rude "hostess". she was the hefty girl with glasses working this Friday night (June 21) and I'm pretty sure she needs to take a crap, because something is definitely stuck up her butt. because we only wanted bar service she was completely rude for a lack of a better word that I'm not allowed to use on this website. first impressions last a lifetime and if she's any indication of how your staff treats paying customers, we will not be back ever.
author: Alecia W.

description: Service and drinks are the only redeeming qualities of this place. The food was completely "meh" with the tacos served poorly. The tortillas were dry, greasy, and spongy. The Posole soup was uninteresting, the short rib taco unseasoned and chewy, reminding me of the meat inside of canned spaghetti. The queso was one of the few quality food items, but it wasn't enough. In a city full of food, you can find much better.
author: Kip S.

description:
Tacolicious has some of my favorite margaritas in town.  They have a lot of selection and we usually end up getting whatever special margarita they're offering.  They have combo deals on tacos, and as a table we normally end up just ordering a plate of 10 or so.  Guacamole is da bomb and the chips and salsa they bring out when you sit down is fantastic.  

I also love sitting outside here whenever possible, especially on a warm day.  It gets really crowded here though so get here early.
author: Gabrielle L.

description:
What I liked about this place is that it doesn't try to be something else.  It's cheap food, good drinks and a fun atmosphere on any night.  It was Tuesday night and we met up with our friends for dinner.   We started with a pitcher of margaritas, moved on to the guacamole and chips, cheese dip that while was very rich, was a great addition to the margaritas and our growing hunger.

The the guys decided to order some sort of chicken nuggets that I think were the low point of the meal, they were dry and the corn meal was very thick and crunchy.  The ceviche was OK but not great, a bit on the dry side and a very small portion.

We had the chicken and beef tacos, they were great, and the salsas were a good addition.  The tacos are mostly protein which fills you up since they are small, but I'm glad we each had two, despite the small size of dishes, the food is filling.

The biggest downside, was the wait, this place doesn't take reservations and for some reason people like to linger so you could end up waiting way over an hour on a Tuesday night, I would hate to see the wait on a Friday or Saturday.  

Upside, we walked away paying $80 for the 4 of us with tons of food and drinks, can't beat that.
author: Inga W.

description:
Will never go again due to food poisoning:

PROS: Fun environment, crowded, lively, great drinks, Nicaraguan beer, tasty-but-greasy (but see below) food, outdoor seating in the sun.

CONS: Visit #1: Went with a buddy, both of us got extremely nauseous the first time but figured it was just a fluke. Visit #2: Just took my gf today, I feel nauseous again and she threw up in my car 30 minutes after eating, and I just had to spend $200 to get it cleaned.

VERDICT: Something is wrong with this place. Management, if you're reading this, I'd love a response here.
author: Marc H.

description:
All I really should say is that I've grown up on authentic Mexican food for almost 30 years now and Tacolicious makes me proud.

The tacos are amazing! Seriously, so tasty, juicy, and every time I've been they're consistent.

The only downfall is probably waiting for a table and then perhaps being seated too close to the tables next to you, but I will sit on the flippin' sidewalk and eat their tacos. Just be patient!
author: Liz M.

description:
Overcrowded ?  HUGE YES 
long wait? OH VERY MUCH SO 
loud? WHAT DID YOU SAY? 
OVERRATED?   HARDLY! 

People like to complain, myself included, but there are some things you need to put up with in order to enjoy some of the best tacos you will ever have.  GET THE QUESO EVERY TIME YOU GO.
author: douglas B.

description: I'm really bummed about this place.. I came for taco Tuesday and the platter was horrible. They didn't put enough food on to fill the "6" tacos. When we asked for a little more cheese and tomatoes to fill the empty shells they charged us $3 for a tiny plate of cheese and cut up tomatoes. Maybe this place has the possibility of being good but I had a HORRIBLE experience.
author: Spencer R.

description: One of our favorites when we come to San Francisco. Nothing particularly outstanding other than a good selection of tacos which are all assembled right in front of the house. Nothing to hide. The Margaritas are to die for but be careful as a couple will likely put you on your ass. It's a really nice neighborhood place with good food at good pricing. I think we've been to the Chestnut location a half dozen or eight times and never been disappointed.
author: Jeff O.

description:
The chicken mole taco is the best chicken taco i've ever had. I'm not a huge fan of tacos and most mexican places cook the chicken too dry. This was different for a chance because they had marniated the chicken in  mole sauce which mde it very flavorful. Other tacos were good too. 
I would suggest coming in for a taco tues or HH - as the regular prices are a little more on the higher end....
author: Amy M.

description:
not as tacoLICIOUS as i had hoped, but it was alright. 

Came here to order some to-go lunch.

Carnitas Taco
- less dry than other pork tacos but still pretty plain
- went well with the sweeter salsa

Fish Taco
- a little bulky and could not fit in the mini soft taco shells
- salty batter they used to fry it in
- the fish tasted like charcoal on the outside, i wonder if they changed the oil... 
-plain overall

Chips and Salsa
- generous portions
- 4 types of salsa packed in the to-go bag

dissapointed that there was no chorizo-potato taco available...

went promptly into a food coma after eating everything.  not too bad for a lunch in the marina district, but i know a few taco trucks who make their taco's much more flavorful and for one-third the price.  if i'm going to spend this much money on a taco, i would much rather go to underdogs
author: Tina A.

description:
Tried this again per the manager's request. I appreciate your courteous staff and great service.

I love your salsa (not traditional) because its different and has some great flavors. I do not like making a french dip sandwich out of my tacos because they are too dry.

Plain and simple every single one of the tacos (including chorizo, not sure how chorizo gets to be dry?!?) was dry. 

Beer Can Chicken- dry
Chorizo - dry
Mole-dry
Carnitas -dry

Dry meat means, something is wrong.

On my earlier post, I said its too expensive, which it is. Of course, its clean not dirty and located off chestnut street which kinda makes up for the price differential. However, price is irrelevant if the food is bad. 

Tip:

Please try instead of shredding/pulling your meat(s), keeping them in chunks, maybe it would retain some of the natural juices. 

Don't cook the meat all the way if you're going to re-heat it.

Perhaps try using thigh meat instead of chicken breast, or cook it fresh.

Substitute pork loin(or whatever cut you are using) for pork butt/shoulder to keep it juicy. 

A little skirt steak would help a lot. 

I appreciate the flavors you are trying to offer, which I think would be phenomenal if they weren't dry.

Sorry tacolicious, I hope you've fixed this. I am not coming back.

Even if I don't, I think you'll be fine. There are plenty of people willing to pay for dry tacos. All the best of luck to your business.
author: Steven C.

description:
Tacolicious is my antichrist. There is so much to hate about it - overcrowded, overpriced, the people who go there suck. Yet, I can't stay away. 

Prepare to find yourself blacked out and penniless.

Tacolicious is the Coachella of San Francisco.
author: Alana C.

description: from the moment i walked in the staff was courteous and food was prompt and on point. from the chips and dip, taco of the week pollo de cuba all the way to the chocolate taco dessert. delicious
author: Glenn E.

description: I'm a fan.  The 4 tacos for $13 are about the only option on the menu.  I get 2 chicken (awesome) and 2 filet (for three bucks more each).  The sauces they give you to go with them are all three delicious.  You get free salsa and chips which are well above par.  The only negatives are: First, the hours - they really should stay open until 12:00 AM consistently throughout the week.  They make enough money to sustain the occasional less than peak crowd.  Second, the size of the restaurant is far too small for the crowd.  They need to shop for a bigger location.  I guess the third negative is that occasionally the place has an off-putting odor.  I know the bartenders are cleaning the place up right, so I'm not sure what the mystery smell is about.  I try to put it out of mind and enjoy all of the other aspects.
author: Doug B.

description:
Overpriced Tacos.
Loud Bar Scene.
Friendly Service.
Decor like a Bachelor Pad.

Margaritas A-OK.
author: Dee C.

description:
The food portions may seem small but the flavors and selections were interesting and appealing. They're drink menu was really good, too. Chips and salsa were offered immediately and kept replenished. The reason I'm only giving it 3 stars is the prices and the food service was a bit sluggish. Lunch for two with a couple of drinks each was $77. Plan to spend about $10 for each house cocktail and $6-$9 for beer. Trendy and tastey, but pricey. 
Drink menu:
http://tacolicioussf.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/tacolicious-beverage-menu-website.pdf
author: Arin C.

description: dropped in on Sunday afternoon for a plate of tacos. this place did not disappoint.  the fish tacos are out of this world. I would definitely make this a regular stop if I lived in SFO.
author: Desiree G.

description:
OMG! The best Ahi Tuna Taco ever!  You don't expect this kind of fresh ahi tuna from this place but they definitely know what they are doing! 2 small portions perfect for a small light meal. I like the little sauce and some crispy onions (I think?) they put on it, but the place is so dark you can't really see exactly what it is.. 

Great chips and salsa too, although the salsa could have a little more kick (spice) to it.

The wait is too long on Friday night, but you can drink while you wait. The margarita is super strong!
author: Cartman P.

description:
Minus one star for the terrible service I got the first time I was here! 

The second time I came here was such a different experience! I'm not totally sold on the food (the tacos can be a bit dry at times, but those are the only things I've ordered so far), but the drinks are great! The staff was really friendly the second time around. Alicia, the hostess, was great at recommending items and drinks while charming us with her friendly demeanor. This place has a fun atmosphere (it does get a bit loud, but that might be because my friends are animals).
author: Christina D.

description:
Well, kids, here it is: 

I lived in Mexico for a hot minute, aaaaand, I am, well, persnickity. 
So, I gotta say..... the food here is unbelievably mediocre. 

EXCEPT for the Marina girl salad. 

The vegetarian taco filling was so "I've been sitting around in grease for hours, and am over salted, but not actually seasoned properly..."

Sad, sad state of affairs. 
The chips are not GF either. 

Of course, if you want to be picked up, or ogled, this IS the Marina, so, be my guest. 

Taco truck, anybody?
author: A. H.

description: Make sure you have an extra $20 to tip the hostess otherwise you will wait far too long for okay tacos. After waiting over an hour the food was underwhelming.
author: Madeline S.

description:
I was fleeing from a rabid pack of hipster-werewolves, when somehow I drove to the corner of change-my-life-amazing and I'm-going-to-die-if-I-don't-come-back-here-soon and I found Tacolicious. The tacos here are mind blowing! I've had them all, they all rock my world, end of story! 
The only thing that compares to the tacos are the hot,hot,hot hostesses. Either way, you can't miss! 
They say the tacos smell so good that hipsters can't go in this joint, because the good smell will rub off on them, and they will lose their musk of B.O. and bong resin.
The drinks at this place are just so-so, but after a couple pitchers of margaritas who cares?
Go here! It will change your life!
author: Alex K.

description: I quite like this place.  Food is good and prices are more than reasonable.  It's a bit squishy, but what do you expect given what they probably pay for their location.  My daughter likes to shop in that area and I'd definitely give this place another go the next time we're there.  Good service and good food.  What more can one ask for?
author: Lisa P.

description: I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. The service was mediocre, almost rude at times. The tables were small and the seats uncomfortable. The food was good but not worth the prices at all. I'd personally rather go to the mission and spend half the price on the same amount of tacos with better flavor. The house margarita was good.
author: Alicia S.

description: Some of the best tacos I've had in my life. The al pastor hit the spot. Not many places I plan to revisit, but this is one of them.
author: Or R.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE IF YOU HAVE FOOD ALLERGIES.

The wait staff does not know the specifics of the ingredients and the management could apparently care less if their food sends you to the hospital.

I used to frequent this restaurant so I trusted their food. Then they added the mole chicken to the menu. I've never heard of this so I asked the server what it was he said, "it's just a sweeter chicken." So I got it, ate it, realized it had peanut in it, which I am very seriously allergic to. I asked the server if it had peanut, he replied, "I'm not sure, I know it has some sort of nut, let me ask the chef." HMM... This is something a server should know!! Secondly peanut dishes always state so on the menu, I can't believe this wasn't the case here.

Anyways, I had one of my worst reactions, barely made it to the hospital in time, and had to spend 12 hours in the ER. Both I and my parents called asking to speak to the owner to inform him how dangerous this is and he didn't care enough to call back. I used to work in the industry and the GMs I had would NEVER think of ignoring something like this.

I hope someone takes the time to file a lawsuit on you someday, maybe then you'll get the picture.
author: Kristen R.

description:
I usually don't eat tacos when I eat mexican food because they are not very filling so I go for burritos instead. However, I just had to try some of their tacos here due to all this review and it definitely satisfied both my taste buds and my stomach. The tacos were filled with meat and pretty filling. I also enjoyed the complimentary chips and salsa that they generously provided. I got the 4 tacos for $13 deal and got a good variety of flavors. My favorite one was the taco of the week (short ribs). 

If you are around the area and would like a some tacos, try it out. I came here for lunch this time and I will stop by for dinner sometimes and maybe grab drink while I am at it.
author: Pin X.

description:
This place was cool, we had the 4 tacos for $13 and the non-alcoholic drinks were cool. The short rib and the deep fried cod was good. I would recommend it for lunch. I didn't see the ceviche appetizer that was at mamcitas so I was bummed, but over all decent eats at a reasonable price. I would come here again. 

Quick tip here: If you are vegetarian ask for plantans without the refried beans and let them know you want your tacos separately if you're particular about not having other tacos touch yours ;)
author: K T.

description: Busy, busy, but great tacos and worth the wait!  Very nice location too and youthful clientele.  Seem to always be busy.
author: Dino Z.

description: One word "chilaquiles". Have to try it. This place is great. It puts an amazing flare on some traditional Mexican dishes.
author: Bryan R.

description: These tacos are so worth building up an appetite for, especially the butternut squash ones (for this vegetarian, at least..). I also LOVE their "brussels sprouts a la plancha recado" that come with some sort of lemon/lime glaze. The atmosphere is fun: busy, but orderly. Our waiter, bless him, kept asking if he could clear our dishes because he wanted to be on top of his job, but it was a little annoying since we were still enjoying the complimentary chips and delicious salsa. Four words: yummy yum yum yum.
author: Hannah C.

description: Tacolicious lived up to the hype!  We shared the plantains - amazing - and then each got two tacos.  I had the rock cod and the short rib, and my friend got the vegetable and the carnitas.  All four were incredible, and the short rib is a definite must-order.  I loved the salsas that accompanied the tacos.  We both had the Pasion margarita with habanero, and while still delicious, was a bit on the sweet side and not as spicy as I had hoped.  We decided to go a little crazy, and got churros for dessert.  They were perfectly crispy on the outside and doughy in the middle.  An all-around wonderful meal with great service and a friendly hostess.
author: Rachel A.

description:
I am really glad that this restaurant is starting to expand down the peninsula! My friend and I waited about 30 minutes (they do not take reservations) on a Saturday around 2pm and we sat at the bar. LOVE the variety of salsas. Each of them has a ton of flavorful and were really delicious. The pasion cocktail we ordered was very strong, but the tequila did not overpower the other flavors so it was fantastic.
They seriously have the best guacamole I have tasted in a longggg time. I highly recommend ordering it to go along with the bomb, fresh chips. However, make sure to save room for tacos because by this point we were already getting full. 
We ordered 8 tacos for two people. BIG mistake! Do not order 8 tacos for two people! They may look small, but they put a ton of meat on them and they are very filling. We ended up only eating half of them, but hey, leftovers are great. Make sure to save some of the salsas to put on the tacos! We got carnitas, short rib, braised chicken, and chicken en mole. Short rib were both of our favorites. 
Even though we were sitting at the bar, our waitress was really attentive despite and our food came out fast. It was fun sitting at the bar admiring the variety of tequilas they have behind the bar as well as watching them prep all the tacos.
author: Alisha K.

description:
The wors place in san francisco The food is  terrible so bad no flavor in The tacos The carnitas so sweet and The salsas are no fresh¡,
San José taquearía in fillmore is much better,,
author: Hans G.

description: Great place for people watching and atmosphere if you're into the party scene. The food is not bad but it's been inconsistent for me and their salsa is pretty boring. I prefer mamacita down the street on the other end of chestnut.
author: K C.

description: Yummy yummy tacos!  Did find it a little dark and noisy but cool place with great service and great food !
author: Meredith C.

description: Well done Tacolicious. I'm Mexican and I grew on on the US/Mexico Border and there's nothing like a taco with a California twist. I'm must admit I not entirely a fan of Sonoran style Mexican food, so eating Cali style Mexican is always a treat. I was a bit skeptical of this place given its name but my boyfriend was super stoked on coming here so I went put all my opinions and judgments aside and went with the flow and I'm glad I did! Super friendly and attentive service from the moment we walked in. The place is a little tight inside and on my way to the ladies room I think I spotted a patio. Had we not been pressed for time we for sure would'vr explored the menu a little and definitely would've ordered cocktails. The guacamole, ahi tostadas and tacos (cod, carnitas and the special: cochinita pibil). The guacamole did not disappoint. The ahi tostadas were rich and delicious. The combo of the ahi, avocado and chipotle mayo made for a filling bite for lunch. The tacos were accompanied by different salsas. The tacos were all tasty. The cochinita pibil lacked pretty much all of the traditional flavors of the dish, but the meat was super tender so we can't complain. I sipped on an agua fresca and my bf ordered the horchata which was super tasty and made fresh. The atmosphere and vibe is fresh and fun. The music upbeat and our server was a delight. Even with all of the options in explore in SF, I'd return on another trip to San Fran.
author: Isabella J.

description: What else do you want besides they serve delicious tacos. Ambiance is great. You may think the tacos are over priced (of course compared to normal tacos). But they aren't really like any other tacos I've ever had. Service is pretty good. When it's busy (most of the time it is) they get you in and out. Nothing wrong with that. Enjoy yourself and eat some tacos with those drinks.
author: Evan C.

description: What's in the name?  In this case, the absolute truth.  Great tacos and strong drinks.
author: Jenn D.

description:
Great stop for lunch or just a snack!   I love their chips and guacamole.  Their lobster tacos were pretty good too, I ordered two for my lunch and it was pretty filling.  

We came by for a snack on our 7th stop of our SF Food Tour.  We had chips & guac with some blood orange agua frescas & horchata to wash it down.   If you need a break from shopping on Chestnut or need some fuel to re/start your shopping, this is a great place to hit the spot.

And I've been craving guacamole since!!!
author: Christina L.

description:
The carnitas tacos must be laced with crack....they are off the charts delicious!  I also love the rock cod tacos and definitely try the guacamole and chips.   The food here is simply amazing.   

The service is generally very good.  On very crowded nights, service drops a little for obvious reasons.  Very noisy when crowded.  Takeout is a great option if you live nearby.
author: Kurt L.

description: They bring out three salsa sauces (I forget their names) smokey one, creamy green verde one, and yellow one. I had the TACO OF THE WEEK - I highly suggest ordering it - this week was cactus - great service too. The busser/expo was on point and our server was friendly
author: Dana B.

description:
Went here with my friend recently and he summed it up best. "Tacos and delicious together? Sign me up!"

I can't say I disagree. Sat at the bar and had some tasty cocktails along with incredible tacos. Now I am a very big taco guy so its tough to please me, but these were pretty freakin good. The braised short rib alone is wroth a trip, but every one had a unique flavor and brought something new to the table. The best part is the corn tortillas on the outside - they are a revelation.

Just be prepared to use a lot of napkins - these babies are messy, but its just part of the tacolicious experience.
author: Mike P.

description: 3.5 stars. The tacos are great! The empanadas and queso dip aren't anything to rave about. The queso dip was like tostitos queso dip. The lamb taco and fish taco were delic! I loved the half and half frozen margarita. You have to ask for them to make it since it's not on the menu.
author: A.L. S.

description:
was in from boston visiting a friend in san fran- we went to tacolicious for lunch 1 of the days there. about 5 mins after being there, a server accidentally dropped salsa on the ground- and a little got on my purse. no biggie to me, i was able to easily wipe it off-

i was amazed at the response though. the chef came out, gave me his card, apologized profusely and offered to do anything necessary to make up for any damage to the purse (there was none)- and the entire meal was covered (we got 10 tacos and guac- so it was a lot of food totally free, for a little spill!) it was totally unexpected and above and beyond the mistake that had happened. i've been out and witnessed people have drinks get spilled on them.... and gotten a free drink and a so sorry- this was the 1st time i've had a restaurant be so gracious.

beyond the outstanding service/response- the tacos were really great too, and the guac/salsa really fresh. the bartender was super nice too! i'll def be back next time i'm visiting!
author: Kate M.

description:
A $9 street taco? Yes, one 3  1/2" in diameter tasteless street taco, $9. See the taco started out at $4.50, which btw is somewhat appropriately priced, but I asked if I could have my carnitas taco plain - no sauce, cilantro, onion, just meat. I also asked if I could substitute flour for the corn tortilla and add cheese. The busy/not overly friendly waitperson said 'sure, but I have to charge you a little extra'. Fine. When the bill arrived and I questioned how my $4.50 taco got to be a $9.00 taco she said 'I told you there was an extra charge'. Really? 

Terrible attitude and the food is definitely not worth the cost.
author: Jody G.

description:
I came here during my lunch break. Here has always been crowded and I wanna try for so long. It's a casual, loud and crowed dining area. 

We ordered 4 tacos/ $12 (beef, pork, chicken, cod). They are just fine but not superb. these tacos are petite (palm size). They didn't meet my expectation. 
albacore tuna tostada was a totally disappointment. albacore is so chewy by overloaded tendon. I had much better albacore at other restaurants.
author: JustinE Y.

description: The tacos are amazing. I dream about the habanero, passion fruit, lime cocktail. Tremendous.
author: Brittani R.

description:
Love it, love it, love it.  This place lives up to its name -- tried a handful of different tacos here, drinks, etc. Everything is what you'd want on a friday afternoon:  healthy, fresh mexican with solid drinks to back it up.

Love the vibe, energy, and mix of people in this place -- always seems buzzing with energy.
author: Steven L.

description: My partner and I had a fabulous time at Tacolicious. I had the veggie taco and cod taco. The veggie taco was a knockout, bursting with local, organic flavorfulness! We also shared grilled squid, very good. The pitcher of cocktail that featured a smoky mezcal was fantastic. It's hard to find this quality of selection of tequilas and mezcal anywhere else. We will definitely be back!
author: Mark S.

description:
Shucks it's overrated. I didn't want that to be the case, and was convinced "taco fusion" was going to be totally my jam - tacos made with quality ingredients minus the grime that's overdone in the mission. Perf plan. 

Unfortunately both the wait time and the inattentive service were enough to tarnish my overall impression, despite the "pretty good" tacos. 

The tuna tostada is on the 7x7 must-eats list. Fish to taco ratio was wayyy too skewed in the fish direction. Half as much fish or a little more sauce would be better. I couldn't even finish mine, and they aren't that big. The rock cod taco is just okay. The taco of the day was a "pollo tinga" which was pretty tasty. 

It almost seems like there was a great chef who planned this all out, wrote down instructions, and left people who didn't know what they were doing to execute. 

Best part of the meal, as others have noted, are the drinks, chips and salsa (free!), and then the made to order guac. If we didn't have to wait 45 minutes, and we just had that, this might have been a 4 star ordeal.

(ps - the marina girl salad - i almost want to give them an extra star for this. it's the most boring thing on the menu. joke appreciated).
author: Joanne S.

description: Generally I really enjoy this place but Tacolicious employees, please get your act together. I put my name down for a table of 4 and proceeded to wait for 15 minutes. A table then opened up and instead of seating my party, they seated a group that just walked in. When I asked the hostess why that happened she just said she didn't know my name was on the list and that we would be next. Ended up having to sit at the bar after she came to say we would have to wait another 20 minutes if we wanted a table. Overall not enjoyable and don't think I'll be going back anytime soon.
author: Ally O.

description:
I had an excellent lunchtime feast here. The place is cozy and wonderfully decorated and the staff is fun and helpful. We sat at the bar, which I highly recommend to anyone. As far as the food is concerned, between the house-made queso fresco and the albacore tuna tostada, I was singing praises before the tacos came out. Because I was completely stuffed after a few (delicious) chupitos and margaritas and plentiful appetizers, the tacos were almost painful to eat. Amazingly delicious pain.  Despite being full, I tried almost every kind and let me tell you- not one failed to be completely and amazingly wonderful. 

Tacolicous is the perfect name for this experience.
author: Elizabeth N.

description: Five dollars for a taco with shredded chicken?! You would think that for the hefty price tag the tacos here would be top notch, they're not. You would think that the size would be comparable to the large tacos at mexican places for three dollars, they're not. They're the size of the tacos that cost $1.25 from a mexican food truck. Go to a mexican restaurant instead, pay the amount you're supposed to, and get some tacos that taste better than this palce.
author: Anthony T.

description: The food and our waiter were good. We had to wait for a table a long time. Hostess was not paying attention to tables opening. But we tried to get a drink. Bartenders were to busy doing shots. When they did finally wait on us they were rude. We tried to order food at the bar. But again the bartenders wouldn't wait on us. They were just standing back talking among themselves and continued to take their own shots. We finally got a table and the waiter then was great!
author: Brenda V.

description:
So the Tacolicious saga begins one night when Bret and his friends fresh off the plane from NYC waltz in and fall in love;  tacos, Tasty MARGARITAS, and really cool staff (how you doin Heather!).  Ahh, this is what heaven must be like!

Then one fine February evening I met the  new hostess.  

She flippantly told me that the wait was too long for a table and the bar was first come first serve.  

Fine you little tart, I will stalk the bar and situate myself MYSELF.  The bartenders were good and got my pitcher right away.  Soon enough two marina guys exited the bar and me and my friend swooped in.  The hostess then abruptly tells my friend and I that THESE PARTICULAR BAR SEATS are for people ordering food.

Well excuuuse me.  So she offers it to two people next to me (ironically, I had already seen this couple waiting and offered them the seats before I sat down).  NO, says the other couple, THEY SHOULD SIT THERE.  

Well theres certainly nothing licious about that Taco.  As a Maitre'D at an extremely busy door in SF, I was sorely disappointed in the way I was treated, and you know what? the way I was judged.  Maybe I will be back once my pride is restored.

Two stars for the fond memories.
author: Bret O.

description: I munched on several tacos: short rib, carnitas, rock cod, and the veggie one with squash and several scorched peppers. And, had a side of drunken beans, which were very very tasty. I'd say that these were quality tacos, packed with taste. Unimpressed with the beer selection, so I went with an Anchor Steam instead of the brews south-of-the-border.
author: Derek N.

description: Be prepared for a wait but the food is well worth it. Me and some girl friends came down to sf for the night and decided to go here for dinner. We sat at the bar and were very well taken care of. The passion fruit habanero margarita was very tasty, but only if you like spicy! The chips and salsa are so yummy but the beer and something chicken tacos were AMAZING! The salsa platter they bring out with the tacos had three great options with each one being completely different than the others. We were waited on by the bar manager Jeremy? And he was very nice, though If you can't handle a little sassy sarcasm then you would probably misread him lol. Overall great food, drinks and service from the staff. Will definitely be going back next time I'm in the city.
author: Britt V.

description:
(ALBACORE) TUNA TOASTADA--

I went to beerfest with a couple of my friends and there was a Tacolicious stand. Got in line and ordered 1 tuna toastada to try.

Well, you know how people would say "Such and such is soo good, it taste like an orgasm in your mouth?" Honestly, I always thought that was a joke.......until now!! MYYYY GOODNESS!!! :) LIFE CHANGING, FOR SURE!!

ok, imagine sinking your teeth in-- 
slices of buttery-creamy-fresh avocado thats on top of chunky strips of R A W tuna (super fresh, butter in your mouth status, btw), all of which is laying on top of a crunchy toastada (deep-fried tortilla) with chipotle sauce (smokey and lightly spicy.) The way that this toastada is constructed is beyond words..Think of tuna tartare,..but in a grander scale. love!! :)

My description does not give this tuna toastada any justice; im basically describing what the toastada is consist of + adjectives. sighh..You just have to try it, to believe it. Next time when I'm in the city, I will definitely stop by this place! And so should you!!
author: Christine H.

description:
Another attempt at Farmer's Market-izing a traditional street food.  Humanely raised and organic ingredients as opposed to questionably sourced mystery meats.  Flavor experiments like short rib tacos instead of the generic list every taco truck in the Mission has.  A long line to order that moves at an OK pace followed by a 15-20 minute wait after ordering.  Some complain, I use that time to buy fruits, veggies and other treats from the rest of the market.

Short Rib Taco: A very thin smear of finely pulled short rib.  Extremely salty, so the portion is probably appropriate for the amount of tortilla, though the last bite felt like there was only tortilla left.  Would have been nice to have some less-flavorful beef mixed in to give it more meat  while still piggy backing off the intense short rib flavor.

Chipotle Chicken Taco: Chewy and charred little niblets of white and dark meat chicken.  Tastes like it had been marinated a very long time.  Tasty as far as grilled chicken goes.

Shot-n-Beer Pork Shoulder Taco: Not like carinitas, but still had a mélange of textures.  There was the very tender meat which must have been braised forever, gelatinous gobs of fat and chicharrón-esqe crunchies.  Probably my favorite taco of the three.

Corn On The Cob: The sweet, watery corn is contrasted well with the salty and tangy rub and the sour lime.  Could have been warmer, I mean the less sophisticated street fair corn-on-the-cob may not have as complex a flavor but at least it's fresh off the grill.  I saw a tub of pre-grilled corn that they warm up on the griddle. 

Nachos: Fresh salsa packed with an array of ingredients.  Chips leave more to be desired as they're too thick which makes them too crunchy and absorb too much grease.  I do like the coarse salt on top though.

Agua Fresca: A light blend of minced nectarines, lemon juice and water.  A much better alternative to those Mexican sodas with crazy amounts of processed sugar.  The straw was made of paper, which I appreciate from a green point of view, but it falls short on usefulness.  If you don't drink the beverage immediately, it becomes like a wet pixie stick and near impossible to drink from.
author: Adam B.

description:
They serve queso.  And you know what I'm talking about if you're from the south or even mid-west.  That alone gets 4 stars.

This place is a bit overpriced ($4 for a tiny taco) but absolutely zero complaints on the quality and taste. These tacos are delicious and if you order in bulk, you get a better value.  Great for groups to share.  Get in there...
author: Cade C.

description:
A restaurant that pays homage to Tapatio wins a star in my book!  Tacolicious is definitely one of those places where you have to use your outdoor voice inside. I typically leave with a minor soar throat because I spent an hour screaming at the person sitting across from me.  And then there's that gril who almost spills her margarita on you, or that guy who's sitting waaay too close.  Good times!

As for the food, the chips, salsa and queso are too addicting.  And tacos are the way to go!   And of course, a margarita (Frambuesa tastes just like a spiked jamba juice!). 

Party up in herrr!
author: Helen V.

description: Love this place!  Great tacos at low price and a super fun ambiance with good sangrias. This place really launched mainstream Taco craze in the bay. They are the pioneering trendy local chain taco restaurant. The best thing is each location feels different. These people know what they are doing. It's not just Taco Tuesday, you can call it Taco Today. It's a hip place everyday of the week. I give this place my 5 stars.
author: Foodie4sf E.

description:
SHUT THE FRONT DOOR!

So my coworkers took me out to the Marina to celebrate my birthday. I've lived in San Francisco for five years and have not been to the Marina so I was excited. I came on yelp to see the reviews and I was a little erked at all the neg and 2 star reviews. This isn't yo mamas taqueria joint. This isn't the mission filled with hispters. This isn't where you should take your friends for a cheap beer and tacos. This is a restaurant. In the Marina. You shouldn't really be shocked at the $3 price tag for tacos.

That being said. I loved it here. We came on a Monday night and it was packed. We wanted to sit in the front window so it was about a 20 minute wait but we all got a pitcher of margaritas at the bar and tried to talk to one another (so loud!). We were finally seated at our table of choice and started with chips and salsa and guac and the queso dip. Oh my god. I died. I'm sure it's about 5639126745 calories. But it was my birthday night. And I did not care!

I ordered the Tuna Tostada. Jesus. I died! The tuna mixed with the avocado and crispy tortilla melted in my mouth. I would have gotten a second order if I wasn't wearing such a tight top. No joke. I ordered the rice and beans as a side and they were a bit on the hot side. Just how I like it. I tried a shot-and a beer chicken taco which was great as well. I also snagged a side of broccoli which was prepared perfectly.

In terms of service, I'm sure it's always great it just seemed like the host we had was new.. or wasn't used/comfortable with working in large crowds. Which made me think she should REALLY consider switching from hospitality. She wasn't rude per se, but also wasn't very helpful when we asked her any questions. One of the guys working there recognized my boss and took care of us the rest of the evening and he was great! 

Great first taste of Marina. And a great restaurant
author: Amanda S.

description:
There's a reason it's always crowded. 

don't fill up on chips while you're waiting like the majority of the population. Save it. it's worth the wait. 

Creative, Gourmet, Freshly made tacos. 

Better to go with your friend than on a date. It gets too loud for anything romantic plus a drunk marina guy is going to push you by accident on the way to the table but just zone it out and focus on the food.
author: Noel H.

description:
Went there this weekend for the first time for a friend's bday get together. The seared ahi tostadas might just be my new favorite food in the city. 

The place is tiny and since there is only one bathroom you end up waiting in line for like 30 minutes, but it's a great opportunity to meet people if you're cool like that, so maybe they know what they're doing.

The drinks were great, the wait staff was friendly (our waitress was super cute), and it's funny watching the staff navigate the crowds with armfuls of dishes in the limited space.

I didn't get to try any of the other tacos, but I've been told that they are incredible and I am definitely looking forward to making the trip there again. The parking in the Marina is terrible, but this place is definitely worth it!

P.s. if you want a story of lost love, I developed a little crush on our waitress. Sparks flew, emotions ran high... she actually talked to me man. I gave her a quick back-rub (which I don't think her manager appreciated) and then she walked out of my life forever. Or maybe I should say I walked out. Whatever, she could have been the one.
