author: Peter B.

description:
Tacolicious is -- well, tacolicious!

Very tasty salsa's. Fresh tortillas. High overall fresh quality.

Nice fresh lime juice in the margaritas.

Recommend if you like tasty Mexico City style tacos.
author: Bruce M.

description: These tacos are pretty good but really over priced. $4 a taco is insane.  However I do love that their chicken tacos are made with mole!
author: Grace P.

description:
This place is amazing, who knew there were such great tacos in the MARINA?!

The staff is beyond friendly and helpful, in a space that gets a little rowdy.  The atmosphere inside is fun and loud, but not too overwhelming or pretentious.  Their ambient music only adds to the fun and young vibe, with a great soundtrack to back your delicious food.  

Their sangria with apple chunks in it is divine!  The tacos have just a little something extra that you can't describe, but they are definitely worth the slightly higher price tag.  Also, each taco filling is easily enough to fill both tortillas, so you basically get two for the price of one.  Well worth the trek out there!
author: Veronica B.

description:
I've had dinner in the restaurant a few times, but now that I have a newborn, I've ordered food to go the last couple of times.  The problem is they don't pick up their phones so you have to order on-line, which would be fine, but the website that hosts the actual ordering is horrendous.  It seems so basic yet it's been so spotty and frustrating to use, so I end up having to email the order to info@tacolicioussf.com and to my surprise, the General Manager responds almost immediately!  

So I sent my order and listed my time for pickup, but I got tied up at work and was about 40 minutes late picking it up.  The bag of tacos (with all the yummy salsa) was ready, but the GM said the food sat around too long and it wouldn't be any good.  She insisted that they redo all the food so it's warm and fresh - who does that anymore??????  And it was my fault for being late!  A waitress offered me a beer at the bar, and viola, within 5 minutes the freshly cooked tacos were ready to go.  Truly amazing service.  

I loved this place before for the food & ambiance and now love it even more for its service.
author: Y W.

description:
The tacos really are tacolicious!  The carnitas and fried fish are my favorite. 

 You can find them at the Ferry Building on Thursdays.
author: Ashlee M.

description:
First off, we went because the reviews were pretty good and it was a great warm Saturday for a night out. Simply put, the food here isn't very good, period.

 We had three different tacos, carnitas, mole, and chicken. All three were very average and a little dry.

We also had the squid and the much talked about tuna tostada. Both were very bland, poorly seasoned, and frankly dissapointimg considering how simple they are.

If you aren't too concerened about food or any attempt at an authentic Mexican flavor but want a lively environment to drink and maybe grab a snack, you will leave satisfied. Other than that, I suggest you keep looking.
author: Z P.

description: We eat here at least twice per week and the family loves it.  The fillet tacos are not cheap but it is grilled fillet after all.  I usually go for the fried fish or carnitas but all the meat varieties are great.  I love the salsa and the new app makes it fairly easy to order and a breeze to pick up.  The staff here are always helpful.  Absolutely a can't miss if you want some fresh Mex in the Marina.
author: Michael B.

description:
So, I literally just left this place...like a half an hour ago:

PROS:
***S-t-r-o-n-g drinks! (Cocktails) The glasses are small, and when it arrives you'll look at it like: "I'm paying $9-$11 for that?!?!?!" But when you take that first sip baby, you won't be dissapointed! 
***Pretty good chips and salsa! 
***The staff are really on their "game." When you're looking for them, they pop out of nowhere. And when you wave them down, they come with all smiles. My girls and I called our waitress like a thousand times. And she was totally cool. Yes, it's her job...but some people act like they don't want to work! So she gets a plus from me! 
***The food was pretty tasty. I had some dish that was made with tuna...currently I can't remember the name. 
***My dessert, (Chocolate w/sea salt and toasted bread, to dip.) was AMAZING! 

CONS:
***Back to the food...the dishes were actually considered small plates. We had to order in multiples, to really make a meal out of them. We were quite dissapointed by this. All of my girls, are fat kids at heart. 
***The bathrooms...or should i say bathROOM really pissed me off! Literally, there was piss all on the toilet seat and I think the floor as well! EWWWW! That annoyed me! Why, in all things that are sacred (especially in a crowded place like this) would you have ONE bathroom! A line was going around the bar. Doing waaaayyyy to much! 
***I felt like we, as in the customers, were literally on top of one another! The table next to us, was super overcrowded. Who told those goofballs that 15 people, at a table made for 8, was a smart idea? And they were overflowing on our side!

Anywho, those are just minor complaints. I would go back to Tacolicious again, for sure!
author: Lauren H.

description: Heard about this place through the wire and walked passed it a few times while in the area so I decided to drop in. Very welcoming environment , so decided to try more than just the happy hour menu. No exaggeration, but the "salt" on the margarita was better than the food itself. Great ambiance , down to earth folks but the food isn't hitting the spot let alone the price. My advice would be visit the mission district for better quality and quantity from ANY taqueria ... Any
author: Joe E P.

description:
Really fun spot with slightly modern takes on classic tacos.

Very fresh, surprisingly filling tacos stuffed with tons of meat.

The Fish Taco is one of the best I've ever had, and the Beer & a Shot Chicken Taco's were pretty solid along with the Chips and Salsa.

Really fun Marina vibe, but they don't take reservations so expect a wait of 30-60 minutes. Definitely would not suggest coming here with a group of more than 4 (2 people only, ideally)
author: Raza M.

description: Fantastic tacos - quick and efficient service. The short rib tacos were spectacular. Best michelada I have had outside of Queretaro!
author: Edwina P.

description:
- food: flavorful tacos, beans, and salsas
- atmosphere: noisy but fun
- staff: friendly 
- price: good value

additional info:
- their unique and amazing salsa is served with the chips
author: J. B.

description:
***Good***
Great tacos. Good prices. Chestnut street can be fun.

***Bad***
Gets packed. 

***Recommendation***
Try lots of different tacos and go during off-peak hours
author: Nick K.

description:
I've been reluctant to try this place because it seems so "Marina".  We finally gave it a try today and were quite impressed!  The queso was very tasty (and I pride myself on being a queso connoisseur) and the tuna tostada was tostadalicious!  My husband ordered the chorizo and eggs and everything on the plate was quite flavorful (don't listen to the reviewers that write that the food is bland, they don't know what well-seasoned food tastes like!). We ordered some tacos but had to take them to-go because we got too full...hooray leftovers!  Why only four stars?  Though some of the items were quite reasonably priced, others were a bit too expensive.  

 I can't wait to go back for "Burger Tuesday", genius,
author: a e.

description:
Tacolicious is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Saturday afternoons are my favorite days to go, it's often crowded and for a good reason. Start off with some queso or delicious guacamole & chips (very affordable) and a Tecate. I always get two fish tacos and am completely satiated.

My tip: Put the mesquite sauce on everything.
author: Jason M.

description: Fun place, pretty good food. The guacamole was good and I really liked the carnitas taco, but wasn't that impressed with the chicken or short rib tacos. Service was decent. Just a heads up, not really family friendly ie. no high chairs (only booster seats), and the booster seat they gave us was covered in black grease that stained both my clothes and my sons clothes. : (
author: Chelsea W.

description:
Came here for the first time about 2 years ago.  I was having dinner with some girlfriends of mine since one of them came back from Socal.  

One of the girls wanted to try this place because of their tuna tostada (which was on the Big Eats List in SF).  Tried it, wasn't too impressed.  Small and expensive.  

We started off ordering some margaritas and some mixed shots.  Delicious!  For entrees, we ordered 2 sets of the platter of 10 tacos to share..total of 20 among 4 girls.  Slightly disappointed by their quality of meats.  Sure, they were big chunks, but not the taste I was expecting.  I was paying $30 for 10 tacos, which is an average price, but not the typical average taste I can get at any other Mexican places.  

Decided to come here a couple more times, which was probably better since I arrived during happy hour time, totally beat the rush! First time took about an hour wait!  

I would recommend this place to friends since it's nice and trendy, but wouldn't come here on a daily basis.
author: Nancy S.

description:
I'm a sucker for a tasty taco, and TL doesn't disappoint.

So my husband and I pretty much share everything we order when we eat out. First time at TL, he orders the carnitas taco.  Takes one bite, is rendered speechless. I reach out for said taco. Denied. Told to get my own.

And I did. And yes. It was that good.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
Decided to check out this spot after a Mexican-American amiga raved about this place... So we stroll in. Busy, loud and cramped... That is as close as this place gets to what a Mexican taco place might be like. This place us tastefully decorated, the chairs at the tables by the window are not the most comfortable. But here comes the food... Delish! the most tasty tacos I have ever had. The flavord were so  exquisite and finger licking good. We ordered the guacamole which I am very picky with... It was perfect! We even ordered desert which was this large curl of chocolate with sea salt on it  and brief to spread on. Not a huge chocolate person, but the concept worked. 

I truly enjoyed this place and have already recommended it to friends and family. Bravo Tacolicious!
author: Amelia M.

description: Went to Tacolicious for the first time on 2/23/14, and really liked it.  It took a while to get a table, but once we were seated, we got chips, salsa and drinks pretty quick.  I ordered 4 of the beef short rib tacos and they were delicious!  The tacos come on 2 corn tortillas, so really there was plenty enough meat on each to make 2 full tacos each.  Great place to get tacos if you're in the area.
author: Christine Z.

description:
If you know me then you know I LOVE tacos!

The free chips and salsa are the best chips and salsa I have ever had! SO good and addicting!

Mararitas are a must!

The 4 for $12 tacos are way worth it! 2 tacos and I am full..especially with all the chip refills! My favorite  taco is the ribs.

The short rib small bites...was good..but not worth it. 4 small ribs. I'd rather get more tacos!

Be prepared to wait
Full bar...can be dangerous
author: Joanne H.

description: It's a sad day to end up in the Marina regardless.. but to be treated badly by the skrageley haired brunette working the door and told you were inconvenient because you wanted to sit outside is just pathetic. I'll never go back to this location. I left upset and sorry for the staff at that location knowing they missed out on a large party and a tip... boo Tacolicious in the Marina... take notes from the mission location... stuck up white girl attitude gets you no where!
author: Jonah W.

description: LOVE the carnitas! I am here at least once a week for the best margaritas and tacos! Tastes so fresh and full of flavor. Huge plus that it's dog friendly so I can take my dog with me to sit outside on those sunny days!
author: Jeanette L.

description:
Don't let the name fool you. It's cheesy, but the food is hardly that. I probably would've glossed over this place if it weren't for 7x7's Top 100 list. So I have 7x7 to thank.

Everything tasted amazing - from the recommended tuna tostada tacos to the carnitas to the fish tacos to the calamari taco. And I always say that you can tell how good the Mexican food will be by the chips they serve...and yes, the chips don't disappoint either. The tacos come with a trio of salsas but honestly, you won't need it - the tacos are packed with so much flavor already, sauce is just an afterthought.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
Not bad for the Marina.  The mission still has the best tacos in town and if you park a taco truck on Chestnut the line will be blocks long (but we know that wont happen) so this is as close as you can get to the real stuff.

I think the steak tacos are good but not for the price -- I am in love with the braised short ribs -- now that is a step above the mission -- gourmet tacos all the way.  The beer chicken is not all that great, the name sounds better than the flavor.

Service is fast (they need to turn tables so folks like me don't have to wait long), the people behind the bar are friendly and acknowledge your presence.

So if the area, drop in and have a few tacos.
author: G R.

description:
i LOVE this place!!!!

Do NOt be fooled into thinking this is just another taqueria-OR- worse another Craptastic marina joint catering to a crowd that think Chipotle is the benchmark for Mexican :-)  That being said, know that you are eating at a REAL restaurant, so you are not going to find $5 burritos of the menu. Just because there are a ton of drunk people, and it's a scene does not take away from the food though.  (And really how can you not be,1 beer 1 shot 1 taco $10's :-p)

The chef here (yes, there is a Real chef) is a Genius. I have never had a bad meal here. Salads are ALL amazing, Guac is awesome, Taco's, every one is soooo delish. Everything is made with local and fresh ingredients, you really couldn't ask for more.

To those haters making Chevy's comparisons...Please go, or go check out the Chipotle that just opened... less wait time for me :-)
author: Heather S.

description: I just can't get myself to like this place. I've been here three times now and every time the food is mediocre and the service is atrocious. Since the tacos were so bad the first time, I got the aztec chicken soup the second time. It was OK -- but bland. My friend got three tacos but couldn't get himself to finish the last one because the meat tasted so bad. Mind you, he is 6'5 and was starving. The third time I got the Marina Girl Salad with added chicken. It was good, but not worth $14. Also, all three times I've been here, the service has been unbelievably slow. The past two times, we've almost left because we've been fed up with the service. Also, the last time I was here, I overheard one of the waiters getting really irritated with another table. In his exact words, "They've been sitting there just staring at the menu for 15 minutes. It's like, order already or get out." I thought that was really rude and I gave him a death glare because I was really upset that he would say something like that about a customer, who was just taking their time to order. Also, it was really unprofessional that he would say that so loud that another customer could hear. Not coming back.
author: Hana K.

description:
We wate hwere on a weekend wafternoon.  My Mwom wate the chorwizo pwotato tacos, my Dwad the pork tacos. They were wery gwood. 

Our main compwaint is the wery smwall twables, not clwose to weing bwig enuff to weat on, and the nwoise level is dweafening! 

The woutside twables do not weven wave enough wroom to gwet between them and no wroom for us dowgs to be on the flwoor!

My Dwad sways we will weave it to the "twenty swomethwings" in the fwuture!
author: Finnegan M.

description:
Go here for the tacos! Do not try to get anything else. We tried their ceviche and enchiladas for appetizers and they were just ok. The ceviche was lacking flavor and the enchiladas were nothing special. The tacos were the main show stoppers of the place. Two tacos will fill you up. They load them with meat so they are stuffed. At first I thought $4 for a taco was pricey but if you buy more then it gets a little cheaper. My fiance tried their carnitas and braised short ribs and he told me that it was the best carnitas he has ever had in his life. I am still mad that I didn't sample it when he offered it to me. I tried the fish taco and the taco special of the day which was pork with green chiles and I thought those were quite amazing as well. 
The only thing I don't like about the restaurant was that the tables were very close together and it was very cramped. 
I will definitely come back to try their carnitas and eat more tacos!
author: Shirley W.

description:
Love this restaurant! But, it loses a star for mediocre drinks and an unusually distant staff on Sunday night.
Usually, the bartenders are more friendly, however tonight they were quiet and acted like they did NOT want to be there. My girlfriend and I waited for a seat at the bar for about 15-20 minutes instead of taking a booth, and the wait wasn't worth it for their attitude. The drinks, which I normally crave, were waaaay sweeter than normal.

The food made up for it all, and never ceases to impress!
I'll definitely go back, hoping it was just a one time, bad experience.
author: Alyssa A.

description: This place gets really crowded and the fact that there is one bathroom in the kitchen is not that great but its a very cool atmosphere. It took us about 5 minutes to get a table. When we sat down we got the taco platters and to tell you the truth I only liked one of the tacos I tried, the potato taco. Everything else had too much spice or flavoring for me. The drinks were pretty good and its a great place to hang out with friends.
author: Heather N.

description: Beautiful Sunday lunch. Good pitchers of Margaritas and great chicken mole and carnitas tacos. Fun sitting at the counter and certainly a lot of great people watching. The food is quality and interesting - not outrageously great, but really satisfying.
author: Kevin M.

description: I come here once a week for dinner and love it! Chips and salsa served complimentary and are tasty. The marina girl salad is awesome, and the chicken and fish tacos are also delicious (by the way, you can ask for the fish tacos to be grilled if you want a healthier option). Prices are cheap and service is fast, although we do always expect a 30min wait for a table for 2 during dinner hours. Much longer if you have a larger group.
author: Rachel D.

description:
Visiting San Fran and a friend that lives here recommended this for good 'meat' tacos. They have said that for fish tacos go to Nick's so we came here with them. 

The tacos are filled well with meat and on corn soft tortillas. Nothing more nothing less. If you like a good amount of filling of the important stuff, you will like this. It comes with 3 sauces of mild, medium, hot levels. We got the carnitas, short rib and special of the week which was pulled chicken and avocado. Very moist and tasty and really affordable. 4 tacos for $14 is not bad at all! In total, we ordered 8 tacos, two beers, two white wines and one order of churros, the bill total was only $64 for 3 people! Have yet to see that in SF!

Only downside was the dessert we ordered. I love churros and figured it would be good in this Mexican establishment. It took a bit of time to get the order and when it arrived they were hot but they were burnt :-( Overfried and crispy. We normally wouldn't be ones to send something back that it basic and a dessert but it was bad so we mentioned it to the hostess near us and they sent us a new order. This was softer but did still taste like old oil. So I would have to recommend against the churros. 

Other than that I would return here for the tacos and try others.
author: K M.

description:
I went here with high expectations.. and was sadly a little disappointed. It felt like a overrated, crowded, overpriced taco place. It's basically an upscale taco joint without the flavors of an authentic taco. Which was the disappointing factor. I thought the short rib taco was too salty, the fish taco reminded me of Rubio's (fast food joint), the chorizo was bland, and the tuna tostada wasn't tasty enough. 

I don't think I'd really ever crave to come here again... sad to say. I think i'll stick to the trucks, whole-in-the wall joints with authentic flavors.
author: Kristina L.

description:
We went here for lunch after walking around the Marina in search of a good lunch and fish tacos, and Yelp helped us find this fine spot.

As it was around 3pm, the place was pretty much empty, though there were some folks eating outside.

We were seated near the window and given chips and salsa, but no menus for awhile, which was fine since we were tired from walking anyway.

We ordered drinks (a margarita for the gf and something resembling a piña colada for me...yeah, i like the manly drinks), and then got a tostada with tuna, crispy leeks and a chiptle mayo, which was smoky and yummy.

We got four tacos (carnitas, mole, cod and short ribs), which was more than enough for two people and each were yummy, though the cod was pretty heavily battered (hardly fit in the tortilla!)

All in all, a filling and delicious lunch and a great way to end our trip out west.  Apparently they get really packed during the evening, so if you want a seat, come for a late lunch.
author: Jeremy M.

description:
I'm working my way through 7 x 7's Big Eat list so I hit up Tacolicious to eat a Tuna Tostada. My friend Danielle raves about Tacolicious like a woman possessed and although I never doubted her sincerity I wondered if any place could live up to the hype.

I know better now and urge you all to never ever doubt Danielle.

When we walked in they were playing Beastie boys and there was a big sign that said "Fingers not Forks". I smiled to myself and though "Well I've come home."

My husband and I got a Tuna Tostada, a fish taco, empanadas and pan con chocolate for dessert.

Tuna tostada-Perfect! I think the best part was the textural contrasts. There were so many layers: the crispy tostada, the creamy seared tuna, the crunchy fried leaks and the smooth avocado sliced on top.  The contrast of the tostada made it both rich and light at the same time, it was quite the balancing act. I wanted to eat 10 million of them, but you know, even a girl like me has her limits.

Fish Taco.-I really only like my fish tacos a certain way: The fish needs to be super crisp and light, the cabbage has to be crunchy but not hard. The sauce should be creamy and tangy but not heavy. Tacolicious totally delivered on my demands. 

Empandas-Not my favorite, the outside wasn't crispy enough but the filling was good.

Pan con chocolate.- At this point we were stuffed but I was off the rails in terms of being reasonable. I read about Spanish Pan con Chocolate in Amanda Hesser's "Cooking for Mr. Latte" and I've been romanticizing the idea ever since. I mean can you imagine? Toasted bread smeared with chocolate, a tiny bit of olive oil and a sprinkle of sea salt? I've been thinking about it FOREVER and it totally lived up to my obsessiveness.

Verdict: Is this the cheapest Mexican food in the city? No. Is it the best or most authentic. Probably not. Is it totally awesome in it's own unique way? Heck yeah! Do I command that you immediately visit Tacolicious and eat tacos without delay. Yes I do! And please for the love of all that is delicious, take me with you...
author: Emily P.

description: They really should consider expanding to the East Bay.  They offer a great variety of meats for their tacos, as well as vegetarian and vegan options too.  You can't go wrong with the chorizo, carnitas, mole, and they once had a potato option.  All tacos are served with  a selection of 3 salsas.  I tried their elote but I found it to be too salty.
author: Cynthia V.

description:
I ate about it... or dreamt about it.. or both?

There is something about their veggie tacos.  Walking distance to my cycle and sculpt classes- so they basically balance each other out.  Everything here is delish!
author: Kristina I.

description:
The Good: 
Chips= 4 stars (but I like light crisp chips, not the substantial type)
Guacamole = 5 stars
Tacos= 5 stars

The Bad:
Wait= 2 stars (1 hour and with no snacking allowed at the back bar while waiting?
Ambiance= loud as fuck. Dont expect to have any kind of legit conversation. 

I'd still go back, I'd just go earlier ;-)
author: Jodie B.

description:
Slightly more expensive tacos, but more than worth it for the ambience.  Delicious chips+ salsa as soon as I was seated.  I asked the waitress if the 10pack of tacos was too much for 2 people and she gave me a look of horror.  Two to four is standard, she said.  We both had 4 and it was just enough.  Taco special was Bahn mi, very delicious.  $18 per person w/o drinks.

No sign on entrance.  No restaurant name on menus. I think they are secretly embarrassed of the name.  

Employee attire was odd, did not match the ambience.  They were dressed in hoodies and jeans.
author: T Y.

description:
Tacolicious is awesome!

I have to admit, I did go through a mourning period for Laiola (the restaurant concept formerly occupying the same space).  The fact that the credit card statement still says Laiola brings back the tasty memories of gambas al ajillo and zesty tempranillos. 

However, Tacolicious just packs the house every single night and creates a fun atmosphere that is hard to beat, with really tasty tacos!  I also used to walk out of Laiola spending an arm and a leg, so the new taco prices--while higher than Taco Bell down the street--are very reasonable for the pretty high quality meal you are getting.

My tip:  stick with the spiciest sauce and try the guac.
author: Mike G.

description: We ordered the fish, short rib, chicken, chorizo, and carnitas. The fish taco was very good and the only reason that this place gets this many stars the rest were kinda salty and nothing special. I would rather go to nick's crispy taco's than this place.
author: Greg T.

description:
There is one place I dislike almost as much as the Mission: the Marina.

I understand that this is slightly hypocritical, as I used to be a sorority girl and I could theoretically fit right into the frat-boy-sorority-girl atmosphere in the Marina.  After all, I started wearing lululemon and I have a few pairs of designer jeans.

But the people just drive me nuts.  I mean. who likes eating dinner next to a big group of loud, drunk Marina guys who were elbowing each other, talking so loudly that we couldn't hear ourselves, and eventually shoving each other into the sidewalk?  And seriously, it's July in San Francisco, which means it's cold.  Who wears plaid shorts, a tshirt, flip flops, and sunglasses at 9 PM?

But other than that, I actually enjoyed Tacolicious, especially because I was in good company (not the frat boys).  The chicken and the carnitas tacos were delicious.  Both were already seasoned well enough that I didn't need any additional salsas or sauces, and all I did was squeeze a lime over the carnitas taco.  They were stuffed so I had to eat a bit of the meat with a fork before I was able to pull the edges of the tortilla together.

Overall a great dining experience.  Now if only they'd move this elsewhere..
author: Tori S.

description:
Our group has begun going here for our "Margarita Sunday" outings as of late, having had enough of Tortilla Heights.  Now, I am not a huge taco fan, but I've enjoyed several of theirs.  The Petaluma Chicken and Chorizo & Potato were quite tasty, and I LOOOOOVED the short rib taco.  Tacos also come with three delicious salsas:  a green avocado-based one, a brown, smokey-tasting one, and a yellow, much spicier habanero one.  (The habanero tends to be a little hot for me, but I really like the other two.)

The margarita / cocktail selection is also far superior to most other sit-down Mexican places I've been to, from the basic house margarita to more creative pseudo-margarita concoctions like "Tickle Me Telmo" and "If Honey Could Drink" (both of which we enjoyed enough to order a pitcher of, btw).  Lots of places try to get away with charging $9-10 for a margarita; I think these are actually fairly close to worth it.

I wouldn't give it four stars because, in spite of the fact that there are a couple of tacos there I'm happy to eat when we go, there are too many other spots, even Mexican spots, in the same price range where I'd rather eat, given the choice.  (Plus, it's in the Marina, which means a long-ish drive, hunting for parking, and the occasional bevy of drunk-n-rowdy 'bros breaking glasses and bellowing along to Weezer while you try to eat.)

Still, the refried beans are tasty, the ceviche isn't bad, and we really enjoyed the fresh-made guacamole, so I certainly don't go hungry when we're there.  All in all, as tacos & margaritas go, it's the best we've found so far.
author: Angela B.

description:
Real tasty Mexican food for the city.  The street tacos are average price for SF, but real good flavor.  The plantain app is delicious, too!

Good place to throw back a few tequilas!
author: Don G.

description: Holy Moly! The tacos here are amazing. We had a selection of 10 to share and some guacamole & tortillas. They were delicious. The wait for this place was long but at least they told us we had time to have a drunk and there's plenty of bars nearby. I'd defo go here again!
author: Kelly M.

description:
Their tacos are HUGE! Ordered the carnitas, chicken and fish... The fish was awesome, fresh and nicely fried. The carnitas and chicken were a bit much for me, there was a lot of flavour but my taste buds weren't prepared for it perhaps. 

Friendly service and will be back.
author: Nenette Y.

description:
When my friends who live in San Francisco first told me that "Tacolicious" was one of their all-time favorite spots, I'll admit I had my doubts.  The name "Tacolicious" brought to my mind an image of a dinky dirty hole-in-wall spot where the tacos are good but you're just not sure what is in them.  Not that there's anything wrong with that, don't get me wrong - there are PLENTY of taco spots I love exactly as I just described.

When we walked up to the place on Saturday night around 8pm, I was quite surprised to see a classy facade with little patio tables and heat lamps set up right outside.  You walk in there's a hostess!  And she tells us there's a 45-minute wait.  My friends insisted it was worth the wait, so we decided to go in and get drinks until our name was called.  As you walk inside, you notice how hip and trendy the place is right away, completely betraying the image its name called into my mind.  There is lounge/jungle house music playing and people drinking margaritas out of fancy glasses.  The place is trendy.  It is no dive by any stretch of the imagination.

We were able to squeeze in and get our margaritas, which were perfectly made.  Right by the bar is also where the tacos are prepared so we watched as they threw together taco after taco after taco, trying not to drool into our glasses.  The food looked absolutely AMAZING.  Not more than 30 minutes passed before the hostess came and grabbed us for a patio seat.  With the heatlamps on, the temperature was perfect.  I ordered 4 tacos total: canitas, chicken, short rib and carne asada (i THINK).  My two friends ordered only two tacos each.  The tacos seem small but they are stuffed to the brim with meat and very little else.  On my first bite, I literally sighed aloud of happiness.  It was delicious.  The meat was so tender and juicy and bursting with flavor.  I loved how simple it was - no cheese or lettuce or tomatos that I can recall.  Just simply meat and a little diced onion.  I wolfed down three and could not eat the last one, which one of my friends gladly helped me devour.  Of all the 3 that I ate, my favorite has to be short rib.  WOW, it was delicious.  Our tab was a little under $60, and that included 3 shots of premium tequila.

We seriously considered going back there the next day but they had other restaurants they wanted me to try before I headed back to Vegas, so until next time I'm in SF, I will just have to settle for dreaming of those delicious little tacos from time to time.
author: Mandi L.

description: I love this place because it is always lively, food is consistently delicious (hence the name) and the margaritas are homemade.  The taco's are packed with meat and 2-3 can fill you up.  The 3 dipping sauces are colorful and unique to this restaurant.  Try the Picante margarita.  It will blow your mind but be cautious if you're sensitive to hot foods.
author: Tyler B.

description:
Great dining experience here! It was a Sunday night around 6:00pm and we were promptly seated outdoors in the sunny Marina :) we ordered the following;

Fish tacos: amazing! Crispy and fresh!

Carnitas tacos: delicious, moist and not too salty!

Chorizo tacos: this was alright, a little too dry and salty.

Some drink with tequila,grapefruit and elderflower liqueur. 

All in all service was great, attentive but not annoying and food was pretty spot on.
author: Olivia H.

description:
MMMMMM!!!! I can't wait to come back on one of my monthly trips to SF to go back here! SO GOOD.

Their house margarita is the bomb.  Get a pitcher. Hell, get 5 pitchers.  You'll finish it...Not so much on their sangria.  Just a warning.

I could probably be ok with just having their chips and queso dip (GET THE QUESO DIP) and a margarita ("A" margarita, notice how I tried to act like a normal, semi-sober person? ha.)  Their tacos are excellent, authentic and pure.  Chilequiles are also magnificent.  

Service is friendly and helpful.  I may or may not have toppled over a stool to have to beg and plead for more queso dip because I was THAT IN NEED. But that is neither here nor there nor a testament to their service for any NORMAL customers...
author: Kelli P.

description:
Let's get a couple things straight - I love good food. I don't care if it's authentic, imported from the far corners of the earth, or handmade by monks who haven't spoken in 100 years. If the food is good, that's all that matters to me. 

APPETIZERS: 
Marina Girl Salad - the name kinda irks me because I'm not a Marina girl, (I rock snowflake long johns at Safeway when I'm cold) but the salad is actually really good. It's HUGE. Definitely good to share with people. It has a nice mix of flavors and textures ... avocado, pumpkin seeds, deliciousness... 

House-made queso fresco - UMMMM .... Can I say that there is no way that this can be more AWESOME! I like regular queso and was kinda output by the idea of honey on queso, but this stuff is amazing! 

Guac - spicy! A little too spicy for me sometimes, but I always order plenty of beverages to cool down ;) 


BEVERAGES: 
Chupitos - ridiculously AWESOME!!! I don't even drink Tequila and they were sooooo good! 

TACOS: 
Tacolicious is just that - delicious! I always order the braised beef tacos, but the chicken and pork ones are also yummy. 

SERVICE: 
I always have great service. I usually get the same 2 people every time I go and they are both wonderful. I stopped in around 6:15 the other night by myself and was seated right away. I asked for the bar so that I could watch them prep food. (Who needs food network?!) I got chips and salsa right away as well as menus and water. I asked if I could have just half of beer on tap as I was driving and can be a bit of a lightweight sometimes. I told them to go ahead and charge me for a full beer - it wasn't a big deal to me. I got my half beer right away and my food moments later. I didn't feel rushed even though the place was packed. When I was done I got my check and noticed that they comped my beer. I had a female waitress and definitely didn't get hit on, so it felt totally cool to get special treatment. 

As always, I'll be back!
author: Jennifer L.

description: My favorite taco place in the Marina. Fresh ingredients, great seasonings, strong habanero salsa and good guac. I love the Tickle Me Telmo margs. Share the tacos that come on a double tortilla and are overflowing. Strongly recommend, but check the time, as it's ways packed at expected rush hours.
author: Nick S.

description:
don't blame the place just its location. if you are in search for good mexican food you are on the wrong zip code. this white people mexican joint is just too white, posh, expensive and crowded and what not to be enjoyable. 
looking for real mexican food? pancho villa.
author: Augusto N.

description:
Finally made it to the mothership tacolicious, which I would call the restaurant of my dreams. Nothing but tacos up in here, and of course other things. 

It's smaller than I imagined, but still has a good atmosphere and beautiful decor (love that big ass Tapatio poster). Was able to sit right up at the bar because the tables and patio area were all taken. 

I've already had a taste of tacolicious at the Ferry Building, so upon looking at the menu I knew right away to order the braised short ribs taco. Of course, it was damn delicious, and I also got the taco of the day which was a chicken taco with some avocado on it. It was good, but I kind of wish I ordered another short rib one. And knowing how much meat they put in each taco, I'm really glad that I got two. I was in full on Anastasia Beaverhausen mode, gobbling up my tacos very happily.

The salsa they give you is really good, it was smokey and had this slow roasted flavor going on. The ceviche? Delicious!!! I recently became obsessed with avocado, so I loved it even more. Paired with a tecate, I had a very delicious lunch. And even better, Tim Lincecum was in the corner eating tacos. It was a dream come true. I'm coming back for sure! It's taco heaven!
author: Caroline L.

description:
Pretty awesome
Ate lots of chips + guac + fried plantains + margaritas here with friends..
Nice place to hang around..
author: Aditya M.

description:
I decided to try this place because it was on the 2010 Big Eats list and my friend would not stop raving about this place. This would've gotten two stars but they lost 1 star for the rude service we received!

My friend and I (both asians) came here during the NBA finals to grab some tacos because he has been raving about for some time so I wanted to see what it was all about. Of course the place was packed! But luckily for us there was a small table for us squeezed between two decently big groups. 

We sat there for a good 15 minutes before anyone even came to ask if we knew what to order. We thought it was okay because maybe since its kind of busy so our waitress was tied up. So finally after 15-20 mins she came and got our order. We each got 4 tacos for $12 and a pitcher of the sangria. 

I ordered the braised short rib taco which was REALLY REALLY dry and over packed with meat. traditional carnitas tacos also very dry and the petaluma chicken taco which was also dry. i didnt even bother to eat the cod taco because it was deep fried and i was just disgusted by the look of it. 

So the food was a bit of a disappointment but the service was worse. Our food came fairly quickly but while we were alread eating our food the white wine sangria we ordered did not even arrive yet! Usually I would expect the alcohol to be the first thing to come because it is obviously the easiest. And we were unable to get our waitress's attention at all. We had to end up getting the bus boy and let him know and he went at got our waitress. When she finally came with our Sangria she did not even look happy pouring it to us. And by the way the sangria was a rip off! it was not that great tasting and super small compared to places like cha cha cha...

at first we didnt think anything of how horrible our service was UNTIL they sat another party next to us, and it a big part of about 8-9 older (30-40s) caucasians. As soon as they sat down the waitress was there right away and attentive to their needs. After they ordered the waitress brought their drinks instantly (in about 5 mins). Of course me and my friend were like wtf? She went and checked on them every 5-10 mins. We never got checked on once. Anytime we needed anything we basically had to ask the bus boy! 

I've never felt so discriminated against and had such bad service at a restaurant ever. I dont know how stupid the waitress thought we were to think that we would not notice her being so attentive to her big group of older people and ignoring us the whole time.
author: Annie L.

description:
i'm going to keep this simple.

The meat is very tender and amazing rich flavor.

SALSA IS AMAZING!

& The Chef came out, and was nice enough to answer our questions about the ingredients he uses in the salsa.
author: mirium f.

description:
The tacos are...tacolicious, really liked the rock cod and beef spare ribs...the bartenders were attentive especially to the female customers :P

But of course being in the Marina, it is a bit pricey, and you can definitley expect a homogeneous, obnoxious "Marina" crowd on the weekends.
author: Kris O.

description:
The overall experience was poor.  The place looks super cute, but the stools suck, service sucks and the salsa has mint in it.  What a shame, b/c the day was gloriously sunny and we got to sit by the open windows.  We thought we had found a gem, instead it was a diamond in the rough.

My most recent mission has been to find some delicious queso.  I have tried 3 places and thus far and this one has been the best, but still not great.  The queso was thicker than I like, only marginally warm and there was no spice to it.  We asked for habaneros and got jalapenos, and I had to tug on the waiter's arm to even get those.

I probably won't be back.
author: Heather S.

description:
Awesome food! The albacore tostadas are amazing, pretty much every taco I've had here has been great. 
BUT.... The service totally ruins it sometimes. Unless there's a hostess there, everyone else pretty much ignores you. you know the service suck when you'd prefer to talk to the friendly bus boys than the standoffish waitresses.
author: Pam S.

description:
First of all let me just say, I am a customer service FREAK! For me, customer service is JUST as important as the taste and quality of food...

My boyfriend and I used to come here all the time when we first started dating, however this place is SUPER small.  I went to get us food last weekend on a Friday around 8, I couldn't even walk in.  There were tons of people!  I think take out is the best option however you have to order through the bar tender and I've ordered through him several times and he's such an angry dude! Not sure if he was having a bad day and taking it out on me...but he was so rude! and not friendly.  The food is yes FANTASTIC! the filet mignon tacos are my favorite! However if you get them you have to go all the way and get carmelized onions as well! It's a little confusing on the menu the way it's phrased it says 3.00 extra I'm not sure if it's for the meat or onions.  If it's for the onions, they barely put any on...one of my tacos had 3 slices of onion! I was not impressed.  Overall yes the food is amazing, but the ambiance during the weekend is overwhelming and the take out guy is so rude, it makes it frustrating to even want to go in there.  When I got back home the other day with our food, I told my boyfriend it was an unpleasant experience, and he was like ya, that's why I sent you to get it, I hate their customer service when you get food to go....sad that he knew this before I even brought up details.  He knew exactly which bartender I was talking about as well.... (Just a heads up I do tip occasionally if I get food to go, even though I've been told you don't need to, I still do it anyways IF the person is very friendly.  

If their online ordering worked better and I could order the filet mignon tacos + onions I'd prefer that, but for some reason it is not an option on the "ordering online menu."
author: Andrea V.

description:
I went here yesterday (Saturday) for a late lunch at 3 in the afternoon with my friends.  The wait wa nearly unbearable.  It took nearly an hour and a half to seat my party (admittedly large at 7).  Even when we were seated it took about 10 minutes before we were even noticed by the waiter.

On the bright side, I had a tasty prickly pear margarita while I was waiting.  The tacos were pretty darn good.  I had carnitas and short rib.  Of the two, I would recommend the carnitas.  Quite flavorful.

I give it two stars.  Mostly due to the service.  Maybe if I go back I will upgrade my rating.
author: Michael N.

description: Amazing food and drinks!  The vegetable taco changes with the seasons and is always magnificent.  The staff are very knowledgeable about what items can be made vegan. The atmosphere and service are clean and efficient without being pushy or stuffy.  This is a great place to take people from out of town.  The front patio is a little cramped, but it is dog friendly.
author: Jill B.

description: This place is great!  Best tacos I've ever had.  I recommend the short rib tacos.  The chips and salsa are also fantastic.  We come here every chance we get.
author: brett b.

description: Man, do I love this place! Delicious tacos of all sorts. Their salsa is AWESOME. Tequila list is endless. Try the $5 tequila+tecate+taco combo (i would add another taco though, because the shot's pretty large...) Small space, so it can get really packed; it helps if you bring jackets and are willing to sit outside. Not great for groups because of the limited seating--I wish they would expand!
author: Caitlin C.

description:
I am a sauce gal & these salsas rock! 

Best part of the meal is the 3 Delicious salsas served in style with just right amount of spice & texture to be scooped up with crispy chips or slathered on tacos. 

Rock cod tacos with red cabbage & creamy sauce, filet mignon with caramelized onions, drunken beans & special of the week: pulled pork with slaw were all delicious. 
Fresca drinks were refreshing but next time I am going for a hibiscus cocktail!

My friends swear by the happy hour: big beer, shot of tequila & a taco for $10....IF you can hang with the Marina crowd scene. 
Break out your "Preppy Handbook" & ear plugs if you want to give HH a whirl. 
I am done with my Kappa sorority days but not done with Tacolicious so I opt for a table outside. Good food without the frat frenzy. Bueno!
author: heather s.

description:
This place is expensive for taco's in SF, relative to the area it's normal. 

I took my friend here a while ago because it looked like a fun place to eat. We ordered a pitcher of mojito, this bacon bean appetizer (i think?) and 6 tacos which was a medley of short rib, carne asada and i forgot the 3rd pair.  The food was just average, but the bill came out to be $65.  

This was well over a year ago, I don't remember how the food tasted, but i remember exactly how much the bill was, this should say something about the place...

Bottom line - $65 for two people for lunch, 1 appetizer, 6 tacos, 1 pitcher of mojito. Granted, the pitcher was $30, making it $30 for 1 appetizer and 6 tacos. eh.   The mojito was strong though? if that counts for anything.
author: Randy N.

description:
I refused to go to Tacolicious for quite a while solely based on the name, but once I caved, I became a semi-regular there. The drinks are delicious (highly recommend the margaritas, the pasión, and the tickle me telmo. 

The tacos are pretty cheap and I don't think I've tried one I didn't like. The short rib is my favorite, and the taco of the day is usually something pretty creative, although it costs more. You can get 4 tacos for $12, and you can easily make one taco into two since they wrap them with two tortillas. 

My one big issue with T-lish is that one time the bartender overcharged my credit card when I ate at the bar one night (gave himself a 40% tip instead of 20%). However, the manager followed up immediately when I emailed them about it, and he sent me a gift card. Super shady that I was overcharged, but I thought the management handled it extremely well.
author: Megan S.

description:
Tuesdays were so tacolicious at Laiola that it permanently became Tacolicious. Muy bueno. Of course, it's still super trendy and packed every night, prices are jacked up ($3.50 for a small taco, which you could get in the Mission for $1.50), but it's a fun spot for Mexican food in the Marina and their margaritas and tequila selection (over 50) are amazing.

The braised short rib tacos are the way to go. The carnitas tacos are also good, but not as tender and flavorful as the short ribs. The made to order guac is very good too. If you live nearby, just place an order to go, and have a drink while you wait. 

If you want to have your own Tacolicious Tuesday at home, they also cater. They can set up a taco bar or rent out their Ferry Building stand. Hmm... wonder if they would make it down to San Jose. What fun they would be at my Connie On The Block Party!
author: Connie C.

description: This place always seems packed. The tacos are amazing, and the priced well for the quality. Just go here. Eat tacos.
author: Keith B.

description:
my office ordered Tacolicious for a work lunch.  the veggie taco filling is AMAZING. yum yum yum.  the veggies were perfectly seasoned & not overcooked (I wonder what they do when asparagus is not in season). had the rice, which was yummy.  chips, guac & salsa were top notch.  since it was a bulk order situation, I did not get to veganize the salad or get the veggie beans.  

on it's face, the menu does not have a ton of vegan options, but I bet they will accommodate (ie omit cheese)
author: Virginia D.

description: Of curse they are not the best tacos I have ever  had, I go to Mexico quite often to eat the best food  ever!! but they have something that  makes them really good. I think they have a great menu, and everything its worth to try. I love the drink options, jamaica con Tequila, cerveza carta blanca, michelada. the bad  part its that its always really busy so you have to wait, but its logic if it is a really good place!!
author: Jessica R.

description:
Came in for the final showdown between UConn and Butler with an empty stomach and open mind. (really no expectations in terms of who should win but that's neither here nor there)

We were seated after about a 10 minute wait (It was a Monday night but given the game was on, the place was definitely  bustling.)

I ordered the Sangria Roja - tasty but pretty standard.

The guacamole is addictive. I seriously could have polished off an entire bowl myself but social norms dictate that I HAD to share. *grumble*

 We split 4 tacos - the vegetarian option, the fish, the carnitas and the chicken with mole. All were stellar but i think due to the fact that the veggies, the carnitas and the chicken were all so strongly flavored, the fish came up slightly short. I love fish tacos so I would say in the future go for the fish, then the vegetarian, and then either or for the carnitas and chicken with mole. 

Two gripes: 1) the wait is pretty crazy. I came in once on a Sunday afternoon (there was a game) and it was completely packed. 2) The reason why 4 tacos for 2 people worked was due to the fact that we were 2 ladies who don't really eat that much. I can see this getting expensive very quickly if you had a more robust appetite.
author: Karen K.

description:
Had a fun dinner here with 7 friends on Friday night. We had to wait a bit  for our table, but that was fine, because we ordered pitchers of margaritas and those were STRONG. 
Tacolicious is very loud, but that's exactly what our group was looking for, a place to laugh out loud, drink, and have fun.
The tacos are a great deal, everyone in our party tried an assortment. I thought the rajas (peppers) were the most flavorful, but my more carniverous friends did not want to try. I also enjoyed the short rib and carnitas tacos, though found the chicken to be a bit bland. 
If I lived in San Fran, I would definitely go back.
author: Tricia K.

description: This place was great. Showed up on a Monday about 7 p.m. with the kids and got a table right away. Ordered some guacamole, which was great, and enjoyed that while deciding which tacos to get. My wife and I each got two tacos and the kids got cheese quesadillas. They're not much for adventure. All the food came out very quickly and was super tasty. If it was just the wife and I this would have been a place to sit back, have a few courses and enjoy the atmosphere. Cool neighborhood and vibe and the patio would be a good spot to hang out. Would be back for sure.
author: Scott O.

description: Tacolicious has redeemed itself as a primer taco and chip place.
author: gina b.

description: The tacos were good but kind of dry. The beer one was the short rib. They use 2 corn tortillas each which I find kind of odd...makes it even drier. Not bad but wouldn't go back.
author: Amanda S.

description:
It is my second time here and  the food quality is still the same... delicious or shall I say tacolicious!  It was late and we were craving tacos.. This place is open til 12am on the weekends. 

Suprisingly, we came just at the right time... there was no wait. We were seated right away!

You are started with their homeade tortilla chips served along side with 3 types of dipping sauce to compliment the chips and top your tacos with!The habanero (orange) my favorite. Not as spicy as you may think.  the other two: Cilantro(green) and Chipotle (dk red). This does not disappoint!

The ambiance: pretty casual.
The food: tacos tacos and mas tacos!

Our order 10 tacos/$29

3- Chorizo with potato (a must try, just the right amount of spice, house made chorizo and the potato just completes the pacakage)
2-fish tacos (Just enough batter, nice and crispy keeping the fish moist)
3- carnitas (juicy and flavorful)
2-Carne asada (your classic asada)

There is ample filling in each taco, no skimps here!
To drink I ordered a Passionfruit Moss- tasted like a passionfruit soda
The rest of my party had their Mexican beer... a little to filling for me, that late in the night.  I am a true fan!
author: Gladys B.

description:
It was a nice day and we decided to take a stroll and eat at a nearby restaurant and Tacolicious came to mind since we've been meaning to try it.

Atmosphere: F-

Right from the get-go, I was completely turned off by the atmosphere, it was filled with the typical marina crowd filled with ex-sorority and ex-frat boys; girls curling their hair with their fingers and guys chuckling in the corner as they drink beer and watch the game thinking they are the most important and most beautiful people in the world.  God, please stab me with a spoon now... I felt so out of place since we were definitely the minority of the crowd.

Staff: C 

The host was friendly and tried to get us seated and away from the annoying group before us that was blocking everyone from getting in and out of the restaurant.  However, the waitress was not friendly and made us feel really unimportant and not worth her time and energy.

Food: F-

Marina Girl Salad - WTH?!!  $10 bucks for a bunch of romaine, a sprinkle of pumpkin seeds and two chunks of avocado (1/2 cm square each) and handful of jicama cubes and 5 slices of radish all in a tiny bowl.  The dressing was just sweet sauce, the salad looked like it was primarily just romaine and really unappetizing when it came.  

Tacos - all lacked flavour, the meat was dry, everything was in a sweet sauce or marinade.  I felt like I was in an American Japanese restaurant where they just slapped teriyaki on everything and everyone goes "Ooooh, this is so good!"  

Salsa: lack of acid, just bland or sweet...boo - how can you get salsa wrong?!

I feel Tacolicious is catered to people who just want to go somewhere to be seen and it's not really for the food or for people looking for the PF Chang version of Mexican food.
author: Miss H.

description:
Dinner with fong and gozun at the Marina!!!

This place is always packed but the friendly staff and the atmosphere makes it worth the wait.  The bartenders are very attentive and sure as hell they did not make us wait for our beers =)

Past few times I came here....I'll say on average a 20 minute wait for our table.  That's really not bad at all considering the crazy packed crowd that seems to never leave.

Ordered the usual 4 tacos for $12.  Mixed it up this time with a filet mignon, mahi mahi, chicken and carnitas.  All 4 tacos tasted great and of course with the mild, medium and hot salsa they give you...you can mix and match to whatever flavor you want your taco to taste.  Loved their in-house sauce they make....gives the tacos an extra kick.

Add to that their bottomless nachos and yummy dipping salsa...and you definitely have a winner here.

Now if only they serve Guinness here............
author: Dave L.

description:
I can usually put away four tacos without a problem, but after 2 my stomach was ready to pop. They put a ton of meat on there. 

Had to really power through my third, get some deep lamaze-type breathing going to polish it off. 

They are deceptively filling, and seriously tacolicious! Had the carnitas and braised chicken. Great for lunch!
author: Melissa L.

description: Food is great. Healthy, authentic, and tasty food. Affordable, especially if you order family style. Atmosphere is warm and inviting. This is one of the best Mexican places in San Francisco. Locals and tourists alike can take great pleasure in dining at this amazing place.
author: James B.

description:
We went in on Sunday afternoon expecting a similar experience to my last visit - great tacos and friendly server.  Unfortunately, things could not have been more opposite this time.

There was one group ahead of us and we were told it would be 10-15 minutes.  That was fine - this was a busy day in the Marina so that wait time was better than we expected.  The people ahead of us were seated pretty quickly and we could see a couple of tables opening up so we waited patiently.  Meanwhile, a group of marina girls entered the restaurant and waited in line behind us.

The host came up to us and told us that we could sit at the counter if we wanted to, or we could wait another 15 minutes for a table.  I asked him if we could have the table that was sitting empty directly in front of us, but he became very awkward.  He stammered that that table was for someone else, and looked over at the marina girls behind us.  It was flat out discrimination against 3 gay guys in favour of 4 marina girls the host was hoping to score with.

Since we were there, and very hungry, we decided to take the seats at the counter.  Once we sat down we realized that the glasses and silverware placed out for us were dirty.  At that point we left the restaurant and none of us will be returning.
author: Andrew N.

description:
-Servers were friendly but extremely slow... I had to walk in three different times to get my own menu, tell them we were ready to order and to get our bill (they were not busy)

-Don't get the guac... $7.50 is a total waste for what you get

On the Up & Up...

-The albacore tuna tostada is OFF THE CHAIN!!! I dream about it. 

-The tacos were pretty good (Petaluma chicken and short rib) YUM
author: Natalie m.

description:
Went there for the first time today with my fiance. We've walked past there a few times but it's always been crowded, however as we were having lunch late we managed to get in straight away. 

We ordered the four tacos for $13 - chorizo/potato, beef shortrib, chicken and traditional carnitas - liked the mild and medium sauce the best. Delicious!  The chips and salsa was also great. Loved it so much I had to have another taco, chose the taco of the week. 

Like that it has an open kitchen. Would definitely go again - recommend checking this place out for a late lunch to avoid the crowds.
author: Lisette P.

description:
So I went here with a friend for lunch and not only were only 1 out of my 3 tacos good, but when we got the bill there was a $2.50 charge labeled as "SF Health".  When I asked what it is, the waiter said it is the same as Healthy SF (which you will sometimes on a bill as $.25 or $.50) and that it was so the restaurant didn't have to pay it.  Unreal.  That's almost the price of a taco. 

That's it...won't be going back there again.  

And oh yeah...when you take an empty water bottle off of a table and the customers have empty glasses, bring back a full water bottle....it's polite.

UPDATE:  I since have received an email from "Joe C." (http://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=9ltV6vP0HC72-Pd7rzmgQQ) and had these kind words to say:

"It's something you see on other restaurants' checks as $4.00 or $4.50, never 25 cents or 50 cents.  Get your shit right if you're going to write shitty reviews.  It's only 2.50 and it's for everyone's benefit - at least those who live in SF.  And they probably didn't want you camping around drinking more water than you probably needed.  I'm sure they're glad you're not going back.  Why you so stressed about water anyway.  You'd have more credibility if you need another cocktail - just saying.  Stressed out water drinkers are lame."
author: Jared P.

description:
This place was fantastic! I had heard a lot about it but had just never gone in and tried it out! 

First of all the salsa is DELICIOUS! Then, the best part happened... they have a happy hour special for $10 that gets you a taco, with your choice of meat on a corn tortilla, a shot of tequila and a beer!! Amazing! We also ordered the special taco with coffee rub and it was great! I will be back here for sure! The prices are low and the food is tasty!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Note to self: open a taco restaurant. 

Why? Because apparently you'll have so many customers in line for 'just OK' tacos that you'll never have to worry about going out of business.

First off, I do like this place (food, atmosphere, etc). Been there plenty of times. However, here's a quick recap of why it gets two stars (solely for the food and atmosphere):

(Rainy night, about 7pm).

Me: Hi, can we put our name in for a table of 3.
Hostess: Sure, it will be about 45 minutes though.
Me: (thinking that sure seems like a long time for tacos, but i was hungry and loved tacos) Sure that sounds fine. We'll be across the street having a drink.
Hostess: OK, but if you aren't here when we call your name we're giving up your place. 
Me: Understood. We'll come and check back every fifteen minutes or so. 

Fast forward 30 mins later. 

Me: How are we looking?
Hostess: About 5 more minutes, this table right over here is just getting up.
Me: Perfect! I'll go close out our tab and be back in 5 minutes.

Five minutes later after tab closed out at Horseshoe.

Me: We're here!
Hostess: Um, sorry, we had to give your table away.
Me: Uhhhh, but we literally were only gone 5 minutes.
Hostess: Sorry, we can't hold tables for people.
Me: Well, how long for another table?
Hotess: It's about an hour wait.
Me: Wow. Ok. Well, see you later.

END SCENE
author: Patrick G.

description:
I've been using Yelp for a while but never written a review. This place made me want to write a review! Fresh food, the best salsa I have ever had at a Mexican place (with the perfect touch of mint and spices), and prompt friendly service. Everything is quality from the meats to the napkins on the tables. The prices are extremely reasonable as well! I wouldn't call this place authentic but it is definitely delicious and a must if you are in the Marina area!

PS. There's a picture of President Obama enjoying the tacos as well in the restaurant!
author: Sonia L.

description: Awesome tacos and margaritas!!! Chips and guac were fantastic. I really liked the pulled pork and shrimp tacos. With spicy mango margaritas. Sitting outside on a nice sunny day makes it all better too. Wow! We all loved this place.
author: Tom C.

description: Great Pina Coladas and Chalupas! Food is exceptional and comes out promptly without compromising flavor nor presentation. The tortilla chicken soup has a great hearty broth and is great for the soul in such a way that gingers should stay far away from this delicacy. The carnitas taco is some of the best carnitas you will taste, there's no shame going to town on 3 or 4 of these just like there should be no shame in going to town on yourself mid afternoon. I recommend both on your lunch break. If you really want a treat, try the Jack in the Box tacos, home made mock up of those Jbox tacos you used to get late night drive thru 2 for a buck, theyll remind you of that last resort (big boned) girl you had sneak in the back door at 3am in college but didnt tell any of your friends about, except this time your going to want to tell everyone. And If you do switch hit, play ball and try a beet and goat cheese salad or a veggie taco, both have a wide array of bright and colorful veggies, but might leave you feeling unfulfilled. Most likely cause youve never indulged in some fresh tuna. For this, the tuna tostada is of highest of recommendations. Nice raw fleshy pieces of tuna tossed with soy sauce and lime juice, paired with a chipotle crema, avocado and fried leaks, this tuna might challenge your fiance's fish when prepped at its finest, and before you know it, this food outing quickly may be turning into your first affair, or your second. After your done devouring down on that tuna, your quickly looking for another taco to munch on, but you need something to counter that salty briny tuna, and your looking for something a littler darker and sweeter, perhaps more forbidden. Boom, the chocolate taco. The homemade chaco taco for desert. Handpressed waffle shell with fresh vanilla ice cream, fully dipped in chocolate. Once your finished, youll feel like this culinary journey has been something like that of a wizards sleeve, and it was.
author: Brian D.

description: All tacos are outstanding, drinks are good, service is quick, music unnecessarily loud.
author: Mike D.

description:
Recipe for Tacolicious:

One part Mexican street food-style tacos
One part shared plates, a-la Spanish tapas style eating
Two parts old friends sitting around a corner table
Splash of trendy Marina location
Hot sauce, such as Chalula, to taste.

Combine ingredients in an ice-filled cocktail shaker.  Shake well and strain into salt-rimmed margarita glasses.  Serve with a lime wedge.

If I lived in San Francisco I'd be a tacolicious lush.
author: CB M.

description:
I'd heard mixed things about this place from my friends that have been here, but was craving Mexican and was in the area so I gave it a shot. And I'm so glad I did!

It was pretty packed when my friend and I came in (Tues. evening, around 7:30pm), but the wait for a table ended up only being 15 minutes or so (bar area is first come first serve). 

They bring out chips & salsa to start. Really yummy salsa. Chips on their own could've probably used more salt, but with the salsa it's perfect.

I ordered the asparagus/potatoes/garlic/mushrooms taco and the enchiladas de pollo. Both super delicious. And more than filling.

But then we also ordered not one, but two desserts. Seriously way too much food, but they were both great: traditional churros and laiola's pan con chocolate.

I think the portions here are pretty generous and the prices are all more than reasonable. I definitely recommend this place for more than just  drinks/small meal before going out; I think the food on its own warrants a visit. 

Obviously an added benefit is it does have a fun vibe with a delicious looking drinks menu (and a selection of really cheap delicious looking shots/chupitos as well... ). My friend had ordered the 'moss' (non-alcoholic containing passion fruit, pineapple, and sparkling lemonade) and it was very tasty, so I imagine their cocktails are all awesome as well.

I think the name 'Tacolicious' is a bit misleading in that they really have a lot more to offer than tacos, and I'm not sure I'd say their tacos are even the best food items on the menu. On Tuesdays they have an additional menu to order off of which includes a make-your-own-taco platter for $12 and items like nachos and quesadillas. Everything looked really good so don't be afraid to not order a taco!
author: Richa A.

description:
Holy crappers this place is a total scene.  It was packed when we got there around 8 and it was packed when we left after 10.  Crowd was filled with lots of "girls night out" and "post college frat reunions."  This is definitely the place to be to have dinner before barhopping in the Marina.  Although I'm not sure how well heavy Mexican food goes with a lot of alcohol...I imagine the aftermath to be not so pretty.

The hostess was super nice and managed the wait really well.  Our server was good but could have probably been better if he wasn't flirting so much with the 2 girls at the table next to us.  Drinks were quite tasty.  Had a drink at the bar while we were waiting and I saw fresh mint so I just asked the bartender to make me a drink with mint in it.  He came up with a Mexican Mojito that was good.  Best drink of the night for me thought was the Pasion...so so tasty if you love passion fruit.  Cocktails are $9 which is not outrageous but also not wonderful.  Oh guy friend pointed out that you have to look at the beer prices to know if a place is overpriced so just for reference they have Modelo on tap for $5.

On to the food.  Food was good.  Probably not better than the Mission or some taco trucks but authentic enough.  Favorite of the night was the tuna tostada...pleasantly surprised that the tuna was served raw and just love the big hunk of avocado.  Also had the plantains and the ribs...both okay, friends seem to really like the jicama salad that came with the ribs.  Tacos were not skimpy on the meat and came with 3 salsas that were good.  Had the carnitas, short ribs, beer chicken and chorizo...favorite was the chorizo.  All in all not a bad meal to start a Saturday night out but definitely be prepared to wait and when you actually get a table it'll probably be a tight fit.
author: Jen C.

description:
I was rather appalled by the quoted 1+ hour wait for a Friday night. Then again, my bad for going out to the Marina District on a Friday night. For a party of 2, we were told it was going to be a 1+ hr wait, but in actuality, it was only roughly 30 minutes. Sweet!

SALSA & CHIPS (to start)
Um, it's free so YAYUHH!!

TUNA TOSTADA
This is a must-get! It's a bit on the spicy side but omg, so gooood! I would have been happy to eat 5 of these that night.

COD TACO
The best taco out of all 6 of them. Well, I can only vouch for 5 of them since we did not want to try the veggie taco.

BEEF TACO
Soft beef -- 2nd favorite taco.

PORK TACO
DRY! Beware...

CHICKEN TACO
DRY! Beware...

CHORIZO & POTATO TACO
This was very intersting. It was the BF's favorite one out of the bunch but to me, the potato added to be too much starch and the chorizo had a weird funky flavor. 

You might think 10 tacos between 2 ppl is so little but note that each taco has TWO tortillas on it so it's a lot of carbs. And I don't know about you, but carbs fill me up! 

The waitress actually forgot to bring us our drinks so at the end of dinner, we told her to take it off our bill. She did so, but was so kind that she brought us our drinks anyway and said it was on the house. Talk about some great service! By the time our drinks came, we were so full that we couldn't even drink more than half of it. I had the "Tickle me Telmo" which tasted like any other margarita and the BF had some spicy drink that tasted like liquid sriracha and tabasco. No thanks.

I'll come back to Tacolicious but I don't think it'll be anytime soon. I read reviews where people say that Nick's Crispy Tacos are better and yes, to some extent I do agree that they are. Although, Tacolicious makes a mean Tuna Tostada! Mmm!
author: Heidi C.

description:
Every time I tell people, "lets have tacos" they always think of a low-end hole in the wall.  Anyway... Tacolicious is good... NO GREAT.  These are some of the best tacos I have tried.

The food is of the finest quality and the service is friendly and efficient.  The restaurant is rather small, but has a trendy upscale feel with casual-classy atmosphere.

Some tacos are better than other and my favorite is the braised pork.  Juicy, not greasy, solid texture that melts in your mouth.  Try it!
author: Nathan E.

description: Fine for what it is.  Easy and fast, and middle scale taco resturant.  The tacos aren't amazing, and the rice needs to be fixed, but the chips and salsa are really good.  Try the cod tacos, skip the steak tacos.
author: Alf O.

description:
Why are you so far away from me, Tacolicious?

And to think, my main reason for visiting this place is because I fell in love with their website (it's beautifully designed, vibrant, and totally functional to boot).

We shared a bunch of tacos and a flight of tequila. All delicious.

I'd love to revisit whenever I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Chung N.

description:
They don't sell burritos, so don't come here looking for one. Now that that's out of the way...

I order the tacos here, so I can't vouch for anything else in terms of entrees. Of their regular tacos, I'm most fond of the guajillo braised short rib and the carnitas. I might need to give the chorizo and potato another shot, but I remember not loving it the only time I tried it. Tacos of the week in the past have included duck carnitas (yum!) and lobster (hell yeah!) and generally have piqued my interest. The accompanying salsas are also good and range from mild to very spicy.

The horchata probably isn't traditional. The mouthfeel was unlike most horchatas that I've had. It wasn't bad, but I think it might have been made with rice and/or almond milk rather than the way it's usually made.

Good margarita selection. Micheladas are nice and refreshing.

Is it as cheap as the Mission? No, but they use sustainable meats and use produce from farmers markets, so there you go.
author: Diana O.

description: fun place to go before heading out and about in the city. Tried the cod-taco (which lacked flavor) and the flank (which was nice and juicy) and also have tried a variety of their drinks and they are pretty yummy!
author: Yas G.

description:
My fav tacos in town - I crave this place! 

Chicken tacos, tuna starters, green and yellow sauce + spicy margarita! Yummmyyyyy! The name of the margi escapes me right now, but its spicy and wonderful!! My husband loves the Palomas and pork tacos.
author: JULIE V.

description:
I have a feeling people come here to see and be seen, and to drink and be drunk, which explains the long wait. Food-wise, this place is a bit overrated. Slightly too greasy tacos. Meat was overcooked. "Made to order" guacamole was most definitely not made to order. We actually saw the cook staff take the ready made guacamole bowl out of the fridge. It had a great bang of onion, but not much else to spice it up.  Chips and salsa were pretty good.

If you're anything like me, you'd come here for a good time and the eye candy more than for the food, but would probably end up ordering a couple tacos after a few drinks.
author: Roxane W.

description:
Move over, Nick's. Step aside, Mamacita. Tacolicious has the fun Mexican restaurant party amosphere thing on lock. 

We showed up around 9 pm on Saturday and the place was packed with good looking young singles doing shots and enjoying a lively atmosphere. Rather than have us stand outside in the cold or feel stifled by the crowd, the hostess let us wait across the street at the Horseshoe until our name was called. One beer later, she was at the bar's door, letting us know our time had come.

We were seated at the bar, and I don't know if it was because of our serendipitous location, or because we were two girls coming in already a bit loopy from a few hours of day drinking, but we were treated like queens!

The waitstaff, and especially Head Chef Telmo, were exceedingly accommodating with all of our drunken requests and questions. We came for the tuna tostada, but wound up being wooed by a number of other tasty bites on the menu. You really can't argue with their special - for $10, you get a taco, a beer, and a shot of tequila. 

I'm not really one for tequila, but the food was superb. Spicy upscale taqueria food at its finest. We each had a taco - I had the carnitas and my roommate had the fried cod - and while I can't speak for hers, mine was a little slice of street taco heaven. They come with three dipping sauces (a mild avocado, medium chipotle, and a hot habanero), but if you have the inclination, ask for the "white lightning" sauce. I'm not sure what was in it, but it's for those who really want to test the strength of their GI tract. 

We also split the plantains appetizer, but the real star of the show was that tuna tostada: crispy corn tortilla, spicy aioli, tuna tartare, and large slices of avocado. The spice was never overwhelming, and all of the flavors complimented each other well. 

By the time we wandered out of Tacolicious close to 11, my roommate and I were in general inebriated agreement that it was our new favorite Mexican place in the city. Flavorful spicy food, fantastic service, and an early contributor to the oft-repeated phrase spoken the following morning, indicative of a great night out: "I am never drinking again."
author: Devon S.

description:
This place was definitely "TACOLICIOUS" :) 

I am not a big fan of eating tacos because every time I take a bite into one, everything falls out! I found this place on yelp and really wanted to check this place out! This is such a fun place to go to and I am definitely excited to spread the word about this place and bring my friends here for a "taco night". 

Who knew tacos could be made to taste so good? The good thing about this place is while you are waiting for your food to come out they give you fresh chips and salsa. The waitress probably thought I was a pig because I finished the basket of chips and got more! The salsa had such a unique flavor to it that it was so addicting to eat.  I ordered the 10 tacos for $29. The original tacos and the filet mignon were my favorite 2 taco types to get. The bad part about getting the filet mignon tacos is that you pay an extra $3 for every filet mignon taco you get, but let me tell you it is definitely worth it! The meat was cooked perfectly (medium rare) and was tender and so juicy. The meat that was in the original tacos were just as good. I like that they put just amount of meat in the tacos so everything is not pouring out when you take a bite into it. Also, they use simple ingredients to make their tacos, but it is so flavorful and literally tastes so DAMN good. The sauces that the tacos came with were such a good extra to add to the tacos! 

10 tacos were probably a little too much, since I could not finish, but it was a better deal than getting 8 tacos for $24. The way the tacos are placed on the dish makes it too good to eat!
