I think I took so many pictures of it to savor the moment. Every time I look at my pictures of the tacos it makes me hungry and more excited to come back! The name of the restaurant sounds so fun!!
author: Katrina T.

description: I had read the reviews and decided to give tacolicious a try. The food was ok. We would probably never eat their again though. Smaller portions and very plain food. Not great flavors. The music was so loud that my husband and I couldn't even have a conversation and the waitress was so rude at first. She got a little nicer towards the very end, possibly hoping for a good tip, but at the beginning she was absolutely terrible, and not just to us, to everyone! So, if I were you I would skip out on tacolicious and try somewhere else!
author: Megan B.

description: went to this restraunt with some friends.  There were six of us and we all had a great time.  The food was good and the service was fine. It is definitely a place to go if you want to be loud, comfortable and just at ease of having a good time. It is cafeteria style so if you want privacy then go with a group so you can get your own table.
author: ed s.

description: Yum! My sister, friend and I stopped by for a late lunch/HH/snack before dinner. I saw guava on the menu in another drink and ordered a guava margarita. It was amazing! The chips and salsa are homemade, fresh and delish. And the 3 of us ordered the 4 tacos to share (beer chicken, chorizo, chicken molé and fish) which we all enjoyed. They also had quite the crowd going for being in between meals. I loved the name of the place and that's why I chose to go there, but I left loving the food, service and atmosphere! Open a Tacolicious in Seattle please.
author: Breea R.

description:
This place is great...here's why: 
-Always seated in 10 minutes or less
-The drinks are out of this world good - really unique
-Guac is fantastic, fresh and makes the even the delicious salsa ashamed
-Carnitas - always get one of these
-Cod taco - yup, one of these also
-The salsas that accompany - try the yellow just for fun :)
-And just to top things off, try the taco of the week - I haven't been disappointed the last couple of times.
author: Natasha T.

description:
I read this from another review that Tacolicious is a corporate-esque taco restaurant. That's the vibe I got when I walked in. Contemporary. Ironically, I came here with my co-workers during lunch. 

It was around 11ish-12pm and the place was about 50% occupied. We were a party of 5 so didn't have to wait.

When we sat down, the table was a bit small for 5 people so we pulled the table next to us closer.

The food is enjoyable. There is a good amount of meat. The free tortilla chips w/ salsa were addictive! I believe we cleaned up 3 baskets of it. The salsa was good but would've been better if it was spicy.

My only criticism was that our server had a bad attitude. It was more of an aura that we felt whenever the server would check up on us. 
This isn't something that would deter me from returning to this place. I figure, we're all human and we have our good and bad days. I understand.

Overall: A nice place to mingle with friends over some tacos, if you're around the area. I'm a fan of the classic taco shops/restaurants so I could be a bit biased in my review.

It's worth to check out.
author: Jason N.

description:
I had their tuna tostada since it was the 7x7 list.  I have a soft spot for ahi tuna, so this was probably a win for me from the start.  But the way the crispy leek, tostada, avocado, and tuna just melts in your mouth...oh my god.  So good!  You only get two to a plate and they're small, but since I was already binge-ing on their delicious chips and salsa, I left feeling pretty full.  

Next time I'll get their tacos and sangria!
author: Jane N.

description: The #1 taco spot in the area by a wide margin. Everything is well conceived and expertly prepared. The service is rapid, large group and kid friendly, and the booze selection is solid.
author: 1 D.

description:
This place is great! But you already know that. Here are some tips:

1. Go at a weird time or you'll have to wait. Especially if you are more than 2 people. There is always a line!

2. Get the ahi tostadas!!! Ohhhh my deliciousness.

3. The carnitas are the best of the tacos, but definitely try a sample platter.

Enjoy!
author: Joshua J.

description:
As a native from Los Angeles, I've had my generous share of delicious tacos. However, since I live in San Francisco now, it's been a bit hard finding places that have great tacos (or maybe I'm just blind lol). That was...until I came here. 

I've come here twice in a week and wanted to make sure my experience was consistent with my first time there. 

These are the tacos I am ranking based off the deliciousness factor starting from the best:
1) Guajillo braised beef short rib taco
2) Traditional carnitas
3) Chorizo potato taco
4) Petaluma chicken taco
5) Summer squash, corn, market peppers, chard

I've yet to try the rock cod and filet mignon tacos!
author: Thomas L.

description: Good tacos, relatively fun atmosphere and decent service. I'll be back
author: Meaghan C.

description:
I finally made it out here on a Sunday afternoon, after hearing about it from a couple of friends. The place was PACKED; we had a 30 minute wait for 4, but it was worth it.

I loved the guacamole; it's fresh, chunky, with a a bit of tanginess. I munched on it with chips during the whole meal. I could tell they use quality ingredients in everything from the salsa, to the tortillas, and meats.

I tried these tacos, with my favorites first:
- the taco special of the week, carnitas cooked in duck fat. it's soo good it should be a regular.
- rock cod
- chicken mole
- chorizo

They also give you three different hot sauces (mild, med, hot).  I wanted to try every taco on the menu, but I can't eat that much anymore.

I'll definitely be back and I look forward to the mission st location on valencia.
author: Jermaine R.

description: Tough neighborhood cause it's a destination place (at least in my opinion). But when I find myself in north beach I will definitely return! Bartenders and staff are super knowledgable! Managers (Jp was the manager who approached me) were super cool and checked in often- making me feel like a VIP! The guest next to me bought me a shot (bartenders choice) he poured me siete leguas reposado (something awesome but reasonably priced) without knowing that I'm in the industry. This tacolicious is the best I've been to. You should come here with friends and/or family...perfect for both! Great time! Can't wait to go back....
author: Ashley M.

description:
Went here on a whim on a wednesday.  Turns out thats the time to go, every other time I've walked by its been dripping with polo shirts and highlights.  We were seated right behind Laurine from Top Chef.  So, that got me pretty excited about the whole thing.

-First of all, their salsa with the chips is enough to make me brave the chestnut chaos.  I think we ate 3 bowls of it.  Its yum yum.

-*MARGARITAS*  I hate them.  But I loved the Fresca one (or 2 pitchers) we had.  They had fresh peach and lime.  They were so good.  I'd like to try some of the other drinks they had.

-We each ordered 4 tacos.  I had: carnitas, fish, chorizo  and the veggie squash. John got 2 carnitas, a short rib and a fish. I wasn't too hungry, next time I'll have to work up more of an appetite for these bad boys.  They were all great besides the squash one.  It just had no jazz. 

on a side note, why must all street tacos have 2 tortillas???  why?  There is no need.  I always end up peeling one off.
author: jessica b.

description: Chips and salsa are bomb. Michelada is the best in town. Food is meh and overpriced!
author: S. V.

description: Yes, it's a little pricey for a simple taco. But it's SOOOOO good. And fun. And in a killer location. T-Lish always keeps me coming back for more. Also try the nachos and guac.... they are amazing!
author: Ryan M.

description: Pretty good tacos in the Marina. Is that an oxymoron? JK JK. They were decent for the price/quality. Service is usually pretty friendly. I've never sat at the bar, but it's always been crowded. It's definitely a lively loud atmosphere. The sangria is kinda small, but tasty. Having trouble deciding which tacos to get? Make at least one of your choices the Cochinita Pibil. I will not lead you astray. Slow roasted pork. It's super tasty, and you can wash it down with one of the chalkboard drink specials. Chips and salsa.. same old. So, if you find yourself out here craving tacos, Tacolicious is not a bad option. 3.5 stars.
author: Donna H.

description:
Tacolicious helped make my baby's first birthday party a huge hit! I was hosting a party that was mostly adults with some kids. Therefore, I needed food that would appeal to a very diverse crowd. I am not sure that anything could have beaten Tacolicious. People raved about the food, which was indeed delish - and Kory, the catering manager, was amazing in his execution. It was, for the most part, the perfect amount of food - hard to achieve with a group of 40+. 

Kory delivered and set up the food himself. All we needed to provide were serving dishes and utensils for the sauces, etc. I am telling you - if you have a catering need, this place is your answer. I had never had the food before, but recommendations were strong, and I just went with it - so glad I did.

Thank you, Tacolicious!!
author: Kiesha R.

description: I normally like Tacolicious a lot.  I usually have to wait for a table and don't get much service, but I figure the food is good so I can overlook that.  But, I recently went there with a friend for dinner.  We split the bill and I left an 18% tip on my credit card slip for my portion.  The waitress took it upon herself to add more to her tip.  I just found out after looking at my credit card statement.  Not only is that illegal but makes it so that I won't return again.  Shame on you Tacolicious waitress!!! I took a closer look at my bill and noticed that Tacolicious in the marina also included sales tax on the sf healthy fee.  Why am I paying tax on a tax???  I don't think that's legal either.  I hope you change your bad business practices before you get caught.
author: Dotty L.

description:
Great food, great atmosphere, great service.  I would come just for the fresh chips and salsa. 

 I know there has been some negative reviews on the wait time but I have been by three times, twice with a party of 2 and once with a party of 6, and never had a problem.  All on the weekend may I add.

Extra thumbs up to the the hostess!
author: Tisa O.

description: My husband and I eat here on a weekly basis. We LOVE T-Lish!!!! The Ahi Tuna Tostadas (with soy sauce) are amazing, the staff is amazing and we will continue to go here regularly.
author: Jessica L.

description: This place is too loud...decibel level too much.  Oil dripping from chips. Oil dripping from tacos. Too expensive. One taco $ 3.95. Four tacos $ 14.00. Mike's cheese dip $7.50. Head back to the Mission District or the taco truck. We were disappointed.
author: Steve K.

description:
Dear Tacolicious,
How do I love thee? Let me count the ways. You have finally answered my need for a delicious sit down Mexican food restaurant that is severely lacking in this city. Typically I would have to go back to my hometown of Santa Cruz for tacos and margaritas that hit the spot - now I go here!

The highlights?
- Always get the guac. Just do it.
- Always get the queso dip - don't ask about the calories, just do it.
- Always enjoy the salsa - love the minty undertones I get from it.
- Always get a platter of tacos - my favorites are the crispy cod, chicken, carnitas (and I don't eat pork! Ooops!) and the short ribs. Also love the vegetarian options.
- Refried beans are straight forward and a great place to dip extra chips.
- Rice is like how my husband's grandma makes! Delish!
- Margaritas are on point.

The also upside? It seems like the servers and staff at Tacolicious are having fun working - service is always great and food is delivered w/ a smile. Highly recommend.
author: Jen L.

description: Definitely Tasty tacos!  Cool presentation, and the service was professional.  We walked over from our hotel, had pre show drinks and dinner.  I would definitely reccomend.  My only complaint is that the tacos were a little overstuffed in my opinion.  Hard to complain about that though!
author: Tripp S.

description: Tacos are totally overpriced and not tasty at all. I tried every single one and was not impressed. Weak!
author: Mark C.

description: The tacos were pretty great! BUT when I spoke to the manager Sandro and brought to his attention a misleading price on the menu he did nothing to accommodate me. Zero. Our server did a great job, but overall it was a disappointing customer service experience for what seemed to be a fairly established restaurant.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Came to Tacolicious on Tuesday, in observance of Taco Tuesday. I wish they took reservations! I arrived before my friend, so I had drinks at the bar, but I felt like I was constantly in the way. Tacolicious looks like it would be one of those Americanized, overpriced, and flavorless places, but I must say, I was fairly impressed with their tacos and their CHILE CON QUESO (mike's cheese dip). The whole patio followed suit, in seeing our queso dip. My favorite queso I have had in a while. And that speaks volumes. For the tacos, they have this pick 1, pick 4 or pick 10 tacos offering . My favorites were the fried local rock cod and the chicken in mole colorado.  The veggie one with the asparagus was a bit on the salty side.

It was a very lively crowd, and all patrons seemed to be enjoying their food. It is a Marina offering, so it comes with Marina prices, but thankfully the quality of the food was equitable. Will come back, since I live down the street.
author: Tammy H.

description: Came in shortly before close, was very active/noisy. Ordered some tacos and it all tasted real good.
author: Victor C.

description: Stopped in during the lunch rush - they were quick, clean, friendly, fair prices. I had the weekly special taco- some chips and salsa, and churros. Took the churros home for later. The chef (one of em) kindly saw me taking the churros to go and made sure to give me a container for the delicious churro sauce. It was as if she read my mind! Can't wait to return - and recommend highly!
author: Jeff K.

description:
Why review something again that you've already given five stars to?

Consistency my dear yelpers. Consistency.

Many can make tacos so delicious they have to be filled with crack once, but six or seven times? Only Tacolicious can do that.

The staff is ridiculously gracious, and doesn't forget about you even when they're so slammed you can't see the walls. But forget that, you won't even notice the walls once you down some of their top shelf margaritas and sangria which obviously have some sort of addictive nature to it besides that they're topped with alcohol and if you smoked next to me while I was consuming them I'd probably start a massive fire.

The owner, Joe, is a total rockstar, and is smart; he stays consistently present in his restaurant while his chef Telmo (no, not Elmo folks, there is no "Tickle Me" in this sentence) oversees quality of the food and happiness of the eaters.

Flan, that's my one new word of the day. Telmo and his sous chef worked on it consistently until they now have what I would like to calmly call, "One of the best effin flans I've ever had, period." Denser, with a thick syrupy sauce that smells reminiscent of the crusty top of fabulous creme brulee, they've hit it.

Tacolicious has you covered, from guac to alcoholism, and does it with style.

To the Tacolicious crew: Just you wait until Cody and I get you our  "project". It's going to be the new Tacolicious logo and grace your clients backs as T-shirts that will be coveted. GOD SAVE THE UNICORN!
author: Danielle S.

description:
So ONE star only! Why? Because the beef taquito was good...I say taquito because they aren't even tacos they use small taquito tortilla and for the price I don't think it's worth it.

Went in with my bf one day, forgot when, but the service was SLOW and there were 4 customers in and like 10 employees? How is it possible to be slow? The waiter was was okay..I didn't find him to be friendly or rude he was just okay...but he didn't know anything about the menu I asked him a couple of questions and his answer was he wasn't sure, or it's what the menu says. I can read I know what it said but I'm askin you on your opinion! 

Honestly, I wouldn't return to this place ever, I rather walk 2 blocks down or less maybe... to eat at Chilayo. For me it's way better and more filling!
author: Yessica H.

description:
Delicious, again.

The yellow tail ceviche tostadas are delicious!

Always a great atmosphere and always great service. 


Tips your bar and wait staff!
author: Mario T.

description: We were dying to try Tacolicious after walking past it a few times before. Yesterday we finally made it and are so glad we did! The wait was long to sit outside, but only because there was a party of 14 that just sat down before us. We didn't have a choice but to wait because we had our dog with us. The staff were very nice about it though, and offered to bring our dog water and even let us snack on some chips and salsa before we sat down. Delicious chips and salsa (on the house). The salsa was the perfect balance of sweet and spicy. I think the salsa is flavored with mango! My favorite fruit is passion fruit, and what do you know?! They had a passion fruit margarita! It comes spicy (hot), but you can ask for them to leave out the spices. I had one spicy and one plain, and enjoyed them both. The tacos are family style (and they're out of the over in just a few minutes) and come with some cheese and lettuce, then you top them with three salsas they automatically bring you. I had the chicken, and my husband had fish. They were both delicious. Didn't try desert since we were stuffed but we are looking forward to returning.
author: Kelsey K.

description: THE WORST TACOS I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. OIL DRIPPING OVER PRICED SUPER SALTY TACOS EVER. not to mention their sauces are weak and they only give you a tear drop amount! Get real. I'd travel to la vics for some real tacos or super taqueria any day. this was a big disappointment. NEVER again, nor would i refer anyone here.
author: Farah J.

description: On any given afternoon or evening in the Marina, you are bound to see a full house at Tacolicious and for good reason- it is one of the best places to eat in the area.  We went on a weekday afternoon around 1, and I was surprised we were seated so promptly- the place is pretty small so it fills up really quickly.  I highly recommend the guacamole, and don't skip out on the chips and salsa- they are simply amazing.  For my meal, I decided to order an avacado salad, and we all split a tray of fish, beef, and chicken tacos, all of which were awesome.  I love that Tacolicious has a wide range of options and appetizers, including many vegetarian options, so it is really a no-brainer if you are with a bigger group.  Tacolicious is definitely the place to visit anytime you are in the Marina!
author: Shannon W.

description:
I loved Laiola but never made it in as often as I'd have liked. Parking in the Marina makes it hard. But of all the restaurants in the Marina, it was one of my faves...especially the medjool dates stuffed with chorizo and wrapped in bacon. Laiola closes and Tacolicious opens. What to think?

We made our first visit yesterday for a Sunday lunch. It was packed...a good sign. Fifteen minutes later we had a window table and a friendly waitress bringing us chips and salsa. The chips were thin and the salsa was really flavorful...not spicy but really fresh. A pitcher of margaritas was on the way as we perused the short menu. Believe it or not...it was mostly tacos! How's that for truth in branding. Essentially the heart of the menu is six different tacos with a handful of sides, starters and chupitos. The tacos - chicken, veggie, cod, carnitas, chorizo-potato and short rib. We split five tacos (no cod) and a side of drunken beans.

The lunch progressed nicely. The tacos were superb. Service friendly and excellent. Margaritas fine (not the best tequila but for the price just fine) and oh yeah, the tacos were superb. All in all a simple, delicious fun meal. I may not enjoy eating here every day but I'll enjoy every day I eat here. Terrific stuff.
author: Gary C.

description:
Sure, it was crowded and loud, and we waited 20 minutes for a table for two at 7pm on a Thursday, but it was worth it. The food was fantastic. They nailed the ceviche, perfect balance of whitefish and shrimps, citrus flavors and herbs. While most people think "kale salad, yeccch," if you don't like kale salad after this place, you have no taste buds. As for the tacos, fish taco was pretty good though missing some crispiness, chicken taco pretty flavorful, cochinita a little flat, carnitas rocked. Solid four stars. The salsa was so good we asked for a to-go container and they brought us a pint container of the stuff. Having it on scrambled eggs this morning. 

Despite the heaving crowd, the servers were prompt and attentive and always checking back to make sure everything was okay. The bus staff really deserves the Order of Merit, constantly circulating, refilling waters, refilling chips, topping off the salsa, all while maneuvering through a packed scene. 

However, someone needs to tell the bartenders to stop ripping off customers. We ordered a cabernet and a beer before we were seated, and the bartender told me it was $18. I rounded up and gave him $20. Steep, but I guess understandable being the Marina and all. Later during dinner, we ordered another round of the same drinks. When we got the dinner check, the drinks were $12. So the bartender had given himself a 50% tip on our first round, to which I then added on my own tip. NOT COOL. So, next time, so long as I order drinks from a waitress who hands me a receipt, all is good.
author: Mark R.

description:
The food here is pretty good. The good stuff includes the interesting salsa. I have never tasted salsa like this, in a good way - I think it's the fresh mint. Of the tacos we ordered, the standouts were the chorizo and potato, the braised short rib and the carnitas. The chicken one was pretty dry, and the fish one was so-so. They give extremely generous portions of taco innards (meats and such) so you certainly get your money's worth.

The fresh guacamole was decent but not mind-blowing.

The chips were super greasy. Tasty, but eating a bunch made you feel a little sick.

The real downside to this place is how incredibly loud it is. Everyone has to talk super loud so you can barely hold a conversation.

Their setup is also a bit stupid for such a busy place. It's unclear upon walking in while it's busy if you're supposed to seat yourself or not. 

There was also a slight attitude throughout, though our server was perfectly fine.
author: Peter C.

description: Margaritas and tacos were delicious! It was busy and a little hard to hear each other but the food and drinks were on point! I got the fish and the special, he got the vegetarian and the special and we were both very happy! Yummy!
author: Megan C.

description:
Appearance: the overall look of the restaurant is very nice looking.  Dark wood, nice looking bar, awesome high top tables near their large open windows, great outside seating(great for people watching) and large tvs. When my fiancé and I first arrived at the restaurant it was packed and all they had was outside seating. It was a little cold out but they have heat lamps so that we ended up sitting outside. There was a football game on so it was nice to be able to watch the game while sitting outside.

SERVICE: the customer service was excellent. Everyone was really kind and made us feel welcome. Even though it was their lunch rush, we did not feel like we needed to rush through our meal. As soon as we were seated our server immediately brought over chips and salsa, waters and asked us what we would like to drink. I asked the server which margarita was his favorite and he told me the Thyme Margarita. I'm so glad I got it! It was delicious! He also recommended tacos for us to try (they are served a-la-carte so you can choose many different types which is nice) The server was really great and we never felt pressured to leave. Even after we had finished our food and paid our bill, the server brought over another basket of chips and salsa so we could enjoy the game  and our margaritas for a bit.

Food: My fiancé and I each ordered two tacos and that was plenty for us for lunch; he had the carnitas taco and the braised beef short rib taco and I had the fried local cod(which you can also get grilled) as well as the veggie taco. The tacos were served on white dishes and on the side were 3 different types of salsas. 

Overall: Service was excellent. Prices were good. There are a lot of other items on the menu that look delicious and I can't wait to go back and try some more from this great restaurant!
author: Whitney S.

description:
Drip drip drip - that was the grease that came out of my taco. Yes, it is trendy and super popular. Good ambiance and happening to say the least.  The chips and salsa were good as were the three flavors that came with tacos. Since we were eating at a taco place, I got three tacos and each were so greasy. The chicken, beef short ribs and carnitas. I think I  liked the beef and carnitas more, but since I was feeling sick for eating so much fat and grease, I really couldn't enjoy it. 

I think this place is good after drinking, when you need to soak up the alcohol with grease.
author: Natalie S.

description:
I ate here a couple weeks ago with friends, and am just getting around to the review.  

DON"T BOTHER EATING HERE.  It was WAY overpriced, they only had five kinds of tacos plus a salad actually called "The Marina Girl Salad."  Eew.  The menu is seriously lacking.  The tacos were just average.  It's  more worth your while to walk across the street to the great hole in the wall burrito place next door to The Horseshoe. I love that place!  

They are getting two stars instead of one because our server was very friendly.
author: Christina N.

description:
SUMMARY: Not "omg amazing" but satisfying for a flavorful afternoon snack.  (Nighttime however, would likely entail commingling w/drunken marina crowd, so do at your own peril.)

NOTE TO TACOBAR in Pac Hts: Listen up, this place has two critical things that you, Tacobar, lack: (1) tacos with actual flavor and (2) free chips & salsa (delicious too, i might add).  I left satisfied, w/a fully belly.

AMBIANCE: Two of us came here for a late lunch on Saturday, approx 2pm, after a brisk stroll along Crissy field (wearing workout clothes/running sneaks, but didn't feel out of place).  The place was packed, but we got seated within 5 mins. While it was rather bar-like/rowdy inside, thankfully we got a table vs. bar counter that made it less marina d-baggy.  I can only imagine what a scene this place is at night (pass!).

FOOD: 
Tacos: ordered 4 (chicken, pork, beef, fish) and was pleasantly surprised. First, they pack a lot of meat into those things (w/the exception of the fish taco, which wasn't as meaty) so they are dense and filling. Meats were savory, tender, juicy. I loved that the tacos come w/a tray of 3 little salsas. Each taco tasted different and had its own seasonings/flavors.

Chips and Salsa: Free is good.  But better is that they tasted good! Big ass bowl of delicious salsa, not your typical salsa, a bit more finely purreed, some different herbs in there. So if you're not too hungry, the chips/salsa and a couple tacos will do the trick without breaking the bank. 

Fried Plaintains: Sweet delicious.  A bit heavy though.  Nothing stellar.
author: Caroline I.

description: Great tacos. Crowded and small. Great drinks. Get the frozen margarita, it was not too sweet and very smooth. Better than on the rocks, and I prefer on the rocks. short ribs were awesome! Carnitas are the best choice!!
author: Drew N Chelsea R.

description:
We were led to the bar  to be seated which I thought could be a potential fail but they surprised me! 

Front Desk-First Impression: We walked in and the place was packed, at first it seemed as if we were on our own, but through the crowd we were immediately greeted by a friendly and sweet hostess that put our name on her list instead of leaving us hanging.

Service: Very good (and cute) waiter, busser, and food runner but a half star deduction because the waiter took too long to drop the check at the end of our meal. When it's time to go, it's time to go!

Drinks: Yes! Cucumber margaritas were fantastic !

Food: I am deducting a half star because the chips were luke warm/cold and oily.  The Cod, Pork belly, Carnitas, and Short Rib tacos are making me crave more as I write this review!
author: SF M.

description:
4.5 stars.  Carnitas, beef and fish tacos were delish.  My friend and I did the 10 tacos for $29 and tried all of them except the veggie.  The chorizo potato one was mushy and tasted weird (maybe the combination was off), and the chicken one wasn't great-- the sauce the chicken was cooked in was strange and not that tasty.  

The space is small and crowded, so it's loud and you're sitting really close to other people, but good for a casual taco night out.
author: Kari L.

description:
Went last night (as usual). Service was awesome (as usual). Tacos were delicious (as usual). 

But...

I hate to say it. I gotta say it. The chips were stale. 

I cannot bring myself delete a star from my beloved Tacolicious. But I just thought...I just thought someone should know.

UPDATE:

The owner, "Joe", contacted me via Yelp to address these stale chips. Is he the real owner? I don't know. Was it a form letter? Perhaps. 

Nonetheless, based in this new information, I am changing my rating to an unprecedented SIX STARS.
author: Scott W.

description:
I'm reviewing the catering part of the restaurant.  I went to a party and the hosts got Tacolicious to cater their little get together.  I had the chicken, carnitas and beef rib tacos.  Those were the 3 choices but all 3 were excellent.  Even more props to them for making it taste so good when they're not in their own kitchen.  The sauces were also really good and chips and guac were delicious.

I can't wait to go and try the actual restaurant!
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Good food but REALLY REALLY BAD SERVICE. I went at the recommendation of the 7x7 list.  The food was good but the service was some of the worst I have experienced in a long time.  This is a Mexican place that charges a significant premium price which therefore means a waiter should at least check on you during your meal.  Every time we needed something I had to get up and tackle a waiter to get them to help us.

It is too bad the Tuna Tostada and the tacos were good because I just can't return to this place after such a negative experience.  I'm used to eating in hole in the wall restaurants that have much better service and lower prices.

I really hope the owners read this review.  They seemed to have figured out the food in the kitchen but have no clue as to what customers and service are.  All of this could be easily fixed with just some basic management.
author: foodiewithadrawl S.

description:
Working in the Mission District, I wasn't too excited to go all the way to the Marina to eat Mexican food for lunch, but that was in the middle between my friend and I.

Atmosphere was relaxing and friendly, doesn't hurt being on Chestnut St and it's sunny out. 

Food was surprisingly creative and tasty and the sauces had some good kick. Had the marina girl salad with chicken and the taco special with shrimp.

Service was a bit slow and when you're used to pricing in the Mission, it seemed a little bit on the pricey side. Lunch for 2 with (ice tea) was over $40.

Not sure if I'll go out of my way to eat here again, unless it's with my friend, but if I find myself in the area, and I'm hungry, I would definitely consider it.
author: Eugene P.

description:
Much has been written about the excellent tacos (and I agree, I've had every kind and loved them), but the incredible thing about this place is that the non-taco menu items are also delicious.  

My favorite is the tuna tostada -- incredibly delicious tuna melts in your mouth and pairs surprisingly well with the tostada part.  Try it, you won't regret it!

The tequila and beers are great too, but the real gems are the specialty cocktails.  

Finally, I love how I can come here with friends to hang out, but also can bring my kids for a family dinner.

Service has always been super-friendly too. I friggin love this place!
author: Joseph C.

description: It fills a needed niche in the Mexican food scene - the kinda upscale affordable taqueria. The tacos were good, if not a tad salty.
author: Andrew K.

description: I love to hate (hate to love) this place. The atmosphere is excellent. An enormous painting of Tapatio sauce is very tasteful (not being sarcastic). The food is VERY tasty. I highly recommend the chicken, filet mignon, and fish tacos they have. The tuna appetizer is EXCELLENT!!!!!! I can eat those all day. The drink menu, especially tequila and mezcal list is very extensive and I have tried some very tasty stuff on that list! The service is pretty good, you just need to get past the initial attitude of the hostess, after her everyone else will seem much nicer in comparison. They have a killer Taco Tuesday deal which is unbeatable. 1 taco, 1 shot of tequila, 1 tecate for $12. WOW. The only thing I don't like about this place is the Marina crowd, but that's not the fault of the restaurant. Just the douchiness of the marina ;)
author: Alex Y.

description:
I liked this place as Laiola, but I LOVE Tacolicious. My favorite tacos are the carnitas. The meat is piled high enough to make two tacos out of one. Follow that with their chili-lime corn on the cob and your meal is complete.

2 tacos (which really make 4), corn and a margarita = $20
author: Jennifer T.

description:
This place will be the death of me.  The chicken tacos will change your life.. Personally, I always rate a mexican or pseudo-mexican restaurant based on the chips and salsa.. These guys know what they are doing.  

The atmosphere is cool, the staff is friendly, the food is killer, and the music is great... what more could you ask for?  The fact that this place is 30 steps from my apartment is going to be dangerous. 

Only reason I'm not giving them the 5th star is because there's only one bottle of Chinaco Tequila on the back bar... Any self respecting mexican joint has all three... Get your act together..
author: Kevin B.

description:
I like the variety of flavors they offer with the tacos. We came here on the 7x7 100 eats list to try the beef short rib tacos. We were pleased because when we arrived on a saturday afternoon there was no wait at all and we got a seat outside on a sunny day so that was nice. The service was quick and pleasant. We tried the tuna tostadas which i had heard were amazing and I was really disappointed. The tuna was ok, and the sauce was good, but the onions on top were too big to be crispy (flash fried i think?) and they just made the texture of the overal dish weird. I love tuna and normally any place that has a good tuna dish will end up getting lots of return business from me - but i wont order this again it wasn't very good. 
The chips and salsa were good, and on the house so that's always a good sign for a mexican place to me (i hate when they charge for just basic chips and salsa). 
The taco - obviously - their specialty. The beef short rib taco was our favorite. A very good spice to it, cilantro, onions, yum! I wished I'd ordered another one. The taco of the day was a shrimp something - blah, i didn't like it, not enough zing - tasted too buttery or sweet or something. The cod taco was excellent. I will definitely order that again, I loaded it with lots of lime, i love fish tacos with lime! The chorizo potato taco was much more bland than I'd expected. I really like chorizo, but I guess normally its just a lot more spicy and zing, this taco was neither and the potatos just made it blander and drier, don't waste your appetite on this one, it's not that great. Stick with a few of the cod and a few of the beef - they are the perfect compliment to eachother. One spicy and saucey the other zingy and creamy. 
I know I'll be back to try a few other flavors.
author: Audrey V.

description:
YUM. There are many wonderful things about this place. The tacos are super good and flavorful, I really like how they come with the different kinds of sauces, and they are reasonably priced. The lady and I split 4 for $12, and were quite content. The music they played kicked ass- sometimes that is a big factor unfortunately. The staff were excellent- lots of helpful tips and just general good service, even had a great talk with the owner, got a good feel for his passion for tacos. I would honestly go here every night if the margaritas were a little cheaper- and that is also keeping me from going all the way with five stars. I'm broke! That said- if you aren't broke, get them, they are fantastic.
PS order the pan de chocolate dessert- it came over from when the place was Laiola's. and Thank God it did, cause it is a little bit of heaven.
author: Natalie D.

description:
Went in for a takeout order. The bartender took my order for four tacos, which are offered for $13. The restaurant was not crowded and the bar was virtually empty. 

I returned home to discover that I received only 3 tacos and a side of asparagus. Two of the tacos were not what I ordered. The menu doesn't even offer a side of asparagus. I was charged $20.50. 

When I looked at their takeout menu to call them, I discovered that they do not list a phone number, only a website and email address. If you call their number (listed on Yelp), it tells you that they don't take calls, only emails. 

I will say that once they received my email they responded immediately with an email and offered me a refund. If I did not have access to email I would not have been able to rectify the problem as I do not live in the area. As it was, my lunch was ruined.

When I went back later in the day to pick up my refund, the GM apologized for the bartender and offered me an additional $10 bill  "for the inconvenience and extra gas". The restaurant is more suited to the "boobs, not brains" they have tending bar.

A little tip to the owners. Next time try offering a free lunch credit to make up for the gaffe and invite the customer back for another try to see if the service is really improved, not a ten buck payoff at the door. Felt a bit sleezy.
author: S H.

description:
When I tried Tacolicious, it was love at first bite! This place has the whole package!

1. The tacos are interesting, mouth-watering and pretty cheap.
2. The cocktails are unique and can be served in pitchers for fun group dining.
3. The atmosphere is happening and perfect for a Friday or Saturday night with friends.
4 The outdoor patio is perfect for Marina people-watching (especially when it's warm out).
5. The many salsas allow you to be creative with your tacos and even chips.

The only downfall to this four star eatery is it's not a hidden masterpiece, many people have come to love it. So in turn, it can be difficult to get a table. And if you're thinking of booking one over the phone, think again. No reservations allowed.
author: Jackie D.

description: Their mole taco is my fav! But their short rib one is a close second. I've never had a margarita I didn't like - and I've tried several on their list. Their habanero one is SPICY but great (heart burn beware). My recent favorite has coconut water and pineapple juice. YUM! Their guacamole is pretty good though I prefer spicier but their cheese dip is amazeballs. Seriously. And make sure you save room for their homemade churro dessert!!
author: Erin L.

description:
Just came home from my first meal here, will definitely go back.

Fish tacos were great...just crispy enough without being overwhelmed by grease.  4 tacos for $12 is not a bad deal at all here...they fill those suckers up and double wrap 'em in the soft taco shells. Sangria was yummy, though a little small and packed with ice for $7. Lots of chips and salsa refills...both a blessing and a curse.  I can't turn down the chip refills but then I always feel like a heifer after the 3rd round is topped off.  Dessert was great, too, though I can't remember the name of it; it basically was a mexican style chocolate pudding with sea salt and olive oil that you spread on little toasts...it may sound a little odd but if you like chocolate you will certainly enjoy this.

My favorite part of the meal was the attentive kindness of the owner, Joe.  I like it when someone is very proud and passionate about their work and their business...I find that it always makes the dining experience that much more personal and enjoyable.
author: Tricia N.

description:
Three Words:  Pork Belly Tacos!

I've been a frequent patron of Tacolicious, but I must say, this last round of tacos warranted a glowing review on Yelp.  The Pork Belly Tacos was a special - but they always have some sort of tantalizing goodness.

The service is equally as great (funny & personable staff).

Check it out peeps!
author: Bella B.

description:
In addition to the delicious tacos they also have a really fantastic website that makes ordering takeout a breeze. 

Also, love the horchata.
author: Kelly S.

description:
I love Tacolicious but tonight was the last straw.  I've stood by this restaurant through 2hr waits and poor service but frozen tacos... I put my foot down.  

I went to HH tonight and ordered their "Crack in a Box" off their $5 HH menu.  Usually I stick to their traditional soft tacos but the waitress/hostess spoke highly of these tacos and I thought I'd give them a try.  The tacos came out dripping in grease and looked pretty unappealing.  I took two bites into one of the tacos and found they were frozen on the inside, such a disappointment.  

Despite being severed frozen tacos our waitress and her manager felt that a $5 discount on our dinner bill would brush this instance under the table.  I've always enjoyed Tacolicious but always been disappointed in their service, tonight was the icing on the cake. 

If you're craving a frozen taco, hit up Tacolicious!
author: Jam K.

description: Tacolicious is absolutely worth checking out. There's a long wait at certain hours and it's not a super roomy location, but the tacos are seriously delicious. Great drinks as well. My friends and I always enjoy eating here.
author: Mia D.

description:
Only in the marina can you name a place tacolicious and have people lining up out the door!  Anyone remember when tacolicious was laiola - and no one was really ever in there?  (ps-on your credit card stmt it'll still show up as laiola).  

I as skeptical about this place, but it's actually not bad, pretty good even...crazy, I know.  The margs are excellente - tasty and fuerte :-)  The tacos are really tasty and so are the chips & salsa and the few apps I have had.  I also love the 3 salsa options they serve with the tacos.
author: Selena G.

description:
I am from the South bay.. So Mexican food is basically a staple here. Went to the Tacolicious stand at the Thursday farmers maket and ordered the Carnitas, Beer can chicken and short rib tacos for $9. Pretty steep for tacos yet is the goin rate for lunch here in the FIDI area. The carnitas taco had petty good flavor however lacked the mexican/spanish spices. The beer can chicken was good and juicy. The short rib taco was greasy and didn't have any flavor what so ever.

Overall it was good to try but I won't be trying it again.. .. Still on the search for a good Taco in the FIDI area!
author: JustAmes V.

description:
This place is AWESOME.

It's a bit small, but at 3:00ish on a Saturday, the crowd was moving fast and we were seated within 15 minutes, despite the long line when we arrived.

I was with my mom and we weren't starving, so we split the tuna tostada and the avocado-papaya salad (which the waiter told us was a new item).  We also got guacamole to go with our chips.  I am SUCH a guacamole snob, but I thought their guac was delicious.  The salsa was different than other places... not my favorite salsa I've ever had but it was still quite tasty. The food arrived promptly, first the salad, then the tostada.  Everything about the salad was perfectly delicious... fresh arugula, large pieces of papaya, avocado, blood oranges, nuts, and a delicious dressing.  The portion was perfect, the salad was light and tasty.  I could have eaten it for hours.  The tostada was everything I wanted it to be.  The tuna was fresh, the tostada was crispy, the crispy leeks on top were an unexpected compliment to the rest of it.  Really, spectacular.

The crowd was ok... kind of typical Marina, to a point.  A table of cougars on one side of us daring each other to post pictures on Facebook, a fraternity party on the other side talking about subjects inappropriate for a meal (and I was in a sorority, I have high tolerance for these things), but it didn't detract from the experience all that much.

In short, the food was amazing, the service pretty good, and I will DEFINITELY be back.
author: Samantha B.

description:
There's a reason this place is crowded any time they are open.
Order beers and a large plate of tacos. 
The margaritas are good, but go down too easy, and at $9 each can add up quickly. The fresh tomato and peach salad is pretty good, but that's not the reason you're here.
The place is loud, and the service is rushed, but it is fun and lives up to its tacolicious name.
author: Sid N.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in the Marina!

It's fun, has great food, and good drinks. It can get a little loud, but it's pretty energetic. Sitting outside on a nice day just tops it off!

Favorite dishes: queso, carnitas taco, braised chicken taco, fish taco.

And the Laiola chocolate cake dish is to die for.

All around....fantastic!
author: Julie V.

description: Tacos were a little overpriced but at least they're packed with meat! They were really good and surprisingly filling. No wait for lunch on a weekday. The guac was also delciious.
author: Leily P.

description:
I've only been living in the bay area for a year. I've had mexican around here from bad to fantastic. This place however has the best tacos I've had in the bay area. Expect the taco truck style tacos except these have a lot more meat than one would expect. 

I HIGHLY recommend the cod tacos as well as their guacamole which I believe is made to order. Delicious stuff.

I had 5 tacos as well as a little chips and guac which came to around $20 after tip. I left pretty damn full as well.

The only downside is that the place is muy tiny and using the bathroom can be a real hassle. At least there is some outside eating areas which were nice.
author: Nick E.

description:
Fresh, tasty, and definitely creative.  Tacolicious is not your typical street-side taco shop.  

Enjoying a sunny afternoon in the Marina with a good friend visiting the city, we dropped by Tacolicious for a late lunch and snagged a outdoor table looking out on to Chestnut Street.  We were immediately treated to some house tortilla chips and a fresh green salsa.  The chips were amazingly thin, much thinner than anything I've ever tried.  Although they were fried, they still tasted very light.

The menu was full of some pretty exotic taco options.  They are on the smaller side, so two to three make up a decent-sized meal.  I immediately ordered one braised beef short-rib taco and one of the specials, a lobster taco.  Both were absolutely delicious.   They were tastefully garnished with some fresh veggies.  The short ribs were tender and not too fatty.  The lobster was full of flavor.  The side of drunken baked beans (onion, bacon, and "pickled things") was great too.

I don't eat out that often in the Marina, but this is a place worth coming back too.  It may not be the most traditional mexican food, but it's clever and creative and just plain good.
author: Tim N.

description:
Went back and the waitress was raving about the veggie tacos, so amongst our platter, we got two. Not good. Don't even try. 
Just not a good experience the second time. 
But still, yummy margs and great ambiance.
author: Francesca F.

description:
YES, YES, YES.

I'm so happy I came back for a third visit.  Tacolicious is starting to deliver folks!  Huge improvement from my last two visits and one of the best spicy margaritas I've ever had.  It's still on the pricey side but the quality matched the price this time.
author: J. SOMA S.

description:
I'll start with the best - CARNITAS TACOS. OH YUM GEE. 

I got the Margarita Picante... it's pretty spicy kids, but I liked it a lot, I would get it again in a heart beat.
 
We got the crazy Velveeta Chili Con Carne dip, it was okay IMO, but everyone else seems to love it. But I don't really love Velveeta in any form, so.. yeah.

The house salsa is KILLER, just how I like it... smokey, flavorful and a smidge spicy. I also really liked the tomatillo salsa in the salsa trio they brought in addition to the house salsa. 

The tuna tostadas are excellent, the carmalized leeks really makes the difference. The tuna is a nice quality and this dish is really simple but is perfect. This is a must order.

The ceviche was done very nicely, good for an ap to share. 

We got 4 tacos - one fish, one chicken, one carnitas, and one beef rib. The fish was good, chicken okay, beef was meh, but the carnitas was OUTSTANDING. God, soooo good. 

Next time I go I think I will just get some carnitas tacos and a margarita picante and munch on the chips and salsa. Sounds like fantastic times to me.

(PS, they have a late night bar menu... cause we were there pretty late)... The staff was super friendly and good about suggesting yummy drinks and food. 

Yay T-Lish!
author: Erin A.

description:
This place is amazing. All their tacos are phenomenal. It's one of the few things I miss about San Francisco. Service is great and the margaritas are STRONG. Eat here. You must. Do it.

ALL of their tacos are amazing, so I can't justifiably suggest just one to order.

Pet Friendly?
There is a small, and by small I mean 3 tables available for seating outside where you can of course bring your pup. They have heaters in case you're worried about the non stop bay breeze. :)
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Who doesn't love a giant platter full of tacos?  Tacolicious has a seemingly simple and obvious concept, but they do it well with a lively atmosphere - plus they provide an endless bowl of salty freshly fried chips and tasty salsa.  The place can get pretty crowded, but that is true for any decent place in the city.  If you are not waiting for a meal, then you probably don't want to be eating there.  

I had four tacos ($12), and picked a variety since this was my first time.  My favorite was the beer battered rock cod, it was fried to perfection and tasted great with the green salsa.  The chorizo potato was surprisingly delicious - the potato provided great texture.  The carnitas was pretty good, but it was a bit sweet for my taste.  The beer braised chicken was my least favorite, but I am never really a fan of chicken tacos.  There is also a rotating taco special (this time it was fried calamari).  Not only do you get a big bowl of salsa for your chips, but accompanying the tacos comes a platter of a red, yellow, and green salsa.  I didn't have anything to drink, but the drinks that went by looked beautiful, and the bartenders were working their heinies off.  

And you have to love the ten foot high Tapatio mural.
author: Dana H.

description:
It's good, but I'll have to come back again to try their drinks and some more food items to determine it's better than Mamacita, which is still the top runner.

Get the shrimp.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
I am a Tacolicious fan... don't necessarily LOVE the tacos but I like their cocktail list (sangria and habanero/passion fruit margarita are yummy). Love the spicy ahi tuna tostada. Chips, guac, salsa are always a good plan. The tacos are good... sometimes a little dry but always good flavors and interesting combinations of ingrediants. 

Fun spot to go before going out... always a good "scene"

TV's a plus to watch whatever game is on, Mamacitas has no tv's which always bums me out (not that I NEED to watch a game... but working in sports- it is a usually a good thing to know what's going on)
author: Sarah A.

description:
I totally go here all the time, because it's up the road from my climbing gym, and because they serve food late.  The marina girl salad is kind of wonderful, and the tacos are tasty. 

But holy generic hipster! There's a total lack of originality and ambiance.  It feels like a corporate group got together and did a poll to see what would sell - it's always packed and loud.  THere's nothing special about this place; it's like a Chevy's for the urban crowd.   Go to Pacific Catch, which is right next door, and ten times better, unless, like me, you're eating dinner at 11 pm.
author: Becka R.

description:
I'm a fan of Tacolicious, as its a frequent lunch destination for my co-workers and I.  We always go for the platter of 10 tacos; and its a challenge to finish just 3 of them.

At Tacolicious the tacos are literally stuffed to the limit with delicious short rib, carnitas or chorizo. I'd stay away from the chicken as its ok but nothing like the mouth watering, drool inducing taste of the meats mentioned above. The waitstaff are normally friendly and the atmosphere is fairly lively though normally packed with people. There are a number of TVs around showing various sports games or ESPN.

Lastly the salsa that comes with the complimentary chips is quite good, its got a distinct chipotle flavor and definitely better than the cheap salsas you get at other places. If you are going with a group of 3-4, the 10 taco platter is definitely the way to go, Just make sure that you have time to walk or nap off your meal after you eat.
author: Lenneal G.

description:
I came here for lunch with a friend on a weekday. I was able to find a 2 hour parking spot for free right on Fillmore. 

FOOD - We orders tacos and a guacamole.  We ordered the "special taco of the week" which was $3.95 ( achiote roasted pork, avocado, pickled onions and habaneros, roasted tomato salsa) and regular tacos are $3.50/each.

It's pricey compared to the tacos which I am use to purchasing for $1.50/each.

There is nothing really to rave about in terms of the tacos served here. 

DECOR - modern and clean.

SERVICE - attentive.

TWO PERSON TAB FOR LUNCH WAS $31/total. You do the math!
author: Jboogie L.

description:
Had the pork belly (visiting chef special), carnita, and beef short rib tacos. Pork belly was wayyy too spicy, and the other two tasted practically the same and were both pretty tasty, but not outstanding. As a NYer, I'm no longer tolerating the West Coast-Mexican food superiority complex, because frankly, it has no merit. All the NYC Mexican food I've had beats out or rivals West Coast food, so what's with the egos???

On a happier note, their frozen hibiscus drink was BOMB, have never had anything like that, and would buy it by the gallon if I could!
author: Sasha H.

description: Tacolicious is absolutely finger-licking delicious! The tacos are a fair size with fresh and juicy ingridients that make you crave for more! their margaritas are also very yummy!
author: Karina A.

description:
I was a huge, HUGE fan of Laiola, and was bummed when I heard they were changing over to Tacolicious.  The wife and I took a few weeks to stop by, hoping that the craziness of a new hotspot would die down.  Hit them up for a late lunch this week and it was excellent.  The food was great; very thought out.  Drinks are excellent, and the best part is the staff has stayed the same.  Great group of employees, and a fun atmosphere.

Tip of the day:  If Nick is behind the bar, give him free-reign to make you any cocktail he feels like making.  He hasn't missed yet!
author: Brett L.

description:
I love tacos. This place is awesome. 
I love tacos- the carnitas were amazing, the filet mignon was supple. 
Tasty drinks. 
Fun atmosphere...
author: Tamara G.

description:
Silly name, but really great food.  Had two cod tacos, two carnitas tacos and an order of tacquitos.  Everything was done perfectly-the fish in the tacos were lightly fried and had a great tartar sauce.  The tacquitos were topped with a generous helping of guacamole.  To top it all off, you get three choices of salsas-mild, medium and hot.  

Even the free chips and salsa were exceptional.  When a restaurant takes care of the little things you can't go wrong.
author: AJ L.

description: Great vibe and great service. All I need from here is a tuna tostada and margarita and I'm set!
author: Mandy C.

description:
My good friend recommended this place to me because I don't live in the city but I was meeting some old college friends there for a mini reunion after a couple of years of not seeing each other. 

It was a good place. I ordered TACOS--Carnitas, Summer Squash/Corn/Market Peppers/Chard, and Short Rib. They were really nice. 

Problems. We ordered a pitcher of margaritas but never got it. The server messed up our order by giving us one wrong taco. But it was nice of him to give us a free taco. I mean, what was he going to do: grab a taco from the tray he placed on our table? lol. He didn't check in with us until the food was done. I thought that he was going to come with the pitcher when the food came but when he didnt, we waited and looked for him so we could ask about it but he never showed up.

We paid three ways. I told him to place specific amounts on the two credit cards and then pay with cash as the remainder. he mistook what I said and didn't give me back change. I'm a server and I totally sympathize so I was like...okay just take the change as EXTRA tip. We tipped him over 20% and he didn't really deserve it but I'm not going to fight him for 5 extra dollars of change that he owed me. 

Grade: C- for the service. A- for the food. Sorry dude. I'm a server and even though I know how hard it is, you messed up on some pretty basic things as a server. 

Street parking (as usual in the city)
author: Thomas N.

description:
Short rib tacos. Ridiculous. 
(Christine C. must have a sensitive stomach)

The only problem with this place is getting a table.
author: John D.

description: After multiple meals here ive put an end to it all. They try too hard with terrible execution, high prices and long waits. If you're looking for good gourmet you need to go down the street to Mamacitas or cheap Mexican literally across the street at Los Hermanos.
author: Tyler J.

description: I am so excited that I came here today before hanging out at Chrissy Field with my dog. The place is pretty cute and clean and the drinks were amazing! Highly recommend the "Fillmore" Paloma if you love grapefruit. Also, this place has incredible chili con queso!!!! SOmething that is apparently pretty hard to find in this city. THe filet mignon taco and the Ceviche were also superb , very fresh well made and beautiful presentation. Very good service and Great music!!
author: L V.

description: Excellent but pricey.  Margarita's were great!
author: Martin S.

description:
I dropped in for tacos and had a couple really quickly on my way up to Russian Hill.  The carnitas tacos were excellent - not to fatty, very well seasoned and tender.  A+.  The cod tacos were good - lightly breaded and fried.  

They aren't currently doing take-out but will be within the next couple weeks they say.  Your mileage may vary.
author: Rob K.

description:
3.5 stars

Went opening weekend a few weeks ago.

Got the 10 tacos and tried every single one of the tacos on the menu.  The tacos look small but they definitely fill you up.  almost couldn't eat my fifth one.  It may have been the 2 Guinesses i had in my stomach from the Horseshoe across the street, waiting for a table at Tacolicious.

Favorite was the fish tacos.  Very light but good.
Pork ones were meh.  Felt like it was too dried out.
Had the veggie of the day - butternut squash with honey on top, not bad.  Probably couldve used a tad bit more honey.

The place was absolutely packed so the service definitely suffered.  Our veggies came much later after the tacos.  I was working on my 4th or 5th taco by the time they came out and i was already defeated by then.  The server said the veggies would be on the house for coming out so late, but when the bill came, the veggies were still on the bill.  I will chalk the bad service up to because it was the 3rd day Tacolicious was open.

Will go back again once the newness wears off.
author: Kyle W.

description:
What's the big deal? Perhaps I'm expecting too much. I can't claim to be an expert on tacos but I've eaten quite a few of them having lived a hop, skip & a jump from the mission district. I am also quite willing to drive cross town to get freshly made corn tortillas at Las Palmas and go miles out of my way to hit the closest Mi Puebla to get a better assortment of fresh chiles and banana leaves. That being said, I would have to think twice about even walking across Chestnut Street to get a taco here. 
First off, this is not a taco restaurant. This is a bar that happens to have a kitchen that can make you a taco or two. There is no civilized seating in the whole restaurant. It is either at the bar or on bar stools on high tables, all with no back support; high communal tables with bar stools on one side and high bench seating on the other; or finally a small cubby hole that is crammed with 6 diners, sharing each other's conversation and body odor on a banquette with a couple of steel chairs that are as uncomfortable as that sounds. Yes, you guessed itl. That's where we sat. 
Next the food, we ordered a starter, the fried plantains which were tasty but cloyingly sweet, more dessert than appetizer. Had to have the partner kill off most of it as I am not a sweets (or sweet) person. After a couple of bites, my teeth were hurting. At $7.70 a small serving, I couldn't recommend it at all. We ordered 8 different tacos. All were passable but none stood out. The meat was uniformly dry. The exception was the cochinita pibil, braised short rib and the carnitas which instead of moist, was oily. The carnitas I expect to be a bit oily. But the trade off is usually that crispy and crunchy pork that is for me the joy of carnitas. None of that here. In fact, we were hard pressed to figure out what meat was what meat on our plate. We had to ask two different waitpersons to identify which was what. Not a good sign. We did figure out what was the veggie option on our own. It was full of corn and peppers but I was hard pressed to see any of the promised summer squash or chard. Still it was tasty and, I can't believe I'm saying this, was better than most of the meat options. The rock cod taco was the other identifiable taco thanks to the overly heavy batter. The fish was bland and unremarkable. The beer braised chicken could have been any mystery meat, it tasted a bit cinammony which got tiring fast, even given the size of the taco. The best in the line up was the chicken mole colorado, good flavor but again plagued by dry chicken. Except for the orange oil slick that accompanied the beef short rib taco, it would have been the star in a bad television series, but I still can't get over all that oil. The corn tortillas themselves were pretty pedestrian. I'd expect the mass produced tortillas in the mission taqueria but they only charge 2 bucks at most. With more pesos you should get something more. Generally, the tacos needed a stronger hand with the spices. The free chips and salsa was just okay. On one of my trips to the restroom to wash the oil off my hands, I saw a waiter dig into the chips with his hands and fill a basket just after he handled the bill and money from another table. Yuck. I guess it was lucky that no one bothered to offer to refill our chips.
Lastly the service. It started out almost irritating. Two seperate staff asked for our order when we were still strategizing. Then we put in our order, the beers and food came and then we became invisible. No water, beer, chip refills. No one checking on us, we had to ask for help. No, it wasnt busy at all at that time as we were the only ones in the cubby hole. 
In summary (finally), Nah.
author: bongo c.

description: Probably some of the nicest and most professional staff I have ever experienced!  I'm talking the north location.  Food was delicious too!  Love the dark swanky atmosphere--a bit too loud.
author: Dre C.

description: Maybe I need to give it another try, but I feel like this place is uber greasy.  It's always way too over crowded, so I don't know if I want to even try.  What am I missing??
author: Michelle R.

description:
holy crap do I love the salsas...ALL of them. 

Carnitas tacos or the Cochinita pibil...the deliciousness is almost too much.   
Ceviche here is awesome too, very tasty. 

The ambiance at this location sucks though...marina all the way. The service has been hit and miss.
author: Nilu r.

description:
This place is mad!  It's so packed that we decided to order to-gos instead.    We went all the way to the Marina district only because we saw the crispy duck confit taco of the week on Yelp!  

There were 3 tables for outdoor seating, inside Tacolicious it's basically a bar.  You eat, drink, order from the bar.  We got two duck, one carnitas, one cod, one chicken, and one short rib tacos.  6 tacos for under $25, that's a pretty good deal.  O and did I mention they put lots of meat on the tacos?  

Loud music, booze, good food, tv, trendy crowd is what you get at Tacolicious.
author: Tadaa T.

description: Went to tacolicious with my friend after she heard how yummy this place was and oh my was her info right. The grapevine couldn't have been more spot on with this place. I recommend ordering the tacos choosing 4 flavors and splittin with one other person. Each taco comes with two tortillas and the filling is large enough to split it into two. Talk about perfect. The tacos are scrumptious, chips and salsa a must and that's not even the best part..the cocktails OMG. I have never had spicy cocktails until this place and it has opened my eyes to a whole new world of alcohol consumption. I swear, I would go to this place and just straight up order drinks the whole time I'm there (spoken like a true alcoholic haha). It's located in a great neighborhood, the marina, so after you're done eating there's plenty of places to browse and walk by while you're digesting. Check it out, you wont be sorry!
author: Hannah K.

description:
Went to Tacolicious for drinks with a friend.

Saw on the menu:
2 tacos-$
4 tacos-$$
10 tacos-$$$

At first I thought of ordering 2 tacos.  When i saw the size of the tacos from someone else's table at least 15 feet away, they looked tiny.
So i switched up to 4 tacos.
My friend was ordering 4 tacos as well, so we decided we should just get 10 tacos and split.

Well our food came out with 5 different types of tacos (two each).
Our eyes were bigger than our stomach.  But we were still excited.
Each of them were great in their own way.  
The fish one was a bit oily for my taste, after two bites, i was done with it.
Short rib was less than expected, but that's because i was expecting the Korean style.
The potato one was fantastic with a kick of spice.

After eating two, I was full.  Three- ready to unzip my pants. Four- oh my gosh I can barely walk.  Had to take the fifth one home.

Ladies, I recommend getting two.  It's plenty.
Dudes,  you can probably have 4 and be pretty happy.

The sangria I had was pretty decent. but the fruits were not soaked in as it should be...

Service was OK... I ate at the bar, and the bartender was too busy chatting it up with some people.

Expect a lot of the stereo typical loud Mariana guys and gals.  it is in the Marina.
author: ji K.

description: Everything was amazing: Fried fish taco,  Shrimp el diablo and, yes, the tuna tostada lived up to the billing.  And a great bar/bartenders too.
author: Amy L.

description:
Tacolicious has got my number fo' sho'.  Any outside dining in the city is fun and that, accompanied by their adventurous options, makes for a perfect SF lunch.  Here's the breakdown from my experience:

Fried rock cod:  Simple white fish flavor as you'd expect.  Being fried gives it that satisfying crunch to each bite.  The crema they join it with is what'll make you really like it.
Shot-and-a-beer braised chicken:  Shoulda asked what liquor and what beer.  The flavors didn't hint at much but its shredded presentation gave it that taste of Mejico.
Traditional carnitas:  Very true to its name.  Very good, but nothing out of the norm.
Cochinita pibil:  Like I said, adventurous options.  I never had or heard of this before.  I really liked the acidic taste to it although it left it just a tad dry.  At first, because of the fiery color, I thought it would be spicy.  The waitress told me that was anchiote.  For the white people who don't know that is not spicy lol.
Guajillo braised beef short rib:  Now THIS  was a taco that could make me sing, or cry, or both simultaneously.  Guajillo is a barely medium hot pepper at best, but its berry overtones latch onto the short rib like wings on an airplane and make it soar.  I honestly think the next time at Tacolicious I will order just this.  

I have yet to dive into anything else there other than the tacos.  It's quite a lot and with the numerous sauces they break out with your food you will fill up.  But if you don't order what you like you may find the price unfair.  If there's one final note I could make to sell the greatness of this place it's the comment my girl made about why she thought it was just ok: "It was too authentic for me."  Score.
author: Nick J.

description:
chips and salsa:  excellent

carnitas taco:  excellent.  wonderful flavor

Guajillo braised short rib taco:  excellent.  rich flavor and texture

Fried cod taco:  again, excellent.  Breading was deliciously crispy.

i would go back in a second.  i want to try everything else on the menu.
the tacos are not that big, but they are very filling.  you get 4 for $12 and i couldnt finish all of them.  not as cheap as a taqueria but a DAMN good value considering how filling and delicious it is.

i heard its way crowded on weekends, but we got there at 5 on memorial day and, although crowded, we didnt have to wait for a table.  it's totally worth braving the trip into the marina and dealing with all the douchebaggery that goes with it.
author: Christian C.

description: my wife and i ate here after the recent sf orchid show. got seated right away, even though it was packed. noise level was very high-would have preferred to sit outside but would have had to wait. without question the best tortilla chips and salsa i have ever had (they make their own); could not stop eating them. shared a taco selection, and all were very good. good beers on tap. will definitely come here again if we are in the neighborhood.
author: Joseph B.

description:
This place is a winner- really good food, a causal yet nice atmosphere and friendly service. 

Tacolicious just hits the spot- they have great Sangria and Margaritas, really good tacos and addicting chips and salsa.
author: Jennifer K.

description:
So I stopped by for the second time and felllll even more. Maybe it's because I had a few shots prior?...highly doubt. But I was extremely impressed with how packed it was (Being 10pm already) and having super fast service!! 

Margaritas-amazing
Guacamole -BOMB.COM...so addicting. and the chips keep coming...
Tacos-way beyond anything my mind can comprehend right now.

 I would totally give five stars however I woke up with a receipt I wasn't so happy with...especially since it was only for two people...YES it was still worth it.
author: Stephanie G.

description: The food at Tacolicious is defintley five star.  The Tuna Tostada and the Short Rib Tacos are both excellent.  O The tequila selection is also great.  The only drawback was the seating, it was cramped and all tables were highboys. I am not sure why the website says to bring the children, because there is no place to put a highchair.
author: Justin M.

description:
LOVE IT!
Well priced with a great creative menu.  The big pitcher are margaritas are splendid.  I suggest trying a couple different flavors or asking for the servers favorite.  The decor keeps you interested with good music to match.  The service is really what makes this place a 4 star rating.  The bartenders, the cooks, the staff, the hosts are all great and very welcoming and accommodating.
author: Red R.

description: Wasn't too impressed.  Tacos were ok. Good atmosphere, waitress was hardly around. Salsas were tasty though but the bill was a little high for tacos.  But the cabernet was yummy!
author: Desi N.

description:
I went here New Years day morning 1/1/2011 and to my surprise it was the only place open without a 3 hour wait. We were able to sit right down and there were about 10 of us, with 4 more on the way. The atmosphere is nice, but what I wasn't expecting was the best street-style tacos I've ever had in my life.

The place is right next to Circa, if you need a landmark to find it.

If you're with a friend I recommend getting the 10 taco plate for $29. It's a little pricey, but these taco's are huge and you shouldn't be able to eat more than 5 each. 

I mixed up the beef short ribs, chicken, and chorizo.

They also have carnitas, which I wished I'd tried and a Lobster taco (extra).

My friend had a good idea, since the tacos on placed on two small corn tortillas you can actually turn 10 tacos into 20 and share them amongst your friends. 

The chicken and chorizo were delicious but the beef short ribs were a 13 out of 10. It was the most delicious thing I can remember eating in a very, very long time.

The menu has a lot of other options, but that's like going to round table and ordering a salad.

Get the tacos. Throw on the salsa, squeeze a little lime, and add a pinch of salt.

I can't wait to go back the next time I'm in the city.
author: Brian P.

description:
#31 on 100 Things to Eat Before I Die in SF: Tuna Tostada

The first of our foray into the unknown (well, some of it's unknown), we head to Tacolicious after a "Shutter Island" viewing at the Metreon.  Hey, did you know that the first showing is 6 bucks??  How friggin' cool is that?  However, you end up having to pay $10.50 for parking, so I guess it comes out in the wash.

But, I digress...

Since Tuna Tostada was under the "Snacks" portion of the menu, we figured we were going to have to get other stuff.  We all ordered tacos, which you can get by the singlet, double, or quad. 

I choose the braised short ribs and carnitas tacos with cheese on the side.  Short rib - Yum a friggin'-licious!  I could have easily had fourteen more of those suckers.  The carnitas taco was alright.  

Then came the thing that I'm supposed to eat before I die, the tuna tostada.  It came as three little chips with the rare tuna, aioli, avocado, and crispy shallots on top.  I pick mine up and expect it to define my every fiber of living.

Um, not so much.  I was unimpressed.  In fact, it made me want to order thirty short rib tacos.  Yeah, the number just went up, you noticed.

So, we head out from our nice little lunch at Tacolicious and I think, "Hey guys, isn't Miette on the list too?"  Check your phone, check your phone!!!  Indeed, Miette is number #49 on the list and, a block away, it's a must.  Ginger snaps are apparently the thing...little did we know that this would become a day of searching for a more things on the list that we could enjoy.
author: Tamar D.

description: I love this place! The food is honestly amazing, the location wonderful and the drinks are perfect. I wanted to give this place 5 stars but the staff is holding me back. The service is really hit or miss. Sometimes they are friendly and very attentive, others they are so so but occasionally the serves and hostess are actually rude. Never sure what you're going to get but I still come back because love the carnitas tacos and guacamole anyways!
author: Natalie M.

description:
There are three ways you can applaud:

1) two hands
2) two feet
3) one hand

This is more of a one hand clap. I was surprised at how bland the food is. It looks yummy but there's hardly any unique flavor - neither Mexican nor San Franciscan.

I got the chicken and beef short rib tacos. There are cooked onions in the taco but you can hardly taste them. For garnish they give you a couple slivers of peppers and carrots.

On my chicken I put the guacamole-tomato green sauce. For the short ribs I put a red looking tomato based sauce that has two X's next to it. There was another sauce with three X's but I assumed that it meant "hot" so I didn't want to venture those waters. These sauces do add more flavor to the tacos except you pretty much have to drench your tacos in them to make up for the blandness. The sauce with two X's was hardly even spicy or hot so I don't know what those X's mean. It didn't even reach Tobasco levels. I wish I tried the XXX sauce. Actually simple Tobasco would've been nice.

One of my short rib tacos was really fatty. I really didn't mind it since it at least added some flavor and moisture, but I can see a lot of people having a problem with this. The second short rib taco was rather dry. It tasted like I was eating mostly tortilla. The chicken was fine but didn't taste like much.

Each taco is $3.5. You can get 3 for $9 but it still will hurt your pocket. After eating three tacos I was still hungry! I don't even eat that much plus I had breakfast. Afterwards I bought a huge sandwich and finished it.

____

Boring. I applaud trying to be a community organic taco spot, however, Tacolicious didn't even meet the standards of a typical Mexican street vendor. I hope this was a freak accident. For now I'll stick to my cabeza tacos and extra hot salsas.

FUN FACT: Did you know that one of the founders of Tacolicious is an editor of 7X7 Magazine? Fun, huh?
author: Michael H.

description: Yum. I've had plenty of different types of tacos here (carnitas, chicken with mole, special chicken, etc) and i love them all. The drinks are yummy and the service is good. I ordered four tacos, thinking they weren't going to be huge, but I could  barely finish two! I love this place and it's great for a taco craving!
author: Sheeva G.

description:
Dear Mexico, 

Thank you for visiting, and bringing your delicious tacos. 

Love, 

Marina 

   There's not much to be said except this is a "marina" Mexican restaurant if I've ever seen one. If you can't quite picture that oxymoron, take a visit to Mamacita and you'll have an idea what Tacolicious is like. We took a plunge and ordered four tacos (two chicken, two beef) to split between us, and were full after the first one.
