Love this place, so happy its here, except my sister got salsa on her new shirt, and I kept elbowing the lady next to me. The tables are way too close together! I will definitely be back though, those chips are just too amazing and even worth stomaching a little klutzy embarrassment.
author: Michelle K.

description:
I'd heard mostly good things about Tacolicious, and was intrigued by the menu, so stopped in for an early dinner.

Chips & Salsa: a fresh, flavorful green tomatillo salsa. 

Marina Girl Salad: very large portion, could be a meal in itself. Could've used more cotija cheese on top, and the vinaigrette wasn't the most flavorful. We added some crema on top and that was much better!

Tacos: We chose the veggie tacos and the fried cod tacos. The veggie tacos were well above average, flavorful and interesting, but the fish tacos really took the cake. They were definitely on par with many of the best fish tacos that I've had in Southern California. Dare I say it? Life-changing.

The service was attentive, friendly, and efficient. In contrast to many of the other reviewers, I found the prices to be spot-on. This isn't fast food, it doesn't taste like it, and it isn't priced like it. 

We enjoyed a delicious, flavorful meal and left stuffed. Highly recommend.
author: Kate S.

description:
I can tell when I am forever going to love a place, and I am going to forever love tacolicious. I simply had too good of a time and left feeling too content with the world that tacolicoous is always going to have a positive connotation to it unless I go again and am eaten by cannibalistic hipsters. 

Back to the review, that atmosphere can best be described as cozy. We went on a Friday night and the place was packed! (a good sign) but were still able to find this little corner of where we still felt very close and where it was easy to talk. I should also mention that the table next to us was a family of four and no one seemed to mind the kids antics and the staff seemed to handle them easily. It just seemed like a place that was easy to have good time.

On to the food. The girl and I split 4 tacos. Combined with the chips, this proved to be the perfect amount of food for a smallish dinner. And good god it was satisfying. The place just oozes quality. The chips were thick, tasty, and substantial. Not those thin generic things you get at some places, but really tasty chips. The salsas were all great. The standard house salsa had enough spice to keep it interesting as well as enough stuff in it to make it feel like you are eating something that is just liquefied tomatoes. The ones that came with the tacos were all wonderful as well. The green one especially was just aaaaamazing. Again, quality. 

Now for the tacos. We had 2 cod, 1 carnitas, and 1 short rib. The cod ones came with a nice big piece of deep fried cod, but were fairly typical except for the generous amount of fish and garnish. And while I say typical, I mean high end typical, one of the better fish tacos I have had, just nothing fancy in terms of flavor. 

The carnitas were excellent. The meat was well seasoned and lingered on your tongue without being to dry or oversalted. When mixed heavily with the salsa it was an excellent flavor that just left you wanting more. 

The short rib one tho, put all others to shame. Its flavor crushed the other two and was just amazing! Incredibly good. It had that wonderful. Just the amazing rib flavor mixed that mixed perfectly with the tortilla and salsa. GAh! GREAT!

Then there's the price. We got a beer and the 4 tacos so the whole tab was $17! All in all I felt great after eating here. 

Tacolicious is just pure quality. I loved it. I mean even the napkins and tortillas just seemed to be of a higher class then other places. I was just blown away by how good the food was, and how content it made me.
author: Tom O.

description:
This place is outstanding.

Everything is home made and they purchase their produce from the Ferry Building Merchants.

I had their guacamole for a starter and then the chicken and short rib tacos.

The guacamole was delicious and very fresh.

The chicken tacos are to die for!  The best I've ever had.  They are double wrapped in soft corn tortillas.  The tacos also come with three salsas, the chipotle one being my favorite.

It's only $12 for 4 tacos which is a steal.

I'll be visiting frequently.
author: Eric T.

description:
My bf and I were bored and decided to wander around the Marina one sunny afternoon.  We passed by Tacolicious and saw rows of soft tacos with juicy meats lined up on everyone's tables.  How could we resist?

We orderd Sols and guac and chips to start.  The guac was mediocre (no tomatoes...sad).  We've made better guac ourselves.  Would not order this again.  On the contrary, the complimentary salsa is really addicting, with the slight hint of crushed mint.

We decided to get the 4 tacos for $12 and got:
*chorizo and potatoes - the meat lacked flavor and heat.  I like my chorizo spicy, sodium-packed, and greasy (orange grease is preferable)
*pork carnitas - well-spiced, juicy, and slightly sweet...why did it take me 22 years to finally try carnitas?  i need to make up for lost time...
*shot-and-a-beer braised chicken - delish 
*beef short rib - oh so tender but a little on the dry side

With tacos this affordable and unlimited chips/salsa, I'm definitely coming back!
author: Jen Y.

description:
My lady and I stopped by Tacolicious last night, and thought it was only alright.  The ahi tuna appetizer was good at first bite, but left a fishy after taste in our mouths.  The guac was unimaginative; I've made better at home.  The Tacos were good, not great. 

Much to my surprise, none of my co-reviewers have commented on how uncomfortable the stools are.   They are small, hard, and unforgiving on the ass and back.   I walked out of there feeling like I had just wiped myself with a broken beer bottle.  Word to the wise: fight for a booth seat.
author: Mr. Papshmir ..

description:
$10 taco + tecate + tequila shot.  All day = 4 stars.

$3.50 tacos.  Battered rock cod were light and delicious.  Chorizo + potato was kind of bland.

After the tequila shots, we didn't really eat much more.  .  .
author: Melanie C.

description: I really like this place. Tacos are kind of pricey, but ehh, it's the Marina. The short rib taco is delish! The margarita pitchers are good too. A great after work spot!
author: m e.

description:
Food: 
Yes, the tacos are good.  I tried the carnitas, cod, chicken and lamb (special of the week).  If you do the 10 for $29, Price is pretty good.  Carnitas was both very tender and tasty.  Yet, my friends were not impressed, but mentioned that it taste like a typical carnitas.  However, I like their soft taco and like that they don't mask their taco's flavor with heavy sauces.  Instead, the sauces (spicy,medium,mild) are place on the side for you to add.  This allows you to focus on the substance/meat itself.

Ambience:
Good.  Noisy.  Very tight space.  I guess this is due to the fact that my table was located near the bar/waiting area.  Other than that,I had two bad experience on the wait.  First time, the whole dining area was reserved for a party.  I guess this happens, but I wish they would indicate this on their website.  I would have avoided driving there for nothing.  Second time, I waited over 1.5 hours for a table.  Service is great. 

Hmm.....   Overall, I can't rate this place as great.  The food is not great enough for a return.  I just don't wait 1+ hour for tacos.  Honestly, I think it worth a taste, but try to avoid the prime times.  If the place is busy.  come back another time.
author: Lawrence C.

description:
Pretty good tacos, cute little place, good service.  Nothing mindblowing (hence the 3 stars), but would come back again with a group of friends.

The 10 taco platter is definitely the way to go - it was more than enough for our group of 3 (we ended up taking some home) and it's a good way to try all the varieties.  Love the little set of salsas that come with the chips/tacos (I heart condiments).

Getting a seat outdoors seems damn near impossible.  Maybe if I get one of those coveted spots one day I'll want to bump 'em up a star.
author: Allison B.

description:
Such a fun place! It's tiny, but totes worth it. 

I normally don't venture out to the Marina all that often, but I crave this place. The salsa alone is worth going for. I love how it's tapas style and you can mix/match with friends/dates. The fried plantain is UH-mazing and the empanadas are really good too. And let's not forget about the full bar ;-)
author: Joey C.

description:
I tried the beef short rib tacos and they sucked. I was like seriously? Is this what everyone has been talking about? I rather eat from a vender on the street in the mission. The prices were soo steep here too. Not a fan. Not worth it. We also tried the fish and carnitas, alas, they were also a let down, despite them both being recommended by the server.

The three stars that I am giving to this restaurant are for the speedy service, the very cool decorations, and the pleasant staff.

I will not be going back here, ever. I'd rather eat at Taco Bell down the street...Okay well maybe not Taco Bell, Taco Bell is pretty disgusting..I'd never eat there.
author: Claudius P.

description: This was our neighborhood haunt. My husband and I used to go there once a week, at least, for tamarind or spicy passion fruit margaritas and the most delicious tacos. Seriously. They also have a chocolate mousse with olive oil and salt that is to die for. I literally crave this place. Definitely don't eat too many chips and salsa at the beginning; you will want room for all their savory and sweet treats!
author: Kendra S.

description: Freaking delicious.  The guacamole is really awesome.  The short rib and the carnitas tacos also knocked my socks off.
author: David P.

description:
Came here after work and order three tacos to go because the wait for a table would be about an hour. Understandable since it was a Friday night and this is Chestnut St.

You'd expect three tacos to be made in a fairly short amount of time, but no.. it took about 30min to get my food. I shoulda just waited for a table. This place had the typical dimly lit, contemporary, modern ambiance that many of the restaurants in the Marina share. By the looks of this place, and their popularity at the Farmers Market in the Ferry Bldg, I was anticipating some gooood tacos.

I ordered the beef short rib, shot and a beer braised chicken, and pork tacos. It came with a wide array of sauces, maybe about 8 different salsa to dip your taco in, which I thought was cool since it allowed me to experiment with a different salsa with each bite.

Unfortunately, these tacos were pretty bland and dry. Not even the sauces could help these poor limpy tacos out. Out of the 3, I would have to say the beef short rib one was the best, but they are nothing compared to the Mamacita a few blocks down or Nick's tacos!
author: Helen Z.

description:
Awesome joint. I honestly didn't know guacamole could get any better than what it already is. Tried all the tacos, the braised beef and carnitas were flavorful, however, the best taco to order multiples of is surprisingly the summer squash and corn.

Overall trendy ambiance, perfect after work meal.
author: Ash T.

description: So busy when we came on a Saturday but that was expected. Food was served in under 10 minutes though! Great tacos, just over priced. Floor staff was visibly stressed and irritated but the bartenders were friendly and attentive.
author: M C.

description:
A welcome addition to Chestnut, since Mamacita requires intensive planning to get a coveted reservation that's NOT at 5 or 9pm. I've been to Tacolicious twice, and each time we were able to get a  table with no waiting as walk-ins.

Staff is super friendly, helpful, and efficient. We got a pitcher of the house margaritas {delish}, queso {at the recommendation of our waitress...and she was right on}, and a variety of tacos. We tried the carnitas, potato/chorizo, and fish, and I liked them in that order. The fun trio of salsas {tomatillo, chipotle, and habanero} to accompany them was a nice touch.

They kept the chips/salsa coming the whole night, and we left absolutely stuffed. What's not to like?
author: Kelly B.

description: What a great alternative to so many of the lacking taco places in SF. Each taco had a unique quality that made it more delicious than the last! I absolutely adored the tuna taco appetizer and we devoured the taco sampler (4 tacos for ~$12 is a deal!) My margarhita was really good and all the ingredients in the food seemed fresh and appealing! We will definitely be back!
author: Emily S.

description:
A little on the pricier side, but great tacos, amazing salsas and decent margaritas. Can't ask for much more. I also love their outside seating, great for bringing the puppy along to dinner with us, and the heating lamps make a chilly sf night bearable. Whether sitting at the bar, at a table inside or outside, I've always had consistent attentive service, even during their busiest times. 

menu tips: their tuna tostada app and made to order guac are both to die for. My favorite tacos are the shot and a beer chicken and the carnitas, mmmm.
author: Lauren S.

description: Came here for the last game of the world series. I've heard great things about their tacos, so I had to try it myself. The tacos here are pretty awesome. I absolutely love this place! Great tacos, awesome drinks and a view of the game? Sold. I'm in. Their selection of Tacos are awesome. Anything here is great. The only thing that keeps me from eating here all the time is that they are a bit pricey, but their Taco special is awesome. 10$ for a Taco, a shot of Tequila and a Tecate? Count me there for any game night!
author: Michael N.

description:
The free salsa was yummy, with quite a bit of cilantro.

Guacamole was tasty and ncie to add onto the tacos.

Got 4 tacos and I tried the carnitas and fish. I think the fish was alright, but the carnitas was good.

Favorite of the meal was the tuna tostada. Tasted like it was smoked or something. Reminded me of smoked salmon. Comes with two taco-sized tostadas.

Definitely was full off 1 taco (had half the fish and half the carnitas) and 1 tostada.

I miss the tostada...and salsa...and guac...and the sun over there.
author: Anita C.

description:
Yummy!! Not only do they have great service but their tacos live up to the hype. The waitress recommended the two most popular tacos on the menu...the fish and the carnitas. Now, the fish taco was good, but not as tasty as I hoped for, the carnitas on the other hand was AMAZING!! 

Oh and I can't forget to mention the margaritas....soooooo good!! Strong but good :) I will be back there for sure!
author: Amanda P.

description: Its in the name- Tacos and they are licious! Here is the deal...on a sunny day gather some friends and have them meet you at Tacolicious- get a pitcher of margaritas and order a platter of tacos- it is a recipe for sucessful friend having.
author: Sarah M.

description: I love this place! I have had almost everything on the menu, the tacos are great, the tuna tostada is very tasty and when available the grilled corn is to die for. If you haven't visited Tacolicious yet you need to. The service is great as well! Definitely worth the wait.
author: Adriana A.

description:
I was really excited to try out this new hot spot, but it was a total disappointment.  Way too overpriced, not a great menu and a total bust for vegetarians.  

The only plus was the salsa sampler that came out with the tacos, that was delish, but not enough to make me come back for more.
author: Chelsea N.

description:
Wow, amazing tacos!! I'm definitely a big fan of Tacolicious after my amazing lunch yesterday. 

I had the chicken, carnitas, and short rib tacos. I added their red salsa and avocado sauce on them, which made then even better. Their Jamaica "lemonade" is delicious! It's dark purple and really refreshing after a spicy bite.
author: Kate J.

description: I've had better tacos in the city, but these are good enough.  I usually come in for a margarita, chips, salsa and a salad (maybe some queso if the group is up for it).  I know it may be strange to order a salad here, but the marina girl salad is a solid go-to option.   Waiting is a pain and the service can be spotty, but it won't stop be from putting it on the normal rotation.
author: Jill S.

description: The ceviche and carnitas tacos here are really good. I would say all of the other tacos are just ok. $3 extra for the filet mignon tacos are not worth it. Definitely stick with the carnitas. The service was pretty good. Overall, not a bad taco place, but not the best in town either.
author: Kerry K.

description:
Good food, better drinks.... wouldn't come here expecting authentic mexican food.  But I definitely feel it has a good vibe for happy hour / schmoozing with friends.

Chorizo tacos 
Carnitas taco
Grilled fish 
Nopal ( prickly pear) inspired beverage
author: David C.

description:
Only had their tacos, but they were pretty delicious and came with a choice of three taco sauces. Well seasoned and the meats are very tender. The salsa was also quite tasty.

The seating is not the most comfortable and could use a little more cleaning. But overall, a great place to go when you are craving good mexican food.
author: Cindy T.

description:
yum! the tacos were delicious (4 star worthy), but the service was unbelievably slow.  we ordered the special giants taco (buffalo chicken with black beans), short rib, carnitas, and shot and a beer chicken.  all the tacos were really tasty and pretty filling. we also got the chili con queso which was awesome and super cheesy.

we only waited a couple minutes, but im not sure i'd brave the usual wait here for the tacos.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Honestly, meh. I had higher expectations. I just keep being disappointed in SF Mexican food. And yes, I know this is in the Marina, but that goes for the Mission as well. And I think Mamacita's has great food (despite the EXTREME scene-iness), so I'm really not a total purist or anything. 

The good:

The plaintain appetizer was tasty. So were the tuna tostadas. The salsa was very good (not spicy, but that's okay). 
Service was very friendly and pretty solid considering the place was packed and we were sitting outside. 

The bad:

The margarita pitchers were expensive and way full of ice. So pretty watery and not enough to go around, and tasted like they'd been made from a mix. 
The bean and cheese dip really did taste like it was made with velveeta. I thought the waiter was joking! 

The meh:

The tacos were not terrible, but really not up to snuff for a place called tacolicious. The fish tacos next door at Pacific Catch are way better than the Rock Cod taco here. Fresher ingredients, more flavor. The short rib taco was okay, but kind of flavorless and not that interesting. 
The drunken beans were not anything special. 
The outdoor heater was broken. I don't really ding for that, because it happens, but I'm just saying. 

Overall, I might go back because it's convenient, but the bill ended up being way too high for what we got (mostly because of the watery margaritas). Meh. Disappointing. La Costeña, where are you when I need you?
author: vanessa r.

description: I found this place because I follow a food photographer on instagram.  When I walked in, I already knew that I had found a place that I would love.  The restaurant was crowded and there was only space for me to sit at the bar.  The Bartender and other patrons were super nice to me and quickly gave me suggestions on what to try. I started off with a side of the guacamole and it was super tasty. then I ordered 3 tacos just so I could get a bite of several different tacos. I tried the pulled pork, braised shortrib and fish tacos....all three were tasty but the braised shortrib blew my mind.  The meat was super tender and the sauce that was on the meat was sweet. I also had a margarita that was made with habenero vodka and passion fruit juice...the word great doesn't do this drink any justice.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
As if the Marina didn't have enough Mexican food joints?  Well, this one is different...it's where the "hipsters" go.  If you don't like hipsters, don't go here....go down the street to one of the other fantastic Mexican food restaurants on Chestnut (like Mamacita or Chilayo).

I must say, though, that the Carnita meat is out of this world good.  I love that they have maduros (fried plantains) on the menu.  My cocktail was good, not great.  The service was good, (again not great).  

I think what turned me off to this place was the ambiance.  I didn't feel the vibe of the patrons at all - I can't put my finger on it.  However, I know when I go to the places mentioned earlier, I never feel like people are looking down their (surgically enhanced) noses at me.  Maybe it was just that evening?  

I'm sure we'll be back and I hope to leave with a better impression.  For now, Tacolicious is not tops on my list of Marina Mexican must-haves.
author: Heather L.

description:
Tacolicious you are TACO-LICIOUS! ...And I bet you've never heard that before. :)

The boyfriend and I have lived in the Marina for only two months now, but we're quick to notice the cute little taco joint that always seemed to be a-buzz.

The boo, cousin, and cousin's college friend, ventured here together for a lovely late lunch. Our waiter was extremely friendly, and didn't seem to mind that we'd gone through two bowls of chips and salsa (which are delicious), before we even bothered to look at the menu. 

The guys ordered a variety of tacos, and I ordered the pork tostada. Although the tostada was tasty, the tacos are CERTAINLY the way to go. They order a mix of veggie, carnitas, chicken, and short rib- our favorite being the carnitas. They also give you three different salsas to accompany the tacos, ranging from mild to HOT. 

Absolutely our favorite place in the Marina to date. We will certainly be back! I'm anxious to try these Margaritas! 

Only downside: It gets LOUD! Conversation is a little difficult to have.
author: Annalise F.

description:
3.5 Stars

When you walk into a place called "tacolicious" it's very hard not ask yourself "why in the world would they name a place tacolicious"??? But I wont base my review on my dislike of the name.

*I would go back (infact I went twice in 1 day)
*Good Food
*Good ambiance
*Good service
*Evidently fresh ingredients
*Recommendation: Fish Taco, Carnitas & Shortrib Tacos

Bottom line is I was able to get over the name and actually enjoy the meal. I thought that Shortrib was unique & it definitely worked. There's more dishes I'd like to try like the Ceviche so this is just a preliminary review.  

ps. You really know you're in the Marina when you have to pay $2 for Chips & Salsa :)
author: Christina D.

description:
In brief:
- Tacos are amazing. Chicken and Beef were shredded to perfection and dripping with flavor. Ok, so it might have been oil. Doesn't make it any less yummy. 
- Chaco Taco was no imitation - stuffed with quality vanilla bean ice cream wrapped in a fresh waffle cone and covered in hard chocolate. Are you hungry yet?
- Got everything to-go, so can't comment on the place itself, except to say it was busy at the bar and outside seating is limited on the sidewalk. Looks posh. 

In depth:

- Not really much to say, except that they give you a heap load of salsas if you want. I recommend the dark red one if you like chipotle smokey stuff, and the green one if your normal and just want some kick in your dish.

- Overall, I give Tacolicious 4 stars because it was totally perfect for my mexi-craving at 9 PM. Can't do much better in the Marina I don't think. Or can you....?
author: Jeff M.

description:
Tacos are super tasty (esp the fish and chorizo) and the music is full of old school hip hop classics. It was a very chill sunday evening meal.

The food came out super fast and although it's clearly not the healthiest of meals, the combination of the vibe and tasty, simple food means i'll definitely come back again.

Was not a big fan of the churros for desert though... Almost too crispy, and the chocolate sauce was a little flavourless.
author: Aadil M.

description:
Carnitas Tacos Rock My World!
Oh dear God. I thought I was experiencing happiness for the first time when I put that Carnitas taco in my mouth! All their tacos are amazing....but when you put that Carnitas taco in your mouth, your tongue gets to have a flavor party! It is my new guilty pleasure food place in the city.
author: Janine G.

description: This place is really cool but I was not 'Blown away' by their tacos. It was definitely 'alright'. very hip
author: Nicolas M.

description:
I find myself craving Mexican food more commonly than many of my cohorts. I want it all the time but, it's hard for me to find a place that offers me the comfort of my hometown. I grew up in Tucson, AZ and am skeptical of places that boast a Mexican food menu but have a clientele that looks more fit for a French diner. 

My boyfriend and I stumbled upon Tacolicious after a passerby recommended it to us. We were hungry and didn't want to wait the requisite 45 minutes for a table so, we opted for two seat at the bar. This was a great idea because we got to admire the cooks as they created guacamole from scratch! 

The service was fantastic and very fast. The chips, salsa and guacamole were delicious. We ordered sangria, a staple in our lives, and it surpassed our expectations. Per our awesome servers recommendation, we got three different types of tacos and they were each incredible! 

Since that day, we have gone back several times and always brought friends in who never leave disappointed. Every time we go there, we try something else from the menu and every time, we are completely satisfied.
author: Bethann W.

description: I was surprised to be disappointed by so many elements of this place. In a nutshell we received menus/service/ordered after two other walk-in parties, our drinks took a long long time because of a "computer glitch", a neighboring table found a hair in their food, we found a hair in our food... We were able to get our drinks comped for all these mishaps but overall this place is extremely slow for a simple taco shop.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Great vibe, fun to watch hot-ish Marina folks drive by multiple times in their 3 Series, and the best carnitas I have ever had. Awesome tequila menu.

Only four stars because they don't take reservations. So dumb.
author: Nick H.

description:
Went on a Sunday afternoon and enjoyed a brunch/lunch. 

The huevos rancheros were alright.. but my friend ordered tacos and they were delicious. Our favorites were definitely the homemade chorizo and the braised beef. All the salsa's are super delicious. Definitely worth checking out. 

We had originally wandered out heading to Los Hermanos, but they were closed and this was actually just as authentic-ly good. Glad to have stumbled in and not sure if I'll actually make it to Los Hermanos at a sober hour ever now.. 

Will def return..
author: Ami D.

description:
This place was pretty delicious. Went on a Thursday evening after work and had to wait for 20-30 minutes, but that was ok. My friend and I just walked down the street to have a cupcake first. :) What's wrong with dessert first?!

Anyways, we got to our table, and it was a high table. I had to be careful to get into the chair--ya know, being 5'0 and all. Moving on...guacamole was fresh and had tons of flavor...as did the tacos. Braised beef was awesome as were all the other tacos I ordered (I honestly can't remember the others I ordered but I was satisfied nonetheless). However, I could do without the plethora of cilantro they threw on there....not a fan of cilantro. ew. 

Overall, great place, a bit noisy, not great for a first date or anything, but good place to pig out with friends!
author: Victoria B.

description: Tacolicious used to be my favorite spot, but I've found that as they've gotten more popular the service has dropped off completely. This last Saturday I had friends from out of town and I wanted to something different with them. We decided on a drinking bike tour and Tacolicious was at the top of my list. We arrived that place was packed as usual, and we were lucky with seats as we went in two ladies had just left the bar and we scooped up their seats. We sat right in front of the bartender and still waited a good 10 minutes before finally being acknowledged and ask if we wanted drinks. I understand maybe they're going for the laidback environment but when the bartender is more concerned with getting his own drink on than the customers I think we need to reevaluate the business model. We were offered chip and salsa that for some reason NEVER arrived and at the point decided that food was out and we'd be moving on to our next stop. We left very disappointed, and I was embarrassed as my friends keep asking how could this be one of your favorite spot? The service was downright horrific.
author: AHodgee H.

description: I have been here several times, but the enchilada's I have today for lunch were great.  I know everyone goes here for taco's but enchilada's are were it is at.  I would totally recommend getting them the next time you go there.  Also the bartender was great, we never had to ask for anything, he took care of us fantastically.
author: Marta V.

description:
If you want the best tacos in town, come here.  I just happened on this place and I can just think "Wow!, how can I miss this?".  I was seated fast and the food came quick.  Crispy chips and fresh salsa appear out of no where as I pondered the menu.  Service was friendly and efficient.  

The tacos, although resembleing street tacos, they definitely are not!   The corn tortillas were covered with large chunks of meat.  The tantilizing  shortrib version had some bite!  It was delish and the best of the bunch.  The carnitas was savory and the chicken was moist.  Great stuff!

The energenic ambience will have you thinking it's a cantina where tequila flows freely but don't just drink, have some tacos!
author: MTBer I.

description:
Went to this Marina place for lunch on 7-3-10.  We had intended to go to a more homestyle taqueria across the street, but we looked over at Tacolicious and saw that crowd eating at outdoor tables and thought it looked more interesting.  The 3 of us ordered 8 tacos (carnitas, chicken, short ribs, cod) and a side of "drunken beans".  They immediately brought out chips and salsa.  The chips were crisp and the salsa very fresh and unique -- very tasty.

The food came quickly, and with it they brought out 3 more salsas to put on the tacos:  mild (green), medium (red) and hot (yellow).  All were flavorful and good.  The tacos were generally all excellent -- served on two layers of small corn tortillas -- not huge portions but more than you might think for "street tacos".  Only the cod was a bit disappointing, in that there was too much breading, so the deep fried aspect of this overpowered what was actually good fish.

Overall, good service, very good and unique food and a trendy setting.  More expensive than your typical Mexican food place (our bill for 3 with no alcohol was over $40 before tip), but worth it for a nice lunch or dinner with friends.  Don't compare this to eating at the taqueria across the street.  I would definitely go back.
author: Fred E.

description: The restaurant itself is pretty nice. The presentation of the food isn't bad either. Unfortunately, you have to eat it, and it wasnt very impressive.. We went in for breakfast, kept it simple, with huevos con chorizo and it comes with rice and beans on the side. I started of with a bloody mary as well, I should have known when the bloody mary tasted like toilet water how it was going to go. The beans were cold the rice was blah and the portions make you chuckle (wheres the rest of my food). I mean, they might be doing you a favor considering it wasnt that great anyway. All in all, I wouldnt go back.
author: Pete G.

description:
Imagine an alternate world where humanity developed along different biological lines. In this alternate world instead of highly developed taste buds, humans have highly developed optic nerves that can see across the entire spectrum of light. In this alternate world, my alternate self looked at a Tacolicious taco and saw a blurry ball of gray. 

Even a person with an entirely crippled perception of Mexican food (IE. people from the East coast) could potentially detect the non-presence of flavor in these taco-appearing food objects. 

To the bitchy Japanese guy with the purse dog; yes we did cut in front of you in line at the farmer's market. No, it wasn't on purpose, you're like 4'3". If I get my Delorean out of the shop I'm loading up Mister Fusion and going back to last Thursday and sticking up for you because if I do and put my past self in his place (behind you in line) then my past self will get there too late to be served up some truly bland tacos thus creating a rather typical time travel paradox.
author: Milk N.

description:
I came here on a rare beautiful-sunny weekend in SF. The location of this place is great,  because the area has a lot of outdoor seating and mini shops which reminds me of Georgetown. It's a pretty small joint with a full bar and  a few outdoor tables. 

I am not a huge Mexican food fan so when my bf took me here, I was a bit skeptical. However, I do have to say after trying the tacos, I am now a fan. we had 
1. Fried local rock cod (my favorite) 
2. shot-and-a-beer braised petaluma chicken
3. house made chorizo potato
4. guajillo braised beef short rib (my second favorite)

Though the price was not cheap (compared to taco tuesdays at tacobell) but the price was worth it.
It comes with free chips and salsa. I loved loved loved the guacamole dip but the tostada salsa was way too spicy for me. These 4 tacos looks small in size but it was very filling.

It takes a lot to change my views on Mexican food but this place did it.
author: Mishi W.

description:
After immigrating to this homogeneous neighborhood I was saddened about my Mexican food (read burritos!) prospects. While Tacolicious does not fill the void in my heart of cheap, tinfoil enclosed logs of love they make some great tacos. Which did more for my waist line than marathons ever did. Now I nurse a healthy addiction to Tacolicious along with my partner in crime. And who doesn't like ordering tacos in quantities? 2 carnitas, 2 fish and 4 chorizo! Carnitas and Chorizo tacos are the best.  

No skimping on the meat here. The tacos are filled to the brim and double "tortilla-ed" for structural integrity. Which can be chased down with some tequila and a 32 oz. Corona tallboy. Tacolicious fills a void of good mexican in this area.  Atmosphere is fun and the staff is more than helpful. Best bet is to belly up at the bar with a friend.
author: Ryan G.

description:
Finally, a great Mexican place on Chestnut that doesn't break the bank. To start they give each table fresh chips with house made salsa, which is really fresh with just a hint of spice. The menu was a bit overwhelming with so many choices -- there's even a 2-page tequila menu with really unique sounding margaritas and sangria drinks.  But since it was lunch, we just opted for no alcohol...next time though!

We ordered 6 different tacos, which were accompanied by three different salsas: avocado, chipotle, and what seemed like habenero which they called "hot". I was a little disappointed that none of the salsa were that spicy, but they all had great flavor. Of all the tacos we tried, the braised beef and the carnitas were the best. The braised beef was so tender and perfectly cooked, and the carnitas tasted great with a little lime juice and avocado salsa. The chicken taco, which came the most highly recommended, was a little underseasoned for my taste, although very tender as well.

The thing I liked best about this place was the street-style tacos that you can't always find. Fresh tasting corn tortillas, yummy salsas, and a great variety of taco and drink choices. Best of all, 4 tacos for $12 was a price I could deal with! I will definitely be back...
author: Erin B.

description:
S L O W service....had to BEG for them to bring our appetizers, it was painful.

Fish taco is tasty--lightly battered, but mine wasn't crispy.

Chicken taco was delicious.

They also started clearing our table and rushed the check to us when we were still working on a full pitcher of margs, while the place was near empty (we didn't ask for it and were still munching). 

Final note to MANAGEMENT (hopefully you get this, as I won't be back and the margs were strong enough to keep me distracted while there), a few marketing disaster's you need to attend to:  1. Take the term "dog" off your beef taco description (I don't care what the association is, if that's the ranches name, etc., it's just a horrible move).  2. This is San Francisco.  It's not a positive spin to explicitly call your food "non-sustainable", "not-healthy", but "delicious".  I'll just eat next door from now on. YAY, Pacific Catch!!!
author: Sara S.

description:
There were 5 of us and we ordered their skillet roasted laughing bird shrimp. For some reason, we thought it was supposed to be prawns. We were disappointed that we had to get about 2 pieces of shrimp per person. And this dish was $10! Paying $1 per shrimp?  It was good. Word to the wise: This dish is enough for 2 people who like small servings. Scale to your needs.

We ordered their 10-tacos special. It was great being able to order from among 6 choices and mix and match. I had only carnitas. My friends loved their braised beef and their fish tacos. They also shared a pitcher or 2 of sangria. Someone thought their margarita was the best they've ever had. I'm not a drinker and had their "Mia" -- a fruity drink with actual fruit. It was good, except for whatever "herb" they thought would be cutesy enough to add. I couldn't place it; I just know it was out of place.

Wait staff was spotty. Our waitress disappeared after 15 minutes. Perhaps she was off the clock. Regardless, she still should have told us that other people would be taking over our table. We waited a good half hour hoping to get some flan, but no one came around. So we asked for our check (and waited another 20 minutes). We debated just doing a dine and dash, but thought better of it. To be fair, they were very busy for a mid-afternoon.

One unisex bathroom.
author: Ruiqiu K.

description: Great restaurant! Loved the mole tacos, so delicious. My only complaint is that it's so loud you can barely hear each other. Get there early to get a seat as it is always crowded but worth the wait
author: Jackie G.

description:
Honestly, the most amazing tacos I've ever had! My personal fave? The fish (fried or grilled) and then potato-chorizo!

Any time anyone wants to go to dinner, I demand we go here! 
Meaning I've been here 9 times since it opened in January! 
Can you say obsessed??

Love the decor, service--everything!
author: Ilana I.

description: Pretty good tacos but the servers/bartenders have SERIOUS attitude. I ordered take out the other day and the bartender was SUPER NICE until she saw that I wasn't going to tip (for a take out order? really?) and then she frowned and didn't bother to say thanks for bye.
author: Matt P.

description:
Not all tacos are the same - this place rocks! What to expect:

Great staff
Great tacos
Amazing tequilas 
Pretty good guac and salsa, too

Don't expect traditional Mexican fast food fare such as burritos and such.
author: Lucky L.

description:
The only reason behind my 4 stars and not a 5 is because I don't think the food is super amazing but it is very good.  They also have a really good cocktail menu which offers many unique drinks.  

I watched the World Cup final here and appreciate that they opened their doors early so that people could get great seats for the game. 

I had the chilaquiles de la casa and some huevos rancheros.  The chilaquiles were too sweet for me but I think thats because I don't generally care for mole (I still don't know why I ordered it).  

To drink I enjoyed flor de jamaica which was really good.  

Overall the staff was friendly and helpful and I enjoyed the atmosphere as well.
author: Sabine A.

description: went 5/15 for late dinner and I ordered the tuna tostada - the chipotle aoli was interesting and I think made the dish :) The twist on the Paloma was a yummy drink.  Nice place, nice service. good chips too.
author: Tere C.

description: Best tacos in the city, hands down. The carnitas is amazing! The bartenders, while not overly friendly, will occasionally hand you a shot of tequila on the house (always appreciated!). The wait can be TERRIBLE sometimes, but as it's a small place and the food is excellent, you can't really blame them for that. All in all one of my favorite places to eat in SF, even if it is in the dreaded marina :)
author: Devereux S.

description:
Tacolicious is Delicious! The salsa selection is yummy ask for all of them, the tacos are super tasty, especially the carne asada. The ablongada's are delish. The flavored sodas are something I would never normally try but my friend said they were really good and I was in an adventurous mood so I tried the lime with mint one. It was honestly probably one of my favorite parts of the meal, I HIGHLY suggest that with your meal, refreshing light, not too sweet, DELICIOUS . Def. worth the $4, for a drink. The tortilla soup is probably my 2nd favorite other than the tacos. Has everything even cotija cheese to go with it. The enchiladas were dry..(only complaint), the delicious cheese on them was the best part, still didn't make up for the dryness though. The tacos are obviously delicious (did I already say that?)
The dessert (chocolate with sea salt), was good, but I think it needed something else other than bread to dip the chocolate in. Maybe a crepe like thing or something? the Bageutte didn't quite work. Overall , very satisfied, would go back! (Mamacita is still better by a few notches though, in my opinion, partly because of the their creative menu, and partly because they offer seafood in their mexican dishes, which i love)
author: Jen B.

description: Great place to sit outside and people watch.. Good chips & salsa, margaritas, and their wide range of taco's are all delicious.. This is a good place to go with a few friends or even a date-Although the taco's do get a lil messy your dessert might get messy too. oops.  Enjoy!
author: Tim O.

description: The taco shells, while premium, are basically a formality. The filler is anything but. Every ingredient had so much thought put into it it stands on its own, but even then the sum of the whole is greater than its parts.
author: Omar Y.

description:
First time visiting this place, the owner was very tolerant of my critique of his frames! HA! Anyway I got my order to go, then got back to work and realized they had forgotten the shrimp in my salad. Bummer. So, I try to call, no # on the receipt. I look them up on line, I call, no answer, no VM. So, I emailed. 15 minutes later, one of the employees comes in with a whole new salad, plus some other side dishes AND my money back. That's seriously good customer service. I was very impressed.
PLUS: the salad was killer, if not cheap. The side of grilled broccoli was smoky and garlicky, YUM! I will be back. They totally delivered (both literally and figuratively, although it was sort of a one off this time around...)
author: Laurian R.

description: This place is extremely tasty, but a little pricey.  I suggest getting the taco combos with some friends and trying the many different choices they have.  Plus, they often have cheap Tecate and other cheap beer, which is awesome.
author: Casey A.

description:
just had a snake there with my 6 year old son.  we had 4 tacos and the chili con queso.  i think the tacos were pretty greasy, i was very surprised for a marina joint, i would think hella clean and healthy looking but was super greasy.  i mean i don't really mind, but pretty marina girls will be like, i don't know.  anyway, the meat also wasn't so authentic mexican style unless they're trying a different more urban hip style and not authentic.  chicken was sloppy, had huge pieces and very small pieces.  carnitas, beef short ribs, and chorizo potato.  not much special flavoring going on.  it was alot better when i doused a bunch of habenero salsa on it.

La Cumbre Valencia and 16th.  The best tacos I've ever had.  Wait, I haven't yelped that place...
author: Kevin L.

description: After a night of partying in the city, this was the spot we chose to nurse our head ache the next day. The atmosphere is laid back, it's in the marina so it's interesting to people watch. To start, we had the chicken soup and empanadas. The chicken soup was satisfying, spiced just the way I like. It reminded me of posole but with chicken. My bf enjoyed the empanadas but they were just ok for me. We also ordered the grilled squid which we both loved! It had a nice smoked flavor and was quite tender, served with garbanzo beans and a delightful lemon caper sauce. We sampled 4 different tacos and all were tasty. Service was adequate, an overall enjoyable meal and good value.
author: April Rose D.

description:
It took some convincing to get me to come here after getting back from Mexico. First of all, I had just eaten tacos for a week straight. And secondly, I had just been to Taco Bar which was the worst taco I've had to date, so I didnt want to try another Marina/Pac Heights froo-froo wannabe taco place.

Boy was I wrong about this place. It ROCKED. Really flavorful, extremely fresh tasting, cheap as can be (especially for this area), awesome salsa that comes with the (too greasy) chips, and reminded me of the better parts of an authentic Mexican taco.

Though we were tempted by some starters (like the chile con queso dip and the tuna tostada) we opted for the 4 taco option and added one of the daily special tacos for a total of 5. Wish we were hungry enough that day to try more but this allows an excuse for many future visits.

Fried Local Rock Cod, Cabbage, Tangy Crema
-This was my least favorite and I'm a huge fish taco fan. The fish wasn't fried until crispy enough to the taco was a bit mushy, and there really was no crema to speak of which is my favorite part of a fish taco, so it was a little disappointing, but I'd try it again because they were slammed so it may have been rushed to get to us.

Shot and a Beer Braised Petaluma Chicken
-This was the favorite by both of us, so flavorful.

Traditional Carnitas
-Alex D. raved about this one.

Guajillo Braised Beef Short Rib
-Maybe we just dislike beef (we never eat it), so this was too beefy for our taste but if you like beef, you'll love this (I think :)

Taco of the Day
-It was a slow cooked pork that day, and was good albeit too greasy.

Okay so maybe in hindsight after writing this I wasn't blown away and nothing here was revolutionary, but coming here right after Taco Bar made this place stand out and prove that good Mexican (sorta street-style) tacos can be done in a sit down setting without sucking (a la Taco Bar).

Give it a shot, and get a pitcher of margaritas!
author: Abby Z.

description:
MMMMM.... tasty tacos.

Came here with some friends earlier this week after some drinks around the corner at The Republic.  I didn't know what to expect, but had heard good things and am always ready for tacos.

I was not disappointed...  chose the four taco option and picked the nopales, carnitas, chorizo and beef short-rib.  The carnitas was tasty, but nothing earth-shattering.  All of the others had really unique, intense flavors.  You can't go wrong with any of em.  If I had to choose a favorite, it would have to be the beef short-rib.  Deep, engaging spices, mouthwatering feel, wonderful texture.

Service was really friendly (but the kitchen was kinda slow).  Engaged in good banter with the waitress, especially when we incorrectly guessed she was from Poland (she is actually from the Czech Republic).  But that was blamed on the numerous pre-taco beers and the inability to correctly discern the accent.

Plenty of free chips and salsa.  Awesome decor.  Eclectic music.

Overall I had a blast and really enjoyed the food.  This won't be my last visit.
author: Matthew D.

description:
Expensive Mexican food in the Marina. I prefer Mamacita's. 

The chips and salsa was okay... yes, it is free, but just ok. 

The tuna tosada is a lot smaller than I had anticipated... but still delicious! You get two tosadas with tuna and a chipotle mayo on top. 

I got the carnitas taco and it was FABULOUS. Highly recommended!

The drinks... small. Tiny. Not very strong. 

Will I come back? Sure... when it isn't busy. What will I have, just the tacos... 

Just okay. If there is a long wait... just come back another time.
author: Lisa L.

description: Went for a friend's birthday on a tuesday and was surprised that a taco shop doesn't have taco Tuesday but instead have burger Tuesday. Taco's didn't have a lot of flavor and the staff member that brought the food to the table was very rude and didn't even answer our questions about what type of taco's they were. Just walked away very annoyed! The venue is nice though.
author: Lise-Marie K.

description:
Love it!

We were walking by around 3 pm and I realized I never ate lunch so, what the hell. They had me after the first bite of chips and salsas. Seriously, that salsa is in my ultimate top five! I will be back for that alone.  Next, the tacos carnitas are amazeballs. I had to stop myself from inhaling them. The cod taco was not as good but still passes. 
Ultimately, its fun, trendy, appropriately priced and there is some excellent food to be had. The only downside was that our server looked like he was counting down the minutes until he could clock out--not very engaged.
author: Jeff C.

description:
I am all about the rugged hole in the wall Mexican joint serving up cheap, delicious eats. But, there is nothing wrong w/farm to table meets Mexican w/a splash of chic. My friend Jeremy said it right: Tacolicious serves up Mexican like a sushi-bar. 

Major points for fresh chips and salsa brought to us immediately after we sit down.

Super tasty, filling tacos on fresh corn tortillas are served up family style. 

Lovely, colorful, fresh sauces from mild to hot to accompany the tacos. 

Al Pastor: Delish
Braised Short Rib: Also Delish
author: Lans S.

description:
I very, very, VERY foolishly almost did NOT go here because of some hugely mistaken notion that this was a serve yourself type of restaurant. Could not have been more wrong. Don't let the name fool you, too. Tacolicious is a hip, chic little place on Chestnut with amazing food, really good drinks and great service. Highlights for me were the tuna tartare tostada (can't remember exact name) starter, the last drink on the cocktail menu (also forgot the name, but the only one with egg whites and pisco, but it's not a pisco sour), the carnitas tacos and the corn. The corn was unreal. I would fly back just for a meal of the tuna tartare, carnitas tacos (with the hot sauces, of course) and the ancho-chile rubbed corn. 

Unbelievably good.
author: Vespa R.

description:
This place is amazing. Good atmosphere, good food, good drinks, one of my favorite spots in SF.

The pork belly taco is amazing!
author: Ricky M.

description: What can I say, I love me some Tacolicious.  One of my favorite places to visit while in the Marina.  Before trying this place, I thought all the hype would leave me disappointed, but I was happy to be proven wrong! Their tacos are awesome, and it's a goal of mine to return and try the other menu options and drinks.  Such a fun atmosphere also!
author: Bridget B.

description:
Shockingly good.  Perhaps even great.

All of the tacos we had were fantastic, the best being the short rib, the chicken, the carnitas and the chile verde.  The chorizo was badly overcooked, but still tasty, and the cod was really underseasoned.  The cod was, however, easily fixed with a healthy dose of their AWESOME habanero salsa.  Served up with fresh and fantastic chips, excellent service and crazy inventive tequila-based cocktails like the pasion (habanero-infused tequila with passion fruit), which was the best, followed by "if honey could drink, " which was a tequila-cucumber-citrus concoction.  The spicier drinks were also excellent, but I generally lost interest in them after the first few sips because they were not terribly drinkable.

All that, and they had crayons and a taco truck color-in for the kids.  And child control with an admonition that only kids that behave get the free sundae.  

They thought of it all.

Just outstanding at what they do.
author: Michael H.

description:
A whole restaurant centered around 6 tacos?  That's what my first impression was when I heard about this place.  Then we arrive and see that about 1/16 of the menu space is devoted to food... the remainder, of course, being different tequila options.  Okay, first thought: I'm liking this place more by the second;  second thought: now this place makes more sense - third thought interrupting the second: get me a drink!

The carnitas and beef were far and away the best options.  Don't waste time with the chicken/potato thing or the chorizo.  The other two out of six (obviously neither exceptional nor exceptionally terrible enough to remember) were decent, but really... get the carnitas and beef.  Yum-ola.
author: Cole I.

description: Stumbled upon this place after getting lost in the Presidio. It was beyond delicious. I would gladly drive up to SF specifically to eat here. Tacos are filling, I had the butternut squash, drunken chicken, spare ribs and chicken mole. All of them were SO good. Also had the meatballs. Those put it just over the top. Chips and salsa were good, but next time I won't stuff myself with them since I could barely finish the meal. They also have this habanero infused tequila drink. Wow. It has quite a kick. All in all - great place. Just make sure you bring quarters for the metered parking.
author: kira d.

description:
Whoa! I cannot believe these people are giving this yuppie, white-boy taco stand from the Marina this many stars.  I suspect the other reviewers come from the same place (or their sycophantic reviews make me think they're friends of the owner).  Simply put, these tacos are not worth the $3.50 price and the half hour wait.  They were incredibly bland, even with the sauces. 

My word of advice, if you're in the mood for street food, go get yerself something real and flavorful from the El Toyonese or Los Compadres taco trucks up the street. The wait will be shorter, the food will be better, the price will be cheaper and you wont have to suffer through the douche manager guy hitting on the hipster girls while you're standing around, waiting 20 minutes for your food.
author: HiLo L.

description: The food was over priced and the quality was not good.  The atmosphere here was laughable at best.  The beef sauce taco which is usually cheap and only good when made correctly were terrible. The sauces I think were  creative, but only one was decent.
author: Cristina G.

description: If Beretta f*cked an authentic Mexican taco cart and banged out a love child of orgasmic culinary proportions, you would have Tacolicious.  Nestled amongst bars filled with hedge fund managers, annoying hipsters and hot MILFs, Tacolicious makes a bold statement with a taco offering that holds up to even Southern California standards of Mexicosity.  With hot waitresses, minty mojitos and a anti-hipster ambience, Tacolicious has achieved a level of winning that would make Charlie Sheen jealous.
author: Kyle T.

description:
If you want good mexican food and margaritas, don't go here.  Margaritas were way too sweet.  Chips were stale.  Taco meats (carnitas, mole chicken, chorizo) all overcooked and bland.  We had too add a ton of sauce to give the tacos some kind of flavor.

The obnoxious, drunk Marina crowd just added to the awful experience.  My recommendation would be to skip Tacolicious and go to Nopalito or an authentic taqueria in the Mission instead.
author: Lauren F.

description: I visited this place on a Sunday night. It was packed but we were seated quite quickly outside. We ordered the four tacos for $12 and the albacore style tostadas (this dish is a must try!). I thought this was going to be to much food even though I was sharing with another person.... However, the two tostadas and tacos were much smaller than I pictured. Basically,  you could eat them in like 3 to 4 bites or 1 to 2 if you have a big mouth. Surprisingly, at the end of the night I found myself full but I couldn't resist the offer of dessert and we were given a taste of the dessert compliments of the waitress, Heather who was pleasant and attentive considering how busy that place was. She even brought my friend a blanket, which they keep on hand for the homeless and outside guests. I definitely plan on returning in the future and exploring some of their other menu items including dessert.
author: Shoshanna T.

description:
really fun vibe here on a thursday night.   we only stopped in for the laiola chocolate dessert, which is basically chocolate with sourdough slices (and incidentally, also tastes great with chips!)

service was friendly.
author: Josie M.

description:
Good authentic tacos here. I see some others have received dry tacos here, but nobody at our table had anything but delicious authentic succulent tacos. The tacos might be a tad overpriced, but not terribly so, and the drinks while overpriced, were no more so that comparable places in the Marina.

I docked it a star because it was a bit cramped in there, and service could have been a tad friendlier.
author: Ryan S.

description: Tacolicious is fabulous! I had such a great experience with the staff and the quality of the food- the ambience is just great. I had a friend visiting SF and she agreed it was the best spot we'd been to all weekend. A special shout-out to the Portuguese guy (chef? restaurant manager? not sure of the title)- he made sure we had a great time and the tequila shots didn't hurt. :) I'm definitely going back!
author: Christine L.

description:
I don't know how you can NOT love a place called Tacolicious. It's hard not to smile at the name of a restaurant that ends in -licious. The tacos are very tender and juicy, and the salsas that came with were excellent (especially the light-colored spicy one). Our waiter was very attentive and sassy. I tried to order a drink for myself and he insisted that the four of us do the set of chupito shots of tequila.. which turned out to be a wise decision.

The only drawbacks to this place were the long wait (45 minutes for our party of four) and the homogenous marina girls.

Tacos in order of deliciousness:
* Beef short ribs
* Chicken (slightly dry)
* Carnitas
author: Jenny S.

description:
Being from Southern California- it is hard to find some gooooood guac! Tacolicious hit the spot! Glad to have this new establishment or I guess re-branded establishment join the line up on Chestnut! Thank goodness for recessions- brings a new restaurant scene to Chestnut Street! Out with the losers who cannot afford their rent... well that is because it is time for a face change and now it is in with the new hot spots at much lower rents! Hey... not great for the landlords but great for the residents who are just loving the new vibe on Chestnut Street!

Tacos are fabulous- my favorite is the carnitas! Margaritas are to die for and yes... love this place! Great place for a date or to just grab dinner with a couple of friends. Probably not the best group spot since it is small and tends to be crowded but over all a great new addition to the neighborhood!
author: Kimberly M.

description:
Came here to appease the higher powers in charge of Big Eats SF and they hit it right on the money.

The atmosphere is really great here. It probably helped that it was a Friday evening, but thats besides the point. Chips, salsa, and hot sauce came out pretty quick. The chips were light and the the salsa had plenty of flavor. The 3 different hot sauces were distinct. The yellow one, i imagined to be a fresh mango based sauce. WRONG. It was probably the least enjoyable of the 3. 

I got 2 of the Braised Beef tacos, carnitas, and the "shot-and-a-beer" chicken. All of them were excellent. The beef and carnitas were very tender and didnt have too much fat/grease coming off of them. They were very tasty and did not disappoint. The chicken was honestly nothing special and I put the most sauce on this one to get it how i wanted. Probably the second best thing about these tacos is that, while pricier than some other tacos, they had very healthy servings of meat on them. They were in no way some skimpy $1 tacos with a teaspoon of meat. These were the big boy tacos. So much so that 4 was too much for me.

The tickle me telmo margarita was very well made. Not strong at all and no flavor was too overpowering. If you are loooking for quantity of alcohol, shot + 24oz corona + taco for $13 is a pretty damn good deal.

One gripe I had was that the bartenders and servers seemed to ignore me. Kinda made me feel out of place, but lets just give these people the benefit of the doubt and say it was busy or someone was having an off night.
author: James T.

description:
- Good atmosphere
- Excellent tacos (try their carnitas, it's awesome).
- Service is decent, even when they are super busy.

- This is a great place to go after work.  It's always got a good crowd.  Their house margarita tastes great too.  

I need to get their carnitas recipe.  If anyone knows how they make it, please let me know.  the damn crunchyness in the carnitas is awesome!

I had their dessert too, it was the shizzz.  super good.
author: Milan D.

description: way over hyped and service a joke. i worked in mexican restaurant for ten years and this was cold food prepared badly with a waitress who hated working. this place is all marina attitude without real substance. put on your leather jacket and cheese out here with the cheesers
author: Nors D.

description: I've been here a couple times and I have to say go with any taco with meat. I've had the fish and a veggie taco and both were less than stellar. However, the carnitas (AMAZING) and the beef short rib (almost as amazing!). The meat is just so tender and flavorful. Great wine list and love that they have bubbles by the class at a taco spot. It's usually pretty crowded but a great take on tacos in a more upscale foodie kind of way.
author: Lindsay A.

description: So I love fish tacos... like a lot... like a lot a lot. Tacolicious you didn't cut it for me. Started with guacamole... not much flavor at all. Had some Margaritas, tasted like generic mix and for the amount seemed overpriced, then the tacos we got beef, chicken, and my sweet fishy!!! ... bland... the fact that I had to drench the tacos in the side sauces to get a hint of flavor makes me feel not much love went in to the initial prep. hmmm. no good. Oh and the fish was way to fried, though I should have got it grilled, my bad. Maybe it was a off day but for me all the food was subpar, drinks were week. Service on the other hand was great, very attentive! I will see you again for a second chance Tacolicious, but you better bring your A game....
author: Sean MC E.

description: I'd give it zero stars if I could. Went for dinner today early with my family and they said it would be a short wait, which was fine. Then another group comes in and they seat them right away. No apologies, no acknowledgement. Just bad service. Skip it.
author: Jim S.

description: Horrible service, dark brown (almost burned) chips, dry and overcooked meat... what else matters
author: Mike B.

description:
After seeing a movie last night, we wanted to go for a bite to eat. One requirement? "I don't really want any kind of scene." And...then we end up at Tacolicious on Chestnut at about 10pm. Mission NOT accomplished. 

I will say, however, that the food is outstanding. I came to Tacolicious once before when they were just trying this concept out on Tuesday nights while it was still Laiola, and I loved it. And now that they have the time and the resources to dedicate their efforts to it full-time, they've made it even better. 

I had the queso fresco with honey and spiced pepitas - SO GOOD! Like the mexican version of burrata. And...I had the pulled pork taco of the week. Not sure if it was the pork, the slaw on top, or the tiny drops of habanero salsa I put on it, but it was a burner. Just how I like it!

The service was a little slow, but it was pretty packed. It's definitely got a lot goin' on a Friday night, so get ready. But if you're looking for Mamacita 2.0, here you go...
author: Kate S.

description: Easily best tacos I've ever had and I had to wait an extra 2 minutes so they threw in extra chips and salsa for free! Loved it!
author: Sam G.

description: Average food.. Drinks were alright.. And slow service..
author: Avi S.

description: I love this place and I'm not even a big fan of tacos. The ten taco platter was the perfect lunch for our family of four. My picks were the veggie and cod tacos but I sneaked a bite of the carnitas. Incredible.
author: Therese B.

description: Overpriced Mexico wannabe food. Heard a gringa owns the place.
author: Steve Q.

description: Food was delicious, and la pasion cocktail was very unique- made with passion fruit juice and habanero tequila. The grilled Brentwood corn was great, drizzled in butter and lime. My filet mignon taco was perfection. The staff was very friendly and served us quickly. The only reason it's a four star rating is for the ridiculous noise level, and a very intoxicated girl who fell on me with sauce-covered hands. Thanks for the greasy stain.
author: Alexandra B.

description: Best tacos ever.  This place is nothing short of awesome.  The sauces they give you with every meal are amazing.  the specials are always great.  I have been 3 times and I plan to go back.  I think it is a little over priced, but everything is in San Francisco so you have to go with it.  Highly recommend.
author: Doug G.

description: Sat along the open window seats on a sunny, late Sunday afternoon (last open seats). Pretty loud, but fun spot for some delicious tacos, guacamole and beers to ease the hangover :)
author: Kate B.

description:
Delicious!

Lucky for our company, they cater, so they were representin' in a big way at our prom this year! They were servin' up three different tacos. My favorite was the beef--mmm mmm! Good with or without the sauce--but I highly recommend the sauce because it just added some UMPH to it. 

They are only at the Ferry Bldg. on Thursdays but "the man" owns a restaurant as well. Ask them for the name (begins with an L I think) because I forgot in my drunkenness!
author: Kat H.

description:
The first time i went was after a 4 hour session of rock climbing and boy were we in need of high calories and stiff drinks.  I got what I asked for an little pay came out of my pocket.  

Pros:
Price
Taco of the week (one week supported the oil spill, pretty neato)
bomb.com food
presentation
atmosphere ( i like busy places cause you know the food is fresh)
Filet Migon (not such how to spell it but i do know how to eat it, so tender)
-REAL CHOCO TACO's!!! a little over priced but worth it.
Cons: could be the loud busy seen but Chestnut is that way so not a family place unless you enjoy your kids yelling while the couple at the bar makes out for 20 mins..not joke)
-one stall bathroom, but it's fine for me. 

can't beat 4 delicious tacolicious taco's for $12.  I work for "Two hunks in a truck" moving company as well (see us on yelp) and after a long 10 or 14 hours of moving, we sure do enjoy hitting up this place every so often to satisfy our taste buds and belly with good eats and tasty drinks.

I went on a Friday with a friend and then again on Sunday by myself.  it's that good!

A must try
author: Zach S.

description: Good drinks, great salsa and chips and guacamole.  The tacos were just kind of ok.  If you want to have a normal conversation on a Friday night, don't bother.  Insanely loud in there.  Really noisy.
author: Fred M.

description:
Very meaty tacos, lots of selection, but a bit heavy.

Guac is top notch!
author: L B.

description: Went to dinner here today and everything we ordered was amazing, well except the chile relleno.  This is what we had:  veggie taco, chicken taco, short rib taco, roasted corn, tuna tostada, guacamole & a Nopal & Pasion margarita.  The servers were super friendly.  We will definitely be back next time we're in town.
author: O. A.

description:
So I've officially embarked on a journey to try and yelp the 7X7 2010 Big Eat SF, 100 Things to try before you die list....thus the update.

On the list is the the tuna tostada at Tacolicious. It is delicious....but not sure it is my favorite thing on the menu. I like that it does combine flavors, there is a spicy sauce under the tar tar, and the shell is perfectly thin/crispy. Also served with a fresh avocado which makes everything delicious.

My only concern and my excitement on the journey to review the top 100 is...really before I die? That is a lot of pressure to put on food...and I tend to judge when you throw things in that category.

So yes...delicious...could i die  before I tried it ?....yes
author: Wendy W.

description:
Stopped in here on Friday with my man friend because I have been craving tacos all week.  We started with the chili con queso dip, which was pretty good for the time it stayed melted, when it started to harden it was just kinda like velveeta with a little spice.

We ordered 4 tacos to share and a carafe of margaritas.  The tacos were excellent, especially the short rib, which I would recommend over the others.  It came with a salsa sampler, of which only one was to my liking, but I am glad they offer a few options to every patron.  Oh, the chips were warm and tasty too.  The margartias, at least ours, were pretty bad.  Way too sweet and I'm almost sure made from a store bought mix.  

As for the service... 
I asked the waiter to heat up our dip because our food was taking a while and it was cold and solidified and I needed something to chase my margarita with.  He kindly obliged and with it brought our check... before we even got our main dish.  We jokingly asked him if he had somewhere to be, cause we were feeling rushed, and he said "Yeah, actually, I do."     It was pretty awkward.

Overall, I don't know how I feel about this place because I could get a better taco in the mission for a lot less money, and eat at my own pace without feeling like a burden to the server.  I am willing to give it one more chance though...
author: Britt C.

description: We tend to eat at Tacolicious at least every week. They're convenient, casual, comfort food is usually the perfect hump day retreat. Unfortunately the food (tacos and soup especially)  have been getting saltier and saltier.  Possibly a new chef with a heavy hand in the seasoning department?   Tacolicious, stick to the original recipe. Good food comes from real flavor, not sodium. And don't forget the details that made you guys our "go to spot." Marina girl salad w/out pumpkin seeds, soup w/out avocado.... deal breakers.
author: Erin M.

description:
Yes, the tacos are actually pretty good.  They are pricey, but at least they overload them with the meat filling.  For sure, my favorite is the carnitas tacos.  I've tried all of them, and while the others pack good flavor, they just aren't that exciting.  The salsas they deliver with the tacos are pretty tasty and should be doused over your tacos.  The drunken beans seemed under salted to me, but maybe it was an off night.  

I'll admit, I hate this place during prime time on Friday and Saturday (lunch and evening).   It's a zoo and getting a table is kind of nutty.  However, their service is pretty attentive even when they are slammed.  The window seats are the spot to hangout since there is plenty of people watching.   I'll be coming back, but it will be really late on the weekend or on a weeknight.
author: Simon Y.

description:
This place is so money...why aren't there more Mexican places like this in SF?
The concept is simple, good food, good prices and a good atmosphere.

The tacos are amazing...normally I am a carnitas fan (and they are good here) but the steak and short ribs rock...even the chicken tacos are good.

The beer selection is strong and they offer a great taco and beer combo.

It can get busy and noisy but if you show up early and eat at the bar it's well worth the craziness.
author: Lindsey W.

description: Completely AMAZEBALLS!!!!!!!!!!!!  Traditional Carnitas and Fried Rock Cod Tacos are the way to go. To start, get the ahi tuna w/ crispy onions on tortilla chips.  This is my new regular spot.  Been to both locations and I think the food at Chestnut is better than Mission...but atmosphere at Mission is better than Chestnut!
author: Nicole M.

description: I loved this place. Great ambience and fun. It gets packed on the weekend. If you get a seat by the window, its great people watching. I loved their 3 dipping salsas with the chips. My husband and I got 5 tacos total and 3 different kinds- chicken, veggie, and steak or beef. The portion size was great and reasonable price. Great place to go in the marina!
author: Sheena S.

description: Their tacos are freakin' delicious, I ain't kiddin' around! Love their margaritas too! Funfun place to go to for a delish meal and drinks! Might I add that I love their multiple salsas?!!! Rockn' place.
author: Chrissy A.

description: I guess I should have known better than to order the "Marina Girl Salad" with chicken for $13 but I felt like a salad.  I've had a better chicken salad at El Torito.  The salsa, um, didn't even taste like salsa.  I dont get this place at all.  Not worth the drive at all, Mission is closer and has way better food.
author: Miss M.

description: I am impressed by the quality of the meats and options to order a la carte.  The bar is also great with a full bar and great margaritas.  Great spot to meet up with friends and have a margarita, tacos and chips for a reasonable price, yes, even in the Marina.  Nice to have another tasty mexican spot on Chestnut (other than Mamacita which is also amazing).  Great job all around.
author: Andrea R.

description:
Busy and noisy destination which makes for a fun little eatery w/ friends, I like to get these great, fresh, higher quality tacos that don't make me feel  bad unlike too many other taquerias in the city.  They come with 3 different sauces, mild to spicy.  My fav are the chicken and beef, i've tried the veggie one but it lacked in crunchiness, i had the feeling to eat a sponge.  There's always a special of the day or of the week, i forget, well, the margarita pitchers probably didn't help for details...
Oh and their stools fall easily! beware!
author: Damien J.

description: Carnitas and braised beef tacos are delicious! They catered to our office last week and threw in an array of condiments, salsas, and tortilla chips to go with the tacos :)
author: Cheri D.

description:
We sat outside under heat lamps. Service was pretty good, food was yummy, but I just feel like therre are so many other options for Mexican so I only give 3 stars. I wouldn't say extremely memorable, but I'd go back if I were out that way again. Just won't make a special trip I guess. We had an array of tacos and some starters.

Give it a shot if you haven't been there. Just beware the crowd can be a bit young (soriety / frat scene).
author: Nicole L.

description:
great carne asada tacos here! since they are priced very well for the place and trend.. two tacos wont be enough - go for three 
their beans are also a great addition to the tacos 
the presentation is really beautiful, however they should think about getting smaller plates or bigger tables. there isnt a lot of room the more stuff you order
also, there is always some sort of line when i go here - so make sure you arent starving.
author: Melissa P.

description:
Summary: Modern tacos in the marina

Companion: B-Zu for a late night got-the-munchies stop

Ordered:
tuna tostada
2 veggie tacos
2 rock cod tacos
Beer

Positives:
+ Pleasant staff, prompt service
+ Good mix of people (except for miss sky-blue-polka-dot who didn't want to move her jacket so I could sit down)
+ Veggie taco - sounded dangerously healthy (corn, squash, peppers) but was lovely
+ Yummy salsa with complimentary chips PLUS a salsa flight served with the tacos

Not-so-positives:
- The rock cod taco - not particularly spiced, so tasted like fish n-chips fish in a tortilla, even with salsa help
- The tuna tacos were good but a bit chewy so there were some unsatisfying eating moments where I had mouth full of tuna and no shell - maybe smaller pieces of fish?
- All the flatware and glasses were ever-so-slightly grungy

Other:
Restaurant was hopping at midnight, we were lucky to get seated without a wait. They were showing Finnish mud soccer on ESPN - very diverting.

Bill: ~$30 - not bad at all
author: kavi r.

description:
Street style tacos made to perfection.
Authentic tradition but also some creative modernity on a large menu.

Plus there's a drink named after the chef....
author: Mark E.

description:
Went in to Tacolicious with my mom and sister on Sunday and am very happy I did.  Perfect when you want to satisfy the Mexican food craving but looking for a little more than a pick up burrito (by more I mean ambiance and flavor - not more food). 

We tried an assortment of tacos and I was very happy with the chicken and cod (grilled is an option).  $12 for 4 tacos - great deal!

Margaritas were pretty damn good but have to say my complaint falls here - filling the pitcher to the brim with ice looks cheap and makes it hard to pour.  If they have to, less Ice and don't fill the pitcher to the brim.  

Dying to go back to try their flying bird shrimp - eyed it at my neighbors table (which by the way - you will be very close to if you sit on the left side of the restaurant).
author: Sarah G.

description: Obsessed with the carnitas tacos and spicy margaritas at this place!  They're also great at catering - super reasonable pricing and easy to deal with!
author: Anna V.

description: Pretty much my favorite place in the Marina. Their braised short rib tacos are to die for. I am drooling just thinking about them.. See you soon.
author: J R.

description: The tacos are the bomb...don't let the menu fool you with other options. Carnitas and the short ribs are the best options, the chicken and veggie ones are good too, but the fish is average. They are expensive for tacos but they are tasty! Like its neighbor, Pacific Catch, the place gets packed so go off-peak hrs.
author: Alex C.

description: My husband, grandson and I went here for a late lunch (1:00ish) and it was still crowded... but very worth it... and we lucked out with a table right away.  Everyone liked their meal, including our grandson who ordered the kid's quesadilla, husband who ordered two different tacos, and me who ordered enchiladas.  We'll be back!
author: Nancy C.

description:
