These are some damn fine tacos!! Too bad they're only at the Ferry Bldg. Farmer's Market on Thursdays. I have tried damn near every taco variety they serve and have never been unhappy and I dont even like cow tongue ( surprise, surprise). I always judge what I refer to as, 'white boy tacos' by the quality of the tortillas and salsa and Tacolicious doesn't disappoint. go get you some; JUST KNOW WHAT THE HELL YOU WANT BY THE TIME YOU GO TO ORDER!! Seriously mid 30's Mom, some of us are on our lunch break!

Oh definitely get a peach agua fresca; it's way better than your $4 blue bottle single drip, you hipster you
author: Lee S.

description:
I took advantage of the cold weather and headed to the Ferry Building yesterday.  Most of the FiDi SFers were to wimpy to brave the cold, so their loss is my gain.  The line was short, and the tacos were certainly taco'licious!   

For $9, I had 1 chicken taco, 1 short rib taco, and 1 carnitas.   I will definitely be going back, because the chicken and carnitas were amazing.  I thought the short ribs were just ok.  

If you're looking to get your taco fill at lunch time, I thought this place was pretty darn good!  Check it out on Thursdays at the Ferry Building.  I doubt you'll be disappointed.
author: Sho O.

description: Amazing tacos - it's one of the foods you will absolutely crave in the city if you can get a seat. I am definitely a fan and repeat customer.
author: Don W.

description:
You couldn't ask for a better meal after a 6 hour flight and a 3 hour time change.

The tuna tostada was recommended to us and it was absolutely fantastic and the highlight of the meal. Tacos were great, definitely sample the beef ones over the other first. Eat them fast while they are hot and before the tortillas get soft. The petaluma chicken and the cactus one didn't have as strong a flavor, and were a little bland. You are required to order the guac, had a great kick and took the tacos themselves to a new level.

The Fleur de Jamica was a fab, uplifting drink, however the sangria seemed heavy on the liquor.

If you see a window see, run for it, they go fast and the inside is a little cramped.

Keep doin' what you are doin' Tacolicious~!
author: Kenneth and Katie A.

description:
I absolutely love this place.  It's definitely a bit of a scene, but our sweet little trick is that we sit outside. There are heat lanterns overhead, so if it's not drizzling you're set to go. Granted I'm from Colorado and 50 degrees seems like a light summer breeze, but even my from-LA-originally roommate thinks that this is an acceptable solution. 

The tacos here are too good and perfectly simple, just some corn tortillas stuffed with insanely delicious meat.  Personally, I am a huge fan of the short ribs and the petaluma chicken ones.  But quite frankly I would eat any of them with a smile on my face.  The only taco I have an issue with is the fish one, it's a little bland, which sucks as I do love fish tacos.

But really what gets me are the drinks here.  Like any good aspiring attorney my top three general interests range from such diverse areas as tequila to vodka rocks to a fine cabernet. The margaritas are wonderful, they taste really fresh and they're never too sugary.  Furthermore, the Mexican Traitor chupito?  Just do it...trust me.
author: Kate E.

description: Tacolicious is absolutely delicious!  My favorite item on the menu is the albacore tuna tostadas "contramar-style".  They give you 2 crunchy tostadas with a slice of tuna, chipotle mayo, avocado, and crispy leeks on top. When you bite into this little piece of heaven, you'll get this burst of amazing flavor. It's so unique and pretty unforgettable. I urge you to try these asap!  We ordered a bunch of these for our preschool's fundraiser and they were a hit!
author: Pina C.

description: I loved this place, the service was great and the atmosphere was great also. Good quality for money. Free bowl of corn chips and super yummy dip on arrival. I chose the enchilada without the chicken, so it was abit cheesy - I tasted my friends quinoa salad which had interesting choices of ingredients, like clever interesting, and also tasted the veggie tacos - yum yum and hell to the yum.
author: A M.

description: Excellent food and margaritas.  You can also order a make it yourself taco bar to go.  I've done it for several years on my birthday.  My friends love coming over and making their own taco.
author: Lisa W.

description: With a name like Tacolicious, you can assume that the tacos are delicious. And they are indeed, but what makes this place amazing is all the other delicious things they have as well. Like the poblano chile soup, for example. Yum. Or the full bar with incredible margaritas and an impressive tequila selection. Or the big screen TV's for sporting events. It's almost like this place is like a Mission District taqueria but with a Marina District kind of style. Oh, wait. I guess that's exactly what it is!
author: Bret W.

description: Taco of the week. Yum. Guacamole. More please. LOVE! I couldn't help but want to pig out. After working out, I came here to stuff my face. It hit the spot immediately.I felt no guilt eating every morsel of tacolicousness and guac . I loved it. I want to go back to try more. Friendly staff. Fresh looking place...Bueno, indeed.
author: Mel P.

description: Tacolicious keeps getting better and better.  For starters, their salsa is excellent.  I want to buy a jar of it - that's how good it is.  I love the vibe in the restaurant - it's super laid back and it makes me feel like I'm on vacation.  The tacos are delicious- they do not skimp on the meat!
author: Sarah K.

description:
FOOD:
So...I can't say I had the tacos when I went..cause it still felt like morning to me so I had the Huevos rancheros and it was ok...just seemed like the standard bean & rice dish..but the girls I went with really liked the tacos
DRINKS:
All three of us hated their specialty drinks (The Bloody Mary, Bloody Maria, Mojito) one even sent it back while I tried to suck it up and finish it really quick and that didn't help either. 
It no 4 star place..3 star at best...
author: Kevin B.

description:
Tacolicious AKA the newest hot spot in the Marina.
I liked it, but I didn't love it.

The concept is simple.  Pack 75 trendy, attractive Marina patrons into a small trendy space.  Serve beer and cocktails and offer somewhat organic/sustainable hearty Mexican food.

Went on a Wednesday night and they were clearly understaffed and needed to work out some kinks.  It took our party of two 15 minutes to be seated. We were then seated smack in the middle of two other parties and our tables were so close to each other than I was practically holding hands with the two girls on each side of me.  It took them another 20 minutes to take our order and bring out drinks.

On the bright side, the food was good.  Ordered the 4 taco deal and got the fried cod, shot-and-a-beer braised chicken, carnitas and beef short rib.  The chicken and carnitas were amazing!  Juicy and flavorful. The short rib was good...nothing special.  The fried cod was bland...do yourself a favor and get another carnitas taco.
author: Betty Y.

description: Great street style tacos. I had the chicken tortilla soup which was very good, followed by a couple of the short rib tacos -  also very good.   Prices are reasonable for SF and the marina area. I'll definitely go back again. Good crowd and ambience for a Tuesday night that was very rainy.  Very good selection of tequilas but the house Margarita I had (using El Jimadore silver) was only OK. Definitely worth trying.
author: Ian F.

description:
Went here a day after they opened with my boyfriend. The service clearly hasn't got their act together yet. Our server came to take drink orders took my boyfriend's and then walked away without asking me if I wanted anything. Bad sign. Then they messed up our taco order completely, while they corrected it quickly the food itself was just meh. Only 1 veggie taco option? Really for a Mexican joint that is the best you can do? My boyfriend had three different meat tacos all were just okay. 

The bar tables in the front window are very close together, when the server squeezed between the tables her hair got a little too close to my food and drink for comfort. After dinner both of us walked away with the same thought: We missed Laiola.
author: victoria h.

description:
LOVE this place! So yes, they don't take reservations...unless you have a large party then you can get in touch with them to reserve something... 

However, whenever I go there, I go knowing I'll probably have a 30 minute wait...grab a drink at the bar--their Granizados (yummy frozen drinks) are delicious...love the Margarita dos bayas. 

Once you're seated the real fun begins--I always go for the four tacos and mix and match...my favorite is the short rib. Hands down the most flavorful taco they have, but I also love the shot-and-beer braised chicken and the chorizo and potato! Love the three salsas they have to go with it. Everything is always super fresh. 

Service is friendly and very efficient, no complaints there! The staff is always very knowledgeable about dishes and can give great recommendations when you want to try something new. 

I also love that they now have online to-go ordering! Usually have to give this 30 min also but love this!!! Go T-lish!
author: Claire J.

description:
What I love about tacolicious is that it ican be quick and casual or you can spend an evening trying tacos and having drinks. The food is amazing and the menu is flexible enough so that you can try a bunch of different things.  Staff has always been very friendly the couple of times ive been, and the quality of the food is wonderful. A little pricier than taco bell, but you definitely get what you pay for. 
My favorite taco is  the vegetable rancho gordo vallarta: http://menuvore.com/content/rancho-gordo-vallarta

The meat options are very good as well and best of all, the meat is sustainably raised!
author: nic h.

description: The tacos (try as many different kinds as you can!) and different sauces make the long wait worth it.  Also, how can you not love the a giant mound of chips that is contstantly replenished?!  The service and ambiance (although somewhat loud) is good.  Going back for sure.
author: Joe L.

description: I really want to like this place. Marks for always streaming soccer. Its close quarters, perhaps too close. It's loud. It's trendy. I don't know something just feels a bit off. The tacos taste good and they are inventive. The menu is curious because its priced for groups but the space cannot accommodate so well. So there's some contradiction and disconnect there. This place seems to always be humming. I'm not sold.
author: Nelson C.

description: A group of us sat cozily outside (heat lamps above), which, on a nice day makes for good people watching. Since this was part of a food tour destination, the hostess pre-ordered the menu- each of us got a platter of tequila + 1 can of Teacate + 1 taco. If you want something quick and easy, the tacos aren't bad- and the meats weren't dried out.  Tasty chips and salsa served on the side.
author: Lisa C.

description: This is a pretty small place, looks like it used to be a bar.. but it is still comfortable and fun. Decent selection of beers, and the tacos are pretty good. I prefer hard tacos and the soft tortilla tacos were relatively expensive, but still a good experience.
author: Ivan M.

description:
i have been here twice, and both times, had a fun experience. both times we sat outside (actually at the same table!) the most recent time was chilly, but we got seated right away (instead of the 1.5 hour+ wait for inside!) and they brought us blankets and made sure the heat lamps were on. 

i have been pretty pleased with the food here so far. i have not experienced any of the dry tacos that some other reviewers have commented on. both times i ordered the fish taco...pretty solid and i would order again. the most recent time i also ordered the potato and chorizo taco. it was fine, but nothing extradordinary. the carnitas one is good, a little spicy and tender meat. 

my favorite thing to order though, is the chicken tortilla soup. the broth is very rich and complex and the soup is filling and delicious. i would go back just to eat that. 

don't bother with dessert unless you are getting the one with the bread, olive oil and chocolate. that is delicious. everything else, meh. 

overall, a fun place to go. a little pricy due to its chestnut street location, and there is usually a wait, but definitely worth it.
author: Rachael B.

description: Amazing tacos! Had the short rib tacos and the rock cod tacos. Both were very, very good. Great atmosphere and service too.
author: C R.

description: The tacos here were AMAZING! Only thing that wasn't so great was waiting in a small crowded space for a table, and feeling completely in the way, and the bartender didn't know what a mojito was.  Thought that we asked for a burrito.  Other then that it was really really good!
author: Amy C.

description: I've never been much a fan of mole, but their chicken in mole colorado is bliss!  I love their local rock cod tacos too.  My boyfriend considers their carne asada the best around and is also a fan of their Mom's Tacos special on taco tuesday -- "tacos the way you mom used to make them."  Good food and strong drinks, plus accommodating hosts, friendly wait staff, and great bartenders make T-lish an easy go-to spot.
author: Cuppy C.

description: If you like tacos then I would definitely recommend tacolicious. We went on a Thursday at 1pm thinking it probably wouldn't be busy. Boy were we wrong. Luckily we just beat the crowd and got a seat, but that's the sign of a good restaurant. I got the chicken tacos and my boyfriend got the carnitas tacos. Both were very delicious! They came with a lot of meat on each taco, I only had two and was very full. I can't remember the exact name of the margarita I got but it was equivalent to a house margarita, it was good but not really amazing. Like the name says though if you like tacos you definitely need to come here.
author: Laura F.

description: I love the fish tacos here and the beans are amazing. Stop by during happy hour for a $5 margarita.
author: Amy S.

description:
Short rib tacos. I think I can stop there.

But I'll continue...even though words can't describe the tender meat, rich flavor and perfect blend of spices! Thursday is THE day to walk down to the water, and Tacolicious is THE reason to stop walking. Holy guacamole those things were good! The meat is prepared ahead of time, which added depth of flavor, like mama used to make (if my mama was Mexican and made delicious tacos). There a slew of salsas to adorn your lunch, but I kept it clean in hopes that being salsa free, I'd be able to appreciate the flavors just a bit better. Total yum fest! Three tacos were super filling, and although I walked to the wharf thinking I'd try a sampling of eats, Tacolicious was all I needed.
author: Corey D.

description:
DOUBLE YUM!  

i had the most amazing short rib tacos at tacolicious!  fresh ingredients served hot!  what else can you ask for?  try with the XXX sauce.  oops...maybe it's just called XX sauce?  ;)

wash these delicious tacos down with some hibiscus peach aqua fresca or whatever the daily special is.  TRY THIS PLACE!
author: Wendy S.

description:
Ah, Tacolicious. Oh, how I love thee. Let me count the ways. When I lived in SF, I would be here at least once a week. But please keep in mind  it's soooo good and popular, be prepared for a very early or LATE dinner. Just try to get a decent table here any night of the week from 5-9pm, and not wait almost an hour.  I dare you. Yes, it's loud. But it blows Mamacita's away - price and quality wise. I do like Mamacitas, but honestly, once this place opened , I barely even bothered with going there. The food is just as good if not better, and the prices won't make you choke on your food. Yes, I realize that this is the Marina, but come on....8 bucks for Guac that isn't as good as the stuff they serve at Tacolicious, and its so tiny...
I recommend the Albacore tuna Tostada, Carnitas, and even the Marina Girl Salad with shrimp if you are trying to keep it light. But really, with something like Chicken Mole on their menu...why would you want to? Oh and one more special recommendation...you must try their Pasion Cocktail with the Habanero tequila..it is spicy, it has kick, it is divine...(I remember being in a Pasion haze while watching the world cup there last summer...good times!). This place might make you actually want to hang out in the Marina for a night!
author: Jennifer C.

description: AMAZING! Visited this place when I was in town and it blew me away.  The food was so delicious and fresh.  The drink menu was creative and extensive.  Try any of the margaritas and you'll be happy and sloshed!   al little pricey though
author: Kayla J.

description:
I tried to go here when it first opened but was a 45 minute wait.  I went last night around 8:15 and had a table ready.  

We started off with a round of negro modelo on tap and the waiter brought out especial.  Waiter fixed the mistake instantly and we were off to a good start.  I don't understand why more bars don't carry negro modelo on tap.  So good.

We started off with the tombo or tuna tostado per the watiers recomendation.  The fish quality was great and overall the dish was tastey.  Maybe a little too much mayonaise in the sauce but very good.

We then ordered 4 tacos between the two of us.  We had two beef tacos, a carnitas and a chicken.  I had a beef and a carnitas and they were great and not bad for $12 bones.  We ordered another beer and hung out for a bit.  There is a plate of three sals's that come with the taco that were great as well. I really enjoyed the habanero salsa.

I almost forgot about the chips and salsa.  The chips were great but something was a little off with the salsa.  Not sure if there was too much lime but wasn't great.

Food here is much better than Mamacita but the bartenders at Mamacita is what keeps me going back.
author: Tim G.

description: i literally ate here every Thursday for 9 mos because its so good. Fresh, local and expertly executed
author: K K.

description:
We were seated right at 5:00 when they first opened, and within half an hour, the entire place was packed! Immediately brought chips (warm!) and salsa which was quite tasty - I could have done without the guacamole, good hunks of avocado, but it seemed to be missing something.....An interesting list of cocktails, beer, and wine; I had a hibiscus margarita which was okay, but think I would order something different next time. 

The tacos and service were the real standouts of the night. Between 3 of us girls, we almost managed to polish off a ten taco platter - they're smallish sized street tacos with only filling (no cheese, lettuce, etc.) in corn tortillas. The chicken and carnitas tacos were delish, super juicy and full of flavor. We also tried the short-rib (dry and totally lacking in flavor when compared to the chicken and carnitas), chorizo (so-so) and rock cod (didn't taste). Our waiter was great! He took the time to explain details of the menu and answer all of our questions. We each ended up spending $30 (for chips, guac, tacos, and a drink). Can't wait to spend another drizzly Saturday night at Tacolicious!
author: Ashley D.

description: Filet mignon taco's are amazing!  Fish tacos - good.  Top shelf tequila selection - impressive.  I'll be back.
author: Rayna A.

description:
AWESOME! 

I came here for my 21st birthday, and even though they dont take reservations I sent them an email and they saved a group of 10 of us a table.

The staff was INCREDIBLE, so welcoming and accommodating, couldn't have asked for better or friendlier service, seriously 10 starts to everyone working at Tacolicious. 

The food and drinks speak for themselves. Ordered the carnitas tacos and the chicken suiza (taco of the week) ... some of the best tacos I have ever had, I'm salivating just thinking of them. And their margaritas granizados were delish (especially the berry one that tastes exactly like a smoothie). 

Thank you Tacolicious for an incredible meal and best birthday dinner I've had yet! 
You'd be a fool not to stop by and change your life with good food and great service
author: Kalin W.

description:
Food was great, but if you would like take out, I would try somewhere else.  

We have tried to use their online ordering system, but it is convoluted and does not allow you to order filet mignon tacos as part of its taco platter.  Our orders are typically not ready at the time specified.  And for our most recent experience, we had to wait 20 mins. to receive the pickup only to find they had forgotten half the order.
author: Elliott R.

description:
If you are looking for authentic tacos, don't come here. If you are looking for yummy americanized tacos and tasty drinks, come here.  It is a pretty small place full of "Marina folk" and parking can be pretty hard to find on a weekend. You can always park at the Wells Fargo on Lombard, but it's $12. Yeah, no thanks. Street parking or I'm going to Mel's Diner. 

They have a special daily that is $10 for a taco of your choice, a shot of tequila, and a tecate. Not bad!! I get this if I am not too hungry and want a quick buzz. Otherwise, I go for the yummy cocktail concoctions. My fave is If Honey Could Drink. As far as the food, I liked the cod tacos best and carnitas second. I found the short rib taco really greasy. Tasty, but greasy. Probably wouldn't get it again for my heart's sake. The salsa and queso is really good! I liked the minty-ness of the salsa and the queso has those pickled spiced carrots in it. 

The wait is pretty long but you get your food fast.  If you can, sit at the bar while you wait for a table. Staff are friendly and very attentive.  It's a good spot to go with friends. Not really a date spot cuz it can be loud in there.
author: Mel G.

description: Love the location and I truly enjoyed the service. However, although their tacos can be unique, I almost prefer the tacos that I could get at a real Mexican place for a third of the price. Don't get me wrong, their tacos were good but when it comes to the quality-to-price ratio, I would say that your average taco truck or hole-in-the-wall Mexican place has a better deal. Besides, it's like trying to make pork rinds fancy.....it just doesn't need to be upscale-ish and they're good the way they are.
author: Rylan C.

description: i crave this place. make sure to get the short rib taco, its the best one. Plus, the chips and salsa are super yummy too!
author: tara v.

description:
Fish taco: crispy but not too greasy, nice flavor, whatever sauce that comes on it complements it.

Chorizo taco: Not my fave, didn't taste right to me, kind of funky with the potato.

Beef taco:  Dripping with orange grease, but tasted good.

Carnitas taco:  The best one, lots of flavor!

Sangria: A bit bland and the small cup is like 90% ice. :(
author: James B.

description: Came in on a Friday, and told the wait is 45min but was able to find a place at the bar with my friends. We had some great drinks and a variety of tacos. Braised short rib is very rich. The fish came deep fried, which I didn't like but the bartender had it switched out for grilled. Make sure you request which type you want. The salsa and sauces are made very well and so are the drinks. The ambiance is pretty nice, although it was a very crowded night, we were still able to enjoy each others company and the food.
author: katrina w.

description: Found a parking place right in front on Chestnut, so stopped in around 5:00 on a Sunday, expecting to wait. Got right in and the greeter and wait staff couldn't have been nicer to this senior citizen couple (special appreciation to Erin). We had a great time and will definitely be back.
author: Cydney B.

description: Atmosphere was awesome, drinks were great. Tacos were quite tasty, and quite frankly, I don't think $3.50 a pop is all that ridiculous. How many tacos does one need?!
author: Andrew V.

description: TACOOOO-LICIOUS!!!! MMMM...LICIOUS!! Yes it was that good. My friend and I had a blast here, sitting at the bar had a pitcher of Prickly pear and a pitcher of the  Honey one. I liked the Pretty Pink Prickly Pear better, it had a nice kick. I also loved the way our bartender stared into space while pouring the never ending liquor into the shaker :) heehee. Oh and the Tacos! We were going to get the 10 tacos deal but glad we went with the 4 taco combo 2 each. The fillings were sooo good! and there was alot of filling! I had the fried fish one and the beef short rib one. There was a HUGE chunk of beef in my taco, so good! The fish was so moist inside and crisp outside, perfect! The side of hot sauces was good too. My only complaint was the salsa, it needed something..hmm..I think it needed hot sauce, so we added our own. I will come back and down a few pitchers and tacos again. The bartender was very nice and attentive and we met some nice people next to us.
author: Karen T.

description: Wowza! The tacos are out of this world. Get the ribs & carnitas. Margaritas aren't bad either- house is made with jimador, which is pretty legit. Good enough that even the Marina location won't keep me away.
author: Kathryn s.

description:
I tend to get my hopes up easily about new restaurants, and this one didn't match my expectations.  I think that I was immediately put off by the fact that the bartender acted like we were crazy when we ordered a pitcher of margheritas for four of us - I was looking forward to a good  drink after a long day.  I quickly realized why he implied that this wasn't enough when they brought over a small carafe of weak margherita that was primarily filled with ice.  We could barely fill our 4 glasses with the amount and it was $30.

My friend and I started with the ceviche.  For some reason it reminded me of tuna salad - I think may have been the combo of the fish-y taste and the apples (which sounded good in theory but didn't blend well in this case).  

I was excited to try the tacos - I tried the fish, veggie and beef.  All were mediocre.  There was nothing bad about them, they were just slightly boring.  The beef was the best by far.  

My other two complaints are
1) They served saltine crackers (in the wrapper) with one of their appetizers.  I'm sorry, but this is just not cute - it seems down-right tacky if you ask me.  
2) 1st round of chips were on the house but the basket accommodated approximately 10 chips.  I made a joke that our chip bill at the end would be $30 with all the refills we had.
3) Service was not friendly.  The only person that demonstrated any kindness/joy was our busboy.  The waitress seemed extremely crabby.
4) I thought I could handle the Marina crowd - but the combo of the restaurant which seems to be trying too hard and confused about its image, and the overly-made-up, white crew there made for a less than optimal experience.

Overall - this restaurant left me craving some REAL Mexican food, and at the very least, some decent white-person Mexican like Nicks.  I won't go back.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Seating here is horrid. 

The house manager must enjoy their design of encouraging customers to have clusterfuck issues with seating.

Ceviche was NOT close to food. Yes, it was "special"  - next time I will bring the cat to handle the special.

Tacos were oversaturated, not terrible - Ingredents were reasonably decent.

I will not be trying to come back here.
author: Haoming C.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night last week after kicking back a few drinks at Mamacita down the street.

Amibance:  fun place, definitely a Marina crowd in here, whatever that means..yes, I like the Marina because it's clean, and it being monochromatic doesn't bother me.

Price:  Definitely pricey for what you get.  3.50/taco is rather ridiculous if you ask me, but I'm willing to try anything at least once.

Quality:  The soft tacos were not the best I've had but otherwise good and satisfied me - they are small, the sauces were really good, the red sangria was garbage.  If you had sangria at cha cha cha, it's miles better.

Overall: fun experience, lively crowd, wait staff was friendly and reasonably attentive.
author: Praveen R.

description: Although I am not a fan of Mexican food but this is the one and only exception. Fantalicious! Simply the tacos, good chicken soup, and great salad. The place is as "in" as it gets - and still good. Wow, I come back at least once a week...
author: Wolfgang S.

description: This place single handedly inspired my wife and to debate opening a taco bar in our area just so we could have this type of amazing daily.  Seriously delicious gourmet grub and an awesome tequila bar.  If the owner checks this we need you to open a location in San Luis Obispo, CA.  This is a staple of every visit to SF for us!
author: Dustin R.

description: We had to wait, but it was so worth it!  The food is delish!  The salsa is so good, I could have just eaten chips and salsa.  The place is loud and crowded, so you probably don't want to bring Grandma.  I will definitely go back!
author: Katie C.

description: YUM!!!!  Everything here hit the spot.  From the homemade tortilla chips and salsa (perfection) to the margaritas and the tacos.  I highly recommend the albacore tuna tostadas.  They were amazing.  I want to go back and eat an entire meal of just those!  Of the tacos that I tried, the fried rock cod and the chicken mole were my favorite. I also liked the carnitas and next time I will try the filet mignon.  The restaurant was bustling and our service was excellent.  The server had great suggestions, knew the menu, was patient with us (I always have questions) and we never felt rushed even though they were busy.  I can't wait to go back!
author: Stephanie B.

description: Just had dinner at Tacolicious tonight. Love the chips and salsa to start on the table. I had wine, which was delicious. And ordered one carnitas taco and one beef taco. Both were delicious, I also tried part of my friends cod taco, which was also very good. Very cool atmosphere and fun vibe. Lively inside, but was still able to have a conversation (for a few hours) without being rushed to order either. Will go back here!
author: Kristin N.

description:
Busy, chaotic, fun, loud these are the adjectives I think of for tacolicious.  Several crowded outside tables overlook Chestnut and inside there are some high topped tables against the window and against the wall. It's a long, narrow space with a bar. Not a good place for a long, quiet meal but a good place for quick, flavorful food.
We sat in the window for lunch.  The meal starts with a pitcher (well a glass bottle really) of water, chips and a sweet pineapple I think salsa.  Very tasty with just a bit of spice.  The menu offers six or seven types of tacos, several sides like two kinds of beans, corn, rice, etc. and then a variety of other entrees including ribs, enchiladas and guacamole.  
We decided to stick with their namesake and ordered four different tacos: we had chorizo and potato (dried out and not very flavorful), braised pork belly (very tasty, moist and lightly spiced), chicken mole (just not quite there), and fried cod with aioli (tasty).  The tacos are served with three salsas: a hot yellow salsa (which, unfortunately, is not very hot) a medium red salsa and a mild green salsa.  They need a hotter option.  All were tasty and for the chorizo taco necessary to add flavor.
We also had a couple of glasses of wine, but the prices were a bit high for a place of this caliber. The wine should not cost more than the dishes.
The drunken beans said they included pickled vegetables but I did not see any pickled veggies in them. They were tasty though and were very well cooked, not firm or soggy.
It's a good place but a tad expensive.
author: Vivek V.

description:
If you order right, the food is scrumptious.  The tacos are all divine and the Salsas had the right balance of heat and zest.  The biggest surprise of the evening was a dense, rich, sweet (without being cloying), Flan.  This is perhaps the best Flan I've had - ever.  Sadly, our waitress undersold this dessert so we did not originally order it.  However, after striking up a conversation with the charming Telmo, he treated us to this heavenly sweet and we fought over every last morsel.

The one black spot on the menu is the tortilla soup.  It lacks both imagination and flavor.
author: Suzanne D.

description: Came here for dinner on taco Tuesday so we were prepared for it to be busy. 20 min wait to be seated was not too bad. When I ordered a margarita and a corona I was charged $22 without being told that house margaritas were only $5 for the night. That kind of sucked. The menu is a little too complicated and non descriptive for a taco joint. When the tacos came, they were delicious and full of flavor. It was over all a decent experience, reminds me of a snoody place I would find in Brooklyn honestly.
author: Samantha S.

description: Not bad for cheap, plentiful tacos! The guacamole was absolutely delicious, and the taco of the week is always inventive and tasty. It's a little loud for me, though...I usually have to yell across the table to be heard by my boyfriend and the waiters. Totally worth it of you're looking for something quick and pretty tasty.
author: Cami J.

description:
i love mexican food, so i thought i have to go tacolicious. it's always crowded in the weekend so I came here on lunch time weekday where is not too crowded. 
They have 2 TVs one one the left and the other one is on the right bar corner. The place has an inviting ambient but when i came in it was just is ok, very loud garage music, enough to tense my back and head that i need-that-shiatsu-soon...i wish they have nicer music, it's just loud music doesn't really reflect marina area, maybe in mission area will work?
the server was ok, no smile, just regular folks who needs some money i guess.
i find it a lil' disappointing that these folks are just an ok people, but let's just sniff that out  for right now shall we.
they give you that fried tortilla chips with homemade spicy salsa sauce just as a complimentary starter.
the service is a lil' bit inattentive, i ordered beer & it never came out i guess our server is really a sleepy head, so i have to call another server just to get my drink after like waiting for 10 minutes, it was not busy but they're all sleepy so..do expect slowly when they're all sleepy.
i ordered rancho gordo black beans, it was okay. & i ordered taco with potato mushroom raw onion fillings, and it was just an ok too, because before i came to this place i thought everything will be delicious just like its name.
the taco lacks of the authenticity of mexican food, and i don't find it delicious enough to give it 5* 
not delicious enough = not tasty enough = lack of producing things from the bottom of your heart.
now that is my definition for my overall experience here.
will i come back? i might be not...because i want real good food that comes from the heart.
author: Ms C.

description: When I have the urge for tacos, margaritas, and chips/salsa I have two places I always think of.   Tacolicious is tops in my book.  Tacolicious has a bit of everything: Great food, delicious drinks, awesome area (Marina/Chestnut St), great service, and the layout of the place itself is fun.  On a warm weekend afternoon they open up the large front window so that it becomes an open air restaurant.  During evenings you can expect the place to fill up with good looking young people ready to get their food and drink on.  I highly recommend the tacos because they are a good size and are well priced.  The chicken tacos are my favorite.
author: Ash S.

description: Great going down, not so good on the way back up! Watch out for those drinks- you might not taste the alcohol, but it's there. Trust me!
author: Jen E.

description: I would not recommend this place to any one I know. I had a horrible experience from the waitress to the bartender to management these individuals were extremely rude "Not A Welcoming Atmosphere". The menu is misleading with false pricing. FYI things need to be stated correctly on the menu. Food wasn't it....i wouldve been better off making my own tacos.
author: Harlena G.

description: Waited 3 minutes at the bar 3 other people there who were already served.  Watched bartender check his iPhone, another bar tender leave the room, another sort sodas in the cooler, and was never acknowledged.  Nice menu, sad service.
author: Paige B.

description:
1st off the food is amazing. Its a very fun and up beat place. My man J in the kitchen makes this superfantasticamazing tuna-torta. MMMMMMMMM!!!!!!!!!!! There tequila selections is top notch and the bartenders know how to put it all together. However there is this one bartender that really should not be behind there. While the man with the swallows on his hands, was running around like a master champion, the blond girl was just leaning over the dishwasher with her chin on her hand and her elbow on the dishwasher and the look on her face was so not inviting. While emptying the dishwasher she very blatantly coughed/hacked into her hand and continued to pull clean dishes out of the dishwasher. If I owned Tacolicious I would not have her and her sour attitude behind my bar. Other than that, I would most defiantly reefer anyone here. 4 amazing tacos for $12. cant beat that.

P.S. To the sour bartender - If your life is that bad, take it upon yourself to change make a change. Life isn't worth waisting your time unhappy.
author: Adam G.

description:
Update: We went last night and sat next to some very loud 20 something girls.  When I asked them to lower their voices they did.  however, their waiter was their friend and the waiter and 4 girls made fun of me right in front of me and my work colleague.  Poor form. When you are loud and doing coke trips to the bathroom at 6:30pm on a Tuesday night, you get to be told to shut up.  Period.  8pm on Friday?  Could care less.  One of the downsides to living in the marina I guess.  Wouldn' t of bothered me if the waiter did not get involved.  Changed my perception of Tacolicious and I am very, very bummed.  We were going almost once a week since it opened.  

Prior to bad visit: This place has become a serious staple.  The tacos are bomb (carnitas and short ribs are a must) and affordable.  The beer is a bit pricey. The $10 pre-fix (shot, beer and taco) is great for a Sat lunch.  The staff is very friendly and we usually sit at the bar.  Wis the queso has chorizo in it but good on its own.  The habanero salsa is super spicy and flavorful.  They should bottle it.  Always busy so be prepared to wait.
author: elizabeth s.

description:
This place is good but pretty expensive for what it is...tacos!

The best taco on the menu is by far the chorizo and potato.  It was pretty delicious.

This place gets packed...so if you're looking to drop in last minute, expect a wait...especially on the weekend.

If I was craving mexican food I would probably choose another place, but if you live in the Marina it is conveniently located.

I'd go back, but not my first choice of mexi in the city.
author: Jules G.

description: Not every taco was a winner, but damn this place is good.  I tried just about every taco and my favorites were the short rib, mole, and cod.  The tostadas are also quite good, as was the grilled squid.  The wait sucks!  Be prepared!
author: Mark A.

description:
I celebrated my B day with friends on Tuesday and it was a blast. Although not a big meat eater, the waitress was very attentive to the different ingredients in the dishes and luckily she warmed me about the chicken meat in the Tortilla soup and the onions and the spiciness of each dish...So when the food arrived I and my girlfriends were really happy wit the selection. 

The TACOS: The fish tacos were great. The vegetarian was ok. 
SALAD:must have is the beet root salad
Starter- MUST have the tostada
Desserts- kinda poor selection

We ordered wine as it was Tuesday- they have nice selection.

Waitress recommended tuna tostada and it was all she said, I still crave for it even now. She also recommended the beet salad and it was delightful... guys if a petit waitress with cute accent serves you in this place DO LISTEN TO HER SUGGESTIONS..she is awesome really made my b-day count...

Overall- atmosphere great -it was bussy although Tuesday 
Food- ok, not the best tacos ever, but the meat in carnitas were great
Service-awesome, she really made it special, very knowledgeable about food and professional yet very friendly.
author: Melanie H.

description: I love Tacolicious. Its such a fun spot, the drinks are awesome, the prices are great, and the food is good. The atmosphere is so much fun - been here on a Friday night and during the weeknights - really great. Sat at the bar both times (which I prefer) but the hostess is really awesome at doing her job. Even when quoted long waits, I've never actually had to wait that long.
author: Paige H.

description: One of my favorite restaurants. Love their food and the cocktails rock!!!!
author: Ines C.

description:
last week some friends took my boyfriend and i out for our birthdays/ anniversary!!

the tacos were good, tried a bit of everything!! i ordered the vegetarian (yummy!!) and fish tacos, the boyfriend ordered short rib (amazing) and chorizo with potatoes, my cucumber margarita was INCREDIBLE!

the only complaints were the long wait, we got there at about 8 and the hostess told us about 45 min to an hour, we went to a bar nearby for about that time but waited at the restaurant another 35 minutes to be sat down.

and the restroom is kind of inconvenient in the kitchen entrance, theres only 1 restroom and you're most likely going to have to wait in line, causing you to be in the way which is never fun. and it was messy, garbage can overflowed and trash everywhere, unfortunate cause there are waiters just standing around chatting.
author: denisse a.

description: I was floored by the quality of service at casual little place that seems like a prettier version of a Mission taqueria.  Instead, it's a really creative, inventive menu with a real sense of pride in the ingredients and methods, and the service was amazingly attentive, thoughtful and pleasant.  I tried the flight of margaritas which was totally fun and tasty.  The food was really good too.  It's not cheap, but I'd go back for sure.
author: Molly P.

description: Kicked it here today in the sun for a minute. The tacos are pretty simple and don't have a lot of extras to them. Essentially you get some meat in a mini tortilla with an onion or two on top. The carnitas were the best combo I had. The cod was pretty flavorless and the beef short rib had enough grease to lube my Camaro but were tasty. My waiter was an amusing dude and the drinks were stiff so I am sure you will see me on their patio again attempting to avoid burning the shit out of my bulbous forehead on a sunny day.
author: Dru P.

description: Thursday at 12:15 this place was packed. Doesn't anyone work in the Marina? Apparently not. They are all at Tacolicious eating the most amazing tacos EVER. Now, I did not try any of the alcoholic drinks they offer but I did see plenty of tables enjoying pitchers of what looked like yummy-ness. You really can't go wrong from the salsa to the tacos to anything that is on the menu. This is the kind of place that you will find yourself craving. You know, those mouth watering gut wrenching cravings that you just can't resist. Gotta love those places.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Best tacos EVER. 

Long line on most nights but it's soooo worth the wait. Do it.
author: Murat K.

description: Amazingly good salsa! That's what I am always on the hunt for. They make tasty, exciting tacos and more. I like the feel of the place-good service!
author: Suzie R.

description: Best mexican place by far! Great margaritas too! I seriously would eat here everyday... which is a problem cause I work down the street.
author: Cat B.

description: This place is just OK.  I dont understand the hype, but all the girls I know seem to love it, so I guess all the guys must too. Their tacos are good, but aren't anything special (say tiny and expensive) and the place takes forever to get a seat. Guess it's one of those "go to be seen" places...
author: I D.

description: Creative menu. Excellent tacos. Kid friendly and tourist friendly.
author: Rebecca T.

description: So delicious, everything is so yummy. There are two reasons I did not give it 5 stars, too loud and always long waits to get a table.
author: Rob S.

description:
I am on the verge of writing that these are the best tacos I have ever had....but I just can't do it.  Trust me, though, they are so good, and the only rival I know of is La Taqueria in the Mission (but then we might be comparing apples to oranges).  

Seriously, these tacos are super bomb.  I love the one with the beef short rib meat....hello.

I do not mind waiting either.  The tacos are so good, they go down quickly (and without the wait, I would be back to work too quickly).
author: Kelly A.

description: Went here this afternoon, and ordered the enchilada starter, along with the four taco plate. Plenty to eat for the two of us, counting the gratis chips and salsa. Super friendly staff. Can't wait to go back soon, even though we live on the peninsula.
author: David R.

description: I heard this place is always crowded so I decided to take an early lunch/dinner there. First thing I like about this place is that they give a generous amount of chips served with awesome salsa on the side and is free! The dish that I got is the amazing tuna tostada which is raw tuna serve on top of crispy tortilla. This dish is worth the 30 minute walk, the creamy texture of the tuna mix together with the crunchy tortilla. Superb! The only thing that gets me down is that for two tostada, the cost hits up to 13 plus which is a little pricy for something that small in my opinion.
author: Mei Kim P.

description: Great food and atmosphere at reasonable prices. A fun place to add to your barhopping list.
author: Zach S.

description: This is THE spot if you like street tacos, they make the best in the city hands down! I tried 4 for 12 bucks and loved each one of them from the vegie (with squash and black beans), the chicken, the short rib, but the most outstanding of all was the carnitas, simply out of this world. They bring you three salsas for dipping, they were all delicious, although one was a tad too hot. Chips and salsa were great too as was their margarita.
author: Chris D.

description: Don't go here! The food and service is horrible. I had high hopes because it has been packed since it opened, but I was very disappointed. To start, the salsa has mint in it and is very bland... not what I call authentic Mexican food. I thought they couldn't screw up the tacos, but I've had way better tacos out of a taco truck. I would never go here over Mamacitas. The service was the worst I have ever had since I have lived in SF.
author: Shakira M.

description:
My fiance and I came here with pretty high expectations.   It seems this place is trying to be a refined spot for authentic, traditional tacos.  Unfortunately, the food is average (3 stars),  overpiced (minus a 1/2 star) and won't call you when your table is ready after you put your name on the list (minus 1/2 star).  This is your typical average food, overpriced restaurant in the Marina. 

My fiance and I had guacamole to start and it was very average.  I think it needed more cayenne pepper.  Rosa Mexicana has better guacamole.  The margaritas were REALLY strong, so you're definitely getting your $$ worth.   Unfortunately, I'm not really into margaritas so I focus more on the food at a Mexican joint. 

We then ordered 7 tacos: 2 filet mignon, 2 carnitas, 2 fish, and 1 short rib.  The filet mignon was okay but I wish it was cooked medium rare.  No way was it worth the extra $3 per taco, so insanely overpriced.  The 2 fish tacos were good, but nothing out of this world amazing.  The carnitas tacos were average.  The short rib was dry. 

The problem with an upscale taco joint is that it's hard to improve on simple cheap tacos.  There's nothing to justify the increased price.  That said, I was completely stuffed and my fiance and I definitely would have been fine with 5 tacos between the two of us. 

No need to return.
author: Katie S.

description: I'm a huge fan of Mexican food and I was a little nervous to try it out because it seemed like a tex-mex place to me but I went there last week because the line wasn't too long. I must say they have the best tacos I have ever had in my life hands down!!
author: nabil s.

description: Always solid. Wish you could call in pickup orders though. Online system isn't great.  Bar tenders are kind of jerks.
author: Gregg S.

description:
This review is for the service only, the food was pricy, but not bad. The grilled fish tacos and guacamole were up to par, and I would recommend them if you find yourself at a tacolicious! 

Let me start off by saying that I rarely venture to the marina because it is mostly out of the way from where I live, and just honestly avoid trekking here because it's not where my friends are, fave restaurants, and the common attitude of "I'm better than you"
Seems to be inescapable. But today I decided to come here because it was beautiful out, and what better thing to do than get some tacos and sunshine! When my friend and I arrived (it was her birthday, btw) we had thought about getting tacos to go because it was so rad outside, and the hostess came back and told us we had to order at the bar. Ok, no problem. We got to the bar and realized, hey, maybe it wouldn't be so bad to stay and eat here. The guys behind the bar were hilarious and really nice, and when I went back to the hostess to ask for a menu, she glared at me and snapped that We had to get out of the way so they could clean the area (there were 5 open bar stools), and once she brought over menus we could sit down. There was no line, and no one coming to clean, so after 5 minutes we just sat down. Once we did, she brought over 2 menus and 2 other guests instead of helping us, and just kept on giving dirty looks to my friend and I (which the guys behind the bar were noticing and scoffing at just as much as we were). Because of this, we ended up getting our stuff to go because we didn't want the hostess ruining the rest of out beautiful afternoon. 

Word of advice to the management team: keep your team in line. Repeat customers don't happen if your hostess thinks she is better than a customer, and her nasty attitude was a huge turn off. I won't put up with it, and I won't be back.
author: Maija W.

description: Yum! Yum! Yum! Not fond of the fish tacos, but the beef was sooooo memorable! Went back and want more!!!!
author: Lucky J.

description: I tried 4 different tacos here.  The filet mignon, short rib, carne asada and fish.  The filet migon was very tender but the meat was way over salted.  The short rib was greasy, soggy and salty.  The fish was bland and a little chewy.  The carne asada was good though.  I also had the carne asada tostada, which was tasty.  I might give this place another chance, all the dishes seemed to have potential.
author: Shelly W.

description:
Joint:  It's not a ghetto taqueria.  So, dates are ok.  It's in the Marina.  So, you'll have to wade through the mass of post grad yuppies to get a good taco.  We were 2 of the three non-standard Marina types in the whole place.  YOU KNOW WHAT I MEAN!  

Food:  NOM NOM NOM

Service:  Nice and down to earth.   

This is a great place for tacos.  I simply can't explain the poor service or the less than stellar reviews.  

We walked into a packed joint and immediately were greeted and placed our names down for a table.  The hostess gave us 40min, which is fine since Circa was on the corner and we grabbed a pre-dinner drink.  When we came back, some other people were sat before us further down on the list so she sat us at the bar right away.  Thumbs up on service. 

My friend and I sat at the bar at the two spots right before the entrance to the kitchen.  We got lots of attention from the servers since we were right there and got to watch as they prepared the food.  Both of us are LOCAL SF FOODIES, that means we eat LOCAL food and were BORN AND STILL LIVE IN SAN FRANCISCO.  No, honey, you can't call yourself from the city if you weren't born here and don't still live here.  We're just different from you, don't feel bad. 

Anyhow,  we ordered the 10 tacos, 5 each, we skipped the veggie and the filet.  We ordered the drinks that were just OK but the tacos made up for everything.  The cooks were awesome.  You can watch them skillfully prepare the food with very fresh ingredients from the bar.  We were impressed and by the time the tacos came, we were totally ready to dive in.  All the tacos we ordered were awesome except for the chorizo being a little salty.. but it's chorizo.  It's salty.  So, that's not really a problem.. just a preference.  I won't order the high sodium blood pressure killer that is the chorizo taco again...even though it was tasty.. OK.. maybe I'll have a bite of yours next time, but I'm not eating another one.  Maybe.  Let's just say we went through plenty of water and were stuffed by the end of the meal.  

The desserts looked absolutely awesome and were eager to watch them prepare it.  So, we were gonna go for the froo froo desserts on the menu but when we asked the server, he pointed us to the traditional churro and the flan.  He was cute and it didn't take much.  FRESH churro with mexican chocolate and NUTELLA flan it is. :D  THEY WERE AMAZING.  Ok.. so we watched the cook make our churros 3 times cause he wasn't satisfied with the way they turned out.  Professional with high standards.  I like that.  It took a little bit but it was worth it.  The churros were hot and crispy on the outside, soft gooey yumminess on the inside covered with cinnamon and sugar.  PLUS, you get to dip them in thick mexican chocolate.  I'd add a little cayenne pepper to the chocolate to give it a kick but that didn't stop us from devouring the churros before they got a real chance to cool. On to the nutella flan.  This was not as good as the churros but honestly, we were stuffed and it was good enough for us to finish the whole thing seriously doing damage to out waistlines.  Creamy and so smooth and OMG NUTELLA in FLAN!  Thank you for hybridizing these two winners together to create a completely sinful dessert.   

You should do this.  Really.  Go do it now.
author: Marie L.

description: Excellent and funky margaritas.  I hear the sangria is good.  But I stuck with the pepper infused margarita.  We had a sampling of tacos that were all delicious... as were the salsas.  The kids ate off the children's menu and were very happy.  Oh, the Guac and chips were fresh and yummy!
author: Robert C.

description: The chips were greasy and the tacos were "ok" at best. Honestly, though there was more variety than Baja Fresh or Rubios, it was about the same in flavor and quality. Not worth the wait or the extra $$.
author: Hari J.

description: Yum! I love authentic tacos and these definitely hit the spot. I wasn't a fan of the taco special of the week (chicken something), but I'm hoping that was a fluke because my other tacos (carnitas and cod) were delicious. Will definitely go back to try other items on the menu. Good margaritas as well! Very good price for the amount of food/alcohol you get.
author: Amy F.

description: Wow had the habanero margarita and it didn't disappoint.  Actually all the margaritas we had were quite tasty.  Now if I could only remember what I ordered to eat.  I wanna say it was the veggie tacos but can't be certain on that.  Guess I kinda suck at being a food critic.  However they did have really good chips & salsa for whatever it's worth, at least I think they did, I don't know, ok I'll stop now.
author: Nick P.

description: I really wanted to like you. You seemed likable. But the taco I ordered took twenty minutes to arrive and was not memorable. The plantains were superb but I'm still looking for the rest of them. It was like someone shaved several slivers off a plantain and mounted it on a smear of beans. Service and vibe were fun and friendly but not enough to draw me back for more.
author: Shira G.

description: Outstanding tacos! Seriously, my fiancé and I were dying of hunger when we got here and at the end were STRUGGLING to finish 10 between us. Get 8 at most if it's two starving people splitting a plate. You also get "complimentary" chips and salsa that are really, really tasty. The chef is super awesome also. He came around and said hi to everyone. Did I say this place is great yet? It is.
author: Brandon W.

description:
the tacos are literally all meat and they taste like grease. there is no crunch in the taco, and it gives you a sick feeling in your stomach immediately. 
is it so effing expensive and crowded too.
everyone hypes this place up, and i dont understand why. we had lots of things on the menu, so i know we didnt order wrong. thumbs dowwwwn
author: mackenzie e.

description: I didn't want to like this place.  I really didn't want to like it.  "Tacolicious."  I just couldn't get past the name!!!!  I imagined a greasy, Jersey, fist pumping guy with too tight of an Ed Hardy shirt greeting me at the door.  Then, one fateful night, my date stated, "I could kill for some of those tacos from Tacolicious!"  Begrudgingly, I swallowed my true feelings and turned that frown upside down.  He didn't last, but my adoration for many-a-Tacolicious taco remains today.  The food is great!  Their hostess/servers are nice enough.  I absolutely love their jalapeño margarita (but I may be part dragon, as I LOVE fired up spicy)!  The upside/downside (depending on your prerogative) is that this is a restaurant AND a bar, and the drinkers rally when the sun sets.  During the weekday kids would be a-ok (especially on sunny days when the front windows are open), but Jose/Jim/Jack show their faces at night and on football weekends.
author: Katie V.

description: Great drinks, great food and atmosphere it is the best Mexican food in the Marina strip. I eat here often specially late. They have great tacos and I often order the four. It is easy to share and is a very communal place. Great for a group, a girls night and even a date. It is a loud place but makes it great for Weds-Sun. Always a fun vibe and good service. It is a place that expects you to get messy, has everything very low key. They even try to make the outside nicer with heating lamps. I love that the windows slide open for our "summer" and can hang out it and flag friends down as they walk by.
author: Natasha M.

description: In one word - - delicious!  My husband and I went there yesterday for a late lunch.  He had recently tried their tacos at a lunch fair on Battery street at work this past week, and came home raving.  I had to try them for myself.  I had the tacos carnitas with mild salsa and they were AMAZING.  I also had the cod tacos which weren't nearly as good, but my husband had a shortrib taco that was so good...it'll take you to another place!  I also had some fresh passion fruit agua fresca - so refreshing.  Every now and then you want to get some great tacos with great ambiance and this was that place.  I'll definitely be back again soon, possible even this afternoon!
author: Ashley C.

description: I walk in the door impressed. Tacos, beer, margarita's, nice decor.... However, after waiting at our table for 15 minutes, not only has no one brought us a menu, we have no chips, salsa, or drinks. Bartender was annoyed by me ordering a beer. ("sir, I'm sooo sorry to interrupt your day to ask you for to take my order"). They charged my friend 10 bucks for a shot she accidentally spilled and we never did end up getting a menu. We had to just wing it when picking out what tacos to order. I'm not impressed. Lame, overpriced, rude, pretentious. Decent tacos though, to be fair.
author: Kent M.

description: Kudos to the bartender! Drinks must've been reaaaally strong because I can't remember specifically what we ordered (a number of items including tacos) but I do remember everything we tried was tasty! Was kind of embarrassed for my date (an investor there, who was on crutches) who they left to just stand there in the lobby because it was packed, but we were seated soon enough and he was a good sport about it. Loved our waiter- very nice....My only complaint is that he forget to put guacamole in our to-go order. Chips w/out guac the next day = no bueno.
author: Shannon K.

description:
My Tacolicious experience was last night.  A large group consisting of 4 ladies and 2 gentlemen.  We were all starving and thirsty for more spirits after a full day of movies & hockey games.  Being a Sunday evening in the Marina, almost every restaurant was packed and hard to get into. Luckily, we were seated very quickly at this packed eatery.

Margaritas, check.  Bubbly, Spanish Cava, check.  Fresh salsa and just fried tortilla chips, check check.  We also ordered a plate full of tacos - petaluma organic chicken tacos and carnitas tacos. Wonderful.  

The restaurant is trendy, but it is worth the hype.  Everything I tasted was full of flavor and zest.  Also, very impressed with their salsa selection and short description once seated.  Service was slow, which just allowed me to enjoy my Cava a bit more.
author: Bridget W.

description: Thought the food could have been sooooo good but it was way too salty. Maybe a bad day? The Passion Fruit Margaritas were really good though, atmosphere was good too.
author: Alexandra K.

description: The tacos here are delicious! I've tried all of them, and not one is sub par. They also have a featured taco of the week where they come up with a new tasty recipe They also have three different types of Sangria. I admit I've enjoyed all of them. :)
author: Heather P.

description:
in a word: addictive.
in a sentence: i was trying to gauge just how many tacos i could eat without being embarrassed because i am a girl. 
i don't know what is in that salsa but it is effing good. i mean lick the bowl good.  as usual, i ate at the bar, which was perfect. they've got some funky flavors. i had fish...but notices that the taco of the week was "fried chicken" huh. interesting. 

 regrettably i tried to order to go via phone tonight for pick up but they have postponed that service until may =( =( =(

drinks were great too. I had the sangria.
author: Angela N.

description: AMAZING. im inlove with this place !!!! LOVE LOVE the venue. Food is KILLER.  And service is great! Even when it's packed food comes crazy quick!!!!! my FAV place to go!!!!
author: Xaia R.

description: This is only for belated service. My previous review - which was not good - was met with a same-day conciliatory email from the owners. This update is much overdue, and for that I apologize. But the owner was extremely apologetic and even wanted me to name the scoundrel bartender. Call me a wuss, but I just couldn't do that in these difficult times, so I never responded. But the effort definitely made a huge impact and I will be going back.
author: Andrea M.

description: I'm giving this place 3.5 stars, so I'll generously round up to 4 for Yelp purposes. So, the first time I visited Tacolicious I was less than impressed. Seeing as how I don't eat meat, I opted for the fish taco (fried fish... meh) and the vegetarian option. The fried fish taco tasted like a big ball of fry batter -- I still am not sure that there was actually fish hiding in there. I left and swore it off for a while. Whenever someone would suggest Tacolicious, I would be quick to provide another option. When my sister came to town, though, I wanted something somewhat central that provided a fun vibe and somewhat reasonable pricing. I think Tacolicious falls into both of those categories. There was a good 45 minute wait when we arrived, but no matter - we posted up at the bar and grabbed margaritas while we waited. Having learned from my previous mistake, I made sure to order the veggie and the shrimp tacos when we were seated and was much happier with my decision. We also started with the Marina girl salad and I was very impressed -- it was a huge salad and was delish for $10 or so. I would order that by itself next time I go in. Big fan. Our service was friendly enough and the vibe was fine (though, not gonna lie... it seemed a bit douchier than I remember). Plus the location makes it easy for post-dinner drinks. If you're looking for a more affordable option, this is worth a shot.
author: Shannon E.

description: I was wavering between two and three stars, but the over-the-top prices pushed it down to two.  I spent nearly $20 for two tacos, a side of refried beans, and a glass of juice.  The juice was delicious and came in a big glass, but the beans were dry.  As for the tacos, one was OK, but the chicken mole one was delicious.  I frequently order mole, and this was one of the best I've had.  The service was friendly, if a bit inattentive.  All in all, although the juice and mole are delicious, I don't think it's worth the ridiculous prices.
author: Mae M.

description:
I went to Tacolicious this past Thursday (5/20), and I had a decent experience - the food was great, but I'm not sure if the wait was worth it. We got there around 8:00 pm - I realize this is primetime on a Thursday in the Marina so a wait is expected, but we didn't end up eating till 10:45 pm. It was a little ridiculous - we were told that the wait would be 1.5 hours, but it ended up taking around 2 and even at that point, we couldn't get seats together. When we were waiting, we decided to get drinks at Circa which is next door. We wanted a table that sat 7, and finally we were given an area where 3 people could sit and the other 4 had to stand around. We started out with chips, salsa, guac, and margs. The margs was TASTY - they were strong but you couldn't taste the tequila. We finally got seated around 10:20ish and ordered the chile releno (yum), veggie tacos, and the homemade cheese. Make sure you don't get the homemade queso - not good. It's really sweet and is served with a few chips, which I thought was random. The food was pretty good, but not worth the wait in my opinion.

If I went back here, I would a) go with a smaller group - I don't recommend going with more than 4 ppl, and if you do, be prepared to wait, and b) I wouldn't wait that long.
author: Priya G.

description: Out of six tacos shared with my husband only ONE had any flavor - the Chicken Mole. The other ones which were an assortment had no seasoning and no flavor.
author: B C.

description: Carnitas tacos are so good. I have tried all the others but don't think any come close. Sometimes the taco of the week is pretty good too but it varies. Prices are reasonable for the location and the chips they serve are usually pretty fresh and tasty.
author: Kenny J.

description: Wow.  This place gets it right.  Ambience, food, drinks, service are all great, and I frequent Tacolicious for that reason.  Pasion & Nopal are two of my favorite cocktails, though i have had many of them and are all fantastic.  The braised short rib taco is my fav but all of them are good.  I always order the taco of the week because it seems like they put extra care and it is always the best taco i have each visit.  The sauces that accompany the taco plates are also well flavored and go with the every taco.  The guacamole (prepared tableside) is also awesome! The prices are fair but get there early cuz this place is always packed, as it rightly should be.  Highly highly recommended!!!
author: Zack H.

description:
Tacolicious is by far my favorite place to get delicious outstanding food and drinks! At this point I've probably tryed  just about everything on the menu and I've loved it all. They always go above and beyond my high expectations down to the smallest details. You can tell that the chef puts a lot of time, dedication, and love into his creations! To go with the amazing food you have a fun delicious menu of drinks...most you havnt seen many other places if not at all! 
Beyond the food and drinks you get a great enviroment, warm welcome, and always a good time...they never disappoint! Great for industry people since they're open late! If your planning a party or event,  trying to figure out where to go on a date, or just looking for a bite out Tacolicious is the spot to be!
author: Victoria A.

description: I live in the Outer Richmond but was in the Marina to run an errand.  Was totally starving and was looking for something not to expensive or "Marina-ish".  This place was AWESOME!  The tacos (tried 4 different ones) and agua fresca were DELICIOUS, not to mention the really great salsa and chips.  Casual/fun vibe.  Nice details like bamboo spoons for the 3 different salsas.  Sat at the counter and the service was great.  In and out for a VERY filling and moderately-priced lunch.  Perfect.
author: Kathryn F.

description: Can I just give Tacolicious 5 more stars because I love them so much?? This place is like my cafeteria, my home away from home.  Staff is super friendly, food is always great, margaritas are bomb, and management is on top of what it is to run a successful business in a competitive industry.  A simple, cost effective menu,  combined with an amazing environment where folks can dine out and have fun at a reasonable price, makes Tacolicious a role model for other restaurants.
author: Michele O.

description: Pass. It's not outright awful but I, for one, am just not into paying $3.50 for one (yes, singular -- each individual taco is $3.50 a pop) measly, mediocre taco. And don't get me wrong, I have no qualms about paying for good food. The problem is that it seems the only thing you should order here is the alcohol hence the name "Tacolicious" is very misleading.
author: Novi M.

description:
So I heard about this place in the Daily Candy emails and thought I'd check it out with a few girlfriends. First off, they've redone the interior and it looks much different from a few months ago when it was Laiola. It's almost Mexican-western-chic. We didn't have to wait long for a table and the hostess was very accomodating. We sat towards the front of the place in a cozy table with people bustling about around us. We ordered margaritas, which tasted fresh & delicious. One fun thing they offered was chupitos (shots) in all different unique flavors, but we passed on those. The tacos were good, but not amazing. I ordered the beer and tequila braised chicken taco and the fried rock cod taco. Loved the chicken but thought the fried rock cod tasted too battered. They served up yummy sauces alongside the tacos that you could add on - a smoky mole, guacamole fusion and a spicy habanero sauce - they added a lot of flavor to tacos that could have been bland. We had to wait a while to pay, but it's probably because they just opened and are getting up to speed with the equipment, etc. 

Bottom line: I'd definitely go back for drinks and a few tacos, but have to say that Mamacitas might be better...
author: Keira A.

description:
amazing chips, amazing salsa (fresh), and amazing taco platters.

check out their bloody marias too!
author: Leslie F.

description:
Tacolicious is phenomenal!! I love that every week that have a new taco to try :)

Granted, some are better than others, but the atmosphere of the restaurant is always a blast! Also, the elotes is amazing! Yummm it's like delicious Mexican street corn :)
author: Jon V.

description: Granted, I only had 1 chicken taco at the ferry building farmers market, but it was THE BEST taco I've ever had. It would have still been really good they way they serve it, but then adding the guacamole sauce made it the best :)  I will definitely be back. Also, the guy told me that they are opening their own restaurant in the marina in a few weeks. Yay, I'll be there!
author: Julie F.

description: I am probably late to the fiesta but I am happy that I finally arrived because I love Tacolicious. I didn't expect delicious tacos for a "reasonable price,"  outside of the Mission. $12 for 4 tacos is reasonable to me. I especially loved every bite of the carnitas taco except when I accidentally added a big helping of the yellow salsa on it. For some reason, I thought yellow is suppose to be mild. WOW! was I wrong.
author: Sherry Z.

description: Consistently excellent takeout. Typically it's too crowded for dining in (though dine-in is great too), so I've turned to their takeout. Order tacos for two and you've got enough delicious taco goodness to last you days (or feed 3-5, depending on how hungry you are). Seriously a great value and always excellent.
author: Amy H.

description:
Came here with a large group- expecting that they would laugh in our faces- but they simply took our phone number and we hung out at horseshoe for about 45 min and got the large table outside all to ourselves! (Heat lamps and complimentary blankets made it very cozy) 

Super service, he took the time to chat with us and did not seem annoyed with the big group like a lot of waiters tend to be. The Thursday night deal is such a treat- tecate, shot of tequila and a taco for $10! The short rib and carnitas tacos were by far the best. The chicken taco was eee ok, and the fish was super extra fried. The tortillas were authentic and the best part of the taco for me. 

The Salsa has a unique minty flavor which we all loved- and the guacamole was also perfect. Skip out on the ceviche- it needed more lime marinating and flavor. 

Overall, great food at a cheap price (wayyy cheaper than Mamacita's) and a golden spot to enjoy a Tecate Tall Boy.
author: Rena Z.

description: This. Food. Is. AWESOME. I agree with the laced-with-crack guy because once I get started on the short rib tacos, I come back again and again in a week. I even tell my husband I'm "jonesing for some short rib tacos and rice" -- not to mention the complimentary tortilla chips, which RULE ALL. I have yet to eat on premises, but it's a great take-out place if you're local. You can order on-line and pick it up in half an hour, which is tough to beat. The only thing that would make this place more dangerous is if they delivered! Then I would eat here 3x a week for sure.
author: Diane C.

description: Just got lunch catered by Tacolicious. When I first yelped these guys thought they looked to be pretty pricey for soft tacos you can get by the dozen on a corner in Oakland for less than $3. Homemade corn tortillas with a spread of various meats and salsas all made from scratch were delivered hot to the office for a lunch meeting. 30 minutes and a medley of empty containers later, our elasto-waisted casual Friday pants were stretched to their gills. Thanks Tacolicious. So delicious (it's hot hot). We blow you kisses. Keep it vicious. Now we'll be up in the gym, workin on our fitness. T to the A, to the S-T-E-Y. Tasty Tasty.
author: Rebecca S.

description: As far as taco places go, this one's pretty good. Decor and ambiance are nice and the service friendly and efficient. Tacos were fresh and tasty and there's a taco special that changes weekly and is usually worth getting. I went to the one on Chestnut and by the time I'm ready to eat tacos again, I'll probably be willing to make the trip out there again.
author: Izzy A.

description: I dig this place. It has really good tacos and other tasty items like the marina salad and albondigas. Note that the "clown tacos" are particularly yummy if you are feeling gluttonous. To top it off, they make some excellent margaritas.
author: David G.

description:
Okay. I've been living in the city since the Fall of 2008 (I go to USF) but I'm from Orange County (this has a purpose). My mom sent me a clipping from the LA Times with 20 places under $20 and Tacolicious was one of them. Intrigued, I went with my girlfriend to partake. Being from Southern California, I hold my standards for tacos and Mexican fare rather high.
     Let's just say I was blown away. First of all, of the three menus brought to you, only one side has food. The rest? Beer, wine and tequila like mad. I was impressed. When we first sat down, they brought us some chips and salsa. Mighty tasty and definitely not afraid to bring more when the first batch has been polished off. Now, those tacos.
     They have a weekly taco special (duck confit when I first went) and then a sampling of simple 'taco truck' tacos as well as a myriad of other plates. Don't let their simple construction trick you. These tacos mean business. Especially the carnitas. I'm usually a carne asada guy myself but, with some prodding, my girlfriend persuaded me. Whoa. Cooked with mushrooms (not my fave but in this instance, a miraculous combo) and topped with cilantro and diced white onions, these babies pack a punch.
     The perfect way to top them off? The house-made guacamole and quéso. And of course the house margarita. It's a bit steep ($9.50) but it's well worth it. It's an excellent blend of tequila and mix without one taking over. You really need to drink one to know what I mean.
     Still need a reason to go? Their 'prix-fixe' menu? Well it's a taco, a can of Tecate and a double-shot of tequila. Straight-up impressive.
author: Luke H.

description: Super cute place, good music and bar. The tacos I had were pretty good but the filet mignon taco was hard to bite through. Best one was the potato-chorizo taco.  Will come back for a brew, but wouldnt be my go-to mexican place.
author: Veronica P.

description: Meh.....nothing special. I had the tuna tostada and made to order guacamole....both were average at best. The atmosphere is absolutely Marina to the fullest, complete with two drunk douches that were chanting 'The South will rise again!!!' about two seats over from me at the bar. Seriously??? Whatevs. I have to say though, the bartenders were both very cool and gave very good service.
author: Julia M.

description: I eat on chestnut all the time, and I can honestly say there's better options. Mamacitas right down the street is better Mexican food. PAC catch next door is more filling. Honestly, it's an overpriced taco shop. Three little tacos will cost you 12 bucks. I don't know who the people raving about this place are. It's good, but 4 stars is a bit excessive. I ate here once, and I'd come back if a friend wanted to try it, but it's not all that people are trying to make it out to be.
author: Devin K.

description: Really good overall. The tacos were delish, decent prices and fun atmosphere.
author: Claire b.

description: I love this place. I don't even know what I'm eating most of the time, but it is all amazing. It looks good, tastes better, and the margaritas are totally unique and delicious. Just a killer joint.
author: Ted R.

description: Yummmm yummmm YUMMMMMYYY!!! I just tried Tacolicious for the first time last week and I had a really great experience. I love the atmosphere and the staff is super friendly. My favorite thing about this place is the flavors in all of their tacos and dishes.
