I loved the Ahi Tuna Tostada for our appetizer and I also really enjoyed the three different sauces/salsas they give you with your tacos. The yellow one was my favorite. I will definitely go back soon, maybe try their happy hour.
author: Lindsey N.

description: Delicious food.  The quality is through the roof. The service is fast and the bar is fully loaded.  The atmosphere is a little too trendy/hipsterish for my taste, but you can't really expect much else in the Marina.   I've replaced going to Nick's every week with friends to come here instead.  It's that awesome.
author: Sean M.

description: We went mid afternoon on a weekday - no wait, great service, small but delish tacos and tasty margs. Defintely worth a trip (or two).
author: Emily M.

description:
Amazing. I need to move to SF just so I can frequent this place.

Phenomenal cocktails, even better food. Had the Avocado Papaya salad- so fresh. The mix n match taco platter was also very good- try the filet minion tacos ($2 or $3 more, but worth it). 

Service was quick, a little impersonal- but atmosphere was exciting and the food was too good for us to care.
author: Taryn P.

description:
I would go again. 
Vegetarian friendly - we got a plate of 10 taco's but several other choices.
Good setting - I liked our table near the windows
Best parts:
Awesome hostess -  Friday evening, 5 of us gals stopped in. It was crowded, so about 25 minute wait but the hostess kept her eye on us and got us in 10 minutes.
Drinks - My specialty. The margaritas were good!
author: Sonali K.

description: This place is always packed, and it is not hard to see why.  Great tacos with lots of unusual ingredients and great margaritas.
author: Jared E.

description: Taco of the week (taco al pastor) + 21st Amendment Hell or High Watermelon Wheat Beer= happy tummy. I added all three of the 'stop light' salsas that came with it (red, yellow, green- the waiter explained but I was too busy watching a kid cuddle a pit bull that everyone else was terrified of). Very tasty. I'll be back. I want to try the Prix Fixe menu- $10 for taco, tequila and tecate, but te-kill-ya and I stopped speaking to each other 10 years ago.
author: Johanna S.

description: Pretty good food.  On the menu they mention that you can get 1 taco for 3.50, and 4 for 12, which made me think that 4 would be a normal portion.  I could have probably been happy with just 2 honestly though.  I did have the guacomole before hand though, which was crazy good.  The tacos were pretty good themselves, i enjoyed the veggie ones better than the fish ones.  Would probably come back if i was in the area.
author: Phil J.

description: Excellent tequila selection. Bartenders make great margaritas. Kitchen has good small bites. The Carnitas and the Rock Cod tacos are the way to go. Vibrant scene.
author: Juan S.

description:
Best tacos in San Francisco. Great drinks. Great atmosphere. Great service. 

 I highly recommend trying this place out if you have never been!
author: Br R.

description:
I am a taqueria-goer at heart, and I always resist going to any Mexican restaurant that seems trendy or organic or that has a clever name, or is a bit over-priced. But I let me friends convince me to try this place, which was easy once I walked past the outdoor seating and had a long, rude look at other people's food as they tried to ignore the intruding stares of passers-by.   The tacos struck me as large and tasty-looking, so I humored my friends and tried it out.  And I am the first to admit, they were great!
I got 4 for myself (I like to ease into things slowly): beef short rib, carnitas, cod, and chorizo.  All of them were awesome except the chorizo, which was just pretty good.  Apparently they make the chorizo themselves, no easy feat, but nevertheless the other 3 were more enjoyable.  The meat in the carnitas and beef tacos was juicy and soft and tasty, and the fried cod taco was everything you would want a fish taco to be; nice crunch, juicy white fish, and good fixins.
While you wait for your tacos, they bring you bowl after bowl of really good chips and salsa, and pitchers of water.  I have heard that the service can be quite rude, but had the opposite experience; a server who was very patient as we ordered in the most inefficient manner possible. 
We had to wait about 25 minutes for our table, which was fine since there is a good bar across the street, and the hostess even said she would run across and get us when our table was ready (though we came back a little early to save her the trouble)! But a very nice gesture if you ask me.
I would give 4.5 stars if I could, but I can't.  And I can't put 5 because according to Yelp that means "as good as it gets", which for me is still the old school taqueria.  But I was very pleasantly surprised by this place.
author: Sam C.

description:
This place is just simply amazing. Last time i stayed in the city i remember our cab driver telling us that tacolicious is really good mexican food. However, I never went until a friend took me here last Saturday and this place was crazy packed at 8:30pm. There was hardly any room to walk. We got a table and the food was to die for. The best tacos i've ever had in my life. I loved it! The drinks went really well with the food. We had so many shots of passion and some picante drink. They were both very exotically spicy. They weren't too strong considering i had 9 shots. If i ever had 9 shots of patron or 9 shots of any other shot i'd be  passed out on the floor wasted. So, these shots were not too strong. But definitely just as good as the food. I have to say this place was different. The food was very authentic. We ordered the chicken and beef tacos,a must try! The chips and salsa was delish as well! Everything here was so good! All i need is good service, good food and drinks and you can count on me being a regular customer!  I am going back again this weekend with friends and i can't wait. 

5/5 for tacolicious!!!!
author: Ms C C.

description: Do you like good food? If so this is a place that has it. The salsa with mint in it is amazing. All the Tacos Are legit. Go there Thank me later.
author: T.J. B.

description:
My friend introduced me to this amazing taco joint located in the Marina the other day. As cheesy (or Americanized) as it sounds, it was actually pretty damn good. Best carnitas I've ever had (so far). And this is coming from a person who was raised by the Mexican border. I know good Mexican food like the back of my little hands. The menu is pretty small so you're not overwhelmed with choices. I chose the 4 tacos for $12. I had 2 traditional carnitas, 1 house-made chorizo potato, and 1 shot-and-a-beer braised Petaluma chicken. All very good. Except the chorizo may have been a little bit over cooked. But some may prefer the smokier taste. Whatever they use for the marinate is brilliant! The chicken taco was pretty flavorful because it just soaks up the marinate better than the other meats. I also tried some of my friend's cod (fish) taco, which was my least favorite. It was more breaded than it was fish. You can't go wrong with the the traditional carnitas. Goes great with a Pacifico on a warm day.

The place itself is pretty hip and modern. They have a bar for people who really just want to get down and dirty with tacos and alcohol. The atmosphere is great. It just gets pretty crowded during brunch hours on a Sunday and seating is pretty limited because the place is not very big.

Overall, a great place to hit up before or after a nice stroll in the Marina or Golden Gate Bridge.
author: Mary Anne R.

description: Short rib and carnitas tacos = delicious.  The chicken was just okay in comparison.  And the homemade guacamole was definitely a culprit in why we ate as many chips as we did ... pretty yummy cocktails too.
author: Melinda C.

description:
Tecate, Tequila, and a Taco for $10?  Hell yeah!  

The food is great, some of the best carnitas I've ever had.
author: Michael C.

description: Love, love love Tacolicious! My only issue is they need a bigger place.  It is always packed. The staff is nice and  good portions. OK margartitas.
author: Hud B.

description: Excellent location, excellent service, and oh yea excellent food. I visited Tacolicious last night after enjoying the scenery on Lombard St. and it certainly hit the spot. The service was prompt, I think we got our orders within 20 min of us arriving there. The place itself was lively and trendy, great for the downtown partygoers as a halftime pitstop or a late snack the end of the night. The tacos have fresh ingredients which are bought local at the Ferry Building. I had the rib eye and carnitas tacos, and they were as deliciously served as they could be. The menu had a variety of other tasty assortments such as the cod  tacos. Chips and salsa were a great start, and like everyone else, we ate too much before our entrees were served. Enjoy!
author: Emmanuel C.

description: Delicious -- grab a seat outside and order some tasty tacos. I can't say they're the BEST I've had (still love Primavera's fish tacos and Nick's Crispy Tacos more...) but they're pretty darn good and a great addition to the Marina.
author: Kate T.

description: Great spot. I sat at the bar here during a quiet time, around 4pm on Saturday. Negro Modelo on draught, shredded pork tostadas with home-made salsa and chips. I will come back for sure with some friends, there are bulk taco options on the menu (10 for $29). The queso was so good; The expediter hooked me up with a sample and I might have to back just for that! Would get the tostadas again for sure. They were piled high with juicy carnitas topped with cotija and some pickled shallots. Me gusta.
author: Dave M.

description: fun spot, that seems to always be hustling and bustling. Their taco's are good and their drinks are strong, a great spot to grab a fun drink and small bite with some friends.
author: Shadi N.

description:
Super-Authentic Tacos, but better.  Better, b/c the tacos are made from organic ingredients, and prepared perfectly.  Some of the best tacos I've had in my life.  Warm, soft, fresh tortillas.  Moist, tasty, perfectly seasoned fillings.  My faves are the short rib and petaluma chick.  Carnitas are good.  Fish is good.  Salsa's are very good, but spot taste the habanero before you commit.

Margs are solid.  Tommy's is still the standard, but why limit yourself?  They have a spicy number, name escapes, which complements the tacos like a Lucy on Ricky (before they fought).  Order one.... pitcher.

Now, now.  Let's not argue about the Mission blah, blah, blah.  Good food is good food.  These tacos stand on their own, and beat most anything in the Mission outside of perhaps Pancho Villa and La Taqueria, but only on carne asada.

YES, it's LOUD.  YES you will WAIT.  More importantly, if you come for lunch and want a drink, sit IN-side.  For whatever reason they can't server booze outside during lunch.
author: Moz R.

description: There are reasons I don't come to the Marina--namely, the people.  The food was delicious--I got veggie tacos that were perfect for me because they weren't spicy and I'm a wimp.  The restaurant was SO packed on Thursday night at 7 that there were people hovering all over my table.  It was uber-unpleasant.  I wish they told people they had to wait outside.  Our server was helpful and didn't mind me asking lots of questions about spiciness and cilantro--things I don't like.  The clientele was annoying me beyond belief.  A random woman hit me in the face while gesturing in a lively way.  The bathroom is also in the kitchen so you have to wait in the kitchen and I felt like I was in the way. I think they're opening a Mission location, which is cool, but I probably will stick to my traditional faves like El Toro and El Farolito.  The staff is sweet, and the food is good, but the Marina people tend to bug me too much.
author: Julia D.

description: Great food and great prices.  A little crowded but the food makes it worth it.  Defiantly would go back.
author: Oliver M.

description: This is the full-blown restaraunt version of the already great Tacolicious stand down at the Ferry Plaza market! I'm sorry to see Laiola close, but good cheap eats are what the Marina needs more of.
author: Alex D.

description:
This place was an interesting addition to Chestnut, with a similar ambiance to Mamacita but obviously with differences.  The menu is pretty light, they have 6 different kinds of tacos, a few soups and salads and 4-5 apps.  Before I knock the place, let me say that the tacos were really good, small in size, but very flavorful and tasty.  Two of us split 10 tacos which was plenty of food for the two of us.  They have several homemade salsas that were good, however they only gave us a minimal amount of each (ie less than an ounce) and if you like putting salsa on tacos, be prepared to ask for more, especially if you're eating more than a few.
While our server was polite and friendly, she wasn't on top of her game.  Granted it was busy and she was helping the table to the left and right of us, but it took a while to both get her attention, especially when she was talking to either table next to us, and the bill took seemingly forever.  She apologized and I know she was trying so I don't want to say the service was bad, just a little slow.
My biggest knock of this place is the drink prices.  I'm sorry but $7 for a 24oz. Tecate is pathetic.  This costs no more than 1.50 at any liquor store and the fact that they are charging this much is sad.  They also have a spicy beer which basically is hot sauce and a lime on top of a tecate, which is very good if you have never tried it, but it too is $7.  Give me a break, Paxti's charges $2 for a tecate shows you that you can in fact make a profit for charging a modest price for a cheap beer.  The other cocktails are around $9 with nice ingredients which is probably about average for the Marina.  The draft beers are served in skinny pints (not 16oz) and are $5-6.  
Overall, the food was good, but the menu seemed to be way more drink oriented then food oriented which is fine if you want to go get a drink and a light snack.  I know the place is new and that rent is expensive but try to keep cheap beer priced accordingly.
author: Eli Z.

description: Oh T-Lish what can I say every time I come back it gets better and better the food is so fresh the Tuna tostada rocks my world, carnitas is insaine and the Marina girl salad with that sweet and spicy dressing and the very yummy pimpkin seeds those alone should be a snack. Yum yum can't wait to come back. Thanks for making my taste buds smile.
author: Jeni Z.

description: Love love love this place. Best tacos in San Francisco.
author: Katrina H.

description:
My wife and I popped into Tacolicious I get it... tacos and small treats to share amongst the table. Our intentions were crossing another item off of our list from the 7x7 100 Big Eats.  The Beef short rib taco... WOW! This was a tasty taco, but man I wish i could enjoy it in a burrito... I know I know, its Tacolicious, Not burritolicious... but a man could dream right? 
The service was good. The chips were super thin and crispy...I'm always happy when that happens. We tried a few other tacos (prawns, choizo/potato, and the cod) The short rib was my favorite, the cod was a close second because of the zesty flavors. the rest were so so... 
If I were to go back it would be for the Short Rib, and to try the Guacamole, but that won't be for a while because I have 84% left on my list.. haha
Lastly, We sat outside and listened to all the people passing by say they either love this place or can't wait to try this place.  I thought that was fun to hear while we enjoyed our meal.
author: Miguel V.

description:
THIS PLACE HAS A 12 FOOT TALL PAINTING OF A TAPATIO BOTTLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Oh and the food is delicious (recommend the carnitas or chicken tacos), the decor is modern and clean, and the service is helpful. Reasonably priced too; I got 4 BIG tacos for $12.
author: Scott L.

description: This place is DELICIOUS! I was not disappointed with my order. I had the carnitas,tacos de papa, al pastor and more carnitas! I had a Michelada and was really good. Defiantly would go back!
author: V L.

description:
It's been a while, Yelp.  Nice to be back.

Anyway, Tacolicious... Hmmm, so what can I say?  Their tacos are quite tasty.  Loved the chorizo taco.  The rest were quite good as well.  This, coming from a socal/LA/OC/SD boy.  Meets with my approval.

We sat outside (there are about 4 tables, and it's cramped) and enjoyed the sun while sipping margaritas.  They have interesting flavors of margaritas, but the classic was my favorite.  

Overall, good tacos, good margaritas (not too sweet), and a little pricey but what isn't in the Marina?
author: Richard K.

description: We visited on a very warm Monday night.  The line was out the door and the wait was an hour.  We were determined to try this place though so we went to a bar and waited.  Its a cool scene and a fun place to be at enjoying beers with friends.  It's kind of cool how they present the tacos to the table on one huge plate.  I like the fresh chips, but the salsa is kind of fruity.  Its not your traditional Mexican restaurant salsa, and I cant say I liked it much.  I ordered the following tacos, shot-and-a-beer braised petaluma chicken, house-made chorizo-potato, traditional carnitas, guajillo braised beef short rib.  I thought they were all good, with one exception the carnitas.  The carnitas were fantastic, moist and flavorful.  I'd go back but only if there wasn't a long wait.
author: Kevin M.

description: Must try if in the area. Great food and fun setting. Love the open area feel of the bar area and patio.
author: Tiffanie J.

description: The name of the place says it all. Been there twice already. Once on a Saturday night and once on a Sunday night. Saturday night was about an hour wait but, it was fine (drinks at the bar). On Sunday night we walked in and they seated us right away. Both times we order the ten taco platter. Fillet Mignon, Beef Short Rib, Chicken, and Carnitas. The salsa verde that comes with the chips is excellent and has a nice kick to boot . Highly recommend the cactus pear margaritas. Not outrageously expensive and for the Marina the douche and Marina chick vibe was surprisingly low.
author: Rob M.

description:
Just tried this for first time and was hugely disappointed.  

After being told carnitas tacos was best in SF, I was stoked to try as I LOVE carnitas.  When they arrived the portion of meat was generous but the meat was super dry and was quite bland.  My wife had the same thing.  The empanadas were forgettable and the highlight of the meal was probably the chips.  

Unfortunately we ordered a chicken taco for my 2 year old and during his first bite he started choking.  My wife couldn't figure out what was wrong and after the threw up a significant amount, a bone about 1.5" in length popped out.  When the "only in the marina" manager came over, his only comment was "It happens".   Needless to say, I was not impressed with him.  

Our waiter was great though and they did take the child's meal off the bill.  I won't go back though as "It happens" is really just not good enough after a 2 year old chokes on a friggin bone.  Mamacita is a better bet with much more original and better tasting food.
author: Freakishly M.

description:
Pretty good. The margaritas are awesome. The salsa they bring at first is to die for - I asked what makes it so good and they said they add a little mint. We all ordered the tacos - they were great. I did not like the vegetarian taco - I think it was butternut squash? mushy and lacking flavor - not the best. 
The quac is delicious, but rather small for $6.50. Cute ambiance. We came a little before 6:30 and there was no wait. Overall, the tacos were good - I actually think the tacos in Mill Valley at Joe's Tacos are better - they have the little extra something that makes them great. 
The appetizers looked really good but we didn't order any. I'll come back - a fun place and fairly affordable.
author: W D.

description: Went for lunch today and found their tacos delicious. Had the Yucatecan special tacos with black bean tortillas, shrimp, avocado, and cilantro. Very tasty. Only problem was that I thought it was $4.95 for 3 but it was $4.95 for one taco. So it ended up being an expensive lunch. But definitely tasty - as a Mexican food aficionado I plan to return. Too bad it's on the other end of town. Tasty chips and salsa and cold Supremo on tap.
author: Dan L.

description:
Ummm... PHENOMENAL food.  Had the fried fish tacos, as well as the the tuna tostada... the fish just melts in your mouth! So unbelievably fresh.  The guacamole is overpriced but delicious.

Best margarita I've ever had.  My new favorite spot!
author: S K.

description: I dine out so much and I forget to review places. Finally had a chance to try you guys for lunch today. It was the perfect weather for outdoor seating. Chips w/ salsa and guac...love the salsa! We had 2 tacos each of the pork & chicken. Street style of course and they weren't bad. Great place to stop in and just enjoy the rest of the day. Drink and be lazy even if it's during your lunch hour :)
author: Lola D.

description: AHI TUNA tostada is AMAZING!! So are the pasion shots, Carlos the server, and the gaucamole. See ya thereeee. xo
author: Morgan M.

description: Awesome service!!! Jeremy and Jackson, great bartenders!!! Mika is a beautiful and warm hostess!!! Best Sunday funday yet!!!?
author: Monique M.

description: I wish I could give more stars!  Great tacos, great service and fun atmosphere. My friends and I went with our daughters and the staff was so friendly. Great recommedations (queso and short rib taco yum!). The drinks were fantastic with so many fun new choices everyone enjoyed especially the tickle me tellmo. Please hit this place again and again because it is simply a quality establishment.
author: Binx J.

description: The short rib taco is legit. I wish it came in a burrito the size of my head, because I'd like to develop a long term relationship with that beef. As for the rest of the menu...a bit overpriced, I think. Tiny, pricey tacos and carnitas that is just a bit too salty.
author: Beth T.

description: im usually a fan of taco trucks and places where the staff only knows spanish, because I think the tacos are more authentic and it makes me feel cool with street cred, etc.  However, this place has some good damn tacos.  Sure it's in the marina and it's expensive for a taco joint, but the tacos taste good, the margaritas are strong and you dont worry about getting the squirts after eating as much.  And isn't that all we really care about.
author: christopher h.

description: This place is good, as Marina Mexican food goes. They have great margaritas and good 4 for $13 taco deals. You pay a little more, but you get a real restaurant feel.
author: Lina L.

description: I wanted to hate this place as much as the rest of you because I loved my nights out at Laiola.  It's become a great staple for meeting up with my boyfriend on a weeknight after work or lunch on a weekend.  Very reasonable prices and yummy guacamole.  A good neighborhood staple.
author: hilary w.

description: O. my. god. Oh hell yeah. Tacolicious is the bomb. That's all. To be honest I've only ever had the fish taco. But I give it an A for A-mazing! Really yummy and creative cocktails. Always great ambiance and unlimited chips and salsa. Tanks goodness I just moved a block and a half away. Ole!
author: Andrea Y.

description: Tacolicious is good...but I am from San Diego...and I could buy better and cheaper tacos down there. That being said, their salsas and chips are delicious and their tacos are descent but not great. I have been back a few times, and I highly recommend the carnitas tacos and their chiliquiles that they offer on the weekends. Its a pricey little mexican restaurant, that is fun to go to once in a while, but I wouldnt call it a good value.
author: Michelle N.

description: decent tacos, and good appetizers.  It loses a star because it's rather expensive (for small tacos) and it loses another because the service was pretty lacking (although it was very busy, so I'd be willing to give it another shot)
author: Sage S.

description: Great place for a Sunday brunch, although it does get crowded.  Good tacos, but I was a bigger fan of the tuna tostada which is fantastic!
author: Jules A.

description:
Working in the Marina this week and I stumbled across this place around lunchtime. I really wanted tacos and didn't want to drive to the Mission just for lunch. So, I took a chance on this place and came away pretty impressed.

The 4 carnitas taco deal is where it's at. Can't really comment on anything else, but those were great. Prices are what you would expect in the Marina, but after 4 tacos I got my 12 bucks worth. Salsas seem homemade and fresh. Don't know about the habanero salsa...seems like it would just overpower whatever you put it on. The standard red and guacamole-like salsas were nice though.

People working there were friendly and plentiful parking is nearby. If you're in the area and want tacos this is your place.
author: Matt M.

description:
Genius concept! Bar with food! What's not to like:
Perfectly sized tacos, Salsa and Queso to die for
(Note- 2 to 3 tacos fills you up even on a hungry stomach, we kinda over did it but now we know)
Margaritas- try the pomegranate...refreshing
Atmosphere- electric, fun crowd
Wait staff- energetic, friendly and fun
No reason to wait 45 mins for a table, the prime spots are at the bar. Spots open up fast. 

Not a spot for a deep conversation but fantastic to end a hard work week! 
Adding this to my list of favorite spots in the city.
author: Mano C.

description: Being a former chef I am very judgmental when it comes to eating out.  First when you walk in, have a drink and enjoy the great scenery.  The tacos are AMAZING.  I live in the East Bay and go to SF 2-3 a month just for the tacos!!
author: JD D.

description: If you're looking for higher end Mexican food (I know that's an oxymoron) like Mamacitas... go here instead. Better food, Better prices, Less crowded, Friendlier. Try the short rib tacos and the queso! Also, the salsa is awesome.
author: Jared A.

description: Great vibe to this place with delicious tacos! They have about 7 different types of tacos and I tried each one. I have to say I'm a huge fan of the filet mignon taco (except it's an extra 3 dollars more for this one). Nice place to grad a bite and have a beer with friends. Had to wait about 15 minutes for a table, though!
author: Tracy L.

description: This place tops my list for hip Mexican. Their fish and veggie tacos are perfect. An the salsa trio...wow. I like to do the 10 taco deal with two or three people and then turn it into 20 by splitting up the double tortillas and adding little side of rice and guac. Now I got myself salivating again. If you happen to catch them on a night when they offer their side of butternut squash, do NOT hesitate...and order two. Tuna tostada also great. Don't forget you can order the fish taco grilled if that's more your style.
author: Scott D.

description: There are quite a few places doing the "fancy" Mexican thing and I don't think this place stands out. We tried pretty much every taco and also had the tuna tostada. In general, the food lacked flavor. The salsas/sauces were delicious, but were also necessary to make the dishes interesting. Tacolicious was fine but I wouldn't make it a point to go back. Also, the name of the restaurant is kind of ridiculous and I found myself feeling slightly embarrassed when telling people I was headed there.
author: m t.

description: Watched USA play here on Wednesday morning and Saturday lunchtime.  I am a fan of the management and staff.  Very friendly, helpful and down to earth.  World Cup breakfast was delicious -- awesome chips and salsa, a decent cafe con leche, fresh and not too sweet watermelon juice, breakfast taco, churros con chocolate -- as was the regular menu today --had huevos rancheros.  Cocktails were clever and tasty, too.  Dig the space -- the bar, the open windows at front, etc.  Too bad USA is knocked out now but go check out Mexico here since this is a great World Cup venue.
author: Kelly J.

description: Great margaritas and amazing beef short ribs.  They seem to focus on quality and getting the flavors right.  Great addition to the neighborhood
author: Radesh G.

description: I tried both the chicken and the vegetarian tacos here and both were delicious! The vegetarian one was unique, with lots of mushrooms and a great flavor. The tacos are small and overpriced, but it is the Ferry Plaza, so I expected that. The tortillas tasted really fresh too. I would eat here again, but I'll get 3 tacos next time since that's a better deal.
author: Maria V.

description:
I had lunch here with a friend on Saturday. We were quickly seated outside, and experienced friendly, attentive service and ate some amazing tacos!

They brought out salsa and chips, which were great, and we ordered some of their guacamole. Definitely try it, it was very fresh and tasty. We also shared the following tacos:

summer squash- very good
fried local rock cod cabbage- our favorite!
shot-and-a-beer braised petaluma chicken- solid taco, not amazing
guajillo braised beef short rib- very messy and heavy, good if you are starving

They had some great drink options, but since we were sitting outside we could not order alcohol. I plan to go back for dinner and try some of their drinks out!
author: Nicole V.

description: This place was packed when me and a friend stumbled upon it for brunch.  Their menu was simple which I liked.  The service was great, especially from our cute blue-eyed waitress.  Free salsa and chips arrived quickly on our table.   The tacos weren't as tasty as I imagined they would be, although the portions are big.  My tacos came out cold and some of the meats were dry.  The three spiciness of salsas as condiments is a great idea.  Come down here if you need to fill up before or after drinking.  Or sit down and have tequila and drinks here.
author: Tom C.

description:
This place has an awesome atmosphere when you first walk in. It is a hybrid bar/restaurant that was packed even at 9 o'clock on a Thursday night. The first thing I noticed when I walked in was the deal of the night (hopefully this deal happens all the time). It consisted of a taco, tecate, and shot of tequila for ten dollars. My friend and I both ordered the special that came accompanied with endless chips and salsa. Also for some reason, the water was really good (don't know why, but maybe it was the cool bottles it came out of).
The food itself was solid. Definitely not the best I have ever had, but I did learn a cool trick before going in to maximize the food you get. Every taco is served with tons of whatever meat (or meat substitute) you order, and it comes with two tortillas. If you simply remove the bottom tortilla, you can split the meat up between the two and almost get two tacos for the price of one.
author: Brady C.

description: Fantastic food, and a lively atmosphere.  Bloody Marias were very special.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Tip - a serve of chili con queso and a plate of 10 tacos were a big satisfying meal for 4 of us.  Tortilla chips and salsa were brought to the table at regular intervals and were consumed with gusto!
author: T T.

description:
Best part, hands down: the passion fruit-jalapeno margaritas. Recommended by our server (who was great), and despite my passion fruit-induced hesitancy, these rocked. Perfect combination of heat + sweet (+ a generously salted rim).

Checked it out on the second night post-transformation from Laiola around eight, and was happy to walk in just as two bar seats opened up. Lots of hooks under the bar for bags, which is always a plus.

Not in love with the mushroom-nopales (veg-option) taco, but thought the rock cod ceviche was a great, fresh start and the house salsa is quite good. Server was wonderfully personable and hilarious, although the service wasn't snagless (my friend was waiting for ages for her tacos) but they had just opened, so not bad overall.

I'd drop by for the tequila+tecate+taco prix-fixe in a heartbeat - and to try more of the drinks, but might spend my taco dollars at Nick's (at least on Tuesdays).
author: Allie H.

description: GREAT margaritas, good tacos, good variety and some really fresh salads make this place a gem.  My bias comes into play here, so I had to give it minus 1 for the neighborhood and lack of parking.
author: Timothy S.

description: When I heard that L'Aiola closed, I was devastated. That was until I tried its replacement, Tacolicious. Out of all of the taco places that have been popping up recently, this is by far my favorite. The guacamole is addictive, and the salsa that comes with the tortilla chips is equally scrumptious. Normally, I order 4 tacos (for $12): the "shot-and-a-beer braised petaluma chicken, the "traditional carnitas", the "guajilo braised beef short rib", and a vegetarian option (which changes seasonally). Although the short ribs are a little greasy, the taste more than makes up for it. It is an "American" taco place, but the prices are reasonable, and the food is exceptional.
author: Victoria B.

description: The tacolic is okay, and i hit it up at times.  Short rib taco is really good.  Albondigas is okay.  I'm not a huge fan of their salsas, but bottom line, good cheap food.
author: Lena D.

description:
We went to Tacolicious to try it out as we knew it had opened recently. This is the full blown restaurant version of the Farmer's Market Tacolicious, but I never got to try it there. 

The restaurant's atmosphere is very nice. It's a small and cozy place with seating both at tables and at the bar. I'm not sure if they take reservations but the place can fill up fast. The staff there were very friendly as was the chef, and the bartender stole the show with "surprise me" cocktails that should be on the regular menu.

The tacos were very good, juicy and not overcooked. I really liked the chicken tacos and my date liked the pork tacos. Chips were warm and salsa and guacamole were quite good. I like REALLY spicy salsa though, but most places won't serve that unless you specifically ask for it, which I did not but will next time.

A good spot in the Marina and a great taco place which suits my tastes. I would urge people to stop in just to try their cocktails, and have a taco for good measure.
author: vincy b.

description: My absolute favorite place to dine in San Francisco.  Absolutely the best tacos with the freshest ingredients available.  Great food, amazing atmosphere.  You cannot go wrong at T-Lish.
author: Joe G.

description: Excellent food, but their online ordering is not good. Our order did not go through, they won't even let you call your orders in. How is that the only way for to go orders if the online system doesn't work?
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I don't understand all the hype. The food is mediocre at best. I thought maybe my first experience at the Marina locale was just a fluke, so recently tried the Mission one. It was just as blah. The carnitas was dry and flavorless, and the fried cod was soggy. For a real fish taco, check out the Taco Bar on Cali & Fillmore. Their only saving grace is the drink menu.
author: erika s.

description: BEST EATING PLACE ALIVE!!! EVERYONE in SF needs to go to this place. Good environment, fun employees, and BOMB food.
author: Ashley S.

description: The carnitas tacos,  seviche, and endless chips and salsa make the long wait and cramped seating totally worth it. And the margaritas aren't too bad either.
author: Erin A.

description: Super tasty tacos. Fun, energetic atmosphere. Great servers. Gets very crowded.
author: Susan S.

description: love this place!!!!!! tuna tostada is amazing, the soup is amazing, and the taco's are amazing. cant go wrong with eating here!
author: Dmitriy G.

description:
Had the Nopales and the braised beef tacos.  Goodness, the braised beef is so wonderful.  It melts in your mouth---I wish I could get my slow roasted beef to taste this good. You get a good amount of beef too, they don't skimp.  There's onions and japalapenos on the side and beans and I can't remember what else but the flavors of the braised beef are scrumptuous that's all you remember.  That and the texture.  I'd definitely come back again.  I ONLY HAVE ONE COMPLAINT----They totally need to give mr. tattoo guy i'm too cool up front an etiquette lesson.  He acts distracted, like he doesn't hear you and he's all looking off in the distance.  I mean come on buddy.  It's like the baristas at the Blue Bottle in the Embarcadero (love their coffee) they act as if they created the coffee beans!!!!  

The lady at Tacolicious is super nice though.  Maybe they need to relegate tattoo guy to the back making tacos and not at the front greeting customers.  I almost didn't come back because of him but saw the lady and gave it a try.  Super delicious.
author: Maria B.

description: I so wanted to love Tacolicious. Tacos are pretty much my favorite food, so a whole restaurant devoted to them could do no wrong, I hoped. I was wrong. The best thing that we tried was the tuna tostada, which was quite tasty. The carnitas taco was both dry and ridiculously oversalted, making it almost inedible. The "shot and a beer" chicken taco was better, but still way too salty. The other tacos we tried (chorizo, chile verde, and vegetarian) were also just not that great. I would only come here again for drinks (the sangria was tasty) and maybe an appetizer.
author: Samantha S.

description: If I lived here, I would be a regular! This was definitely one of my favorite places I have eaten in the last year. I loved being able to mix and match taco fillings; I had the fried cod taco and the special honey chicken taco. I wish I had room to eat more. I loved the salsa so much that I filled up on the chips and salsa. Since I am pregnant, I didn't get to have a beer with my husband, but had the non-alcohol drink named "moss". It was spectacular; pineapple juice, passion fruit juice and sparking lemonade. Next time I am in SF, I will beg to go back!
author: Sarah L.

description: I enjoyed hanging out in this trendy looking restaurant, but I am not too crazy about the tacos and guacamole here (I've tried all the tacos). Maybe it is because I've had better and was expecting more. However, the service here is not had, and it is definitely a great place to dine. Maybe I will give it a try again and order something else some time.
author: Jackie W.

description: Went to Tacolicious the other day to try the tuna tostada from the 7x7 list.  We got in around 7:30, and immediately got seated at the bar.  We had the tostada, as well as a 4-taco place -- one each of chicken in mole colorado, cochinita pibil, fish, and veggie.  We were immediately greeted with chips and salsa, and the bartender made us our margaritas very quickly.  I liked the kick in the Pasion, but wanted a Frozen Pasion, and they weren't making them that night.  The chips and salsa were tasty, and the tostadas came out pretty quickly.  The tuna was delicious and tasted very fresh -- I just wish they were bigger!!  Then the tacos came a few minutes later.  The cochinita was tender and saucy.  The fish was light and crispy.  The veggies were ok, but my wife liked them more than I did.  Our least favorite was the chicken, which was a bit dry for something that was cooked in sauce.  We really enjoyed the three salsas that came with the tacos.  I really liked the chipotle and the habanero ones!  I've also had the short rib taco once, at Union Street Festival I think, and I remember really enjoying it.  I'll try some of the other tacos next time, but the tuna tostadas were the star of the night.
author: Pilan C.

description:
I have visited this place twice in the last two weeks. Once at an off hour, around 4pm on a Wednesday and again on a very busy Saturday Memorial Day weekend at 7pm. 
I was so charmed on my first visit by the setting, style, and concept...oh AND food, that I made a return trip, even though I'm not a Marina kind of guy. 
I view this place as upscale without being too serious about itself. Taco eating should be fun and Tacolicious accomplishes this with a friendly staff, good toppings, and solid main ingredients. 
On my Saturday visit I came in by myself and the adorable floor girl watched out for me and helped to get a good seat at the bar. This was my second visit and I had the Pre Fix Tecate, Tequila, and Taco on my mind. 10 bucks...come on! Carnitas! Save my life! 
I'm writing this on the Sunday after my visit and I'm thinking maybe I'm going back right now!   
Try this place out. Take a date. Maybe even a first date. You will have fun here, and you won't even try.
author: Mark B.

description: I ended up here after a long city hike along the waterfront.  I found the tacos to be good, and the menu was well written.  The cocktails were also good.  I will have to agree with some other pople on here that the service seemed especially slow.  I hope to give this place another shot in a couple months and see if it has improved at all...
author: Chris W.

description: Went here for the first time a couple of weeks ago. The tacos were good and the sauces you could put on them were great. We ordered a pitcher of sangria but it was pretty bad. The service was OK but pretty slow. I think our waiter was a little awkward - my girlfriend ordered a veggie taco and a fish taco. He asked her if she wanted them on separate plates and said "what are you, vegetarian or something?" haha. While that could be offensive the way it was said, we found it pretty entertaining.... especially since fish is not vegetarian...
author: Richard C.

description: Went there with my girlfriend. Great service ! And the dude Sweet Wheat is the best server ever!
author: Le Y.

description: So I moved up here from Santa Barbara a few weeks ago, not sure of what to expect in the form of mexican food. Well, when I went to Tacolicious I was beyond excited. The place is great, especially the chicken mole tacos. The fish are good, but I'm more of a grilled fish kinda guy. Can't comment on the steak tacos, but all the sauces were great, and the chips were good too. Plus you can get 4 tacos for $12, which filled my roommate and myself up, and we love food.
author: Clay T.

description: pretty great. food was really well prepared and it has a great environment
author: Parker H.

description: Rainy and cold day, so what better than to try tacolicious?  and yes, (forgive me for saying), they were delicious.  Farmer's market translates well to their restaurant.  fish, short rib and carnitas = yummy tacos.  The bartender is super friendly and very attentive.  food comes out a bit on the slow side...so be prepared to wait.
author: Sonia C.

description:
YUM YUM YUM

Food, Hotess & Service = FABULOUS


What we had:

The 4 Four Taco Deal (Which was plenty for my beautiful friend and me)
2 Chicken
1 Fried Cod
1 Carnitas

(they had many other taco choices but I will get to eatin' those on my next visit!)

My fave about this dish was that it came with 3 delicous Sala's.. The habanero was nice and hot for those that like the heat. 

They are small.. i dunno maybe 4.5 inches in diameter BUT stuffed with a good amount of meat (or whatever yumminess you ordered).

We also had the Platanos and Guac.

Platanos (1 Plantain over a smear of refried beans and some type of sourcreme sauce on the other side of the plate)

Guacamole was very delicious.. not too creamy and seasoned just right!

And yes we had dessert too!

The Chocholate something with sourdough bread (recommended by our waitress). The chocalate was topped with a sprinkle of sea salt and a touch of olive oil. It was interesting on the sensories.. however, it would have been better with shortbread cookies instead of sourdough. My friend said it remided her of Nutella. 

DRINKS!

Margarita - YUM
Nopal - YUM

Very Sweet so if your are not big on the sugar or sweet drinks.. these are not for you!

Other good to knows:

Sat outside to avoid a wait because they don't take reservations.. but they gave blankets and had outdoor heaters. 

Definitely worth it.
author: christina M.

description: Delicious goodness.  I fly into SF on business and sometimes don't arrive until about 9pm.  So glad I met the Rancho Gordo Taco!  Squash, nopales & vallarta beans with tasty salsas.  Light enough to satiate my light appetite and enjoy along with a glass of white wine.
author: Grace F.

description: More like 3.75 stars, but I'm bumping up.  The tacos are filled to the brim with your choice of tasty fillings.  The meats were all warm and delicious.  I couldn't pick a favorite if I wanted to.  It's on the expensive side (these are street tacos), but I'll be back.
author: She-Ra ..

description:
Came here recently on a Wednesday and I'm torn between 3 and 4 stars. Here's why: 

4 stars for the food: I had the chorizo, chicken and filet mignon taco. Each one was to die for..the flavors had such great taste (chicken was a little spicier than the others) and they're filled with a big chunk of meat. I tried the guacamole too and it was great. The chips were tasty too but needed more salt.

3 stars for the service: I was told that the bar seats were first come first served and as soon as I saw people get up and leave, I went to take their seats. There were two bartenders and one of them made eye contact with me but did not greet me. I sat there for a couple minutes with dirty dishes in front of me and watched them take a shot ( shot #1). When they were finished taking their shot, one bartender came to get the dirty dishes and greet me, also handing me a menu. He didn't even wipe the counter of the crumbs and the left over taco bites left from the previous people..I didn't bother saying anything. I ordered my food and a margarita de la casa. It was way too sweet, sweeter than a margarita should be. I decided not to say anything again and see how the rest of their service would be. I got my food very fast (and was put in a better mood by how tasty it was). I used the chipotle sauce they gave to put on my tacos, and I tried to ask for more but the bartenders were again, too busy in their own world. One was watching TV and the other was putting glasses away. Then comes shot #2. I sat there appalled at how they were taking another shot (keep in mind they just took one when I first arrived) and how other customers like myself, were waiting to get their attention. I gave up on asking for more sauce and instead finished my meal to get out of there. The only thing that the bartender was timely with was giving me my check when I had asked. 

So there we go, 3 stars for service and 4 for the food. Will definitely come back, just will not sit at the bar. I will have to wait a good 30 or 40 minutes for a table, which seems the best way to go given my experience here. They should really watch how much the bartenders drink because customers can see them doing it and even interfere with their ability to make drinks.. Maybe that's why mine was too sweet.
author: John S.

description: Love, love, love this restaurant!  The tacos are amazing, so are the appetizers and the chorros.....OMG - they are the BEST!  The service and staff is awesome too.
author: L N.

description: The piping hot queso dip, empanadas and short rib tacos are off the hook. The full bar and margaritas are excellent and fresh. The staff is young and great eye candy.  A great place to flirt. This is my favorite quick Mexican place in sf. If you have not tried it, go!
author: Bey A.

description:
This place is small, maybe fits about 50 people and also is packed most of the time. It does get loud inside on friday afternoon by 5:30 and is packed and bustling. There are limited larger tables, many 2 tops and a long bar with lots of seating. We wanted a table for 4 and the hostess was able to seat us at the bar until our other party members arrived 30 minutes later but we couldn't take up valuable table real estate without all four people present. She was very helpful. 
The drinks are yummy, especially the house margarita, and the cold beers, not so much the house sangria. All of the items on the food menu are delicious. My favorite is the shot-in-the-beer-chicken tacos. The tacos are small but they fill you up and they are really well spiced and reasonably priced. 
The menu is pretty limited to tacos and a few starters, which is actually kind of relieving because it makes it easier to choose and everything is good. The pulled pork tostadas were also tasty, much like the carnitas tacos but on a toasted corn tortilla rather than just a warm corn tortilla. I recommend getting a selection of tacos so you can try several. 
It also has outdoor heated seating which is fun in the afternoon.
author: Jessie B.

description: The food here is kind of greesy and the chips were served cold. Their is always a line and the frat boy 20 something's are always yelling for more tequila. Not my scene, but to each his own
author: Dennis A.

description: The only bummer about Tacolicious is waiting in the ridiculously long line. Fortunately, sunny days at the Ferry Building ease the suffering. That, and the very yummy potato chorizo tacos (which are wallet -friendly). The corn is bomb too.
author: Jason J.

description:
Went here with kids twice in the last 3 weeks for lunch and each time it was a fantastic experience.  Each time we had to wait for one of few lower height tables that fit the high chair but the staff was great about getting us seated and food in front of our kids ASAP.  Most importantly the food was a hit with a range of difficult customers.  The Kids loved the carnitas tacos (dad would have too if he wasn't on a diet).
In addition to my diet I am allergic to nuts and tomatoes which makes finding stuff to eat a challenge.  Here is the thing - the Marina Girl salad is one of the best salads in SF right now (though it pains me to order it).  
Combine that with a side of broccolini and a beer braised taco and I am very happy and bordering on healthy.
Bonus for the kids is free ice cream included with their meal.  Bonus for dad is sneaking a bite of whatever small scrap of fatty pork is left on their plates when the ice cream comes.
author: Carter K.

description:
Laoila - where have you gone?  What is this place?  Why is the service so slow?  

Guacamole was awesome, fish tacos were so-so.  Not planning on returning anytime soon but not adverse to the idea once the commotion over the place dies down.
author: Molly R.

description: I'm just being a little bias because I've now discovered I'm a burrito girl, not a taco one. Tacolicious truck came to Levi's Plaza so I got a couple veggie tacos. There's something about the small double skinned small tortilla that I don't like. Maybe because the filling falls out as I try to eat it. If I ever encounter Tacolicious again, I'll definitely get the meat tacos. Shame on me for trying to be healthy! I should stick to what I'm used to.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Food: We split 4 tacos (2 chicken and 2 pork). The chicken tacos are really good. The pork tacos are greasy and messy. The guacamole is pretty bland (tastes like mashed avocados with nothing else added to it).  The rock cod ceviche was completely forgettable.

The margaritas are tasty but they come in half size glasses. 

Tacolicious is decent on a night when you don't want to deal with the scene and the long waits at restaurants on the rest of Chestnut.
author: sara m.

description:
let's start with the bad
peach horchata was too thick and not peachy
the sole taco was over salted
the beef rib taco was too fatty
$9 for 3 tacos

now for the good
the potato chorizo taco was so good i almost cried
i can overlook all the flaws because it was THAT good. 5 STARS!
author: Christopher L.

description: DELICIOUS! Even as a vegetarian this place wowed me. I'd been wanting to try Tacolicious but being that is in the Marina, home of the douche and slutty girls with babies and JUICY pants, it wasn't high on my priority list. For starters, their chips and salsa were perfect. The salsa was different than most places- very fresh, almost herbal, but not entirely from cilantro. We ordered some guacamole and sitting at the bar we watched them make it from scratch in a big bowl of avocado heaven. I would take that job for minimum wage just to make guacamole all day. It was fresh and bright, I didn't even mind the few tomatoes. I just keep scooping it into my mouth. I ordered the squash, corn and chard veggie taco. IT WAS AMAZING. Very fresh, well seasoned, beautiful veggies. The tacos come with 3 sauces, I couldn't stop with the salsa verde, which I believed had avocado, it was super creamy, and fire roasted tomato/chipotle, dosing each bite. My bf ordered the chile relleno, again watching them make it was delightful, they even fried it in a separate fryer from the meat products. The relleno was stuffed with rice and zucchini rather than cheese, but it was equally as fantastic. Crispy outside, fresh inside, perfect tomato sauce, a sprinkle of oaxaca cheese on the outside. You could make this pepper a meal. I wish we would've had time to explore their alcoholic offerings, but I was pleased with my hibiscus lemonade. I'm going to miss you Tacolicious, until I have no choice but to return to the Marina.
author: Cori W.

description:
3.5 stars 

I know the tuna tostada was just named to the 7x7 top 100 list, but I would definitely disagree.  The tuna used by Tacolicious is sustainable and eco-friendly (always a plus), but the flavor is distractingly "fishy."  

The chili con queso is a total throwback, but unfortunately is reminiscent of spicy cheese wiz.  

The tacos are the shining stars of Tacolicious... we tried 5 in total (shared between 2 people and we left totally full).  The crispy chicken taco was a special that night which should be made part of the regular menu, they were fabulous.  The fish tacos were the best, light and crispy.  The chicken, carnitas, and short rib tacos did not disappoint.  

The salsas served with the tacos are delightful and add an interesting flare via mixing and matching... get creative!  

Go for the tacos, beer, sangria, and be sure to save room for the pan con chocolate, an amazing carry-over from Laiola!
author: J O.

description: Went to Tacolicious now on Chestnut St. on Jan. 12th with three other girlfriends and had a fun time. The restaurant even at 10pm still felt crowded. We enjoyed 10 tacos and four shots between the four of us. The perfect amount of food. The prices were just right and the shot the perfect amount of sweet for a girl's night. My favorite of the tacos was the fish taco...the veggie taco only so-so and the meats ok. I give this restaurant three stars because while the vibe was fun and lively, the service was only mediocre and other than the fish tacos I wasn't that blown away. I would most likely only venture back when having a craving for a fish taco.
author: Katie P.

description: Prime location, hip, great stuff! And the pitcher Margaritas...oh yeah!!!
author: Christina G.

description: Came here yesterday for lunch and stood in line for prolly 30 min or so. It was insanely busy. I ordered the coca cola beef taco and the tequila pulled pork. They were absolutely delicious...uber-flavorful. Got a nectarine-mint agua fresca to drink and it was very refreshing. Not too sweet. This is definitely not a cheap lunch. Tacos are $3.50 a pop and VERY tiny. I walked away having spent $11 and I wasn't super full. But then again, it's nice to have a lunch for once that doesn't sink me into a major food coma. Very fresh ingredients. I'll definitely be there next time.
author: Rebecca F.

description:
I heard about this in DailyCandy SF yesterday... so just had to be one of the first to stop by and check it out!  Spent a solid 30 minutes waiting (first in line, then for my food to be prepared).  I'd say this is going to be an aptly hyped place for the rest of the summer and I'm thankful that I was one of their first patrons!

At $3.50 a pop, these things get pricey pretty quick, particularly if you're planning to fill up.  I literally finished one of these petite delights in 3 bites.  And I probably would have needed to eat at least 4 tacos to feel full.

The beef taco was awesome and so was the chipotle chicken.  They have three bottles of taco sauces (1 guac + 2 are tomato-based salsas) that you can drench the meat in.  But they do have great flavor on their own.  They also sell chips/salsa for $2/bag.  Horchata looked particularly refreshing (and was selling like crazy).  I overheard one of the guys lament that they stayed up late last night trying to figure out how to make it!  (At least they're honest...)

The guys who pulled this place together are too kind - really very nice people - look like they're enjoying themselves - which gives their little stand a nice vibe.  They have cute long-sleeved white tee-shirts on that say "tacolicious" just in case you're wondering if you're at the right place.  (But the long line should be your first indication that you've found them!)
author: Lindsay M.

description: Great service & great food. Definitely get the tacos (favorites are the fish & carnitas). I honestly didn't really enjoy some of the apps and would recommend just getting lots of delicious tacos at a reasonable price. Drinks are good as well.
author: Jeannette L.

description: First off, let me start by saying that I've had many authentic tacos in my life, and this wasn't far from it. I dined here with my Wife and 2 friends of ours. To start off we had the shrimp Cake App (Loved the Jalapeno Aioli). After that, we went with the 4 tacos for $14, any of your choice which we did 2 platters of. The Tacos were cooked simply but with a full mouth full of flavor, seasoned perfectly. We went with the short rib taco, Taco of the week, Veggie squash taco, and the Deep fried Cod taco (Wasn't our favorite). I don't mind paying $$ for good food so Id say the prices were pretty good. The service was pretty good as well (Though your seated very closely to the table next to you on the bench side of the table). The parking is a little tricky, luckily we found a side street parking a little ways down but after our meal, it was well worth the walk. Definitely coming here again on our next vacation.
author: Jose G.

description:
better than mamacitas.

great tacos, good prices, nice menu layout.  I really like the 3 taco sauces that come out with the food, and bottled mexican soda with tons of sugar.  dont leave without getting a short rib taco

last but not least, free chips and salsa- THE WAY MEXICAN PLACES SHOULD BE.  i'm tired of going to mex places and paying $6 for chips and salsa in this freaking city..
author: Nick H.

description: Super loud, not great for conversation.  Squash tacos are yummy.  Great location, especially if you sit in the window.
author: Danielle B.

description:
i was meeting a friend for lunch during a recent visit back to the bay.  since she lived in the area, we decided to come here since another burrito place was closed. (don't ask me why we decided to go for mexican in the marina area!)
this place looked decent so we went inside and were seated immediately in front.  it got crowded after us so we came at the right time!
at first glance, the menu is obviously not authentic (duh, it's in the marina area!) but looked good, nevertheless.  i ordered the albacore tuna tostada, expecting the typical tostada style.  needless to say, i was pretty disappointed when only two small round fried taco shells arrived, with a few slices of tuna and avocado on top.  $10 for this?!  my friend ordered a taquito thing that was less than what we expected.  my husband ordered the 4 for $12 taco special with 2 carnitas and 2 chicken tacos.  i wished that i got that instead.  it was very good!
the only upside was that we ordered the watermelon agua fresca.  it didn't arrive until we had to ask for it and the server comped us the drinks.
i probably wouldn't go back unless it was for the tacos but then again, i'd probably visit the mission for tacos!
author: Serena L.

description: Salsa was alright but after sharing all the chips with the salsa, 5 tacos and and an order of the albacore tuna appetizer, I still left a little hungry. By the way, it was just me and hubby.  Total bill wasn't ridiculous but food wasn't compelling enough for me to order more.
author: C L.

description: When I walked in the door I was greeted by a giant bottle of Tapatio displayed on the wall, I knew I was in the right place. Delicious tacos and margaritas! Friendly staff who kindly refilled our chip basket upon request.
author: Emma D.

description: supergood, and pleased that they brought out sangrita w/o asking, but it was the worst sangrita i've had.  i've only had 3 though, so it's a small sample size.  but it didn't have any heat at all.  if they didn't bring it out they might have gotten a 5.  a 6 if it was good.  oh, and their michelada was lame.  so def. 4.  carnitas were off the hook.  salsa was great.  service was fast.
author: reza n.

description: I live about 45 mins away from SF and my fiance and I make special Tacolicious trips.  It's well worth the wait.  The food is amazing.  The drinks are wonderful.  And the staff is excellent.  I highly recommend the tuna tostadas and the chili con queso.  Yum!
author: Chi C.

description: It was the amazing smell that brought us in. We were getting into our car on Chestnut when we were allured by the most amazing fragrance of grilled good. Just picked some tacos to go but were treated like first class customers-free chips and great salsa while we waited. Then they gave plenty in the to-go bag for a very reasonable price. We will be back to try more of the dishes cooked fresh on the open grill in front of us.
author: Kathi O.

description: I've been doing a lot of exploring lately and found this place on the Marina. I remember it being a pretty trendy place as it also serves as a bar. They start you off with some pretty good chips and salsa and water from a pretty fancy bottle (nice). Then you order your tacos and I ordered 4 of them being chicken, pork, carnitas, and beef short rib. I think the beef short rib tasted the best with carnitas coming in second place. While I was chowing down the tacos, I also decided to be gluttonous and order the drunken beans. Nothing drunken here, but good bowl of beans with a little kick of bacon to it. Great place to start the night!
author: Dave Y.

description: taco + tecate + tequila shot = $10... bundling food, beer, and tequila is a very easy way to gain my approval.
author: William H L.

description: Stopped in on a Sunday afternoon with a bunch of friends (six of us) and got a table right away... a big plus in my book. :) Margarita's are strong... pitchers are a bit on the pricy side depending on what you get, but for the most part they're very good. The tacos were good... we had a mix of the beef, chicken, fish, and "chef's special," and the only thing I was a little disappointed in was the chicken (kind of dry) and the fish, which was a big piece of fried fish on a soft taco shell with some garnish on top. We ended up just eating the fish seperately because it was too awkward to pick up and eat. Other than that, though, it was a pretty nice place and the service was very good. We did a really taboo thing and asked them to split the check 5 ways, and they actaully did it for us! That was a very nice thing for them to do... we will of course be going back... and oh! If you get the chance to try the Rice, go for it! It's really really good!
author: Eric P.

description: 5 stars for hands down one of the best carnita tacos I've ever had.  So incredibly flavorful.  If this was based on service and speed of getting a table, it would be negative stars.  Everyone at the door was totally confused as to how they go about getting a table, and no one really knew if they were on a wait list or not.  The "host"/"waiter" really didn't give a damn...he knew there was a ton of people wanting to come inside so why bother with customer service.
author: Todd C.

description: carnitas tacos was the best. margaritas yum. loud.
author: tessie n.

description: If you like filling tacos that are truly tasty then this place if for you. The carnitas stand out amongst the braised short-rib, chicken and fish tacos but they are not your average SF tachole - go here. wait it out - fill up and enjoy.
author: stan s.

description: basically tacolicious is divine. i was won over by the life-size tapatio poster hanging on the wall... but i digress. the only reason I knocked tacolicious down to four stars is because their portions could be a little bigger, but that aside, as you would expect (and can read from all of the reviews) their tacos, food in general, service, etc. is superb. i'm here to rep the drinks. If you enjoy tequila, the chupitos are delightful (try the passion - YUM!)
author: Ami V.

description: My boyfriend and i were starving after finishing a run on the golden gate bridge. We had walked by Tacolicious the night before and it looked packed so we thought it must be good. It was amazing! We didnt have to wait long for a table, surprisingly on a saturday night. The tables are very close together and the other diners that sat on each side of us were repeat customers. Our eyes were bigger than our stomachs because we ordered 10 tacos, thinking we would eat them easily. We got a mixture of the brazed beef short rib(our favorite out of the 3), carnitas, and chicken. after eating a total of 9 between us both along with the chips and salsa and guacamole we were in a food coma. The salsa has mint in it which adds a fresh kick. The only down side was that they lost our taco order so they took forever to serve our tacos. For that reason they comped two of our drinks which made up for wait.
author: Jen S.

description: Was not sure what to expect but I arrived into San Francisco late and was hungry. I had heard Tim Lincecum talk about it in a interview so I thought I would give it a shot since I love tacos. I expected to to be a more fast paced, in and out type place. The place looks clean and in great condition and they have you sit down and give you a menu. The prices are not super expensive but they are not super cheap. I was a little apprehensive of the prices but wow the food is amazing. The salsa they give you before your food arrives is awesome. I wish I could buy it or make it myself. I purchased the tacos with carnitas and they were absolutely amazing. They are the best tacos I have ever had and I have had tacos from all over and grew up eating tacos. My wife chose their chicken tacos and they were great also but I especially liked the carnitas option. Definitely go try it! There is parking nearby and parking meters right outside. There is also a Bank next door in case you need to pick up some cash before you go around San Francisco since many locations only take cash but don't worry Tacolicious takes card.
author: Cliff S.

description: so I was not totally stoked. Went for lunch, and had four different kinds of tacos. chicken, cod, short rib, and chorizo. I well start by saying that the chicken was really good actually . If I am ever dragged here again that is what I would get. The cod was no good, the fish it self was not bad, but the batter was thick and soggy, the short rib was dry and lacked flavor plus I had ordered the traditional carnitas not the short rib, so I guess I was disappointed it that taco to begin with, and the chorizo was so salty and dry I did not finish it. Sat at a table in the window, and was bumping shoulders with the people on either side of me, and was having a hard time hearing my dining partner over the conversations next to me. what a headache. the only reason that I am giving 2 stars and not one is because the chicken taco really was very good, and I could see that siting anywhere else in the restaurant would have been fine probably, and I was interested in the rest of there menu..... a little nervous now that the tacos at a taco place were disappointing. but every restaurant has its bad days I supose. I do sincerely hope that one day I can give this place more than 2 stars. wish me luck
author: Damien B.

description:
This review is for the Tacolicious in the Marina - on Chestnut and Fillmore. Went there last night for dinner and was totally unimpressed. We ordered the poached salmon and ceviche apps - the ceviche was good the salmon was TERRIBLE - and we had the shot and a beer chicken and braised beef tacos which were mediocre at best. If I want overpriced mexican food I would much rather hop on down to Mamacita where the food is super delish which takes the sting out of the price - at least you leave satisfied. 
The service at Tacolicious was not good - they seated us without menus then tried to take our order - which makes no sense - and then everything took forever. They were super slow with the drinks and it all seemed very disorganized.
Needless to say, if you want Tacolicious, go to Mamacita instead - you won't regret it.
Oh, and I miss Laiola too. Same owner - I just don't know where he went wrong with this place. Bummer.
author: Quinn N.

description: This place was AMAZING.  Fast service, fresh food, unique drinks... There were three of us, and it was pretty cramped but not obnoxiously so.  We had the poblano chile relanos, which were my favorite part of the whole meal.  I'm currently trying to figure out how to recreate these in my kitchen!  We also had the rock cod tacos, the chorizo-potato tacos (again, AMAZING!), and the braised beef short rib tacos.  They serve everything with a side of three house-made salsas, which were pretty good.  I'm usually a spice girl, but I thought the flavor of the spiciest salsa was just okay.  It was the mild avocado one that I liked the most, and I didn't like the medium salsa at all--it reminded me of a mole sauce, and I don't like mole sauces.  My recommendation is to get a few different things for everyone to share, and if they have the chile relanos, make sure you get 2!!  Next time I come to San Francisco, I will definitely make a point to dine here again.
author: Cally G.

description: With a name like Tacolicious, I almost stayed away... but my husband's best bud told us we wouldn't regret it. And we didn't! The tacos are amazing. And who can beat their prices? Great great food for a low low price. We'll definitely be back when we're in town!
author: Sara T.

description: exciting energetic environment! loud music, people everywhere, and awesome tacos!
author: josh m.

description: My friend BK and I decided to give this place a try last Monday and I must say, it was nothing special.  We both started with the tortilla soup, which was a huge disappointment.  It was a bit greasy and had no flavor.  Sad, because it is not hard to make soup taste good.  I reached for the salt to put some on my soup and to my horror, noticed it was a "communal" salt.  What I mean is, is that it is an open saucer of salt, which was not replaced in between tables.  There were fingerprints in it!  Gross!  C'mon, it is the same as the bowl of salted nuts at the bar, you just don't do it!  Along Came Polly, anyone?  The chips and salsa were good, along with the four different flavors of salsa they brought out with our meal.  We both shared a plate of four tacos, I had carnitas and chicken.  The carnitas was tasty, but the chicken was mediocre.  Overall, for the price, this place is not worth returning.  The pricing is similar to Mamacita and the food and atmosphere at Mamacita is way better.
author: Carolyn D.

description: I wrote an email to Joe (the proprietor of Tacolicious) after this incident, and he did make a generous offer to make up for his employees handling of the situation, so I'm updating my review. The tacos are really tasty, and the prix fixe deal of 1 taco, 1 Tecate, and 1 tequila shot is a good way to start off your night in the Marina.
author: Jason G.

description:
i really liked tacolicious. we had GREAT, GREAT, GREAT service there - very attentive.  food is not that fast but we sat at the bar so we got to see the chefs working their butts off - it is really, really busy there.  the tacos are phenomenal!  

the taste of the food there is high end mexican with a tinge of japanese, which amazingly goes very very well.  very nice tequilas there, all the food there goes very well with tequila - sour and salty!  it is greasy, it is very non-vegetarian.  it is great bar food with great alcoholic drinks if you're looking for good food (not too picky) and looking to get wrecked!
author: tc h.

description: Oh i went there last night at 10pm. I had four pork belly tacos. The tacos were good. The place is loud and i can not hear anyone talk to me even across the table. The special taco were $5 each. Two would fill me up. Also they give complimentary chips and dip. The bathroom is clean. I do notice that not everyone wears gloves who work in the kitchen.  The pork belly tacos's fat literally melts in your mouth
author: Stanley L.

description:
Yowza!!! 
We were sad to see Laiola go away and it took us a while to visit  its new incarnation. Boy, very glad we did. Super friendly and efficient staff (lots of folks walking around making sure that you have everything you need on your plate or in your glass). The place was hopping on a wednesday eve at 9,  and we sat at the counter. The drink lists looks very nice, but we were good children and stuck to Negra Modelo on tap. The salsa they brought us was one of the best I've ever tasted (was that fresh mint?). The chips were crispy and just-made;  salty enough to make the cold Modelo Especial go down very easy. We each ordered 3 tacos which were presented on a long plate and show up with an assortment of salsas. There are all types of combos to order, as well as dishes other than tacos, but this being our first visit we wanted to get down to business. My favorite taco was the one with potatoes and chorizo, but we also had some pulled pork and chicken which were excellent, topped with fresh salsa and vegetables. Super fresh tortillas, everything is assembled and made to order and it's clear the quality of the ingredients is the best;  most are locally sourced. Everything was filling but with a very 'clean' and fresh flavor to it (I keep writing 'fresh', must be something about that food). No stale oil here.

Tacolicious clearly grew out  of the same sophisticated and knowledgeable palate/vision as that behind defunct Laiola, except it's actually better. Laiola never found its niche customer base in that neighborhood and eventually suffered for it.  Tacolicious on the other hand appears to be enjoying a well-deserved Marina love-fest, which means it'll be able to survive. Yay. I didn't mention the price, but this is actually a very reasonable dinner/drinks option. Would definitely recommend it and will go back. 

PS Tacolicious has a stand at the thursday Ferry Plaza farmer's market if you want to try the goodies before diving in.
author: Rebecca P.

description: I came the other day with my friend. He insisted we go here instead of the Taqueria across the street because this place looked "trendy". I was a bit confused when we walked in because I didn't know if we waited to be seated or just sat. We just sat and eventually we were helped. They brought out some oily nachos with a pretty good salsa. But I was so dissapointed when I saw that they only had ONE vegeterian taco, BOO. SO I oredered only the one taco. The taco was delicious at least, and I know I will crave it from time to time, and those three salsas they serve are bomb! I also got a jamaica lemonade, it was bleh. My mom makes a better one! I would give this place 4 stars but just the fact that they only had ONE veggie taco brings it down one star. I mean c'mon we are in SF there are so many vegeterians and vegans here it only makes sense to accomodate us. But I guess one taco is better then none!
author: Peeta B.

description: I had heard bad things about Tacolicious from some friends after it first opened, so I decided to wait a while before I gave it a shot.  It seems that they have turned some things around because I enjoyed it.  We sat outside and started with margaritas made with 100% blue agave tequila, lime juice, and agave nectar.  I had the carnitas tacos and thought they were pretty good.  I wouldn't recommend this place for authentic Mexican fare, but for a casual dinner out with friends or loved ones, this place isn't bad.
author: MIKE S.

description: Great food at great prices.  Watch out for To GO Orders of Seasonal Vegies.  5 dollars for 1 small ear of corn.  Ridiculously over priced grilled ear of corn.
author: c c.

description: Overpriced; mediocre with delusions of grandeur.  Service is decent though.
author: Zack H.

description: This is one of the best meals I have had in a long time.  The food was good, but the service was outstanding.  First was Carlos, the waiter.  They were packed!!  He was hugely helpful with the menu and actually kept me from over ordering, which I really appreciated.  Also, the tostada with tuna, which he suggested, was awesome.  Then came Manny, the busser.  He was on it!  He kept the drinks filled, chips loaded, and salsa fresh.  He was super polite and always stopped to make sure we were okay, despite the packed crowd.  All in all, their positive attitudes stood out to the extent that it became a conversation starter between our table and the table next to us.  Yes, they were that positive and helpful that we both overheard each other talking about it.  They made the experience great!!!  I will be back soon - not because there is a shortage of restaurants, but because the staff and food were both off the charts.  It is nice to have a great place in the marina with such a great attitude.
author: JonnyBoy K.

description: This place forced me to write my first review of Yelp ever. The tacos are ridiculously good and that passion fruit margarita is seriously dangerous.
author: Nadia S.

description:
Finally checked this place out.  We had a sample of tacos and the pork tostada.  The pork tostada with cabbage rocked but unfortunately the tacos fell short.  The cod taco had no flavor (which is odd considering it's fried).  The chicken and beef were just so so.  The salsa served with the chips has a very different flavor and not something I have ever tasted before.  It's ok but nothing to write home about or return for.  My margarita was very good but I only had one and ended up with a throbbing headache.  Hopefully I didn't pay $10 for crappy tequila but who knows.
The service is very good and they refilled our chips a few times which is appreciated!
If I am going to pay top dollar for tacos I still think Mijita in the Ferry building does a WAY better job at fried fish/cod tacos and their chips/salsa and other tacos are also 10x better and bigger bang for your $3-4 bucks.  Tacolicious is obviously a great place for drinks and a quick bite, especially if you can get outdoor seating (indoor was nice too).  Not sure when I will return but I recommend stopping by if you are in the hood.
author: K L.
