description: Wonderful!  I went to the Ferry Building to meet a friend for lunch at the Slanted Door, but got there early when the Thursday morning farmer's market was still open.  A good thing I'd skipped breakfast, because there was the Tacolicious stand, churning out incredible delicious smells.  Yeah, I paid $3.50 for a carnitas soft taco that would be $2 elsewhere, but I will remember this one as long as I live.  I lived for years in San Antonio and Austin and I've had a lot of Mexican food, but this was one of the three best tacos I'd eaten in my whole life.  And right now I can't remember the other two!  Kelly Walsh (I think she is the owner; her card was on the table) was friendly and gracious.  A welcome relief from the attitude you get some places.   She knows that if she serves delicious food and is friendly, people will come back again and again.  I can't wait to try the Marina restaurant.
author: Lira K.

description: Pretty good tacos, wasn't a big fan of the salsas, a little pricey for what it is - tacos, but a good place to kick back and kill a few drinks.
author: Brad W.

description: this used to be my fave place of all times.. unfortunately i feel like they have lowered their standards over the years ... the food is still really good and reasonably priced (although chips used to be so much better and so did carnitas), but i cant even come here on the weekends anymore.... way overcrowded in a tiny little place they have and they play music like its a night club..... not a good atmosphere for dinner... service is pretty good though...
author: Anna S.

description: Carnitas taco & Guacamole were truely outstanding.  Bottomless chips & Salsa.  Short rib taco was very good (not as good as folks have said here though).  Chorizo and potato taco was very bland.  I will try this place again to see how their fish tacos are.
author: Mike P.

description: Well, what I can say for certain is that there is always a wait at this restaurant... but now that I have eaten there, I know why. The tacos were delicious! I highly recommend the carnitas and the shreaded beef. The food was fresh and the service was decent (although the process for putting your name in and getting seated could be a lot more professional and organized.) The guacamole was good, but not great. The prices were very reasonable - $12 for 4 tacos (and 3 tacos was plenty!)
author: rachel s.

description: I came here with some friends and we shared chips and guacamole to start off the evening. The chips were nice and crisp and the guacamole was really flavorful. For dinner we shared a plate of 10 tacos consisting of a medley of carnitias, chicken, cod, and veggie varieties. The tacos were soft shell, light, moist, and tasty. The place was a bit noisy and made it hard to hear at time, but it wasn't too distracting. Definitely worth a visit.
author: Ryan B.

description: love this place. it's a bit pricey for what it is - mexican food. the wait can be long because it's so popular. but the tacos are absolutely delicious! the sangria blanco could be made better. it was fairly watery when i had it. otherwise, the atmosphere is great, food is great, and service is great.
author: nightlife i.

description: These tacos are unbelievably tasty and Tacolicious uses all fresh, local ingredients (who else does that?!) I just may come back every Thursday!
author: Issabella S.

description: we spent $70 on 8 tacos and 4 drinks. a bit spendy in my opinion. the carnitas taco was great, the fish taco lacked flavor, and the $9 margaritas were tiny! I'm sure I'll end up back there because the marina lacks a good margarita, but I wish I didn't have to spend $9 for something that could fit in a dixie cup.
author: Lauren T.

description: The stars on Yelp really do mean something, people, and "Meh, I've experienced better" is about right.  I've eaten here twice because I really wanted to give it a chance.  The first experience with the food was about the same as the second.  Both times I walked in hoping to like it, and both times I walked out vowing never to try it again.  Tacolicious definitely caters to the drunk Marina crowd and it's probably the reason it does so well.  I've tried all 6 of their tacos--the summer squash, the chicken petaluma, chorizo + potato, beef short ribs, carnitas, and fried cod.  First of all, everything is overly salty--especially chorizo + potato taco--we could not bring ourselves to finish it.  The chicken petaluma and the carnitas tacos were the best, although somewhat dry.  The fish taco is kind of gross and bland and the beef short rib tacos were just gross.  My bf and I are pretty good at finishing our plates, but we left three tacos (out of 8) half uneaten.  The best thing about this restaurant is the free chips and salsa (which was pretty tasty), but if your restaurant 's name is a combination of "Taco" and "delicious", you can't fail with the tacos!  I understand the concept of the "modern" taco and even an "inventive" taco, but I would have been wiling to pay $3.50 for a GOOD taco.  Will not be back.
author: Trinh N.

description: really really really good salsa and margarita picante!! worth the wait and love the chocolate bread dessert!
author: jackie a.
